name: Gilded Heights
description:
Step back in time to the dazzling world of the roaring 20's, where the city's destiny rests in your hands! As a visionary real estate developer, your mission is to achieve fame and recognition by strategically placing your buildings in the largest metropolis on the East Coast. Welcome to Gilded Heights, the thrilling city builder card game that will test your wits and strategic prowess.

Construct magnificent buildings every round and watch the cityscape transform into a testament to your ambition. But beware, fellow developers are also vying for fame, and they won't hesitate to place their buildings strategically to diminish your success. The competition is fierce, and every decision matters. Only the savviest minds will rise to the top.

Discover four distinct types of buildings at your disposal: Residential properties, steady point collectors; Landmarks, immovable monuments to your vision; Industries, influencers of property value; and Influence cards, the perfect tools to annoy your rivals. Master their unique abilities to shape the city in your image.

Are you ready to immerse yourself in the allure of the 20's, embrace the thrill of building a skyline, and outwit your adversaries in a game of strategy and cunning? Gilded Heights awaits you, where fame, fortune, and architectural legacy are within your grasp.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, City Building, Print & Play, Territory Building
mechanics: Hand Management, Neighbor Scope, Tile Placement

name: Monopoly: 1880 Saigon
description:
1880 Saigon Monopoly features historic buildings and some of the city’s original street names from the era before the city’s name changed to Ho Chi Minh City.
It incorporates an old 1881 map of Saigon with some traditional Vietnamese art into the design to give the game an antique feel.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Lose a Turn, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Market: A Dice Game with a Twist
description:
Created by 9-year-old Oliver in 2022, this 2 to 5 player game is structured around dice battles called face-offs. There are four levels of dice, each more powerful than the previous.

On their turn, challengers can choose to merge and/or unmerge their dice to change their power levels before rolling. Challengers can also play the Market and sell a dice pair in hopes of drawing a higher powered die from the bag. Playing the Market is a gamble though, because you could lose your dice and have nothing to show for them!

Strategy matters, but don't discount luck in this game, because special elements are activated when you roll doubles, and then weaker dice are able to overpower even the strongest of dice!

Defeat your opponent by rolling the higher value and you get to take one of their dice. Win when you are the only one left with 2 or more dice!

—description from the designer

name: Eysenhudt: Anspruchsvolleres Adaptives Kampf System
description:
The Advanced Adaptive Combat System (AACS) is intended for real freaks, who’re looking for an advanced battle experience. The AACS gives the players more tactical control over combat against strategic targets (towns). In determining their Risk Tolerance players can now, through careful consideration of their chances of beating the defenders, risk nearly everything to make their Battle Rolls a success. Of course, the endeavour can fail. For the defenders will then prepare countermeasures, which again will endanger the success of the Battle Roll.
Also, for the first time in Eysenhudt, with the AACS the players risk actual battle losses – either in damaged goods or in absenteeism or even in the loss of whole units.
The AACS builds on the Adaptive Combat System (ACS) and is meant for very advanced players (or freaks), who love the battle experiences and who’re willing to accept an expanded duration of playing time and a way more extended and advanced combat system in exchange for more tactical options and better control of the battle procedure.

—description from the designer
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Pike and Shot, Print & Play, Renaissance, Wargame

name: SIGILS
description:
Each player has one or more forbidden cards. The object of the game is to discover the shape, color and number of each of the forbidden cards. Players will take turns creating clues using their cards in hand to deduce a forbidden attribute, never showing a forbidden shape, number or color.

If a player must draw a card from the central deck, but there are none left, all players whose card has not been completely uncovered have lost.

Be careful, the cards disappear quickly! Will you be resourceful with your clues, or will you lack clarity and time?

—description from the designer

name: Who's a Good Dog?
description:
Who's a Good Dog? is a deduction and memory-based board game where players take on the roles of dog enthusiasts trying to identify their opponent's hidden character card. The game revolves around the excitement of discovering and eliminating characters through strategic questioning, all while attempting to outwit the opponent.
Each player has a board with slots to place character cards facing away from the opposing player. The cards represent different dog characters. Players take turns asking alternate questions about the appearance of the opponent's chosen character. The questions help narrow down the possibilities, leading to the eventual identification of the hidden dog.
The primary objective of the game is to be the first player to correctly identify the opponent's hidden character. Players do this by asking questions that help eliminate potential options based on the appearance of the characters. The winner gains a point and marks it on the slider to keep track of the score. The game combines deduction, memory, and strategic thinking as players try to unveil the mystery dog using clever questioning and reasoning. The catch is that specific questions about dog breeds are not allowed, but questions about fur color and other attributes are permitted.

name: Pick A Boo
description:
Combine correctly - The little ghosts have to scare the right people in the right room. But watch out, there are night and day ghosts, which one is on the next card?
Pick-a-Boo is ideal for 2 to 4 players from 5 years. If you are the fastest to put the right spirit on the card, you will win it. Whoever then collects the most cards wins the game.
Fun learning effect - In addition to a quick comprehension, the exciting card game Pick-a-Boo also playfully trains the logical thinking and reaction time.

Deckt eine Karte auf. Bildet nun mit den Geistern und den dazugehörigen, farbigen Sockeln den richtigen Geist. Platziert euren Geist möglichst schnell auf der richtigen Spieltafel. Aber Achtung: Die Geister fliegen entweder nur nachts, oder nur am Tag. Überlegt euch also gut, auf welche Karte ihr euren Geist setzt. Wer die meisten Karten sammelt gewinnt.

name: KALISTO Dice Game
description:
Klaisto is a Print & Play dice game for 1-4 players.

The players must try to turn all the plates into the goal to win. Only a few dice are needed. Pay attention to the event cards. They can help or harm.

name: Las Ligas de la Ñ: El juego de las fuerzas primigenias y existenciales
description:
Las Ligas de la Ñ: El juego de las fuerzas primigenias y existenciales ("The Ñ Leagues: The Game of the Primal and Existential Forces"), is an asymmetrical fighting board game for 2 to 12 players that includes classic characters of Spanish literature in card form, with their name, work, author, representative quote and unique powers (there are no equals). The time has come for Don Quijote, Sancho Panza, Celestina, Lazarillo, Fortunata and Jacinta, Segismundo, Bernarda Alba and others!

In this new Ñ game (the fifth in the series), players have to control one of the playable characters in order to score more points than their opponents (after summing up the points for final position and for eliminated elements). Each turn, the players use their cards or powers to maneuver, attack or defend, displace enemies and make other actions. There are several types of playable characters: some have allies, some are a pair of heroes, some undergo evolutions and transformations, and some go on their own.

The game's main source of inspiration is the Super Smash Bros. video game series and it maintains important similarities with both the Unmatched board game series and battle royale style games.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Educational, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Mythology, Novel-based, Party Game
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, End Game Bonuses, Grid Movement, Interrupts, Lose a Turn, Memory, Multi-Use Cards, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection, Square Grid, Sudden Death Ending, Tags, Variable Player Powers

name: Star Wars: Legion – Strike Me Down Battle Pack
description:
Recreates the pivotal moment in Return of the Jedi when Luke Skywalker and Darth Vader duel.

Contents:
2 resin miniatures
1 throne room display
2 unit cards
6 command cards
1 token sheet
1 insert sheet

name: Flyting
description:
A card based party game for people who like to debate why they should be the winner!
In standard play, a judge draws a prompt card. Players take turns playing a character card with a modifier card and pitching to the judge why they are the clear winner. Other players are encouraged to voice their own opinions at any time. The judge will select a winner and the player is awarded a point!
To add add more fun there are additional ways to play, such as drawing an additional random modifier from the top of the modifier deck as you make your pitch.
In arena mode, you face off against a single opponent and the rest of the table votes on the winner!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Humor, Negotiation, Party Game

name: Word Spy
description:
A quick card game where players are spies who make words out of signals they intercept. Players make words by getting the best cards, but beware for stealing spies!

Players can swap a consonant for a vowel, and try to make words with the 4 cards they have every turn. Players are able to change words, or steal letters from each other.

The game ends when there are no cards left to draw. The players count the cards they have and withdraw points for cards they cant make words with.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Educational, Spies/Secret Agents, Wargame, Word Game

name: Pixels and Polygons
description:
Immerse yourself in the world of video game development as you lead your studio in the creation of the next gaming sensation - or an overhyped flop.

"Pixels and Polygons" is an original take on the worker placement mechanic, featuring modular hex tracks that vary in every game. Workers, or developers, can compete and move on these tracks to collect specialized bonuses for your game in development, such as genres, fans, and features. Researching the tracks can increase the maximum range to which the developers can move, representing your strategic commitment.

Cards are played in games to add specific features with special effects, unlocking the true potential of your projects. Released games are scored based on specific trend requirements and then compete on the hot list for reputation and revenue.

Gear up for launch! Will you become a legendary game creator or a heartless profit-chaser, exploring every dark aspect of game development?

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Humor, Industry / Manufacturing, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Die Icon Resolution, Hand Management, Income, Investment, Worker Placement

name: Qwadro
description:
Qwadro is a roll and write game for 2-4 players, 10+ years, playing time about 20 minutes.

On his turn, the active player rolls 4 dice and is entitled to 1 re-roll.
All players then write the sum of 2 dice on their player sheets.
The colors of the dice determine the row or column in which the number is entered.. The numbers must be entered next to already entered numbers.
The active player may enter a 2nd number as well, but must use the 2 dice that he did not use in the 1st entry.
Numbers in rows and columns must go from lowest to highest - left to right and top to bottom..
If a player has 4 of the same numbers orthogonally connected, he gets bonus points and may no longer enter that number.
If a player cannot enter a number, he gets negative points.
The player with the most points wins.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Drawing, Grid Coverage, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Ankhitects
description:
Ankhitects is a tile laying pyramid building game for 2 players, ages 10+, playing time 15-20 minutes.

The players are rival architects in ancient Egypt who have been tasked by the Pharaoh with creating blueprints for the construction of the Pharaoh's pyramid.
They will try to do this by placing polyomino tiles on their own player boards in order to connect as many groups as possible of the same elements - air, water, fire and gold.
The player who scores the most points at the end of the game wins.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Connections, Grid Coverage, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Loot&Roll
description:
You and your fellow comrades are going down into forgotten dungeons full of loot to collect. Avoid cursed treasures and fearless ghosts in your way throughout dungeons. Be quick and be smart while collecting treasures. Prove your scavenging skill and become the richest adventurer of all times.

Loot&Roll is print and play game for one to four players. Your goal is to collect treasure and score the most points. But don't be too greedy. Each treasure has its own value that changes through the game. So, pick the right time to collect each treasure type. Overtake your opponents and collect the most valuable loot.

—description from the designer

name: Speculaas
description:
Speculaas is a simultaneous card drafting, card laying, set collection game for 2-4 players, ages 10+, playing time around 20 min.

Speculaas are spiced shortbread cookies originating from Belguim and The Nederlands which are molded into different shapes usually depicting windmills, ships and animals. The spice mix is made from cardamom, cinnamon, cloves, ginger, nutmeg and white pepper.

In Speculaas players are pastry chefs who are trying to score the most victory points by collecting Spice cards and matching them with Recipe (scoring) cards.

—description form the designer
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Matching, Set Collection

name: Dick Tracy the Super Detective
description:
A trick-taking game based on the 'Dick Tracy' comic strip. The 35-card deck is divided into three "Gang" and three "Detective" suits, each of a different color. The Detective suits are numbered 1-5, while the Gang suits are numbered 1-6. There is also one card each of the Gang Boss and Dick Tracy, each worth 15 points.

Object of the game is to take as few tricks of Gang suits as possible, while avoiding the Gang Boss and trying to get the Dick Tracy card.

The Dealer starts by dealing a "Mystery" hand face down in front of him, which will remain until the final trick has been played. Dealer then deals six cards to each player, three at a time. Each player looks at his cards and discards two. This continues until only the Mystery cards remain undealt.

Player to the Dealer's left leads by playing a card, then each player in turn must play a card of the same color (suit) if possible, otherwise he may discard any card. Highest suited card wins the trick. A player who cannot follow suit may play the Dick Tracy card on any Detective suit and win the trick; likewise the Gang Boss card wins any Gang suit trick. The player who wins the trick leads the next one. If a player leads with either the Dick Tracy or Gang Boss card, players may discard any card in their hand.

The player who wins the last trick collects the Mystery cards. Players then count all the Gang cards in their possession and score two points for each one. The player holding the Gang Boss card adds fifteen to their score, while the player holding the Dick Tracy card subtracts fifteen. Game ends when one player reaches or exceeds one hundred points, and the person with the lowest score wins.

—user summary

name: Capture the Flag!
description:
Two players or teams compete to answer questions about each state (capitol city, flower, bird, nickname), marking correct answers by placing a colored magnet -- either red or blue -- on the state in question on the map printed on the inside of the metal travel case.

Players need only answer one of the four facts to place a magnet. If they are able to answer more than one question, they may continue playing until they make a mistake or cannot answer. If a player cannot answer any of the questions on the card, it is placed on the bottom of the draw stack, and play changes to the opposing player or team.

The winner is the player or team with the most magnets on the map once all the cards have been used.

—user summary

name: Trivial Pursuit: Life & Styles Editie
description: Expansion for Trivial Pursuit with 500 new question cards.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Les Chroniques de Pargate
description:
Welcome to Pargate, a mysterious village hidden within a lush forest.

Here, you will encounter a plethora of unique characters and wondrous creatures, who... who... well, who will do what you decide!

In The Chronicles of Pargate, you are the one creating the story.

Start with a basic storyline structure, or mix and match the ones provided, or even create your own from scratch, and envision - alone or with others - a story full of twists, unexpected events, and laughter...

name: もしも勇者がいるのなら (Moshimo Yusha ga Iru no Nara / If there is a hero)
description:
Defeat the unreasonable royalty!　A new SATSUGAI (murder) -style card game!
You only play one card at a time, but the game development changes every time.
Will you rob with the royalty, stop with the heroes, or laugh with the ...... clowns?
Make full use of 7 different characters to achieve the victory conditions!

This game is designed to be "easy to play", "moderately strategic" and "flashy game development".
Only 7 types of character cards and 3 types of chips are used.

All you have to do is "select a card in your hand and reveal it.

Depending on the effect of the revealed card, you gain or lose chips.
After you have done this four times, the game ends when you reveal the last card in your hand.
You win if the last card in your hand satisfies the win condition.

All you have to do is reveal your cards four times and fulfill the victory condition at the end."

That's all there is to it, but it doesn't go very well.

The game "If there is a hero" is a recreation of such a slapstick game.

name: Trick Gear: Monogatari Series
description:
A fast paced, action, battle royale game where you face off against 1 to 3 opponents incorporating characters from the Monogatari series and power them up using any standard 54 deck of playing cards! Activate special skills and be the last one standing to win!

Players take turns drafting heroes (from the 17 character cards included in the box) that they will use to battle their opponents. Each player shuffles a 54 card standard playing card deck (sold separately) and draws a starting hand equal to the value printed on their current character. They also draw cards equal to that character's LIFE value. Players will then pick one card from their hand to represent their starting POWER (1-10 cards have power equivalent to their numbers, while Jacks, Queens and Kings equal a power value of 11,12 and 13 respectively).

Players then take turns playing different suits and numbered cards in specific combinations to activate their character's own unique battle skills. These skills will either allow you to charge up your current battle power value even further, increase the rate of damage dealt to losing players at the end of the round, or any number of special abilities (like drawing more cards or dealing instant damage to an opponent).

Once all players PASS, everyone counts up who has the current highest power value. That player wins that round, dealing damage to every other player, equivalent to the current rate of damage! Those players must discard life cards equal to the damage rate. If a hero loses all of it's health, that player must switch to one of their reserve heroes. When all of your opponents heroes have been reduced to 0 health, you win the game!

name: Ankhitects: The Dice Game
description:
Ankhitects: The Dice Game is a roll and write game for 2 players, ages 10+, playing time 15 min.

The pyramid has been built, it's time to decorate it.
The players are rival architects in ancient Egypt and they have been tasked to make decoration plans for the new pyramid of the Pharaoh.
The player who manages to make the better decoration plan and collects the most points by grouping the same type of elements - wind, water, fire and gold, will win the favor of the Pharaoh and be the winner of the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Connections, Dice Rolling, Drawing, Grid Coverage, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Sand Stacking
description:
Sand Stacking is a pocket-sized dexterity game for 1 or more players that rewards precision and patience. To be successful, you will need a steady hand, an eye for balance and nerves of steel.

Stack tiny metallic cubes as high as you can (or as fast as you can) and see who comes out on top. You can build with either large (4mm) or small (2mm) cubes.

In the standard head-to-head game, you can go against any number of opponents, taking turns to create one tower - with the player who knocks the tower over as the loser. You can also play as a co-operative team to get as high as you can!

Alternatively, you can attempt to set records by building one tower on your own (official records are kept on sandstacking.com).

For most, Sand Stacking is a fun party game. For others, it can actually be a tool to help with meditation and focus. The game requires such a degree of concentration that meditation can actually be a part of the strategy!

One thing is for certain - sand stacking is for everyone!

…except kids under 12.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Single Loser Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Stacking and Balancing

name: Cities of Venus: Survivors
description:
Set during the time of Cities of Venus, Survivors continues the story with the search for survivors on the surface by the brave mining mech operators. The object of this stand-alone polyomino-dice manipulation game is to find as many survivors as possible while discovering fuel for the re-ascent vehicle. Once the launch sequence is initiated, players utilize the resources and engineers that they had rescued to secure their place as the captain, and hero, of the re-ascent ship.

Plays 2-4 and is expandable to 6.

—description from the publisher

name: Sine Tempore: Dungeonology Rocca Civetta Promo Cards
description:
Theses promo cards were included in the Dungeonology Rocca Civetta SG box.

Chrono's Crown Accessory Promo Card:
Psionic
3AP RNG:4 - Once for Mission you can target another Hero.
Move the Target Activation Token up to 5 Sectors backward on the Momentum.
The chosen Activation Token cannot be placed before the Sector where the Activation Token of the owner of this Equipment is located.

Yocca Promo Card:
Yocca can move using his master's AP with the Runner Skill.
Yocca can end his movement in a Square occupied by an Enemy (Troop).
If an Enemy starts their turn in the same square as Yocca, the enemy gains a stun token.
When his Master kills an Enemy (Troop)in the same Square as Yocca, he automatically gets a Resource card.

name: Personal Vendetta
description: In Personal Vendetta, players are clones fighting for revenge against one another. Draft cards from a shared tableau, and play them using any and every resource at your disposal: your life total, cards in hand, cards in play, and discarded cards.

name: さいふアイス (Saifu Aisu)
description:
Saifu Aisu is a game about vowel patterns in Japanese words. The game includes two decks of cards, with each card showing a different three syllable word.

One of the two decks of cards are turned face up on the table. Then, a card is revealed from the other deck and read aloud. The players race to find which of the revealed cards has the same vowel pattern.

As an example, if the revealed card is "Saifu" (さいふ, sa-i-fu), a matching card would be "Aisu" (アイス, a-i-su).

The winner is the player who find the most correct matches.

name: Bill of Rights Round-Up
description:
This game can be played cooperatively or competitively. Either way, the procedure is generally the same. The "Amendment" cards contain the text of the first ten amendments to the United States Constitution. These should be read aloud to the players beforehand to familiarize themselves with the purpose of each amendment. The "case" cards are shuffled and placed in a stack face-down on the board. Each Case card contains a dilemma relating to one of the amendments, and asks a question about the actions of the people described.

Team/Player 1 draws the top card and reads the case to Team/Player 2. Team 2 answers either "Yes" or "No". Older children are encouraged to name the amendment referenced, and explain their answer based on its text. If their answer is correct, they place one of the provided horse tokens in their "corral" on the board. If their answer is incorrect, no token is awarded. Then Team 2 draws and reads a case card to Team 1, following the same procedure. The first Team to reach ten horse tokens is the winner.

Cooperative play follows the same steps given above, with the Team/Player attempting to accumulate ten horse tokens.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Questions and Answers, Team-Based Game

name: トリティバ (Toritiba)
description:
Toritiba is a trick-taking that lasts one trick, and to which each player contributes 5 cards. It is themed around a horse race, though some of the animals are zebras or deer.

Cards can be played face up as an animal to enter the race or face down to set the conditions of the trick, such as trump suits and are high or low cards stronger.

The highest ranked card played to the trick earns the player 3 points, second place 2, and third place 1. It is suggested, as a variant, that players could play more than one hand. Additionally, if a player finishes 1st, 2nd, and 3rd, it is an auto-victory.

name: Send It!: The Snowsports Board Game
description:
A snowsports board game complete with skiing/riding, crashing, skill building and, of course...SENDING IT!

SEND IT! is for those times you want to hit the slopes, but can’t — maybe it’s the middle of summer, maybe you’re waiting for your next vacation or maybe you’re just tired from a day on the mountain — because no matter what, even when you can’t ski/ride, you should be able to SEND IT!

On each turn, riders choose two actions, which can be the same or different, from the following options:

Ski/Ride - roll the ski/ride die and move 1-3 spaces along the singletrack.
Train - roll the two training dice to gain the skill points you need to send the next feature.
Prepare - draw a Prepare card to gain points (which help you recover from a crash and send the next feature) or special skills.
SEND IT - if you are on a run and have the necessary skills, play Prepare card points and roll the 20-sided die to try to send it and pass on to more difficult trails.


Just like real snowsports, crashing can happen in a variety of ways - you can crash while training, while skiing/riding or while sending it - and until you recover from your crash you can't do anything but prepare, giving the other skiers/riders the chance to get ahead.

The first skier/rider to send the final run (the "Hall of Fame") and reach the Golden Hot Chocolate wins the game.

name: Ciudad de 15 Minutos
description:
In Ciudad de 15 Minutos (15 Minutes City), you are going to design a city focused on its inhabitants’ well-being and accessibility. You will develop VRT lines, bike paths, pedestrian zones, and railroads. You will help your citizens move around in a safe and sustainable way to their destinations, so they are not stuck in traffic for hours to access their necessities.

Ciudad de 15 Minutos is a short and fun game where you will be choosing cards in a closed draft, and build little by little the city of your dreams. Each player will only be able to place 24 cards during the game, so choose wisely how to design your city’s mobility.
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Connections, Network and Route Building, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Chrono Crawler: Time Crystals Quest
description:
Chrono Crawler: Time Crystal Quest is a single-player dungeon crawler, consisting of only one card and no other components. It is played using a new mechanic that uses time to modify and vary the game, while leaving ample decision-making space during the game.

The player plays an adventurer who must explore a dangerous dungeon in search of 3 special crystals. The dungeon is made up of several rooms, each of which contains may contain monsters, traps or treasures.

The game is difficult and challenging, but also very rewarding. You have to use your skills and intelligence to overcome obstacles and reach the crystals. Chrono Crawler: Time Crystal Quest offers a unique and immersive experience, which is suitable for all types of players.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Exploration, Fantasy, Medieval, Print & Play, Real-time
mechanics: Area Movement, Multi-Use Cards, Real-Time, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Star Wars Mandalorian: Precious Cargo
description:
In this fast-paced game, aim for your faction, build your forces and claim Grogu! Players split into two teams -- The Mandalorian vs. the Galactic Empire -- and each take a character disc that matches their allegiance. After placing Grogu in the centre of the table with 15 Ally cards spread a good distance around it, each player then takes it in turn to throw their character disc to land on and win Ally cards! The aim is to collect enough points to then aim for and land on Grogu, with the first player to do so being the winner.

A quick to learn and easy to play game that's perfect for The Mandalorian fans, it comes in a Mandalorian helmet case and is suitable for ages 8+, 2-6 players and has an average gameplay of 10 minutes.

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Roles with Asymmetric Information, Single Loser Game

name: Hyper Hacker
description:
Hyper Hacker is a cyberpunk-themed board game that challenges players to hack their way through a dystopian city. The city is plagued by cybercrime and corruption, and only the most skilled hackers can make a difference.
Players compete as hackers who use their equipment tiles to create a network of connections that can bypass the security systems of the criminals. The goal of the game is to score the most points by placing tiles strategically and connecting them to the most valuable targets.
Hyper Hacker combines elements of puzzle, strategy, and bluffing, as players have to balance their own network expansion with disrupting their opponents’ plans. It is set in a rich and immersive world that explores the themes of technology, society, and morality in a futuristic setting.'

name: Zurvivor Zchool
description:
Zurvivor Zchool (Z refers Zombies) is a semi-cooperative game in which players take the role of a survivor with difference abilities to against obstacles by test type of status.

Each turn, one player takes on the role of leader and chooses 1-3 members that will face off against the crossroads. If you pass the test, leader gets a card, and members get to level up. In other words, if you don't, you could get hit and injured, which could infect you.

Some cards have mission items to send missions. Once complete, you'll go to the next mission, and if you complete all 3, you'll face the boss! That's the final battle.

When you defeat the boss, the game ends. Check objective and score points. The player who most points win!

This is just a great game for zombie world enthusiasts.

—description from the designer

name: Gridwars 2.0
description: GridWars are set in an alternate future where society, technology, and reality itself are interconnected in a sprawling digital matrix known as The Grid. Multiple cyberpunk factions wage a relentless war amidst hypnotic neon lights and humming data streams. Exploit every bit of data as one flip of a binary switch can decide who will control the vast digital expanse and seize the overwhelming power it promises.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Kreel Manor: The Path of the Dead
description:
Become a Necromancer and summon defeated enemies to fight for you with this dark new hero.

The expansion for Kreel Manor: The Dungeon Crawl Card Game adds a new hero to play as (and allows up to 4 players, 5 with The Path of Song).

name: The Last Catch
description:
The Last Catch is a card drafting, hand management, pick up and deliver game for 2-4 players, ages 10+, playing time around 30 min.

The players are fishermen and they are trying to catch as many fish as possible and deliver them to villages before winter.
But this won't be an easy task.
The villages have specific demands on what kind of fish they want. Also, the players are restricted by the cards in their hand, they can only add cards to the right or to the left and can only deliver cards from the right or from the left of their hand.

The player who collects the most points by catching fish and delivering them to villages will be the winner of the game.

—description from the designer
categories: Animals, Card Game, Nautical, Print & Play
mechanics: Matching, Open Drafting, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement

name: Five Twists
description:
Five Twists is a semi-cooperative trick-taking game with hidden roles & variable card ranks. Player actions determine card ranks while revealing information that can aid players deducing partner identities. Using limited information to identify hidden partners, players vie to score the points with their partner and by also fulfilling secret individual objectives. Each round partners, secret objectives, & variable card ranks change; setting up the perfect storm for betrayal and intrigue.
Five Twists is played over 5 rounds, with the winner being the player with the most points at the end of the 5th round.

—description from the designer

name: Below the Torii Gate
description:
Below The Torii Gate is a competitive trick-taking game where players make offerings to nearby forest spirits and earn points based on how many spirits they please. Playing cards allows players to attract spirits & fulfill different offerings. Fulfilling offerings affords players points and sometimes another special bonus. Card suits are ingredient types for various offerings. Players play single cards where suit and rank determine lead in future hands of play. Players have a limited number of visiting spirits they can entertain at once, so gaining the lead is important for attracting the most easily pleased spirits.

Below The Torii Gate is played over 5 rounds, with the winner being the player with the most points at the end of the 5th round.'

—description from the designer

name: Battle for Manhattan
description:
With the help of the Avengers, defend Manhattan against Thanos and Loki!

Your aim of the game is creating the biggest group of Avengers Tiles depending on the symbols drawn on your Identity Token. Shuffle the Identity Tokens face down and draw one of them each. Do not show your token to the other players!
Choose one tile each from the tiles you have received and pass the remaining tiles to the neighbouring player. When all players have selected 1 tile each and passed the rest on, place the chosen tiles face up. Then, one by one, add them to the previously
placed tiles. The player who has the tile with the highest number lays it out first, followed by the others in descending order of the numbers on their tiles.
In addition to the squares with the image of the Avengers, you will also find 5 types of special squares on the tiles. Special squares can be added to any other square in the game, and any square can also be added to them.
Special squares can make your game easier or harder for other players.

When you have played 2 or 3 rounds (depending on the number of players), reveal your Identity Tokens and count whick of the Avengers has created the largest continous area. The fewer players have owned the same Avenger, the more points you get for its area. Then add up the scores for both of the Avengers you have on your Identity Token.
The player with the highest score wins!

—description from the publisher
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Territory Building
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Hidden Roles, Pattern Building, Turn Order: Stat-Based

name: Demon Hunter
description:
Hunters play cards to complete rituals to banish demons, but one or more among them turns out to be possessed by a demon. Will the hunters succeed or will the demons?

Demon Hunter is a semi-cooperative trick-taking card game with hidden roles & open bidding. Players play cards to win tricks; trick-winning cards count as fulfilled portions of rituals for each player on both sides. With a limited book of rituals, each player bids on which of their rituals they think they can complete each round. Each ritual being completable once per game. When a player completes a ritual, they fulfill a portion of the group ritual which determines how Hunters & Demons score. The more the Demons win, the more they corrupt the group ritual and the more points their wins are worth. Hunters are working to beat the demons to the top, but since no one knows who the demons are, this battle of good and evil comes down to wits.

Demon Hunter is played over 5 rounds, with the winner being the player with the most points at the end of the 5th round.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Bids As Wagers, Hidden Roles, Trick-taking

name: Starving Artists
description:
Starving Artists is a game of abstract thinking and shrewd resource management for 4-6 players that takes about 10 minutes per player. Manage a supply of unique magnetic pieces, using them to represent abstract titles and trading them in for new title cards if the ones you have aren't working. One player is the art critic, who must try to match each artwork with its title, avoiding decoys. Doing this successfully earns both the artist and the critic points. The player that communicated their vision and managed their resources best will be declared the winner!

Objective:
Become the most successful artist by having the most points at the end of the game. Score points by guessing others’ artworks correctly, having your own artwork correctly guessed, and having the most pieces remaining of each color at the end of the game.

name: Loaded Questions: Greatest Hits – 26th Anniversary
description:
You might think you know your friends well, but do you know how they’d respond to a controversial question like, "What superpower is not very super?"

Loaded Questions: Greatest Hits is a hilarious Q&A party game for you to figure out who said what with 250 of the franchise's top-rated questions!

Each round, you make your friends anonymously answer an absurd question from the deck: "If you started a rock band, what would you call it?".

You then have to decide which friend gave which hilarious response–which might reveal more about them than you knew! With each round, the role of the judge rotates so everyone has a chance to become the Loaded Questions Champion!

—description from the publisher

name: Fantasy Fishin'
description:
Fantasy Fishin’ is a game for 2-5 players with a focus on gameplay that’s easy to learn, quick, and engaging! A game typically lasts only 30 minutes and is recommended to anyone 8 years or older.

In Fantasy Fishin’ players take on the role of an angler in a breathtaking fantasy setting. Enjoy catching legendary fish, epic treasure, and even some useful trash as you compete with your friends to become the ultimate angler.

On each turn, players will go fishing and choose between moving to a new lake, using 1 of their 3 unique tool cards, or exchanging their old tool cards for new ones.

There are a total of 19 unique tool cards and 16 ever-changing lakes to fish from. Only by mastering all the lakes and tools available to you will you become the ultimate angler! Do you have what it takes?

—description from the designer
mechanics: Multi-Use Cards, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: If You Were
description:
An adult party game where the active player draws a card and reads the question, like "If I were a tasty Chicken which would I be?" Five choices are given and then players simultaneously pick the option that will be the most like the active player.

Players matching the majority opinion get a point and play continues around the table with a new active player.

name: Dream Team Soccer
description:
Earn your way to the top of the podium by getting rid of your cards the fastest.

The deck consists of 60 cards: 10 tens, 9 nines, and so on down to 1 one card, and 5 special cards.

The person who leads can play either a single card or a set of two or more cards of the same value. As play proceeds, each player must play a set with the same number of cards, of a lower value, or pass.

Hands continue until only one player has cards remaining in their hand. The first player to go out wins a gold medal, worth 3 points, the second player gets a silver medal worth 2 points, and the third gets a bronze medal, worth 1 point.

After seven rounds, The player with the highest point total becomes the Dream Team Soccer Champion!

name: Nut Nut Squirrel!: Even Nuttier
description:
Those naughty squirrels are back at it and peskier than ever in this nuttier version of nut nut Squirrel! Collect the most cards to win this game of lickety-split decisions, chance, and strategy. What kind of player will you be?

Are you meek and mild mannered, an impulsive risk-taker, or a slow, calculating strategist. Find out in this breakout game of surprise and wild choices. The object is to flip over as many cards as possible without unearthing a squirrel which will steal your stash!

Exciting New Additions

The Golden Acorn (oooh! ahhh!): If you are able to bank this card by the end of the round, add 5 points to your final total.
Squirrel Cage: Cage the next squirrel you flip over and keep going!
Winter Is Coming: It’s time to gather more nuts. You must flip 3 more cards.
The Nut Thief: Steal 1 nut from each player.


—description from the publisher

name: Merry Guess•mas?
description:
Stack up presents in this easy, fast-paced card game full of giggles and gifts as teams try to guess their way to the win. Extra challenges may have clue givers spinning in circles to fulfill this outrageous gift-gathering quest. But whatever you do, don’t land on the naughty list!

—description from the publisher
categories: Children's Game, Party Game, Real-time, Word Game

name: Grind House: Scythes Out
description:
The secrets of Grind House deepen in this new expansion that promises greater rewards…if you can stand the risk.
The Host has opened a new wing of the mansion for you to come explore, and your invitation included a little something extra this time around. But did the other players receive another message too? You’d better stay sharp if you want to win Scythes Out.

New Thematic Mechanic: Promised Inheritance tokens. The Host has invited you all with a promise, but you’ll soon find, that some promises are better than others. Rooms offer the ability to swap tokens between yourselves and other players in hopes of ending as the favored player.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Horror
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Team-Based Game, Voting

name: Lyrically Correct: A Music Trivia Game – Mix Tape Edition: Funk, Hip Hop, Pop, and R&B
description:
Are you ready to get funky fresh, spit-dope rhymes, and hit those fly notes? Grab ya homeboys and homegirls and get ready to partaaaayyy. It’s time to see who knows the lyrics to all those 80s jams we love.

We have created a game so HOT that the VIBE will shift with every new card. Some cards are INTENSE FACT CHECKERS, some will MAKE YOU DANCE, and others will lead to a STRAIGHT UP KARAOKE SESSION. This is a UNIQUE EXPERIENCE like nothing else on the market.

Grab two or more players (pick your teammates wisely) and take turns answering questions about the 80's Hip Hop, R&B, Funk, and Pop hits.

Hold up, that’s not it. Just when you think you have the right answer, a challenge card can be issued at any time which will test everyone's knowledge a little more.

—description from the publisher

name: Lyrically Correct: A Music Trivia Game – 60's and 70's Oldies But Goodies Edition
description:
Lyrically Correct is a music trivia card game that tests how well you know the lyrics to some of the hottest songs. This game will have you laughing, arguing, singing, and most of all enjoying time with friends and family.

Are you ready to get your groove on? Get ready to sing your favorite lines from ya momma and em' favorite songs!

We have created a game so HOT that the VIBE will shift with every new card. Some cards are INTENSE FACT CHECKERS, some will MAKE YOU DANCE, and others will lead to a STRAIGHT UP KARAOKE SESSION. This is a UNIQUE EXPERIENCE like nothing else on the market.

Grab two or more players (pick your teammates wisely) and take turns answering questions about the 60s and 70s Oldies but Goodies.

Hold up, that’s not it. Just when you think you have the right answer, a challenge card can be issued at any time which will test everyone's knowledge a little more.

—description from the publisher

name: Lyrically Correct: A Music Trivia Game – Revival: The Gospel Edition
description:
Lyrically Correct is a music trivia card game that tests how well you know the lyrics to some of the hottest songs. This game will have you laughing, arguing, singing, and most of all enjoying time with friends and family.

Are you ready for a game night full of praise and worship? Be prepared to sing, dance, and shout your favorite gospel songs.

We have created a game so HOT that the VIBE will shift with every new card. Some cards are INTENSE FACT CHECKERS, some will MAKE YOU DANCE, and others will lead to a STRAIGHT UP KARAOKE SESSION. This is a UNIQUE EXPERIENCE like nothing else on the market.

Grab two or more players (pick your teammates wisely) and take turns answering questions about the gospel music we all love. Whether in your living room or in the holy sanctuary, we got you.

Hold up, that’s not it. We have created all New Challenge Cards for this deck. Are you saved and sanctified? Just when thou think you have it all figured out, a challenge card can be issued at any time that checks to see who was really paying attention at Sunday School.

—description from the publisher

name: Lizzie Borden's Ghost
description:
Fall River, Mass. 1927: Elizabeth “Lizzie” Andrew Borden, the main suspect in the August 4, 1892, ax murders of her father and stepmother, has died of natural causes. She has left a faded letter to the four people who can finally solve the crime. One player takes the role of Lizzie Borden. The remaining take the roles of City Marshal, Judge, Neighbor, and News Reporter, called the “Seekers.” The Seekers move room to room while picking up 19th century equipment used for paranormal exploring. They attempt to capture Lizzie’s ghost as it travels the scene of the crime: the Borden home.

The game board is a map of the first and second floors, back and front yards of the Borden home, Massachusetts, circa late 1800s. Each room and noted areas is a “Hot Spot,” or haunting.
Seekers gather equipment for capturing Lizzie’s ghost moving room to room only by using marked doorways. Lizzie moves in secret using the "Hot Spot" location cards. By various means, the Seekers attempt to deduce and uncover Lizzie’s location.
A roll of the dice, a turn of a card, a decision to "seek" or "hover"- will a Seeker catch Lizzie's ghost and force her to admit her guilt? Or will she escape by haunting five hot spots without being found?

Adult themes of criminal activity, gore, paranormal
Mystery, roll ‘n’ play, selection
This game was created by an all-female team of talented writers, artists, and designers from all over the world. The game includes trivia, facts, and history of the case and the 19th century.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Impulse Movement, Multi-Use Cards
publishers: Best True Crime Books, Games & Video LLC

name: Rock, Paper, Scissors: The Card Game
description:
Bringing together two classic games, "Rock, Paper, Scissors" and "War" in this fun and fast-paced game. There are, of course, a few twists. This is a game the entire family can enjoy! It was inspired by my own kids and their love for card games, but especially their favorite game, "Rock, Paper, Scissors!"

QUICK TO LEARN: The rules are simple and easy to learn!

SMALL AND COMPACT: Bring this game on the go, it is small and easy to travel with!

BOREDOM BUSTER: This game brings the fun, and is sure to beat boredom any day!

—description from the publisher

name: Captain's Log: Myths and Legends
description:
Captain's Log Myths and Legends will incorporate fantasy into the game board, now not only the living are present and not all acts are equally honorable. Every act can have a consequence, and this will be revealed as time goes by... the story continues.

We have separated from the main plot, now we can find mermaids, harpies, flying ships and much more... little by little will be revealed all the content that will incorporate this expansion.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Age of Reason, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Nautical, Pirates, Transportation
mechanics: Action Points, Action/Event, Area Movement, Bias, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Map Addition, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Race, Semi-Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Set-up

name: Super 00s Board Game
description:
Grab your flip phones and frost those tips as you re-enter the world of the 2000’s in this totally radical board game featuring fascinating trivia questions on 00’s music, T.V., movies, sport and cultural affairs!

—description from the publisher

name: Vitals
description:
Vitals is a real-time cooperative dice-rolling game about working together as a surgical team.
Players work together in real-time mimicking the atmosphere of an operating room to perform all of the tasks of the procedure while keeping your patient alive.

Teams are made up of 3 to 6 players consisting of the following roles: Surgeon, Scrub Tech, Anesthesiologist, (4th player) Circulator Nurse, (5th player) First Assist, and (6th player) Student Intern.

The gameplay begins by pulling a card from the Operation deck. Cards drawn from the operation deck explain the type of surgery about to be performed. It will show which side of the game board to use, what instrument cards will be required, and the locations of the surgery.

Each player assumes one role and works together to roll dice in real-time to perform their individual tasks needed to perform the operation. A core game concept is the Wellness button. This button needs to be pressed by one of the players when achieving their initial task at least every 15 seconds or the patient flatlines. This must be done throughout the entire surgery. If the patient flatlines, all players must stop what they are doing and roll the defibrillator dice and place the proper face on the defibrillator track next to the patient within 15 seconds to revive them. If the players succeed in reviving them, play continues. If they fail, the patient is lost and the players lose.

Roles:
Surgeon (required) - This player rolls dice when working with tools. He must roll dice until he has the dice faces of the tool he is using. Once he meets the required faces, he may use the tool to perform the task and reveal the next tool needed.

Surgical (Scrub) Tech (required) - This individual rolls dice to match the tools the surgeon asks for. When they roll the correct dice faces, they may hand that tool to the surgeon.

Anesthesiologist (required) - This player rolls dice to check the vitals of the patient. They must alternate between checking temperature, heart rate, respiratory rate, blood pressure, oxygen saturation, and awareness. This player is responsible for keeping the patient alive when other professionals are tending to their tasks.

(4th player) Circulator Nurse - This player prepares the patient for surgery and collects tools to give to the Scrub Tech and Medical supplies to give to the Anesthetist.

(5th player) First Assist - Assists the surgeon in performing surgical tasks that require more than one person.

(6th player) Student Intern - Assists all players in dice rolling. This player has one of each die for all of the other players.

—description from the designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Dice, Educational, Medical, Real-time
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Drawing, Re-rolling and Locking, Real-Time, Simulation

name: Supper's Ready
description:
Once you set the table with four plates the cookoff begins! With a dash of luck and a pinch of strategy, Supper's Ready is all the fun of running a professional kitchen without the mess or picky customers!

So how do you make healthy meals with a board game?

Players draw Food Cards and take turns building up meals and the Chef who places the last ingredient on a plate calls out "Supper's Ready!" and gets credit for the meal.
So keep an eye on you foo because another Chef may steal our meal and take all the credit!
It pays not to be a chicken because whoever finishes the most meals in a game wins the title of Master Chef!

In Supper's Ready! each meal follows real-world nutritional guidelines so you may even be inspired to make some of your delicious, healthy meals in your own kitchen after you're done playing!

Additionally, to make the game more immersive we have mixed in real-world events with the Food Cards and called them Action Cards. Whether they call for a surprise government inspection or ask you to give some food to charity.

Action Cards can slow down your Healthy Meal production or give you the edge you need to mussel out the competition.

—description from the back of the box

name: Interceptor
description: A version of electronic Battleship with 6 different game modes. Games are played using joysticks to electronically set up pieces and select grid spaces where a player wishes to attack. The six modes include sea, ground, space, sea/ground, ground/space, and treasure hunt.

name: Road Rage
description:
Avalon Mini-Games #112

Chad gunned the car and thumbed the trigger, the machine guns mounted on the hood of his beat up car throwing hot lead across the highway. He was close to winning this duel, all he needed to do was put down that scum bag Wilma an he would be crowned champion.

As the bullets from his twin machine guns scared the back plating of Wilma’s car, he watched in horror as a panel open up on the back of her car, small limpet mines falling out like a swarm of cockroaches. “Damn”, he cried as he tried to swerve out of the mines field, but then his tires hit the first mine and he knew he had lost this duel, his car flipping over and over across the blacktop of the highway.

This is Road Rage another great Mini-Game from Avalon Games. Take your chances on the abandoned highways of a future America, a country falling into anarchy and desperation. The highways now are home to roving bands of biker raider, and the brave, some say, foolish road warriors and their hoped up battle cars. Can you survive the battles on the blacktops, will your skills behind the wheel be enough to win the day, or will your foe blow you and your car into small little smoking bits of wreckage.

-description from publisher's website

name: Road Rage 2
description:
Avalon Mini-Game #113

Road Rage 2 is an expansion to Avalon Game’s great little auto duel game, Road Rage. Within this expansion you will find new Road Cards, New Cars and some new options.

Note that this is not a compete game and requires that you have a copy of Mini-Game #112, Road Rage Set #1.

name: Road Rage 3
description:
Avalon Mini-Game #114

Road Rage 3 is an expansion to Avalon Game’s great little auto duel game, Road Rage. Within this expansion you will find new Road Cards, New Cars and some new options.

Note that this is not a complete game and requires that you have a copy of Mini-Game #112, Road Rage Set #1.

name: DICE-Tractions: Dice Football
description:
Avalon Mini-Game #106

To play Dice Football, you need:
• A long flat surface
• 16 Dice.

Before you and your opponent do anything else, set a salary cap. A salary cap is the total number of sides each team is allowed to have (a d6 counts for six points, a d20 counts for twenty points, etc). Setting the salary cap to 128 allows your dice to be, on average, d8s. Assign each die to a position. On a single team, no two dice can have the same position, nor can any die hold more then one position.

The offensive positions include:
• Quarterback (QB),
• Running back (RB),
• Wide Receiver (WR), and
• Offensive Line (LT, LG, C, RG, and RT).

Defensive positions include:
• Cornerback (CB),
• Safety (S),
• Linebacker (LB) and
• Defensive Line (LE, LDT, CDT, RDT, and RE).

There are no special teams in Dice Football.

name: DICE-Tractions: Dice Racing
description:
Avalon Mini-Games #104

Horse racing, auto racing, gladiator racing, whatever the kind of racing, watching something pushed to the edge of its endurance cross a finish line has been a past time of the human race throughout recorded time. Now you can
do it at home with you dice.

Dice Racing is a multiplayer dice game where everyone takes one race participant and shows how well they can roll with their dice. Not only is Dice Racing a fun standalone game, it works in conjunction with role playing games of any setting or system. Your gambling character now has a way to place a wager without just having the Game Master say, “You lost,” with no
explanation.

How to Play
1 Setup: Choose the number and kinds of dice being raced. Each player will need that many dice. A pen and paper is recommended for recording everyone’s results, but these are not required. Count up all the sides of the dice that one player rolls, then multiply that number by five. That number is the finish line.
2 Rolling: Roll your dice and record your total results. Roll your dice again add these results to your previous total. Keep rolling until someone meets or exceeds the finish line.
3 Winning: If two cross the line at the same time, the one with the higher final total wins. If both had the same final
total, then it is a tie.

name: Sew Fast
description:
How fast can you sew?

Each player gets a sewing board and three strings in three colors. Flip over one of the challenge cards and then...

Ready, set, SEW!

Working as quickly as they can, players race to thread their strings through their board so it matches the picture on the card.

The first to finish wins!

With 40 cards, four levels of difficulty, and multiple ways to play, seamsters young and old are in for hours of skill-testing fun with Sew Fast!

name: Block'em Pop'em Woodbots Balloon Game
description:
How to play:


Blow up balloons and tie the end .
Insert balloon on top of player into the slit between shoulders putting the knot into the top hole and stretching the end of the balloon into the slit until balloon is resting firmly.
Use both left and right triggers for sword chopping action! The intent of the game is to pop the balloon head of the other player Whoever pops other persons balloon first wins!


—description from publisher

name: 200 MPH
description:
Print & Play racing game

From publisher's description:
RACE, BUMP, WIN

Speed around a track at 200 MPH! Interfere and block your opponent, but be careful not to bump into a wall!

200 MPH is a racing game for 2 to 6 players, ages 5 and up. Game time is 15 min.

name: Infantry Attacks: Winter's Battle
description:
In February 1915, the Germans launched an offensive in East Prussia designed to drive the Russians out of their last foothold in German territory. Despite the bitter cold and heavy snow, the Germans crushed the Russian 10th Army and secured a major victory though not enough to knock Russia out of the war as had been hoped.

Winter’s Battle is a Campaign Study (a short book of scenarios and history) based on the Second Battle of the Masurian Lakes (we covered the First Battle in August 1914). The Germans, reinforced by newly-raised divisions and troops transferred from the Western Front, inflicted as many as 135,000 casualties including 80,000 prisoners taken, at a cost of some 32,000 of their own.

Winter’s Battle adds 11 new scenarios to Infantry Attacks: August 1914, split into two chapters, each with a battle game to link the scenarios together. This being an Avalanche Press product, there’s also the background story of the battle. It requires August 1914 and Fall of Empires (for some additional Russian pieces) to play all 11 scenarios.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War I

name: Cancelled Club
description:
Cancelled Club is a Party Game where you try to get your friends cancelled while you gain social credit points.

Players battle it out to get the most points in their hand before someone is cancelled. Defend yourself from being cancelled by claiming Fake News! Steal cards by playing offensive cards like Social Justice Warrior or Gaslight. Protect yourself by playing defensive cards like Conspiracy Theory or Defamation. Mess with the deck by looking, stealing, or shuffling. And collect as many point cards as fast as you can before someone is cancelled.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Hot Potato, Take That

name: DuAlma
description:
DuAlma is an abstract strategy game for 2 players of at least 8 years of age, with an average playing time of 15 minutes, aiming to create a row of 3 discs of the same colour, being at the topmost of height-2 stacks.

—description from the publisher

name: Rogue Seas
description:
Many moons ago, a mighty Spanish ship, The San Miguel, was barreled up with precious metals and stones. To escape pirates hot on their trail, the crew ventured into the perilous Infinity Storm, never to be seen again. Pirate Captains from every port in the Seven Seas have flocked to these waters in search of the fabled Treasure. Aye, with so many greedy scallywags, these ROGUE SEAS are not to be reckoned with!

In this EASY TO LEARN strategy game, the goal is to:

Find the five missing pieces of the treasure map
Safely navigate the Infinity Storm & reach Treasure Island


Players must upgrade their vessel and assemble their crew in order to find buried treasure, slay Lethal Monsters, and plunder Loot from Merchants and other Captains.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Different Dice Movement, Hexagon Grid, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Tags, Variable Player Powers

name: Skylines: Air Traffic Control
description:
Skylines: Air Traffic Control is a 1 to 4/5 player cooperative puzzle board game. Players take on the role of different ATC stations (Approach/Departure, Delivery, Ground, and Tower) and must undertake a shift at versions of some of the world’s most iconic airports. Working together, players must deal with approaching and departing aircraft, represented by two individual decks of cards, and deliver varying flights to different locations both at and beyond the in-play airport, represented on the game board.

Players win the game if they can clear both the Approach and Departure decks without any safety hazards. At the basic level, hazards refer to safety protocols. If planes come into contact with one another, at any stage on the game board or on the approach/departure board, the game immediately comes to an end. In addition, players must deal with ‘Hazard Cards’, which emerge from both the Approach and Departure decks.

Skylines: Air Traffic Control is a 3D puzzle game. Players must exercise planning, communication, and cooperation to deal with the Approach and Departure decks and must show the ability to think several turns ahead of the current game turn to avoid catastrophic results that will bring the game to an end. The ‘gamification’ of this puzzle is achieved through action rationing.

Players will carry out their limited number of actions simultaneously during a game turn by applying tokens, representing radio instructions, to the planes currently under their jurisdiction. Once the game turn is over (i.e., when each player has issued their instructions), the planes then carry out these instructions on the game board and approach/departure boards, with the responsible players moving the pieces along allocated taxiing routes, approach/departure vectors, and runways. Once the planes are moved (represented by meeples/miniatures), the next game turn begins and players continue issuing instructions to their planes under their jurisdiction.

Skylines: Air Traffic Control can be played solo, with one player taking on all ATC station roles, though works best with the full complement of four players. An option for adding a fifth player to a game exists. This is achieved by splitting the Approach/Departure station into individual player roles. The game is also expandable, and can be played with multiple groups of players representing multiple airports, using multiple copies of the game. In this case, the role of player five in each group takes on the role of an Area Controller. The Area Controller is responsible for routing planes between the two airports.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Multiple Maps, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Sudden Death Ending

name: Coconosian Sharkball
description:
Sharkball is a form of dodgeball played between the various monkey nations of the Fruitopian Archipelago. Notable exceptions from standard dodgeball include aerial gymnastics over a shark-infested section of the ocean, the bombs strapped to everyone's back, using coconuts instead of balls, and the fact that a match begins with 8 teams instead of 2.

Your objective in this game is to predict which team will win overall, and which team will be eliminated in each round, and then to try to make it happen. Play cards to the teams, call strikes to eliminate monkeys, figure out who your temporary allies are among your fellow gamblers, and gain points for making your predictions come true!

—description from the designer
categories: Animals, Card Game, Print & Play, Sports
mechanics: Alliances, Predictive Bid, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Shiloh Solitaire
description:
Shiloh Solitaire is designed to be played by one player who commands the Confederate army at the battle of Shiloh on April 6, 1862. Solitaire rules govern the actions of the Union side.

There are four types of combat counters in the game: infantry and cavalry demi-brigades, division artillery, and Union gunboats.

There are 16 one-hour turns in the game, starting at 5 AM and ending with the 8 PM turn.

The Confederate side has the initiative for the first five turns. For the sixth turn and every turn thereafter, the side with the initiative is randomly determined by rolling a six-sided die (1D6) for each side. If there is a tie, the Confederate side acts first in the turn.

The side with the initiative conducts the following action phases first in the order shown. Once the side with the initiative has finished with the Assault Combat phase, the other side then does the same.


Union Camp Activations (Union Side Only)
Rally
Movement
Combat
Artillery Bombardment Combat
Assault Combat



The idea is to create a fast-play, solitaire game of the battle with quality art, which would fill a need in the activity for this subject.

—description from the designer

name: Fast Play A.C.W. Rules
description: Miniature rule set aimed at fast play. Covers all the American Civil War.
categories: American Civil War, Book, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Devour the Heart!
description:
In the wake of the Marrow Queen's murder, Mecinar has been thrown into chaos. With the throne vacant and the city in turmoil, you must gain influence and snatch enough gold in order to seize power in just five short days, before the coronation of the next Monarch!

Use your Agents to infiltrate the city, start fights in the shadows with your Thugs, and enlist common folk to your cause with the promise of fresh water and wealth, in this 2-4 player asymmetrical territory-control game. After five rounds of corrupting, fighting, and looting, victory points are tallied based on a combination of spread corruption, amassed gold, and public objectives.

Do you have what it takes to Devour the Heart of Mecinar and ascend to the throne in this game of strategy?

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Movement, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Builder Bees
description:
Builder Bees is a bee hive building hex polyomino tile laying game for 2 players, ages 10+, playing time around 30 min.

In Builder Bees, the players are bee hive builders and they have been tasked by the Queen Bee to build a new bee hive.
The player who manages to build a better bee hive by building honeycomb tiles and grouping the same type of honey together along with following Queen's Decrees will score the most points, win the favor of the Queen Bee and be the winner of the game.

The game also has a solo mode in which you play against the Queen Bee.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Connections, End Game Bonuses, Grid Coverage, Hexagon Grid, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Mount Dora-Opoly
description:
For board game lovers, things just got a little closer to home. Mount Dora has now joined over 50 other Florida cities with its own version of an American classic. Mount Dora-opoly launched fall of 2020 and features popular local landmarks, businesses and streets in the quaint Central Florida town.

Using rules similar to those of Monopoly, players can snatch up Goblin Market, the Donnelly House, One Flight Up. the lighthouse and other recognizable local spots and streets to build their property-trading portfolio. Like the classic game, a long or shorter version of Mount Dora-opoly can be played.

—description from the publihser
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Dungeon Crawl: Blackthorn Forest
description:
Blackthorn Forest is the first of a series of expansions for Epic Adventure Dungeon Crawl. The game principles remain the same: you must search the dungeon for the random finale card, the big difference is that now you must explore Blackthorn Forest and FIND the dungeon.

This expansion introduces a new character class as well as the new Special Encounter Cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Maze, Print & Play

name: Dungeon Crawl: Blackthorn Forest Quest
description:
This expansion introduces a new character type - The Bard. This musical adventurer has access to some special powers IF he has his prized lute with him. This new character type has an experience table to add to the Dungeon Quest experience table.

This expansion includes:

Forest Quest Cards
New, Forest Quest related Treasure Cards
New, Forest Quest related Encounter Cards
New character advancement and experience tables
Character Sheet
Ranged weapon and Spell rules
Part Play rules - Now you and a friend can adventure together.
New Skill - Ranged Weapon


Other Quest Expansions will be available for Blackthorn Forest, Treliar City and Murkwood Swamp

This is NOT a stand-alone product. This expansion requires the Epic Adventure Dungeon Crawl Core Rules and the Dungeon Crawl: Blackthorn Forest to play.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Maze, Print & Play

name: Woodland
description: In Woodland you and your fellow hikers have lost the trail back to base and nightfall is closing in. You are only equipped with a few survival tools that you must use to survive in the unforgiving forests of New England. Each turn you must roll the die and perform a variety of dice outcomes that simulate resource consumption. You must manage your food and water supply while avoiding injury and periodically building shelter to make it out alive.

name: Marathon Beginners
description:
The marathon beginners edition is a highly educational question – answer game, prepared under pedagogical school-age.

Marathon beginners has more than 2500 questions about school and cultural matters, classified in three difficulty levels. 240 car juice, vivid graphics of famous people, monuments, animals, and many other familiar objects, to stimulate your child’s imagination in memory.

Your child will begin with a 10 km run against IGG Knoranz, the mightiest representative of an imaginary country of I don’t know.

Each of the players has three possibilities, answer correctly and move his knowledge token 1 km answer incorrectly and IGG Knoranz token will advance 1 km, or pass, giving the question to the next player.

Marathon beginners provides your child with the opportunity to learn, educational, basics, develop visual recognition skills, discover a wide variety of fascinating things, exercise the mind with the deductive reasoning questions, encourage your child to make the awesome roll.

Marathon beginners is a turn based game rated for ages 6 to 11.
A minimum player of two teams or individuals in a maximum of six teams or individuals.

name: The Naval SITREP: The Journal of Naval Miniatures #64
description:
The Naval SITREP is published twice a year by the Admiralty Trilogy Group. It supports the Admiralty Trilogy game system with scenarios, articles on history and technology, and rules expansions & corrections.

The Naval SITREP Issue #64 was published in April of 2023.

Features

The Finnish Navy and Border Guard

Guns, Missiles, and Radars in Finnish Service

Naming Chinese Missiles, Part 1

Mining French Harbors in WW I


Rule Changes and Corrections

Clarification: Dogfight Speed Modifier

Updating Laser Dazzlers

Obituaries

David C. Schueler 1964 - 2023

Book Reviews

Tsar Bomba, by Krzysztof Dabrowski
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Nautical, Wargame, World War I, World War II

name: Clear the Coast: Scenarios for Small Craft in WWII
description:
Most of the naval battles in WW II weren't fought by big ships, but by small craft – torpedo boats, gunboats, subchasers, minesweepers, and the like. These battles aren't as well-known as the big fleet engagements like Matapan or Leyte, but the day-to-day patrolling, minesweeping, and convoying by these feisty small craft were just as important.

Pat Hreachmack has collected thirty-four surface actions involving these smaller coastal vessels. They are all historical and most involve only a handful of units.

These are short, vicious fights, usually between matched forces and were determined by the side with the better tactics. But there are also times when the victory conditions are to simply escape without being mauled or sunk. Many are in less-than-ideal visibility, with the two sides coming upon each other well inside effective gun range, sometimes with one, or both parties, surprised.

In addition to the scenarios, Clear the Coast! includes all the information on the ships, weapons, and sensors needed to play them using Command at Sea fourth edition rules.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Covidbuster
description:
Covidbuster – A simulation about comprehensive Crisis Management of the COVID-19 Pandemic in Austria

Covidbuster is a cooperative serious board game for 1-4 players and was also designed for educational gaming by professionals. In the classroom Covidbuster is best suited for four player teams with 4 participants each and one gamemaster.

The game is based on AFTERSHOCK: A Humanitarian Crisis Game, and so those familiar with that game will recognize many of the mechanics. It is also inspired by core mechanics of virus spread used in the successful Pandemic game series.

Covidbuster has been developed 2020/2021 under real life restrictions caused by Covid-19 involving various professionals from public authorities and science. The project itself started as cooperation between the Austrian Military Academy and the game design label Tablewood Studios.

Covidbuster could be seen already as historical conflict simulation, which covers the first year of nation-wide crisis management after the outbreak of a new virus. It can be used as educational tool to remember the challenges the world was facing during the Covid-19 pandemic, but also to get into the topic as soon as a new virus gets viral. Note: After the Covid-19 pandemics is before the next pandemic. Societies are forgetting all too fast.

The key actors available with Covidbuster are the Health Authorities, the Civil Rescue Organizations, the Police, and the Austrian Armed Forces (Bundesheer), which play in that particular order.

Covidbuster demonstrates the complexity of nation-wide crisis management in Austria at different working levels during a pandemic linked with a simple, but still logical, infection rate. The actors should face the ups and downs of virus spread due to different factors like clusters, lockdowns, limited supplier markets, vaccine research, influencer conspiracies and a variety of other events which drives the situation. The dominant key player is the Health Services with the authority to put a general Lockdown in place (just once per game with a special card the actor has already at hand from the very beginning of the game). The military is the last actor during a game round, since it only acts by request of other authorities like Health Services or Police.

Instead of districts you have the whole state of Austria represented by the nine federal states (Bundesländer). Each game plan for a federal state (Bundesland) includes a “Corona-Ampel” with four different colors (green-yellow-orange-red) reflecting the regional epidemic situation. The Corona-Ampel and the deck of Needs Cards are linked, since the colour of the Ampel increases the needs for critical supplies (+ 1 per type). Players assign teams to different tasks. There are special fields for certain events like Quarantine and Disaster Relief (e.g. due to avalanches or floods) to tie up operational teams.

The four types of supplies are related to the most critical groups of goods needed to manage the pandemic. White cubes stand for personal protective equipment.
