Blue cubes stand for “disinfectants” and other liquid resources like blood plasma. Green Cubes are any form of test kits and also include medication. Red Cubes stand for intensive care beds and include the whole technology linked to it (e.g. respirators). In the fourth month production facilities could be put in place representing domestic production capacities of critical items.

Since Austria is surrounded by eight neighbouring countries there is an Infection Plan for these countries, too. This plan also includes a “Corona-Ampel” related to the WHO representing the global pandemic situation. The Police and Military actors assign teams to border management which act as a blocker for the cross-border spread of the virus.

In each player turn there is an Infection Phase prior to the concluding Supply Phase by drawing infection cards to define the location of new infections like in the boardgame Pandemic. “Pandemic Cubes” will be placed on the Ampel of the effected “Bundesland” or “Neighbouring Country” and each color/cube stands for a reproduction factor of “1”. There are four “Pandemic Cards” in the deck which trigger an outbreak and could lead to chain reactions of viral spread. 

Logistic and supply chain challenges are simplified by delaying the availability of supplies. With a logistic operation you get ordered supplies from abroad back home into your domestic warehouses. The exchange of items between players and the generation of production facilities is possible. There are certain events in the course of the game which will have an impact on the supply chain, too.  

Cards, cards, cards: The card driven core mechanic needs a lot of playing cards. There are cards for coordination, events, needs and special situations (e.g. Media, Assessment, Social Unrest). In detail they differ very much due to the pandemic situation. Needs Cards (Bedarfskarten) include three different types refering either to a Regional Pandemic situation, a Corona Cluster or special situations like Corona Demos, Travel Warnings, Daily Commuters, Influenza Wave, Lack of Intensive Care Beds, Mask Refuseniks or Cov-Idiots.

The game lasts over 12 months/rounds. Playing time could be longer (5-8 hours), but the game system allows flexibility by reducing the playing time (3, 6 or 9 months) or even play it longer.

Players gain or loose “Government Points” – the final score could be “good” or “bad governance”.

Extra blank playing cards can be used to add new challenges or personal experiences of participants.

This serious board game had a print run of 20 copies (German edition). 

Due to the geographical position of Austria in the heart of Europe with borderlines to many neighbouring countries it may be a game system attracted by a wider audience, since during the global Covid-19 pandemic domestic challenges have been quite similar to each other effected country.

Therefore the designer is looking for a publisher for an English edition to make Covidbuster also accessible for a wider audience.
categories: Economic, Educational, Industry / Manufacturing, Medical, Negotiation, Political
mechanics: Action/Event, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Modular Board, Simulation

name: Veria
description:
Veria is a card placement, worker movement game for 2 players, ages 10+, playing time 30 min.

Players are peach farmers in Veria, Greece and they are using card placement and worker movement to plant, grow and harvest peaches.

The winner is the player that scores the most points.

Veria is part of the designer's 2 player Around the World series of games.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Layering, Movement Points, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Random Production

name: Dungeon Crawl: Treliar City
description:
In the province of Darcanthia lies the city of Treliar; a strange city full of mystery and intrigue. Many say it is impossible to map Treliar City because every time you visit the metropolis, it looks different!

Welcome to the second expansion to Epic Adventure Dungeon Crawl - Treliar City. Visit the various shops and places of interest in an attempt to prepare yourself for the dungeon. But beware, not everyone is friendly in the city. You may even find yourself slammed up in the gaol for all eternity.

This game includes:

New Prayer cards
New Monster cards
New Equipment cards
Special Encounter Cards
City Special Event Cards


A new character class is included in Treliar City. The Priest. This class has accesss to a prayer book that grants him use of the prayer cards. Prayer cards are used like spell cards with the exception that you do not discard prayers after use. As long as you have your prayer book, you have prayers so guard it with your life!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Maze, Print & Play

name: Dungeon Crawl: Graveyard
description:
Enter the Graveyard if you dare!!!

Graveyard is the latest expansion to the popular Epic Adventure Dungeon Crawl game from [publisher=9581].

This expansion boasts:

2 character classes
Special Event Cards
New Prayer Cards
Graveyard Tiles
New Monsters
New Equipment


—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Maze, Print & Play

name: Dungeon Crawl: Encounter Updates
description:
If you are using the Party Play rules for Epic Adventure Dungeon Crawl (featured in the Quest Card Expansion), these are the updated encounter rules.

These updates cover all of the expansions released to date. All subsequent expansions will have the party play, and all relevant Quest rules, included.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Maze, Print & Play

name: Dungeon Crawl: Murkwood Swamp
description:
Enter if you dare!

Monsters lurk at every corner, treasure is abundant, but the risk is high. Welcome to Murkwood Swamp!

Murkwood Swamp is the latest expansion to Epic Adventure Dungeon Crawl. This expansion boasts:

New Monster Cards
Swamp Encounter Cards
New Treasure cards (including new magical items)
Swamp tiles
Murkwood cards


This is NOT a stand-alone product. Murkwood Swamp requires the Epic Adventure Dungeon Crawl Core Rules set to play. This expansion is designed to be played with the Quest expansion although it can be played just as well without.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Maze, Print & Play

name: Dungeon Crawl: Free Monsters
description:
This file contains some new and FREE monsters to use with Epic Adventure Dungeon Crawl.

Look out for more free monsters, equipment and encounters for all the Dungeon Crawl expansions.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Maze, Print & Play

name: Dungeon Crawl: Free Magic Items
description: Nine new and free magic items to use with the Epic Adventure Dungeon Crawl core rules and any expansions.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Maze, Print & Play

name: Dungeon Crawl: Crypt of the Darc Elf Prince
description:
Crypt of the Darc Elf Prince is the first in a series of pre-set Epic Adventure Dungeon CrawlDungeon Crawl[/boardgame] adventures. Search for the crypt via a quest card or stumble across it in a dungeon.

Can you survive in the Crypt?

Dungeon artwork and chasm have been drawn by Gary Chalk, famed for his joint creation and illustration work on the Lone Wolf Gamebooks.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Maze, Print & Play

name: Cities of Venus: Civil War
description:
Choose how to outfit your gargantuan airborne fortress to scavenge Vnite on Venus to escape the dust and darkness before time runs out. Among your unique rival factions simply collecting Vnite will not be enough to save you, you’ll need to conserve it, trade it, protect it, and even steal it to ensure you’ll be the one to reign.

Story
It's the year 2322, a century after the communication blackout with Earth, the once-unified Venusian cities have found themselves fragmented and divided. The collapse of the republic had given rise to individual city-states, each ruled by powerful factions vying for dominance and control. The valuable Venite resource drives the conflict, as factions fight for literal power and control.

Amidst this chaos, the International Innovation Station (IIS) thrives as a neutral entity, offering technological advancements to all factions. Its influence is immense, capable of shifting the tides of war.

But complications arise. The singularity, which once took hold of Earth, has found its way to Venus. It manipulates and controls some of the factions, adding an additional layer of complexity to the struggle for dominance.

In Cities of Venus: Civil War, you'll navigate the treacherous landscape of Venus mining Venite while leading your faction in the quest for supremacy. Alliances may come and go, as necessity drives your decisions.

Utilize the ever-evolving technologies offered by the IIS, but be cautious of their potential consequences. Balancing the acquisition of power and the practical implications of tactical battles will be vital to your success.

As you compete against rival factions, both controlled by players and influenced by the enigmatic singularity, your decisions will shape the future of Venus. Establish a new order, one that brings stability and prosperity, or plunge the world into further chaos and division.

Can you lead your faction to victory in this intense struggle for control? The fate of Venus lies in your hands.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Multi-Use Cards, Solo / Solitaire Game, Take That

name: ShyCon: Chicago 2023
description:
A 18-card wallet compilation of 4 Button Shy games, delivered at ShyCon Chicago 2023:


Windy City (9 cards)
Battlecrest: Noxious – Fan Hero Set (6 cards)
Medieval Mash (rules)
Best of Three (3 cards)

name: Windy City
description:
It's another gusty day here in Windy City. Snag your favorite airborn items before they fly away!

On their turn a player takes a single action and then play proceed to other player.

Actions: Pass a card, Draw a card, Claim a card, Lock a card.

The game ends when any player cannot take any legal action during their turn. Each player scored their locked cards, and highest score wins.


Included in the ShyCon: Chicago 2023 wallet compilation.

name: I'm Not Here To Make Friends
description:
In I’m Not Here To Make Friends, you’re all fame-hungry glory hounds who have signed up for a reality show where you’re stranded on a remote island and forced to treat each other like pawns in some sick game.

Yay!

The only way off is to eliminate your fellow contestants through cunning, skill and – most likely – deceit. But beware – those eliminated will fight back, and could steal the win from the surviving players!

During the game, players will guess where other players are intending to go, either working together or going it alone, to collect rewards they can use to win immunity from elimination.

If you are eliminated, the game isn't over! Players go to Reject Island, where they can interfere with the remaining players' plans, as well as possibly steal a collective win from under their noses!

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Negotiation, Party Game
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That, Voting

name: Martian Empires: The Venus Expedition
description:
The Venus Expedition is a free-to-download supplement for the Martian Empires fast-play rules for Victorian Science Fiction wargames. It accompanies the Martian Empires range of 18mm figures sold by Fighting 15s.

The supplement adds details of the Lizardmen forces encountered on Venus and adds some ideas for fighting on a jungle planet. It includes errata for the main rules, scenarios and some helpful FAQs. It was first published in 2012.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Don't Tell
description:
Don't Tell is a party game designed to discover each other's wildest secrets and create unforgettable memories.
Roll the dice and challenge yourself with hilarious tasks and sensitive questions.

The goal of this game is to strengthen new and existing friendships by stepping out of your comfort zone. Make new memories you'll never want anyone to find out!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Command Cards, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Events, Role Playing

name: In It Together
description:
A simple class-war variation on Snakes and Ladders fro David Cameron's Britain.
"Every player starts at a different position on the board but the game is how you react to this inequality."
Players vote on which rules variations to use but only reveal their class after decisions are made.
mechanics: Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Voting

name: Feuds and Fiefdoms
description:
Summon your vassals and choose your allies wisely. War is coming to the land!

In Feuds and Fiefdoms, players bid for influence over the land's major Feudal Houses and command their armies to accomplish secret objectives.

The objectives (vanquish, expansion, or trade) are accomplished by capturing specific castles.

Each turn, players choose a campaign card to play that may raise vassals in specific Fiefs, start an influence bid, or change the weather. Then they command the armies of the houses over whom they have influence.

Battles are fought using an innovative, quick tactical combat system.

Players do not "own" anything, they only have temporary influence over the Noble houses who possess armies and castles. Because of this, there is no snowballing. If a noble house is vanquished, the controlling player will regain the influence spent on them and have opportunities to affect other houses.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Movement, Auction: Sealed Bid, Dice Rolling, Moving Multiple Units

name: The Promise
description:
Once upon a time, there was a world where far too many kings made promises and would not keep them. Your name is Tom Thumb. You and your younger sister Anna have made it your mission to help these kings and get rid of those who want to claim the royal promise.

The Promise is a 18-card boss battler in the Grimm World universe. You battle with two characters against one enemy. Because your characters are very little, enemies are rats or birds. After hunting them, you take out the animals and build new equipment from their remains. This allows you to hunt these animals in a higher level, which will bring you more and also better body parts to craft more powerful weapons and armor.
In the Promise you have 5 battles in which you can hunt two different animals in 3 different levels. After that you will face the final boss: Hans the Hedgehog. If you win against him, you'll cancel the promise and win the game.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Animals, Book, Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Fighting, Novel-based, Print & Play
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Line of Sight, Modular Board, Movement Points, Multi-Use Cards, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid

name: Stars of Akarios: The Drones of Akarios
description:
The Drones of Akarios is a gameplay expansion for Stars of Akarios where players can equip unique drones with their ships, explore an all-new "one-off" campaign, and use the new scenario event mechanic to completely change the Stars of Akarios space combat experience.

—description from the designer

name: All's Well That Ends
description:
All’s Well That Ends is a fantasy, campaign-style adventure game for 1 to 4 players. Together players form a party of reckless profiteers and wayfarers exploring the untamed reaches of the Western Wildlands. Your goal is to hunt down a roving band of slavers and killers, and to exact a bloody revenge.

Throughout the campaign you will uncover clues as to the nature and whereabouts of these villains while fighting against countless hostile forces, not stopping in your pursuit until justice – as you understand it – has been served.

The story plays out over several chapters, each of which draws you deeper into the Wildlands as you discover clues, add allies to your roster, and become increasingly deadly with new abilities and equipment.

You can also play individual combat scenarios for a quicker, bloodier gaming experience.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Chaining, Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Finale Ending, Hand Management, Legacy Game, Multiple Maps, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Get Over
description:
Finally a pro wrestling card game that deserves your time and energy. Finally. A pro-god-damn-wrasslin game that'll get over big, brother.

For those unfamiliar with the wild and wacky world of professional wrestling; welcome. In this biz, you're trying to Get. Over. Because to 'Get Over' means to win over the crowd, man. So now every time your music hits, the place goes bats**t wild! Because you're a freaking star, you hear? That's what this business is all about. It's about making stars, baby! It's not just about how well you can go in the ring, but how well you carry yourself out of it. To get over, you have to be the total package.

--

In this competitive 2-player game, opponents use deck-building and worker placement to pull off the match of a lifetime, reducing their opponent's health low enough to successfully pin them.

Card play is a kinetic recreation of the 'sport' you love (or maybe never watched). It's a seamless back-and-forth flow where momentum is key. It's not just about the physical battle, but the mental struggle to be able to tap into everything you've learned in training. In between card rounds, players take worker placement actions at the 'Mind Market,' a physical reconstruction of in-ring psychology.

Build your deck, choose your class specialty, hone your strategy and do whatever it takes to GET. OVER.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fighting, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Sports, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Role Playing, Set Collection, Single Loser Game, Victory Points as a Resource, Worker Placement

name: S&G Dungeon: Crypt of the Shadow Mage
description:
The Second Adventure for the S&G Dungeon system, explore the dark, deadly crypts of the Shadow Mage and his undead minions. Do you dare explore these dank halls and web-covered crypts? Do you dare face the deadly magic if the Shadow Mage?

Fully compatible with the S&G Dungeon system, this adventure will challenge the best, bravest adventures, so gather your gear, sharpen your sword and brave the dark dungeon of the Shadow Mage.

S&G Dungeon is a simple but fun game of dungeon exploration. Using the powerful S&G game engine, you can play several heroes as they delve into a dungeon full of danger and rewards.

Full expandable, and every few months this year we will offer new dungeon to explore and new heroes to play.

So, gather up your gear, get your sword and a few fools…um, friends, and go explore a dangerous hole in the ground.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: S&G Dungeon, Hall of the Hill Giants
description:
Adding a new adventure to the mix with Hall of the Hill Giants. Now take your S&G characters into the dark halls of the Hill giants. Comes with two new characters to play and all new battle tiles.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Orphenia
description:
A cooperative "Open World" RPG Table Top for up to four Players

Explore and shape the World of Orphenia.

Choose your Class. Will you be a damage dealer, a tank or a supporter?

Level up your Character while doing main- and sidequests, fight enemies with dices and cards.

Find and lockpick treasure boxes

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: War of Beauty
description:
This game is set in the palace of the Qing Dynasty in China. A group of women are fighting for the position of Queen.

In the game you have to give gifts to each other, however, there are good gifts and bad gifts. Receiving good ones can enhance your status in the palace, while receiving bad ones may cause you to lose your favor and even enter the cold palace.

Be careful, yesterday's friends may be tomorrow's enemies. Make good use of the gifts and servants at hand to make your way in the palace!
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Ventis Mare
description:
This is a boardgame of a sail naval battle for 2 players. 30min-1hr gameplay time.

It takes you to the age of great galleons, frigates, pirates and treasures. You have to show your strategic skills to turn victorious.

Both players have a fleet of sail warships. They move all ships one after another according to the wind direction which changes by the cards draw. The fight occurs by cannon firing or abordage.

The goal is to sail the transport ship to enemy's harbour. It's a guick and simple game for kids.

The mechanics are similar to Bitwa na Morzu Wiatrów.

name: The Third World War: Portuguese Forces
description:
Issue 103 of paper Wars

Portuguese formations expansion (for southern europe)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Power Plants: Starlaflower  Promo Card
description:
Starlaflower is a new plant card. So the Starflower token (pink) can be played with new rules.
This promo is part of the "Our Family Plays Games"-Kickstarter

Starlaflower
Sprout: Gain one Gem, plus one more for each path in the largest field next to the Wizard

Grow:
Gain one Gem for each distinct field (even two separate fields of the same type) next to the growing Starlaflower

Endgame: Before field scoring, each Starlaflower earns points for its owner for every other patch it is touching that displays the same number as itself.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Puzzle, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Lenino 1943
description:
The Battle of Lenino took place on 12 and 13 October, 1943, north of the village of Lenino in Byelorussia. The engagement was a part of the Soviet Spas-Demensk offensive operation which was launched in order to clear the eastern bank of the Dnieper River of German forces and break through the Panther-Wotan line of German defences.

It was one of the first major battles of communist Polish Army created in the USSR.

The game uses the B-35 wargaming system and was published in Taktyka i Strategia magazine #47 (2022).
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Star Realms: Star Captain Starla Promo
description:
This promo is a reward for the Growing Our Family! - Our Family Plays Games 2023 Kickstarter Campaign.

Star Captain Starla Cost 5 Gold
Type: Hero

Effect: 5 Damage
Trash: Draw a card
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Delayed Purchase, Hand Management, Income, Open Drafting, Tags, Take That, Variable Set-up

name: Tidal Blades: Banner Festival – Honeycombs
description:
This card was a reward for supporting the Growing Our Family! - Our Family Plays Games 2023 Kickstarter Campaign

Honeycombs
Cost: 7
Gain 1 fruit for each Banner you have in this region.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Bialystok 1920
description:
The Battle of Białystok took place during the Polish–Soviet War, on August 22, 1920, near and in Białystok, Poland. The forces involved were the Polish 1st Legions Infantry Regiment and the remains of the Soviet Russian 16th and 3rd Army, who were withdrawing after a defeat in the Battle of Warsaw.

The battle resulted in a complete destruction of the Soviet 16th Army.

Białystok 1920 is available in Taktyka i Strategia magazine #47 (2022). The game uses the WB-95 wargaming system by Taktyka i Strategia.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Zone of Control

name: Domanice 1831
description:
The battle of Domanice took place on 10 April 1831, during the Polish–Russian War 1830–31. The battle was won by the Polish forces, commanded by Gen. Ludwik Kicki.

The game is available in Taktyka i Strategia magazine #47 (2022). It uses the Napoleon wargaming system developed by Taktyka i Strategia.

name: Smart10 Junior Kysymykset 2
description: 200 new questions, 2000 answers.
publishers: Martinex, Mindtwister AB, Peliko Oy, White Castle

name: Trivial Pursuit: Generations
description:
GENERATIONAL TRIVIA: An all-new trivia gaming experience for the whole family from the Greatest Generation to Gen Z! In this fun reimagined edition of Trivial Pursuit, each card has five generation-specific questions, allowing you to play for your own generation or the one you know the most about.

PERSONALIZED GAMEPLAY: Incorporate personal memories into the gameplay! You can read a question, fill in a name, and write the answer on the back, or even make up your own unique questions—creating a more immersive and personalized trivia game that allows you to relive memories every time you play.

FRIENDS & FAMILY GAME LOG: Capture the memories and create new traditions! Keep track of past games, victories, and special moments to enhance the joy and excitement of each future match. This game log enhances the communal experience, providing a precious record of the fun times shared with friends and family.

INCLUSIVE & ACCESSIBLE: Joy For All's version of Trivial Pursuit features bigger cards with easy-to-read text to ensure a fully inclusive experience, making it accessible for players of varying abilities and ages—from teens to older adults.

—description from publisher

name: Rival
description:
Welcome to Rival.

You are an operator of battle-hardened mechs with goal: destroy your enemy.

At the beginning of the game, you will select your 3 mechs to go into combat with.

Each mech comes with three Special Weapons, Special abilities, and different stats.

On your turn, you get 3 actions, 1 on each mech.

Your opponent may play Rapid cards in between your actions.

Purchase weapons from the buy zone and turn your mechs into powerful war machines with specialized roles.

Your opponent will know which weapons you have purchased, but not necessarily which mech they are equipped to.

Weapons can deal damage, affect position, block damage, drop traps and walls onto the map, or apply status effects.

Build your wombo combo to get kills or go in sneaky deaky like and hit the enemy base to win the game.

With 15 different mechs, 220 unique weapons, and 2 maps, Rival will always keep you on your toes.

—description from the designer

name: Dynasty Duel
description:
In a parallel world, there lies a glorious empire built by humans. It is a pity that the descendants of the emperor neglected to govern, and citizens complained about everything. With pressure mounting internally and via external sources, the empire collapsed in the midst of uprising cries after 200 years of existence. At this juncture, many different races such as humans and demons rose, a group of alchemists who tried to summon the undead were also attracted to the empire. The races compete with each other, all dreaming of becoming the new masters of the empire. How will leadership of the empire change hands? Players lead their own faction (race) in the game and fight against one other. Only the winner steps closer to the throne.
Command your unit and successfully eradicate the enemy's leader to win the game!

The are 4 races in the game, each race has its own fighting abilities and characteristics. Players can choose their favorite race to traverse.
Each turn, the player will get 3 action points, and is free to allocate these action points to summon or activate. Action points are consumed when performing an action based on the cost of summoning or activating the unit. As long as there are enough action points, players can freely combine and perform actions. Some units come with unique characteristics. Units with characteristics can gain additional effects on the field.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Pattern Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Hoarding Hamsters
description:
Discovered three? Perfect!
The children help Anni Hamster in the exciting memory game Hamsterei to the power of three from HABA. For each of their items, they look for two related things. Whoever secures three golden hazelnuts first wins the fun collecting game for children aged 3 and over. Simple rules ensure quick fun. The wooden cube brings even more excitement into the game. A great training for the memory and careful looking. Great playing fun with HABA.


a HABA memo game for animal lovers: hamster egg to the power of three
colorful game for children from 3 to 8 years
classic memo principle reinterpreted
simple rules for quick fun
Durable game material made of sturdy cardboard for 2 to 4 players


—description from the publisher

name: Dobre 1831, Zakrzew-Pniewnik 1831
description:
Taktyka i Strategia #46 offers two battles using the Napoleon wargaming system: Dobre 1831 and Zakrzew-Pniewnik 1831. Both battles took place during the the Polish–Russian War 1830–31, also called the November Uprising 1830–31.

During the Battle of Dobre, the Polish forces were commanded by Gen. Jan Zygmunt Skrzynecki, whereas Russians by Grigorij Rosen. The result of the battle was rather inconclusive, although in terms of dead soldiers, Russians suffered heavier losses: Poles lost some 200-300 soldiers while Russians some 750 soldiers.

The battles at Zakrzew and Pniewnik were two small engagements, involving a detachment from Gen. Skrzynecki's main forces. At Zakrzew, Poles surprised the Russian forces, attacked them and forced them to leave Zakrzew. After that, maintaining the momentum, they continued the attack towards Pniewnik, where they also forced the Russian forces to flee.

The games use the Napoleon system by Taktyka i Strategia.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Bialoleka 1831
description:
The Battle of Białołęka took place on 24 and 25 February 1831 in the village of Białołęka, Poland, during the Polish–Russian War 1830–31. The Polish forces defeated the Russians. However, the Polish victory was not decisive and ultimately inconclusive.

Białołęka is a small town situated north of Warsaw. The Russian forces in that area, commanded by Ivan Shakhovskiy, consisted of some 11,000 men and 56 cannons. The Polish forces commanded by Jan Krukowiecki, Antoni Giełgud and Kazimierz Małachowski were fortified and their aim was to protect the entrance to Warsaw. There were some 13,000 men and 22 cannons in the Polish forces.

The games use the Napoleon system by Taktyka i Strategia.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Stoczek 1831
description:
The Battle of Stoczek took place on the 14th February 1831 during the Polish–Russian War 1830–31. The Polish forces were victorious and Russians suffered heavy casualties.

The Polish forces, commanded by Józef Dwernicki, consisted of some 4,700 soldiers, including 2,200 cavalry, whereas Russians, led by Teodor Geismar, had around 2,100 soldiers.

The game uses the Napoleon system by Taktyka i Strategia.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: The Daring Escape of Pancho Villa
description:
In the early morning hours of March 9th, 1916, Pancho Villa launched an attack on the sleeping town of Columbus, New Mexico, and the adjacent US Army camp. Villa’s intelligence operation had failed. Having ordered the men forward, he was unaware that so much of the US 13th Cavalry was at Camp Furlong that night. After hours of confused combat in the streets and through the Army camp, Villa suffered many casualties and was forced to withdraw back across the border into Mexico, thus starting what would be known in America as the Punitive Expedition.

The Daring Escape of Pancho Villa is a tabletop miniature campaign which uses a moving battlefield design as the game engine. The Villista Army is always on the board, executing their escape always in front of the players. Instead of using a scrolling game mat or moving terrain around the wargame miniatures, the battlefield moves as the figures move. The US player attempts to gain contact with the retreating band of Villistas and bring them to battle using an abstracted pursuit mechanism.

The battlefield itself is divided into four 2-foot by 4-foot separate game boards which are connected to form a moving 4x8 foot gaming surface. They are then repositioned using card play to create a constant sense of movement as the figures move from town to town, cross railroads, through mountain escarpments and even cross a river. Always trying to avoid Federales mounted patrols, garrisoned towns, and the United States Cavalry Regiments in pursuit.

If Pancho Villa can exit the final game board before the last card is drawn and played or avoid being killed or captured in the process, he escapes into history.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hidden Movement, Multiple Maps, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Square Grid

name: Traders of the Silk Road
description:
Traders of the Silk Road is a tabletop card strategy game by independent game developer Arrogant Pixel.

It is a historical, turn based card game based on the ancient trading routes that trailed throughout Africa, Asia and Europe. It aims to highlight underrepresented cultures and real-life historical locations through its authentic and stunning card designs.

Players are pitted against each other to gain the most money and commodities. They will visit different locations as they progress through the game and attempt to outbid each other on new stock. These items can be either sold for a profit, used by the player to protect themselves, or to gain an advantage over others.

Rounds are played in 3 stages: Location Phase, Auction Phase, and Player Phase. In each, players will grow their inventory and pad their pockets - but will have to watch out for tragedy rearing its head and stealing their fortunes.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Deck Construction, Income, Investment, Trading

name: Puck
description:
The number of players must be at least 5, the more the better. The order is determined by placing the numbered playing pieces and Puck upside down on the table and drawing one for each player. From the 2nd game onwards, however, Puck is always the one that reaches space 62 first in the last game.
The other players each pay 10 tokens into the till, start at space 1 and advance as many spaces as they rolled eyes, except for "Puck". He may move once after each throw of the others, in the manner of a knight in chess.
If "Puck" reaches someone on a space that brings profit he receives half of it. If he catches someone on a penalty space, half of the penalty falls to him and the other half to the cash register. Conversely, if he is caught on such a space, he must pay half the penalty for the player concerned.
Likewise, he caught on a winning space instead of paying the cash register the winnings from his pocket. If one of the other players finally catches him on a blue space - to which 24 and 50 do not belong - he must pay 2 tokens to the till.
Whoever reaches space 62 first, receives two thirds of the contents of the box is "Puck" in the next game. Whoever arrives afterwards gets the rest.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Square Grid, Static Capture, Track Movement

name: Roll the Deck!
description:
A small booklet of 11 dice games designed for use with Steve Jackson's Pick a Card Dice and standard playing cards.

The games in this booklet are built around the concept of generating a series of random draws from a standard deck of playing cards. Instead of playing cards, though, we've used our Pick a Card Dice. And so can you!

—description from the publisher

name: Babble Blurt
description:
Babble Blurt is the speedy, "blurt-it-out" word game for 2 or more players! Be the fastest to blurt out a word that fits the prompt and score the point!

—description from the designer
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Party Game, Word Game

name: Aquaretto: XXL Promo Tiles
description:
22 Promo tiles for Aquaretto that came in the Zooloretto XXL Box:

12 Supply Tiles
2 Coin Tiles
1 Penguin Tile
1 Wale Tile
1 Hippo Tile
1 Dolphin Tile
1 Seal Tile
1 Sea Turtle Tile
1 Polar Bear Tile
1 Crocodile Tile

name: Dungeons & Dragons: Onslaught – Trouble at the Tavern Scenario
description:
Exclusive scenario included in Game Trade Magazine Issue 282 August 2023. Includes map, tokens, cards, and more.

In this scenario, you will prove your mettle in a knock-down, drag-out slugfest set in a local tavern. Once the tables and chairs started flying, the patrons fled and now you are staring down sellswords who claim to be tougher than your crew!

name: Start ins Welt-All
description:
Start ins Welt-All is a game for 2 players and is a simple space target game.

Players roll a ball at an upright futuristic rocket range. At the base there is are 4 openings where rockets sit behind and tension held. If a ball goes through a hole and hits the base of a rocket it launches high into the air.

Each rocket is worth a certain amount of points. The player at the end with the most points is the winner.

—user summary
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: The DioField Chronicle Board Game
description:
The DioField Chronicle board game is based on the video game of the same name.

Control one of four captains to become the most famous mercenary on the DioField island!

Players use dedicated action cards in other to perform a variety of tasks - travel on the game board, gather resources, encounter events, engage in battle, learn new skills, upgrade your pre-existing cards and grow your army.

When encountering another player on the board, a battle ensues! Secretly choose both a Magilumic orb card and the soldiers you commit to the battle and hope it's enough to best your opponents choices. Can you bluff them into spending more than is required?

By making offerings of your resources to the royal castle and winning in battles, players compete to be the first person to reach 15 fame.

Each card features both Japanese and English text, although the rule books are separate for each language.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Market, Movement Points

name: Baraka y Fatalidad
description:
From the disaster of Annual to the mythical landing of Al Hoceima, the Rif War marked the lives of our grandparents and the subsequent history up to the present day.

It is our Great War of Africa, in which our Legion, the Regulars, our Armored Force and the Spanish Aviation are born and begin to make history.

Baraka & Fatality is a fast-paced and hilarious game of skirmishes with miniatures, with constant action and reaction and role-playing overtones, in which commanding your column you will feel immersed, from the first to the last moment, in the most epic combats of the rif war.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Interrupts, Line of Sight, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Kyiv Expedition 1920
description:
Kyiv Expedition or Kiev offensive took place in 1920 during the Polish–Soviet War.

The Polish high command decided to conduct a pre-emptive strike against the Communist forces on the southeastern part of the front, who were preparing their own offensive. Thanks to effective Polish intelligence, Poles were able to decipher Russian secret military dispatches concerning the disposition of their forces and their plans. The main aim of the Polish forces involved in the operation was to capture Kyiv. There, working together with Symon Vasylyovych Petliura, the Ukrainian leader, Poles planned to establish an independent Ukrainian state, friendly towards Poland. The Polish offensive was launched on 25 April 1920.

The Kyiv scenario offered in Taktyka i Strategia #42 expands Poland 1920 and you must have the base game to play it. The scenario also includes 6 additional counters.

The game uses the K-1/K-2 wargaming system by Taktyka i Strategia.

name: Dark Prophecies
description:
Dark Prophecies is a competitive cultist card game. You play as conniving sorcerers, working to ensure a prophecy comes to pass. The new dark master it heralds will reward those who served faithfully.

The game is played over several rounds, and the player with the most points at the end is the winner. You earn points by completing Dark Deeds, stashing cards, earning Titles, and leveling up your Grimoires.

Your Grimoires will also unlock new abilities on your Arcana cards, allowing you to do do more each turn as the game advances.
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Sana Sana Colita de Rana
description: ¡Que alguien llame a un médico! Yo Sabo The Game is back and ready to help you become your family's next medical professional, Tú Sabes! The Sana Sana Colita De Rana expansion pack is the same Yo Sabo you know and love, but with an extra level of difficulty. This expansion pack includes 25 game cards, each ready to put you to the test!

name: Yo Sabo: Noches embrujadas
description: ¡No tengas miedo! The cards in this expansion pack are meant to prepare you for a spooky night, not scare you! The Noches Embrujadas pack is the same Yo Sabo The Game you know and love, but with everything you need to be able to have a spooky game night. Share your scary stories, guess some creepy words, and take on new challenges! Tú Sabes!

name: Farmyard Frenzy
description: Galt's Farmyard Frenzy Game is a fun counting game that introduces young children to adding and subtracting. Drive around the farmyard in your tractor, picking up and dropping off animals according to the roll of the dice. Includes 4 tractor and trailer playing boards, 4 tractor counters and stands, 42 animal tokens, farmyard game board, dice, shaker and guide. The Farmyard Frenzy Game for 2 - 4 players is suitable for children ages 4 - 8. Galt products are quality controlled and meet all American, Canadian, British and European standards for toy safety.

name: Battle of the Pyramids
description: Recreates a Napoleonic battle fought in Egypt against the local Mameluk rulers in 1798. All the game components were produced on a Spirit Master "Ditto" machine and hand colored by Mr. Wesenberg. The game was reviewed in Panzerfaust and Campaign magazine #72 (March/April 1976).

name: Munchkin Bibliophile's Booklet of Bookmarks
description:
Munchkins have been doing their level best (get it?) to kick open doors, kill monsters, and grab treasure for more than two decades, and in that time we've created a plethora of Munchkin bookmarks that add unexpected twists to your games.

In this booklet, we've gathered some of our favorite Munchkin bookmarks from over the years so that everyone can have a chance to play with them. There are special rules (this is Munchkin, after all; of course there are special rules)! And you don't have to share, tear up, or eat these bookmarks to play!

—description from the publisher

name: Great Empires of the Iron Age
description:
Meeple Empires is an approachable Grand Strategy game set in the European Iron Age. The goal is to forge your empire’s legacy and secure its place in history.

Expand by war and diplomacy, recruit epic Heroes, build marvelous Wonders and make brilliant Discoveries to collect VPs and effects that strengthen your empire.

Players adapt their abilities by managing their selection of Command and Battle Cards in their hand.

Play as Rome, Greece, Egypt or Carthage, each with their own set of 3 heroes, a unique legacy bonus and a starting Discovery.

The are 3 phases per turn - Income, Action and End - and there's a maximum of 8 turns per game. If certain triggers are reached, the game will end early.

The player with the most VPs at the end of the game is declared the winner. That player earns the title "The Great" and must respectfully be adressed as so for the rest of the day.
categories: Ancient, Civilization, Educational, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Command Cards, Hand Management, Movement Points, Negotiation, Worker Placement

name: Hot & Cold: Promo Pack
description: Extra word cards for Hot & Cold

name: Halfcut
description:
INTRODUCTION Halfcut is a two-player game played on a square board of any size, initially empty. The two players, Red and Blue, take turns placing their own checkers onto unoccupied squares, one checker per turn, starting with Red. Passing is not allowed, but if you don't have an available placement, your turn is skipped. Mark Steere designed Halfcut in August 2023.

OBJECT Red must form a path of red checkers (interconnected via horizontal or vertical adjacencies, or both) connecting the two red sides of the board. Blue must form a path of blue checkers connecting the two blue sides of the board.

GROUP A group here is a monocolored group of checkers interconnected horizontally or vertically, or both. Diagonal adjacencies are irrelevant in Halfcut.

CROSSCUT A crosscut is comprised of four adjacent checkers arranged in a square. Two of the checkers are red and two are blue. Like-colored checkers are diagonally opposed in the square.

CROSSCUT GROUP A crosscut group is the group that contains a crosscut checker.

CROSSCUT RULE You can only form a crosscut if by doing so you create a new crosscut group which is larger than at least one of the enemy crosscut groups of the crosscut.

CHECKER REMOVAL Having formed a crosscut, immediately remove the enemy crosscut checkers which are part of enemy crosscut groups which are smaller than your newly formed crosscut group, concluding your turn.

SIMULTANEOUS CROSSCUTS In order to make a placement which would form two crosscuts simultaneously, you would have to satisfy the crosscut rule for both of the crosscuts, each considered separately.

name: Clump
description:
INTRODUCTION Clump is a two-player game played on a square board of any even size, initially filled with red and blue stones interspersed in a checkerboard pattern. Mark Steere designed Clump in August 2023.

OBJECT Red must form a path of red stones (interconnected via horizontal or vertical adjacencies, or both) connecting the two red sides of the board. Diagonal adjacencies are irrelevant in Clump. Blue must form a path of blue checkers connecting the two blue sides of the board.

PLAY Players take turns swapping one of their stones with an orthogonally adjacent enemy stone (subject to swap conditions described below), one swap per turn, starting with Red. Players will always have a swap available. Passing is not allowed.

GROUP A group here is a monocolored, orthogonally interconnected group of stones. Groups can morph without any change in size.

SWAP CONDITIONS On your turn, make a swap subject to the following conditions:

At least one of the swapped stones must be part of a larger group after the swap than it was before the swap.



The largest group so formed must be larger than the largest group that would be diminished by the swap. (If no groups are diminished, only condition 1 applies.)

name: Crisscross
description:
INTRODUCTION Crisscross is a two-player game played on a square board of any size, initially empty. The two players, Red and Blue, take turns placing their own checkers onto unoccupied squares on the board, one checker per turn, starting with Red. Passing is not allowed. Mark Steere designed Crisscross in July 2023.

OBJECT Red must form a path of red checkers (interconnected via horizontal or vertical adjacencies, or both) connecting the two red sides of the board. Diagonal adjacencies are irrelevant in Crisscross. Blue must form a path of blue checkers connecting the two blue sides of the board.

SEGMENT A segment is a straight (horizontal or vertical), contiguous sequence of like colored checkers, of length one or more.

NEW SEGMENT When you place a checker, you form a new segment. Your newly placed checker will either form a segment of length one, or it will lengthen an existing segment (or two perpendicular segments), or it will combine two existing segments into a larger segment, or some combination thereof.

FLANKING (DIFFERENT FROM REVERSI) A blue segment is flanked if it is sandwiched between two red SEGMENTS in a straight line. Conversely for a flanked red segment.

CAPTURE If your new segment, together with another of your segments, flanks an enemy segment, replace all checkers of the enemy segment with your own checkers, concluding your turn.

PERIMETER Consider the board to be surrounded by an invisible perimeter of squares. You can never place a checker on this imaginary perimeter. But, on your turn, assume that the perimeter is entirely occupied by your checkers.

DRAWS? It’s unknown at the time of this writing if a deadlock can occur. If it is possible, it’s extremely unlikely.

name: Swaptimum
description:
INTRODUCTION Swaptimum is a two-player game played on a square board of any size, initially empty. The two players, Red and Blue, take turns placing their own checkers onto unoccupied squares, one checker per turn, starting with Red. Passing is not allowed, but if you don't have an available placement, your turn is skipped. Mark Steere designed Swaptimum in August 2023.

OBJECT Red must form a path of red checkers (interconnected via horizontal or vertical adjacencies, or both) connecting the two red sides of the board. Blue must form a path of blue checkers connecting the two blue sides of the board. It’s possible that a player may win on the other player’s turn.

CROSSCUT A crosscut is comprised of four adjacent checkers arranged in a square. Two of the checkers are red and two are blue. Like-colored checkers are diagonally opposed in the square.

PLAY You can place a checker on any unoccupied square not ruled out by the placement restriction (see PLACEMENT RESTRICTION). If your placement forms a crosscut, then make a swap:

a. between any two checkers in the crosscut, OR
b. between any checker in the crosscut and any other checker not in the crosscut which is horizontally, vertically, or diagonally adjacent to said checker,

which kills the crosscut and doesn’t form a new crosscut, concluding your turn.

PLACEMENT RESTRICTION If your placement would form a crosscut, and if every possible crosscut killing swap would form a new crosscut, then said placement is illegal for you.

SWAPTIMUM DESIGN NOTES Swaptimum was inspired by Reneo (2023) by Luis Bolaños Mures. Luis is a world class abstract game designer and the leading authority on OOSCGs (orthogonal only square connection games. That is, only horizontal and vertical, but not diagonal, adjacencies count as connections.)

Swaptimum is my most recent in a series of OOSCGs after a continuous, obsessive, months long design odyssey. Of my last 18 attempted OOSCGs, only five (Halfcut, Clump, Crisscross, Flipstop, and Swaptimum) survived Luis's scrutiny. Most either didn't work or were very similar to what had already been done, many by Luis himself.

name: Silos
description:
In Silos, players are given the roles of farmers who need to sort and collect seeds. Farmers take turns dropping seeds and hoping they land in their hoppers.

As the seeds fall, they are deflected by obstacles. Predicting which hopper collects each seed is key to winning.

Silos is a game of predicting where the “chips may fall” with two game modes for two to six players of all ages.

COMPONENTS

16-inch clear acrylic tower with four hoppers.
8 deflectors
25 seeds
30 coins
6 predictors
1 die


SILO SETUP

Insert the mine shaft into base.
Insert deflectors into the tower, at least one per column.


GAME MODES

Prediction: drop seeds and collect a coin when the seed land in your hopper. Collect the most coins to win.
Collection: drop a seed such that it lands in your hopper. Collect the most seeds to win. Maximum of four players.


PREDICTION SETUP

Give each player their prediction token.
Place the coins face up in a heap.
Decide upon a winning score, usually five to ten points.


COLLECTION SETUP

Each player picks a hopper 1-4.
Decide upon how many seeds collected will win the game.
Coins and the die are not used.


PREDICTION GAME PLAY
Players take turns being the farmer in charge of the silo, picking up a random seed and dropping it from a predetermined location. Prior to the drop, the player may alter the seed’s path and all players make a prediction as to where the seed will land.

Order of Play:
Farmer in charge:

Rolls the die.
Optionally alters or moves one or more deflectors.
Picks up a random seed.


All farmers:
Place their prediction marker in front of silo 1-4.
Farmer in charge: Drops the seed from the location shown on the die.
All farmers:
Watch to see where the seed lands.

PREDICTION SCORING
Players who correctly predicted where the seed landed each receive a coin with one point. Players can make change with their coins whenever single value coins have been distributed.

WINNING PREDICTION MODE
After several rounds, the first player to exceed the target score will be the winning farmer. In case of a tie, play another round.
 
COLLECTION GAME PLAY
Players take turns being the farmer in charge of the silo, picking up a random seed and dropping it from the top of the silo. Prior to the drop, an opponent will change the deflectors. The farmer in charge hopes the seed lands in their hopper.

WINNING COLLECTION MODE
The farmer whose hopper is filled or collects the predetermined number of seeds will win the game.

SEED CHARACTERISTICS
Seeds come in various shapes and sizes. This gives each seed a slightly different property as they fall and deflect. As well, how you position or rotate the seed before dropping will change its “flight” dynamics.

DEFLECTORS
When moving deflectors, ensure that the column beneath the drop location will have a deflector. Otherwise, a seed would drop without deflection to a predictable silo.

—description from the designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Dice, Party Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Panzer Cavalcade '41
description:
A free downloadable solitaire postcard wargame portraying a German armoured incursion into Soviet Union in 1941.

You’re in command of a German Armored formation, in 1941, during the early stages of Operation Barbarossa.

—description from the designer
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: Fortuna et Victoria
description:
Fortuna et Victoria is a family game where players compete against each other to become the richest and most powerful being in a legendary universe. To accomplish this goal, players will hoard money and obtain properties to grow an empire, but also acquire troops, capture monsters and fulfill technological advancements.

The game is based upon a classical square design where players cast dice to move their pawns. Players can buy properties to extend their empire but they also have to keep an eye on other players, as opposite troops may attempt to shatter your power. Players may enter into conflict with one another and this is solved through card combat. You can hire troops or attempt to capture monsters that fight for you. You will have an edge to this combat if you can manage to discover one of the 18 technological advancements of the game. If you win, you keep your troops or monsters plus a large sum from the defeated player. Luck also plays a role in the game with plenty of random events, that may be of benefit or not.

There are several ways to win the game. First, players decide if they want a short or a long game. Short games have five different possibilities of victory including when all properties are bought or when a player captures the dragon. The long game has four possible outcomes including leading to bankruptcy to all other players or by possessing castles in all properties. The winner is the player that obtains the highest amount of money adding properties and other card values.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Income

name: マイルストーン (Milestone)
description:
Milestone is a game consisting of a roll of washi tape and a special "dicil", a pencil with printings on the sides such that it can be used as a die.

In the game, players pull out two lengths of tape, and place the, parallel to each other on the playing surface, with a fist's width between them.

On your turn, roll the pencil towards the lengths of tape. The number showing on the pencil is the die value for the turn. The two places on the tape that the pencil overlaps affects how you can modify your die result. Then, write the resulting number on a blank space on one of the pieces of tape.

The game ends when both pieces of tape have a number written in each of the blank spaces. To win, numbers must be decreasing from one end to the other.

name: ラインフレーム (Line Frame)
description:
Line Frame is a game consisting of a roll of washi tape and a special "dicil", a pencil with printings on the sides such that it can be used as a die.

In the game, players pull out a length of tape based upon the die roll and place it adjacent to or on top of specific places on tape which has previously been placed. Then, they must write the number from the die in a blank space.

The game ends when a certain amount of tape has been placed. Players score for numbers written in boxes where one of the surrounding colors is in a group with a size at least that of the number.

name: updn
description:
updn is a trick-taking game using domino-style cards with two values, where either number can be the rank and either number the suit.

It is a "must follow" game, where you must play a card that matches the suit of the lead card if you can. However, the card with the highest sum of its two values will win the trick, regardless of suit. The winner will take all of the cards played to the trick, with some cards worth positive points and some cards worth negative points.

The game also uses a row of bonus cards to effect certain conditions, with the bonus cards taking effect every two tricks (2, 4, 6, 8, but also 9). These cards do things such as reverse rankings (so that low sum wins), and are also worth points themselves. The card which is available in round 9 will reverse the player's score - making a score of -x worth +x, and vice versa.

The player with the most points wins.

name: The Great Heist
description:
The great heist was executed in the city of London. You and your fellow PIs are recruiting your assistants to gather clues to find the eight stolen goods. However, if you pay your assistants too much, your agency will close. If you don’t pay them enough, they will reveal their knowledge to your opponents as revenge for you being a miser. Can you find the stolen goods before your opponents without closing your agency, and without revealing too much of your clues?

The Great heist is a board game that uses a companion App to play the game.
Using the App the players ask for clues (at a cost) and the App respond with answers as to how many goods are placed in the clue area (but not exact location).
At the end of the turn, the clues the were paid the least are revealed to all players which will give them more information.
Every other turn there is a police raid to one location of the game that also help figuring the real position of the stolen goods.
Using known relation between the objects and the answers from the App and police raids players can figure out where the goods are placed on the map.
At the end of the game, the player who paid the most for their clues (in order to avoid them from between revealed to the other players) will lose the game since his PI agency will close. All other players will score points for the stolen goods they found and how fast they found them.

—description from the designer

name: Ye Witchcraft Game
description: A game about witchcraft published by Parker Brothers of Salem, reportedly withdrawn within a few years due to local sensitivities.

name: Kock 1939
description:
The game presents all phases of the Battle of Kock, the battle for the Brest fortress, as well as a hypothetical scenario of the German-Soviet conflict in 1939. Although the game is a standalone title, it can be combined with other games of the September 1939 system (W-39), thus creating one big game about the entire Polish Defensive War of 1939.

—description from the publihser

The Battle of Kock was the last battle during the invasion of Poland in 1939. It took place between 2 and 5 October, 1939, near the town of Kock, Poland. During the battle, the Polish Independent Operational Group Polesie, commanded by General Franciszek Kleeberg, fought against the German XIV Motorized Corps, under the command of by General Gustav Anton von Wietersheim.

This game uses the W-39 system developed by Taktyka i Strategia.


Game counters: regiment-battalion-company
Board: 2 x 50/70 cm
No. of scenarios: 4
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: QQ Step
description:
In the world of Tomatatlo, the economy is powered by friendship, and violence is prohibited. Friendships are randomly assigned and max out at three, but those who want to choose their own friends must work laboriously to discover the secret trick to cast off their current friendships. However, rumors tell of an underground dance battle tournament in which the winning team of friends can achieve the friendships of their dreams…

In this competitive 2-player abstract strategy game, players pit their chosen team of friends against each other on the dance floor. Utilize your team leader’s secret powers as you boogie to either bump opposing dancers off the floor or achieve your unique goal!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Pattern Movement, Static Capture, Variable Player Powers

name: 仲良シふれんず5人用拡張  (Nakayoshi Friends: 5th Player Expansion)
description: An additional suit of cards for Nakayoshi Furenzu which allows for a fifth player. It also includes one additional rule. The expansion is available for both the first edition (large numbers) and the second edition (smaller numbers).

name: Shear Embarrassment
description:
It was that time of year again, where all the sheep on the farm got their wool trimmed. As they herded into the barber shop, one by one they got freshened up, and went on their way. That was until BzZzZz " I SAID LEAVE THE TOP NOT BUZZ IT!" And that folks was the start of the biggest brawl in barnyard history.

As the first year was snatched from the barber and turned against them, the struggle to get revenge resulted in wool being trimmed in places no sheep would want bald. It was total mayhem.

So grab a shear, it's a shave or be shaved world, hopefully you won't have to leave the farm out of shear embarrassment.

—description from the designer

name: Was! Wo? Normandie!?
description: A Japanese wargame on the campaign in 1944 in France.

name: Katacrash: ¡El loco juego de las columnas chifladas!
description:
Place rings to put columns on top. Once complete, place another ring and put more columns on it, until it falls.

See also Tower Collapse.

name: Escape: Flucht von der Karibikinsel
description:
A balloon ride ends on a small island without mobile receiption.

As stranded, you have to escape from the island with your two friends. The box contains 50 cards which have to be turned one by another. They contain information and small puzzles to solve and questions to answer. The solution of the puzzle is each on the back side of the card. After reading the cards and solving the puzzles, you escape from the island and win the game.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Children's Game, Puzzle

name: Community Food Bank
description: Using the typical Family Pastimes cooperative game mechanics, most similar to "Snowstorm", Community Food Bank sees players cooperate to drive the lorry truck around the city gathering collections to the warehouse, before then distributing them to those in need - but cautious of closed streets, traffic accidents and other perils that could cause them to run late and miss the day's quota.

name: Dark Deeds: Loot of the Gods Expansion
description: An expansion for Dark Deeds, Loot of the Gods contains six Loot cards for items infused with the magic of gods, saints, and sorcerer

name: In Fours to Heaven
description:
In Fours to Heaven is a strategic level board wargame about the first campaign of the Second World War. Battle for Poland, that took place September 1st to October 6th, 1939.

The game portrays dramatic clash between Poland and Hitler's Third Reich. It was the first introduction of what will be later called "Blitzkrieg" tactics. From military point of view, Poland was doomed from the start due to many reasons. Because of this, this story cannot be told without taking them into consideration. The biggest issue for Polish defenders was stubborn implementation of defensive "Plan West". It assumed Allied intervention or opening of the second front days after the potential attack. Many flaws of the plan and pointless actions, if the circumstances were different, caused quick downfall of Polish defenders.

The story in this game is told mostly from the Polish perspective, introducing Polish propaganda, morale and General Staffs standpoint. All of this combined creates many layers of the campaign beyond simple hex&counter wargame, which is crucial to the gameplay and makes Polish player really decide, how to play.

The game covers the whole campaign from it's start on the September 1st to the bitter end on October 6th and can be played in many ways, as a whole campaign or in series of smaller scenarios. Unit scale is division/regiment, 1 hex covers 10km of the real terrain.

—description from the designer

name: One Card: Lunes
description:
One card version of Lunes.


Lunes ("Monday") is a fast-paced, single-player board game in which you must avoid being caught by your boss and cut out of the office once you finish the essentials for the day.

In each round, you move your peg through the corridors of the office (which is a modular board), and your boss will perform movements through an AI comprised of action cards and automated movement. Before you can leave the building, you have to reach the printers and get reports to deliver to your colleagues, who will then cover your escape and reward you with useful objects to achieve your goal.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Humor, Maze, Print & Play
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pick-up and Deliver, Square Grid

name: Iure
description:
In the city of IURE many people are deprived of their dignity, but some young people have decided to change the situation. With their actions they will try to assert their rights, but to succeed they will have to cooperate. A story and a board game to build a city, where dignity and rights for all rule. Produced together with Amnesty International.

Players will needs to play action cards, use different city buildings cards and follow news card instructions in order to improve the value of their city layout and gain a specified amount of points.

name: Juggle It
description:
Beat the voice commands and pass the level. You have to be fast. 7 commands and 4 difficulty levels. Complete the commands correctly and pass the level: red inside, blue outside.

Commands can be:
Throw in the air, grab for a color, touch a color on the outside, touch a color on the inside, spin 5 times.

name: Boss Monster: Dungeon Kart Promo Cards
description:
Three promo cards for Kickstarter backers of Dungeon Kart. These cards can be used in any of the Boss Monster base sets.

Cards included are:

Go-Kart (Universal Item) - When equipped to a hero: The hero only enters the first and last rooms of your dungeon.
When used as an item: Move a hero at the entrance of any dungeon to the last room of that dungeon.

Haste (Spell) - Play after building your first room this turn. Reveal your first room and build another room on top of it following normal building rules.

Finish Line (Advanced Trap Room) - [4 Damage] If a hero survives this room, destroy this room.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Minikin Saga: Mechanical Treasures
description:
A legend speaks about some ruins that hide mystical mechanical treasures, that have amazing gems and the more you open the more powers they will offer you!

Mechanical Treasures is a game from the Minikin Saga series. In this game you must keep the most valuable treasure to win the most points and the player that gets a certain number of points will be the winner! But beware, if more players have the same value treasure as you… they will be worth nothing!
On your turn, you must decide to open a mechanical chest or to pass.

If you open a chest, you are going get information of what type of treasure your opponents don’t have, and you must activate that chest's ability if you can.

The more mechanical treasures that get opened, the more powerful the abilities will get!
The round will end in these 3 scenarios:


All players pass consecutively.
A player reveals the Value 1 Mechanical Treasure; that player gets eliminated for the round.
There are no Mechanical Treasures available to open in the Ruins.


When one of these scenarios happens, all players that are still in the round, reveal the Mechanical Treasure they own, the highest value treasure (That doesn’t repeat) wins that many points!

If no player got the points to win, prepare a new round. The player with the lowest treasure and least points, starts the new round!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Score-and-Reset Game, Take That

name: London: Twilight's Game – variations on a theme
description:
LONDON: ‘Twilight’s Game’ – variations on a theme is a suite of Cold War themed strategy games using progressively building, but eminently simple, rules in which two or more adversaries seek to outmanoeuvre and/or best their opponents on a squared grid nominally representing the London of Len Deighton’s and John Le Carre’s twilight world of spy fiction.

In the basic game, two Players take turns to place and move their agents on a 54-square grid comprised of six 3-by-3 tiles. There are three types of square:

‘Normal’ locations (in the basic game there are forty these).
‘Black bag’ squares (there are eight of these, more than one on some of the tiles and none on a few others)
‘Tube’ (London Underground) locations (the basic game has just six of these, all on different tiles.)


More advanced variants of the game include the following additional types of space:

Taxi spaces
London bus spaces
Telephone box spaces
Safehouse spaces


The basic game is for 2 Players. The first variant allows 3 or 4 Players to play with accordingly different board configurations and some simple changes to the basic two-player rules.

Have you got what it takes to be the ultimate spymaster in the treacherous and murky World of Deighton and Le Carre’s twilight city?

Components (the items needed to play):

The Print & Play gameboard tiles (available in the files section)
24 wooden playing pieces (tokens, pawns or blocks etc) [six each of four different colours]
The rules.
A set of numbered 'stickers' to differentiate an adversary’s agents for some of the advanced variants in the Suite.


Optional: a printed playmat picturing a map of central London onto which the gameboard tiles can be placed.

Objective of the game and how to play:
In the basic two-player game the winner is the Spymaster who can manoeuvre three of their four agents off their adversary’s edge of the board. These spies are deemed to have infiltrated their opponent’s agency (SIS or KGB). The 3/4-Player versions of the game bend these objectives slightly – although a choice is provided in the rules as to how this is done. Players take turns to move one of their spaces. The regular move is one orthogonal space. However, this can be extended in one of three ways:

A spy moving onto a ‘Black bag’ location has to move on quickly (they do not want to get caught!) – such a piece can move a further space, again only orthogonally.
A spy moving onto a ‘Tube’ (London Underground) space may on a subsequent turn move from that space to any other ‘Tube’ space. They will then have the choice to remain in that new location or move a further space/spaces before completing their turn per the normal rules for moving.
A spy can make a ‘jump-type’ move over an adjacent agent. Such moves still need to be orthogonal but can be ‘chained’ for a spy to move longer distances and the pieces being jumped over can be one’s own or an adversary’s.


Spaces spies are moved to must be vacant. No spy – friendly or otherwise – can share the same space. (That would be poor Tradecraft!)

No diagonal move is allowed in the basic game and Players are not allowed to “Pass” their turn. Nor can a spy's move be ‘reversed’ in the immediately following turn.

A little information about the variants
One of the more advanced variants of the game described in the rules allows for the elimination of enemy agents. A Spymaster skilled, or lucky enough, to kill two enemy agents automatically wins that variant – although there are further variants that allow for even this to be otherwise. Spies can only be killed adjacent to ‘Black bag’ locations.

Players cannot move an adversary’s spies in the basic game. One of the variants described however allows for this. Further variants introduce additional types of space – for example the ‘Taxi’ space allows a spy to move to any space within the same tile or to any space, depending on the value associated with the ‘Taxi’, up to 1-2 tiles away. Another variant introduces “values” for the spy pieces and a further variant introduces the idea of “missions”. There are twelve of these. For example:

'One of your spies must visit two safehouses.’
‘Each of your spies must travel at least once by bus.’
'None of your spies must enter the central square of a tile.'


Both the above variants provide options for introducing additional game mechanics reflective of a need for bluff and counterbluff intrinsic to the murky world of Cold War espionage activity. For instance, the variant introducing the attribution of values to spies allows for pieces passing over an enemy agent to gain “intelligence” on that agent's value.

Players can choose which different variants and/or optional rules they wish to incorporate in their game play. The game is suitable for Players aged 8 to 80+. Several games can be played inside 30 minutes even using combinations of the different variants.

The rules of the game and each of its variants can be found in the files section – as can several different versions of the gameboard tiles, the “Mission” Variant cards and other sundry items that can be used to assist in playing the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Chaining, Grid Movement, Line of Sight, Square Grid

name: girl code
description:
Hey ladies, it's time to have a little fun without leaving the house! The girl code card game is jam-packed with a variety of cards providing you with endless entertainment. Complete with question and answer prompts, you’re bound to uncover some shocking and hilarious truths about your friends! Look out for wild cards including: shares, dares, callouts, and immersive challenges. With 350 cards, you'll have a new and exciting game, each and every time you play. It's the perfect addition to any girls’ night or bachelorette party, so don't miss out on the hilarity of girl code!

This game was created for ages 17+. Some topics in the games are intended for adults. Remember, girl code is NSFW! So, no holds barred, laugh at the inappropriate, and don’t forget to have a good time!

—description from publisher

name: Fast 4
description:
Electric 4 in a row Game - The first 4 in a row board game that features an electric counter. It is a strategy game that requires fast reactions and is suitable for all ages. Ready for some strategy, fun, and excitement!

Get 4 in a row - Simple and Unique game rules for 2 players: win the game to create 4 same-coloured tokens in a row in any direction within time limitation.

Electric Counter - Provides 5 levels count time, maximum 10 seconds for Beginner Level and minimum 2 seconds for Expert level. Increase the excitement of the game and provide more fun then classic one.

Choose Your Own Difficulty - Allows 2 players choose their own difficulty at the same time. Make your game more challenging, enjoy the game together no matter you are beginner or expert.

—description from the publisher

name: Fight in the Hive
description:
For centuries, Bees of a particular hive have lived in harmony and respected the division of labour amongst them. Things have changed! There is chaos in the hive. Who will come out on top! There is fight in the hive!

Fight in the hive is an elimination card game that is played 2 rounds. Players gather points during each using various ways and tricks. The player with the highest point after each round wins.

Mechanics:
Kill steal
Alliance
Battle card driven
End game bonuses
Matching
Player elimination

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Alliances, End Game Bonuses, Kill Steal, Matching, Player Elimination

name: Click A Tree
description:
In Click A Tree, players embody Ghanaian farmers. They have adapted to the climatic conditions and learned to make use of their surroundings. In the shade of the trees, they plant their crops.

In this tile-laying game, players strive to plant trees in a strategic arrangement, deploy their workers skillfully, and reap the most harvest. The general display offers various tree species that players pay for with their harvest to be able to place them on their board.

The harvest serves not only as currency but also as victory points. The player with the most victory points wins the game in Click A Tree.

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Educational, Environmental, Farming
mechanics: Simultaneous Action Selection, Tile Placement, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Mamma Mia!: Pizzeria
description:
Players take on the roles of competing pizzaiolos, striving to assemble the most delectable pizzas to satisfy a quirky cast of customers.
