With a hand of ingredient and item cards, players must cleverly strategize their moves, navigating the likes and dislikes of customers while utilizing special action cards to boost their pizzas or sabotage opponents.

As cards are played simultaneously and passed around, the race to assemble quality pizzas while outwitting fellow chefs adds a dynamic twist.

The game's exciting mechanics and themed cards create a deliciously engaging experience where taste preferences, calculated risks, and quick thinking combine to decide who will emerge as the ultimate pizza champion!

—description from the publisher

name: Flying Colors: Beat to Quarters, Vol IV
description:
Beat to Quarters, Vol IV (Under the Southern Cross) is an official expansion to Under the Southern Cross by GMT Games, LLC and requires a copy of that game to play.

One of the most common criticisms of the Flying Colors system is the clutter of status markers on the map and that they may detract from game play. This concern can be minimized somewhat by using status sheets and a handy pencil to keep track of things on paper. This, however, adds a separate record-keeping aspect that the design of the game goes out of its way to avoid.

Beat to Quarters provides the ultimate way by which to keep track of the status of individual ships through the use of individual tracking cards that are kept conveniently near the map and that are laid out to conveniently hold a variety of status markers such as Broadsides Fired, Sail State, Rigging Damage, and Hull Damage. The cards are designed to be printed at a standard 3.5 by 2.5 inch size so that they can be slipped into card protectors for extended usage.

Individual tracking cards are included for all 214 individually named ships included with Under the Southern Cross. But that’s not all!

As a bonus, Beat to Quarters also includes the print-and-play components for an entirely new way to play Under the Southern Cross. Drawing from games such as Naval War, Modern Naval Battles, and (in particular) Enemy in Sight, Beat to Quarters can be played with just the ship tracking cards, a special set of markers and 8.5 x 11 inch tracking board, and the status markers from Blue Cross, White Ensign. The ship cards are organized into squadrons that maneuver and fire against the opposing fleet within a relatively small playing area. With Beat to Quarters, you can play the huge battles without the space requirements for several game maps.

NOTE: This volume of Beat to Quarters only includes marker sheets for the Argentinian, Brazilian, Chilean, Colombian, Peruvian, Portuguese, Spanish, and Uruguayan fleets.

With Beat to Quarters, you can either enhance or completely change your enjoyment of Under the Southern Cross!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Napoleonic, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Lass dich nicht überfahren
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. Each player has his own track from space 1 to space 100. Between spaces 50 and 60 the players may chose to exchange their meeple (pedestrian) for a car. Each turn the traffic lights of the traffic tower are changed. Whenever a meeple gets to cross a street the player has to roll a color die (red and green) to determine if it can do so. The meeple has to look left and right when crossing the street or has to suffer a penalty. If a meeple gets on an orange ringed danger space it has made a mistake and the player has to look up a penalty in the mistake chart.
The first player to reach space 100 wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Spirit Session
description:
A restless spirit haunts this house. The home's new inhabitants call on you, a group of spiritual mediums, to perform a séance to channel the entity and seek answers for the five enigmatic questions that keep it tethered to this world.

Spirit Session is a cooperative word-crafting and deduction card game for 2 to 5 players. On their turn, players will either draw a letter card into their hand or play a letter card down to the table to help craft the five words necessary to release the spirit. But be careful, sprinkled within the draw decks are 'Darkness' cards that threaten to permanently alter the words being spelled or 'Candle Flickers' cards that threaten to blow out the three lit candles on your table. Nothing is safe from the growing darkness.

Spirit Session is a limited communication game in which all players will create a different compelling story with each play. For added difficulty, the game also includes additional game play elements that increase the difficulty for seasoned mediums by adding a cooperative puzzle element to each session.

Can you channel the spirit and decipher the answers of its fate before your candles flicker out? Gather your fellow mediums and prepare for a Spirit Session.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Murder/Mystery, Print & Play, Word Game
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Deduction, Push Your Luck, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Dig 'em All
description:
Dig 'em All is an engaging and family-friendly board game that centers around the exciting premise of a crashed asteroid laden with valuable precious metals in the heart of a desert landscape. This event triggers a modern-day gold rush, where people control drones and robots in their pursuit of gathering these valuable resources. The game is designed to cater to a wide range of players, from beginners to more experienced gamers, thanks to a scalable rule set that allows for increasing levels of complexity.

The gameplay revolves around players taking on the roles of drone and robot operators, each vying to collect as much of the precious metals as possible from the asteroid crash site and surroundings. The board is likely to depict the desert landscape and the crater left by the asteroid impact, with paths, obstacles, and various locations representing different resource-rich spots.

Players can expect to engage in a mix of strategic planning, resource management, and tactical decision-making. They might have to navigate their drones and robots through treacherous terrains, avoid hazards, and outmaneuver their opponents to secure the most valuable deposits. The game could involve elements of player interaction, such as competing for resources, blocking opponents' paths, or even forming temporary alliances.

What sets this game apart is its adaptability to different skill levels. The rule set can be adjusted to accommodate players' experience, allowing beginners and kids to jump in quickly while still offering deeper strategies for seasoned players. This versatility makes the game accessible and enjoyable for families, casual players, gamers and enthusiasts alike.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Chaining, Hand Management, Map Reduction, Solo / Solitaire Game, Take That, Variable Set-up

name: Volts
description:
With Volts, there will be electricity in the air. The current may not pass between you. Keep up the pace and pump up the volts. The first to reach 21 volts cuts the current and then points are distributed.

Volts, the game that electrifies your evenings!

name: Tulip Season
description:
A very portable & easy to learn tile laying game of tulip fields, greenhouses, & windmills.

Lay one of two dual-coloured tulip tiles on your turn and place windmills to claim fields for points. Bonus end game points are awarded for public scoring goals selected randomly at the start of the game, and you can add another "greenhouse tile" scoring goal during the game that only you can score. Can you maximise its scoring *and* placement bonuses?

—description from the publisher

name: DustCollectorz: Champions Unleashed
description:
DustCollectorz - Champions Unleashed is a collectible trading card game introducing monsters from the world of Seraphia. The monsters have been trapped and turned into cards.

Players of the game have several game mode options. A two player fighting mode allows players to clash on any surface. A player starts the clash by attacking with a monster or monsters from a specific tribe and declaring which stat value will be used. The second player counters the attack with cards that can defend against it. Each card can have special abilities that can alter the course of the game. The player with the highest stat value wins the round and their cards are captured. The game is played until one of the players runs out of cards.

A second game play mode is a 2v2 four player team mode. In this game mode, there are three clashes per round. The team that wins two clashes wins the round. Cards are played until all of one player’s deck and hand are exhausted.

The goal of the game is to have the highest number of points in a player or team’s capture pile. Points can be earned by capturing creatures in clashes.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting, Party Game
mechanics: Alliances, Closed Drafting, Hand Management, Interrupts, Take That

name: Rebirth: Carved in Blood
description:
Behold, a world forever changed, where humanity's remnants struggle to survive amidst the ruins of a once-great civilization. They call them Slayers, the heirs of mankind and scourge of abominations, masters of the eternal power of blood.

Rebirth: Carved in Blood is a Living Card Game set in an alternate world ravaged by the battle for control over Earth's last precious resource: blood. Each player takes charge of a group of Slayers, the elite descendants of humankind, and leverages their abilities to subjugate opponents and strengthen their rule over the Battlefield.

An evolved resource management, a structured Battlefield, and the presence of unique dual-natured characters and powerful neutral creatures make the gameplay distinctive and highly strategic. Master harnessing the fury of abominations to your advantage, gather blood, and unleash the power of Transmutation to awaken the true strength of your Slayers.

Three game modes are available: 1vs1, 2vs2, and Draft. To infuse more intrigue and strategy into the Draft experience, players can manipulate Draft piles by spending Blood Points.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Closed Drafting, Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Make That Most Magnificent Thing
description:
Calling all backyard inventors! Reveal a creative idea card, then grab an assortment of wheels, gears, pipes, food and other fun items to build a device that matches the prompt MAGNIFICENTLY.

200 sturdy cardboard pieces can be combined in infinite ways to make innovative inventions and wacky contraptions.

When time is up, budding inventors explain why their invention is the MOST magnificent. Fun character pieces (Girl, Boy, and Dog) can help illustrate a device's function.

Use the award ribbons to recognize Best Story, Most Inventive, Brainiest Solve, and more!

This game is based on the book "The Most Magnificent Thing" by Ashley Spires.

Smart, clever or downright genius … are you a maker of magnificence?

name: Grand Plan: New York City
description:
New York City is one of the most iconic and influential cities in the world. While the city was founded in the 1600s by Dutch settlers, over the next few centuries New York City transformed from a small trading post into a global center of commerce, culture, and innovation.

In Grand Plan: New York City, players are urban planners who build this city from the 1600s through the early 2000s against the backdrop of historical events. A unique system of historically based chronicle cards allows new rules to come into effect and expire over the course of the ten turn game.

Players lay out the grid plan of Manhattan across the island and into the sky, developing new neighborhoods, placing inﬂuence, and engaging with the news of the day.

—description from the publisher

name: Bon Bon
description:
Bon Bon is a card game where cards have a number and various possible symbols - from among three types of symbols, with three different potential colors.

Each player gets a hand of cards, and in the center of the table the players see a card that is on offer this round and the card that will be next round.

Each round players have 3 turns, and on their turn they either draw 1 card or play 1 card face down. Then, players reveal the cards they played. The person who played the most value in the shape and color combinations shown on the card on offer take that card as points.

The first person to 21 points wins.
publishers: Super Hige Club (スーパーひげクラブ)

name: Host Your Own Escape Room: Museum Edition
description:
When the museum guard tells you about a secret exit and a legend of creatures coming to life at night, you can't resist the challenge, With clues hidden within the exhibits, you set out to solve the mystery and find the exit before it's too late.

This escape room is perfect for the whole family to play, Let your imagination take hold as you embark on an exciting adventure together, all from the comfort of your own home

—description from the publisher

name: Back to Start
description:
Back to Start is a "roll" and move game, where players' movement is determined on cards they play from their hand - numbered 2, 3, 4, and 5. They will begin on Start, travel to the Turning Point space, and return to Start.

The spaces in between are randomized and begin face down. When a player moves, they count the spaces, reveal the final card they land on, and activate its effects - such as advancing 2 spaces; causing the player on your right to discard a card; swapping locations, etc.

The first player to return Back to Start wins.

name: Ding Ding HK Tramways
description:
Ding Ding‧HK Tramways Board Game, is a board game base on Hong Kong Tramways which is one of the prominent tourist attractions in Hong Kong.

The tram is an icon of Hong Kong and one of the best, enjoyable ways to explore the metropolis. The tram runs along some of interest and historic regions of Hong Kong island. It moves at a relatively low speed, so travelers can experience all the attractions of each neighborhoods.

Player will play as tourists and use the "Ding Ding Cards" travel around the northern to the southern section of Hong Kong Island. The fastest player to collect the "Fun Cards" will win the game. Through the "Fun Cards", players not only could obtain to know the geography of Northern and southern Hong Kong Island, but also would receive a better apprehension of the tourist attractions, as well as the other places to see along the tramways route.

name: ねぇ、なに着ていく？ (Hey, What Are You Going to Wear?)
description:
Hey, What Are You Going to Wear? is a game about not going out in the same clothes as someone else.

Players draft the colors and types of clothes they'll wear, and then try to be the only trendy one this season. If another player is also wearing the trendy style, points instead are awarded to the person wearing the nicest clothes. If this is also a tie, the players who just put on a t-shirt score!

The player with the most points after two rounds wins.

name: Host Your Own Escape Room: New York Edition
description:
Locked inside Central Station by an infamous criminal gang, it's a race against time to uncover their plan for the heist of the decade, and foil their scheme before it's too late.
Work as a team to solve the sequence of puzzles and input the answers online to discover whether you have been successful.

The difficulty level of this escape room is moderate. Hints can be found throughout to help you catch the bandits and complete your mission.

—description from the publisher

name: Creatures' Battle
description:
The game pits creatures from 8 factions against each other. The creatures and their fate are in your hands, in the form of a deck of cards.
Creatures' Battle is a challenge-based card game. At the beginning of the game, each player draws four cards from their own deck, which they must replenish at the end of each round so that they has four cards in their hand again. Each round starts with a different player. The starting player uses one of their creatures to challenge the others, who, if they have the right cards, may beat the challenger. The last player to beat the cards with their own wins the round. When the deck runs out of cards the battle is over and everyone counts the points they have collected. Whoever has the most points wins the battle. But be careful, to win you need quality victories, not quantity.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Party Game

name: Party Game Trilogy
description: Party Game Trilogy combines three favourite games: Sketches - Pantomime - Find the word. Draw, describe and pantomime different words for your teammates to guess.

name: Fahr- und Reit-Spiel
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first to reach space 100 wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement
publishers: Verlag von Auerbachs Deutschem Kinder Kalender

name: FLIGHT
description:
From the first human-carrying kites in China through to the designs of Leonardo Da Vinci to the first modern aviation pioneers – the Wright brothers, human desire to reach the sky has been limitless.
However, the last few decades have been difficult for all airline enterprises throughout the world. In FLIGHT players will take on the role of the Head of Operations.
You will deploy aircraft fleets to airport hubs around the globe and take part in creating new aircraft. You will manage day-to-day events and lead your specialists to OUTSMART YOUR COMPETITION.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Drawing, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Push Your Luck, Race, Semi-Cooperative Game, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: Squatch & Seek
description:
A combat-memory cards game where sasquatches lurk near every logging camp.

Lumberjacks spend the daytime chopping and swapping: Chopping adds cards from the deck to the forest grid, while swapping conceals them as they cycle through the players' hands.

In the evening, players must choose face-down cards from the grid one at a time. Find a fallen tree? Live to log another day. Reveal a sasquatch? Lose a life!

Lose three lives and you're out. The last lumberjack standing wins!

—description from the publisher

name: FRUIT
description:
FRUIT is a tree-shaped board game about the 9 Fruit of the Spirit as shown in Galatians 5:22-23.
Starting at the root, climbing up the trunk, and going to the ends of each of the 9 branches, be the first player to collect 1 of each of all 9 Spirit Fruit cards. This is done through reading Bible verses based upon the Fruit of the Spirit and by making wise choices, collecting Wild Fruit cards, and going through penalties.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Race, Random Production, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Elegy of Atlas
description:
The Elegy of Atlas is a skirmish-engine builder tabletop game.

Two players build their civilizations on the backs of massive giants called Atlases. These creatures are the size of a continents and can range from man made monstrosities to natural wonders.

Each turn the player upgrades, researches and evolves their Atlas to become the most powerful entity of the land.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck Construction, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: Ironmasters of Yorkshire
description:
The Industrial Revolution in Yorkshire began in the late 18th century. Inventions and improvements to manufacturing processes, advantageous geology and geography as well as established local practices and traditions, determined the progress of industrial change.
In Ironmasters of Yorkshire players will take on the role of coal mine owners and steel producers. Players will develop their mines and steel furnaces as well as increase their investment in local markets. As time goes by, they will start to acquire industrial companies which will increase consumption.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Income, Loans, Market, Multi-Use Cards, Ownership, Resource to Move, Tile Placement

name: Lands of the Quests
description:
A two to four player game where players compete to be the first player to collect three tokens and bring them to the center of the game board. Players take turns rolling two four-sided dice, one featuring the numbers 1-4 and another with the cardinal directions (East, West, North, South). Players then move one of their pawns accordingly. Landing on an opponents pawn will return them to their starting position, and if they were carrying a token, you can pick it up.

The game has no theme other than a name and celtic knots on tokens and along the edge of the game board.
mechanics: Moving Multiple Units, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Seven Dragons
description: In Seven Dragons two to four players compete to be the first to collect seven colored tokens from the map, knocking their opponents home and using the features of the map, such as portals, to arrive first.
mechanics: Moving Multiple Units, Roll / Spin and Move

name: YES or No: The Game Conspiracy Expansion Pack
description:
The most anticipated follow-up to the best-selling game is finally here. With 110+ new cards, you can find out even more about your friends and family, and judge their stances on the most hotly contested conspiracies in American life. Because the original game wasn't controversial enough.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: HODL UP
description:
A Bitcoin Mining Game

Travel the time chain from the Genesis block in 2009 through 2140 when the last bitcoin - ever - is finally mined ... Hodl, hodl, hodl. May the best holder win!

name: Μικρές Αγορές (Small Markets)
description: An exciting game to get to know the euro, learn to manage small amounts of money and make successful purchases and sales!

name: Crazy Léon
description:
Chameleons no longer find their way in the jungle! To help them, get rid of all your cards to advance the chameleons from vine to vine, without exceeding the imposed playing area.
But beware, chameleons have gone crazy! They change colors and direction without warning... Stay alert not to leave the jungle! Joker cards will allow you to trap other players (and save you!) by giving you the opportunity to change the color requested, the direction or both.
Crazy Léon is a family game that will appeal to the youngest. Contains 54 cards and the game rule printed in the box.

—description from the publisher

name: Papa Tango
description:
Papa Tango gaming rules were designed to give players a feel for the PT actions that oc­curred in the "Slot" around Guadalcanal during World War II.

No attempt was made at a naval simulation but instead the main design goal was that of a fast playing, fun, "Beer and Pretzel" type of game. A game that would give you an excuse to collect and paint up some PTs and Japanese naval craft.

A couple of different design techniques were use. As PT pat­rols and actions almost always happened at night, part of the game would involve just trying to locate the enemy. This could best be accomplished having all of the players on one side and having the Japanese side run by a game master. The other unique design technique was the use of darts as the hit mecha­nism for firing. I had watched a naval game at one of the first Little Wars conventions that use darts thrown at a silhouette tar­gets and it was obvious that the players were having a good time tossing the darts. It just seemed that the game might be fun in­corporating another popular game into the wargame.
Game players are members of the "Lucky Seven" PT squadron, a fictitious squadron operating in the "Slot" during the Guadacanal and New Georgia campaigns during World War IL The squadron consists of 3-6 players operating with six PT boats. There are two replacement boats for boats lost in combat.

Each game consists of 10 patrols with each patrol lasting up to 20 turns. The squadron has been assigned the mission of protecting the Guadacanal airfield from attack by the Japanese navy and to interdict supplies and rein­forcements from reaching Japanese held islands. So check your ammunition and fuel, man your craft and get ready to tango with the "Tokyo Express".

—description from the publisher
categories: Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement

name: The Game of Meme
description:
A party game for 3 or more players.

How to play:

5 Picture cards are placed face-up in the middle, and each player gets 5 Phrase cards. Players get 60 seconds to place one of their Phrase cards face-up under one of the Picture cards, trying to create the funniest meme.

The winner is determined by a vote with all players simultaneously pointing to their favorite. First to five wins the game.

—description from the rulebook

name: Auf in die Berge
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. Before the game begins, a token is placed on each city (black dot), but 3 tokens are placed on the towns of Brenner, Reit im Winkel and Garmisch-Partenkirchen. Whoever touches these places first during the game may appropriate the tokens on them, but never the one who jumps over the cities at high speed to be the first to be back at the starting point in Lindau.
The winner in this game is not the fastest who first reached Lindau, the start of the journey, but the one who owns the largest number of tokens.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Track Movement

name: COMSUBPAC The Game
description:
Solitaire game in which the player commands USN submarines in the Pacific Ocean during WW2. The game can be purchased from WargameVault online. Price: $10.00 File Download


Starting as a Subron Commander, with six boats, he sends his subs hunting enemy shipping.
Die rolls decide all outcomes. There are War Events, Passage Events, Patrol Events, and Random Events plus many optional rules to enrich gameplay.
The objective is to earn promotion to Admiral, Commander Submarines Pacific.

—description from the designer

name: Dusk Runners
description:
In the world of Dusk Runners, the post-apocalyptic future is intertwined with the ancient past. In the shattered world, the night advances slowly but unstoppably, hiding bloodthirsty monsters in its darkness. The survivors defy the night in various ways, but the bravest are constantly on the move, fighting on the edge of day and night to unravel the secrets of the ancestors. They are called Dusk Runners.

Dusk Runners is a campaign-based fully cooperative survival-adventure game in which players take on the role of a character and face the monsters of the night as a team. It offers a persistent world with an emergent narrative.

Each player creates a deck of 14 unique cards which that they are using as a resource or for their abilities. For each challenge you must push your luck to succeed with the least cost. If you spend too much cards you will be exhausted soon, and the night advances.

During each game you are exploring the sights and secrets of the map, trying to advance your situation, collect food and loot and try to avoid injuries, while fighting with the monsters. Decide wisely how long you are staying, pride is the deadliest foe of Dusk Runners!

Develop your hero from game to game, find companions and change the world as you face the darkness and unravel the secrets of the ancestors!
mechanics: Action/Event, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Multi-Use Cards, Multiple Maps, Push Your Luck, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Dicing with Dinner: Events Extension
description:
This is a cut-out-and-play game with a food/cooking theme.

This extension comprises an extra deck of cards and a new task to Dicing with Dinner, allowing random events to change game play and scoring, usually round by round.

Events can affect recipes, scoring, and ingredients. Balance short-term gains and losses against realizing the long-term value of ingredients in your 'fridge.

—description from the designer

name: Doomsday
description: Doomsday is a fast and dynamic card game in which the goal is to collect the least number of card points and force your opponents to collect as many as possible. The number of players is limited by the amount of cards (a maximum of 8 per game is recommended), several game boxes can be combined to increase the number of players (e.g., 16 players with 2 boxes).

name: The Battle of the Sambre: 16–19 May 1940
description:
Commanded by Rommel, in May 1940 the 7th Panzer Division was one of the major units playing a major role in the success of the German plan to isolate the Franco-Anglo-Belgian army group on the North Sea coast. It forcibly crossed the Meuse in Belgium on 13 May at Dinant, breaking through the French 18th Infantry Division after a day of fighting. The French hastily committed their reserves in an attempt to contain the Germans. Two first-rank divisions were therefore sent to block the Panzer route: the reserve 1st Armoured Division and the 4th North African Division, which was stationed between Anor and Trélon, on the line of French fortifications near the Belgian border. Coming up against the 1st DCR, the 7th Panzer was surprised by the powerful and numerous French tanks (B1bis and H39), but after a few severe losses, the German tanks, which were more mobile and better coordinated, avoided a confrontation and left it to the well-directed German artillery to destroy most of the B1bis one by one, paralysed by a lack of information on the enemy's action and the rapid exhaustion of their fuel tanks. Faced with the 1st DCR, it was more the 5th Panzer Division that was engaged and momentarily halted. The latter therefore followed the advance of the 7th panzer division westwards, a little further north and with a slight delay. The 4th North African Division fought and sacrificed itself between Dinant and France; it more or less disappeared on 15 May, although some elements managed to return to France. At the end of the day on 15 May, the remnants of the three French divisions (18th DI, 4th DINA and 1st DCR) arrived at Beaumont and, retreating, crossed the French border again.

After clearing his route on the morning of 16 May, Rommel placed his forces between Beaumont and Sivry. It was then that the soldiers of the 84th Infantry Regiment, part of the fortified sector of Maubeuge, learned that the Germans were only a few kilometres away. Despite their initial optimism, they hardly had the means to stop the Germans, as this south-eastern section of the fortified sector consisted only of a line of light blockhouses, mostly equipped with automatic weapons. To the east of Maubeuge, only the fort at Boussois, although not completed, was a significant obstacle to the German advance.

After the 84th RIF's thin curtain of blockhouses, the Sambre was the last possible barrage before Rommel's panzer division and the 5th panzer division that followed a little further north reached Cambrai and crossed the rear of the Franco-British expeditionary corps engaged in Belgium. The French high command therefore decided to recall several major formations to try and stop the Germans on the Sambre. These included several well-equipped North African divisions and a motorised infantry division, but above all the 1st mechanical light division, the elite of the French cavalry. While the French arrived in scattered order to plug the gap and avoid being surrounded in Belgium, Rommel pushed westwards with his reconnaissance battalion, sometimes taking ill-considered risks.

Would the French arrive before Rommel on the Sambre, perhaps even managing to capture the fiery Wehrmacht general? Would the French tanks be up to the task of fighting the Panzers?

—description from the publisher
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: Koven
description:
In the lands of Echomere, the only thing more powerful than a witch, a wizard or a dragon is the combined sorcery of all three! While these spellcasters and fire breathers are an ominous force alone, a koven of witches, wizards and dragons can together yield unspeakable magick. It is up to you, young fledgling, to unite these divided mythics and create the most powerful koven the magical world has ever seen.

Koven is a solo card game from Galaxy Goose. Each turn consists of playing one of the two cards from your hand into the playing area. Cards must always be played adjacent to an existing card. By game's end, the player must have created a 4x4 grid. The goal of the game is to group (in columns and rows) as many like-minded mystics together. The game also comes with two included expansions: Witch Trials and Monster Trials.

—description from the publisher

name: Moving Day
description:
July 1st is Moving Day in Quebec, Canada. It’s no joke: more than 100,000 people (!) move on this special day. Why? Starting in the 1700s, by law all leases would expire on the same day. The law has since been changed, but landlords and renters still stick to July 1st as the universal Moving Day. And since so many people are moving on the same day, it's of course near impossible to hire movers or even rent moving trucks on Moving Day - so everyone in the community shows up to help you move!

In Moving Day, your job is to pack all your stuff nicely into the available vehicles, trying to avoid crushing lighter items by putting heavier items on top, while also assigning people from the community to each vehicle. Some of them are pretty clumsy and might break fragile items if you are not careful, but perhaps if they are bringing delicious food with them, it might be impossible to turn them away...

On your turn, choose a set of two item tiles and one person card from a general display, and then assign them to your vehicles. But be aware that your vehicles have limited space and different shapes, and you must fill the items from the bottom to the top. People also have different strengths and should ideally be strong enough to collectively lift your heavier items.

After eight rounds the game ends. Each player now has sixteen item tiles and eight people cards assigned to their vehicles, and they calculate their score:


Heavy items on top of lighter items break the lighter items below.
Clumsy people will break fragile items.
Heavy items score more points than lighter items.
Score extra points for adjacent items of the same shape.
Score extra points for adjacent items of the same type.
Food tokens are also worth 1 point each!


The player with the most points wins!
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Increase Value of Unchosen Resources, Open Drafting, Tile Placement

name: Fleet of Foxes
description:
Fleet of Foxes brings all of the fun of battling your friends with spaceships to roll and write games!

Roll 3 dice, then take turns placing your dice completing actions. Players will be able to upgrade their abilities, attack their opponent, regain health, and shield from incoming attacks. Attacks are tallied at the end of the turn less the shield values. Players will gain bonus effects each time they deal 3 or more damage to their opponent.

Players will gain energy to upgrade abilities allowing for stronger effects. The top most row can have up to 3 dice on them while upgraded abilities may only have 1 die on them. Players can learn abilities to the left, right, or below from a previously learned ability. This will give the players plenty of options for upgrading their fleet.

Do you lean into shields and hit point regeneration? Can you stall your opponent's attack and gradually wear them down? Or do you go for the big blasts and push for that super nova win of running your opponent out of hit points as quickly as possible?

With 4 different character sheets, players will find plenty of variability and options for battling their foes! Will the Explorer be your guide? Do you pick the Mechanic for her dice changing abilities? What about the MP who can block just about any attack headed her way? What about the Space Marine with his ability to deal huge damage to himself and his opponent? Each character presents their own play style!

Plus no need for holding sheets back with stretch goals or asking backers to pay extra, nope, not here. We want you to have all 4 for just your pledge amount! Join the Fleet and get ready to battle!

Players will find additional challenge with being able to play with up to 3 friends playing 2 vs 2 or free for all with 3 players!

Even more challenges await, we're also including 9 cards for solo or cooperative play! You can even chain multiple challenge cards to battle against the Wolf and his minions. Its time to take back the controlled space and free the Foxes!

Get ready to roll, write, and win!

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Aviation / Flight, Dice, Print & Play, Space Exploration
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: A Return to the Islands of the Damned
description:
Those who have subscribed for or buy the Against The Odds (ATO) Annual 2020, published in 2023, DIRECT from Against The Odds (ATO) magazine, will receive a small expansion kit with mounted counters for both the solo games inside our "Islands of the Damned: Wake Island and Peleliu" issue (ATO #43). The expansion kit is named "A Return to the Islands of the Damned".

For the "Wake Island: Not Dead Yet" expansion game, in which the US solo player is defending against the Japanese attack, the expansion kit includes an addition eight (8) US counters to arrive if there is a Second Japanese Invasion, and represents the hypothetical event of US Task Force TF-14 getting close enough to Wake to unload some or all of its supplies (extra ammo, fuel, aircraft, radar, and more marines).

For the "Peleliu: Utmost Savagery" game, in which the US solo player is invading the island, the expansion kit includes:
(1) three US Marine Wardog counters which boosts the US side; plus
(2) five extra Japanese units, modelling the hypothetical event that a significant part of the 25,000-man Japanese force on the nearby Babeldaob Island actually had been successful in reinforcing the Japanese defenders on Peleliu.

"A Return to the Islands of the Damned" includes one page of Rules, and 16 die-cut counters. ONLY available by buying ATO Annual 2020 DIRECT from ATO magazine.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Rise of the Trackers
description:
Rise of the Trackers: A Fireflies Trilogy Game is a board game based on the imaginative world brought to life in the Fireflies Trilogy books by Melissa Koberlein.
 
This game is played collaboratively between 2-6 players against both time and the deck. Players choose their characters, and each become a "Tracker", a human hosting alien symbiotes called chondria. This relationship grants the player unique abilities resulting in varied attributes that aid the player on their journey to both find other humans that are compatible with chondria and assist in successfully bonding the compatible human and chondria together. In this symbiotic state, both the chondria and human thrive, developing new and elevated skills from the purely human state.
 
This task is made difficult by the fact that bonding can have complications. If a bonding is attempted on an incompatible human, that human and the chondria die. Additionally, a compatible human still must be willing before successfully becoming a host. If a compatible human is unwilling and a bonding is attempted, their body and the chondria become at odds, and they turn into "Razers". While a Razer remains alive and hosts living chondria inside their body, they also become unresponsive and lose control of their human selves. Their consciousness is now influenced/responsive only to the host that bonded them against their will. In this race against odds, a team of Trackers is on a mission to find more compatible humans and convince them to become a host to this incredible alien species.
 
Malcolm Durst, however, is a host with a sinister mission: Create more razers to do his bidding. He uses the vulnerability of the Razers to prevent the growth of healthy hosts and grows a force of Razers under him to amass power and control in the world. He and his daughter, Lilah, have to be stopped before their control of Razers gives them unrestrained power to see their plan to fruition.
 
In this turn-based board game, players move around the board working together in making decisions that influence themselves, their fellow Trackers, Allies, and Enemies. The Trackers must work together to reveal if a human is compatible, use their unique attributes in various combinations to convince them to be a willing host, and bond them into an Ally that can aid in their mission to stop Malcolm and Lilah. As game play progresses, Trackers can be hindered or boosted by characters or their environment via the deck, and an enemy turn every round works to progress Malcolm’s mission. Players win when they have created enough Allies. However, if Malcolm accumulates enough Razers first, or if too many humans dies from incompatible bonding, the Trackers lose.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Command Cards, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Events, Grid Movement, Interrupts, Move Through Deck, Moving Multiple Units, Square Grid, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Gumball World
description:
Ion Award Winner 2023
Ciutat de Granollers 2024 Semi-Finalist



In Gumball World, you are a teenager who has just been hired for their first part time job at a candy store! Sounds pretty chill, right? Not with Mr. Gimble running things! You only get paid for filling the gumball machines in the way that Gimble insists and lose money if even one gumball is out of place.

You will fill all 30 spaces of your gumball machine over 15 turns where you will take one of two actions:

1) Take 2 gumballs from any one tray.

OR

2) Take 2 gumballs from any one tray and the corresponding Instruction Card.

Also, bribe Mr. Gimble with quarters to gain powerful special abilities to alter your gumball machine, rearrange gumballs you've already placed or cycle through Instruction Cards to shake up the market! As you fill your gumball machine, you must follow specific gravity rules. Do you want to fill the sides and bottom first to create a nice base for the rest? Or do you want to build up the middle and leave the sides for gumballs that are harder to place?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Set Collection

name: Hole Up
description:
Hole Up is a "holey" word game for two or more players, generally aged 7+. Players take turns stacking up letter cards to make three-letter words.

The cards have one or two letters and one or two holes. The holes line up with missing letters such that when two or more cards are stacked, underlying letters appear through the holes and a new word becomes visible.

COMPONENTS

72 double-sided letter cards
Six dry erase score boards
Two dry erase markers.


OVERVIEW
The goal of HOLE UP is score the most points from the words stacked.

MODES
There are three ways of playing HOLE UP:
• Stack - single stack
• Square - four-sided square stack
• Crosswords - like Scrabble.

All modes can be played solo or with two or more players.

COMMON SETUP

Shuffle the letter cards.
Place the cards within easy reach of all players.
Draw the the top card and place it between the players as the base card in the “heap”.
Give each player one card.
Give each player a score card.


GAME PLAY
On their turn, a player can perform the following actions:
Try to form a word on the heap.
Draw a new card if they cannot make a word.
Stack one of their cards to make a word or combine two of their cards (if available) to make and stack a word.
Players can lay either side of a card. The stacked card must form a valid three-letter word using the letters beneath and on their card. If not a single stack, all words formed must be valid.
At all times, at least one hole will be present and the letter in the hole will be used to form the next word.
 
FORMING A WORD
A three-letter word is formed using a combination of the letters beneath (as seen through the hole) and those on the card played.
For example, with the stack showing H A T
and the current card showing [ ] I P , the new word would be H I P, scoring 8 points. The "H" in the hole is used.

SCORING
Add up the point values of the three letters in the word made. Add the value to the score card.

ENDING THE GAME
The game is over once the draw pile has been exhausted and no more words can be formed by the player(s).
STRATEGIES

Examine both sides of a card to optimize a score.
Hold on to a valuable card to use later, for example one with high point value letter like X or Z.


—description from the publisher

name: The Middle Sea
description:
The Mediterranean naval war includes more intense action in the air and on the sea than we could stuff into our game on the topic, La Regia Marina.

The Middle Sea is a very large expansion set for La Regia Marina: 630 new pieces (210 double-sized “long” pieces, 420 standard-sized square ones) and 40 new scenarios.

It covers the action from the summer of 1942, when La Regia Marina’s story ends, through the surrender of Italy in September 1943. And there’s also the brief 1940 naval war between France and Italy.

You get the full French order of battle for the Mediterranean fleet, Italian ships commissioned during the last year of the campaign or planned to join the fleet, and the American and British ships that participated in these operations and were not included in La Regia Marina. Plus many, many aircraft.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Handyman Jam
description:
Welcome to Jammington, a charming neighborhood filled with extraordinary residents and skilled artisans. What sets this community apart is a fascinating twist - all the homes were constructed using a remarkable ingredient: jam! Yes, you heard that right - jam, it works better than glue!
Thanks to the innovative Jammer 2.0, we have access to the finest quality jam right here in our neighborhood.

In Handyman Jam 2-4 players ages 12+ will repair homes by collecting and using Jam. You will select 1 of 6 unique Handyman characters to play as. On your turn you will collect Jam and repair homes to earn as much money as you can. The 1st player to repair their 9th home ends the game. Use your expert skills to repair homes and earn the most money to win the game.

—description from the designer

name: Escate
description:
Escate is an exciting quest game with 42 logical riddles and cunning mysteries. This is the first game in series of Mr. Cat’s fun adventures.
Escate is a great entertainment for family and friends who love riddles, both for beginners and experienced players.
How to play?

Read the task card.
Inspect all rooms.
Find a clue.
Solve all the riddles to complete main quest.


—description from the publisher

name: Push D6
description:
An Abstract Strategy Game for 2 players utilising dice movement in an unusual way.

Be the first to push 5 of your opponents 6 dice off the edge of the board in an strategic game of cat and mouse, whereby the mouse can easily become the cat.

Your dice's strength and value will change after movement based on it's top value prior to movement. With a 6 benefiting from high movement potential but weak strength, to a 1 being the strongest on the board but with vastly restricted movement. As you can guess the numbers in between offer their own benefits and weaknesses.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Different Dice Movement, Grid Movement, Moving Multiple Units, Slide/Push, Square Grid

name: UFO Wars
description:
The sector is in turmoil as 2 or more UFO fleets strive for total domination in this fast paced tabletop game.

And... all rules on a single A4 sheet!

Two or more players have a fleet of UFOs, this can be any number but to start 3 to 5 is recommended.

The UFOs are moved like most other tabletop games by measuring the distance they fly. Important to note is that the UFOs have four fixed speed values.
The faster a UFO flies the harder it is to hit but also the harder is to target an enemy UFO. Shooting makes use of a simple straightforward gunnery chart using a single D6.

The last UFO (fleet) standing is the winner!

name: Vegan Lions
description: In the sunlit expanses of the savannah, not all lions are carnivores. Enter the world of "Vegan Lions", where you're a unique lion with a penchant for plant-based delights. A table top 52 card games where you roam the vast plains, gathering a diverse array of vegan foods from crunchy kale to protein-packed lentils. But it's not just about the food; it's about the friends. Recruit a squad of animal allies, each bringing their own perks and quirks to your journey. But beware! The savannah has its challenges, and you'll need to navigate obstacles that can hinder your progress. The goal? Amass the most points through your vegan collection and animal alliances, proving once and for all that plant power reigns supreme in the animal kingdom. A delightful blend of strategy, humor, and vibrant themes, "Vegan Lions" promises a roaring good time for players of all ages 8+.

name: Assassins Quest
description:
Based on the "Assassin's creed" series, take the role of a professional assassin who make is steps in the streets of a full-of-life medieval town, trying put his hand on a high-priced wanted head. Watch-out! your not alone. few experienced assassins want his head too and will do all the necessary, even by take you down...
Make your wise choices to assassinate disturbing guards, get some 'clues' from civilians, find useful objects and treasures and locate the Wanted before them.
But remember, one wanted won't make you a legend...

Instructions(summary):In a small medieval town shown on the game board and divided into zones, the participants distribute the various game tokens, 6 in total: citizens, guards, objectives, event, bargain and tower.
The 'Citizens' and the 'Guards' are placed with their faces up and the others upside down. Each player in turn has the right to choose a face-up token and act according to the roll of the dice. Civilians will reveal info to you so you could flip a face-down token in the same area but be aware - an bad die may also kill them (3 kills of a civilian will get you out of the game). Killing 'Guards' will get you victory points according to the guard rating. 'Bargain' are also victory points but they can be used for bribery. 'Target' will allow you to choose another player and try to rob or eliminate him but also to locate the 'wanted'. An 'Event' will allow you to cause an 'Accident' and instantly eliminate a 'Civilian', 'Guard' or other player (can be useful) and the 'Tower' will allow you to peek at face-down tokens.
The game ends when one of the players finds the 'Wanted' or alternatively if the other players are disqualified (killed too many civilians or were killed somehow). A player who found the 'Wanted' will win 5 victory points.
At the end of the game, victory points are counted and the winner is announced.
mechanics: Bids As Wagers, Constrained Bidding, Dice Rolling, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Second World War at Sea: Ironbottom Sound
description:
The Solomons Campaign of 1942 saw the American and Japanese navies engage in the most intense naval combat of World War II. For months the two sides fought over Guadalcanal, a miserable jungle-covered island with a vital airbase.

Ironbottom Sound: A South Pacific Story continues the tale that we began in Second World War at Sea: South Pacific. You get 36 new scenarios for South Pacific, covering more of the operations around Guadalcanal including Tassafaronga, Operation Ke (the Japanese evacuation of Guadalanal) and the campaign for New Georgia. The battles of Tassafaronga, Kolombangara and Kula Gulf. And a deeper look at the campaigns we already covered in South Pacific, with still more scenarios.

South Pacific is a rich mixture of game play and history, but there is more to the story than we could fit in the box (which is already filled to the top). The U.S. Navy wrote its most glorious chapter in the Solomons, and it’s a story that deserves the attention we give it in Ironbottom Sound.

—description from the designer
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: AltarShock
description:
AltarShock is a miniatures bloodsport skirmish game inspired by Unreal Tournament and Quake Arena.

With no stats, lists, or points, AltarShock is extremely fast to learn, set up, and play. 15 weapons, ammo, HELTH, and more are placed as pickup tokens around a terrain filled battlefield. Frag, Get Fragged, Respawn, Frag again. AltarShock includes 4+ game modes and can be played with up to 10 people in death match or team game modes.

Prepare yourself, and your friends, for the ultimate bloodsport on the table.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Galactic Heroes
description:
Warning! Sneaky aliens are attacking Earth... and not only that, they've sabotaged our Robots. They are totally out of control! It's time for us, the Galactic Heroes, to fight back and face this enemy invasion. Let's rescue our planet!
Galactic Heroes, a social deduction adventure for 3-6 brave humans. And robots. And aliens.

In this Social Deduction Game, players joining secretly 3 teams and try to outsmart the others.

With easy to teach rules, this could be the 1st Social Deduction game for your Family. Child friendly!

—description from the publisher

Player holding 3 cards. The majority of their color will show their true identity. They could be Human, Robot or Alien.
Players can investigate cards from others to see their faction options and if they think they know who is the enemy, they could grab a boxing glove or a Banana-Thrower from the table and attack the enemies. Thanks to Update cards players can become more powerful, so maybe it is better to collect more updates.

Humans must defeat all Aliens and Robots t win the game as a Team.
Every Robot is a lone-wolf and must be the last man standing.
Aliens wind together if all Humans are defeated.

Every game needs 10-45 minutes is unique thanks to new Update cards, other weapons and other hidden Role skills.

name: Tiny Traders
description:
In this 2-4 player game, players sail from island to island gathering cards.
The board consists of three islands, each made up of a stack of cards. The cards act as resources, contracts, and upgrades to your ship, and are slowly wittled away as the game progresses.

Resources are just that: resources. They have no inherent value unless accompanied by a contract.

Contracts list what resources -- and what combination of resources -- score points at the end of the game.

Upgrades change what you can do on your turn, whether it be stealing cards from your opponent or gaining an extra action.

The game is over as soon as an island is used up. The player with the most points scored by their contacts wins.
mechanics: Contracts, Open Drafting, Resource to Move, Set Collection, Take That

name: Diceocracy
description:
Ever since you were a kid, you've been told that you're destined for grand things, so you're pretty certain that things will only be better with more you in it! Well, it's finally time for more you...in the name of democracy, as it just so happens there is an election coming up. There is only one tiny little problem: Democracy is kind of up to the people, and the people are, well, DICE!

In the corrupt cyberpunk future of Diceocracy, you will use your influence to attract groups of voters in different districts and introduce them to your jaw-dropping politics by "any means necessary" — as long as you can get away with it, anyway. The goal of the game is to get the most votes by just being YOU...along with a fair bit of stern persuasion and political stunts!

On a player's turn, they choose a representative that gives them a special bonus, such as increasing your popularity within a demographic, raising funds, getting agenda cards, moving positions of your representatives, and manipulating dice — because the dice in this game represent different demographic groups.

Players then send out their representative to one of the districts in the city to increase their influence and use any tricks they have. After twelve rounds, the player with the most votes wins.

—description from the publisher

name: 9-Card Rally Run: Hazards Pack
description:
Hazards Pack is an expansion for 9-Card Rally Run that adds more challenge.

To ramp up the difficulty, this pack introduces 2 hazards: Water and Crests. These two hazards change the lane requirement to a specific value. Water hazard requires the lowest dice value of that lane while the Crest requires the highest value of the lane.

Road cards from this expansion have Caution on their card back.

Quick Rule:
Water: Use the lowest dice value of the lane
Crest: Use the highest dice value of the lane
Swap out 1-7 regular road cards with hazard road cards. Card backs must match.

—description from the designer

name: Food Truck Rally
description:
Food Truck Rally is a card drafting, economy game. Pick a spot to park your truck, combine resources to complete customer orders, and travel around in your truck as you gather a crowd of loyal customers.

Watch out though, your competitors may try to crash your truck, pay off an inspector or steal resources from you. Keep up on your insurance to protect your truck or take a chance without insurance in hopes to save money as you race to the top for the title of TOP FOOD TRUCK.

name: Card Caverns
description:
You are a dwarf and you are digging a hole, not just any hole, you are digging a mine. Along the way you will find treasure, hopefully enough to make you rich; but no promises. Pay attention to where treasure is as you dig deeper and deeper into the mine. Everyone can be a miner in Card Caverns!

Card Caverns is a solitaire roll and write game, that uses cards to help you build a map, and also shows you what you are allowed to draw on that map. Over the coarse of 9 rounds, you will be carving out a mine, using a dry erase marker. Collect gemstones, and items along the way that will lead you to being the best miner out there.

Once you have played the classic version, be sure to try out Challenge Mode. This will give you set objectives to try as you play the game.

Card Caverns was originally designed for the 15th Roll and Write Game Design Contest. The designer (Wayne Koenig) wanted to create a game that was played mostly in hand, which is why all the "rock formations," also show you what you must draw on the mine. We hope that you will print the game out and enjoy it as much as we have enjoyed designing it.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Exploration, Fantasy, Maze, Print & Play, Puzzle
mechanics: Drawing, Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Set Collection, Square Grid, Tile Placement, Variable Set-up

name: Sophistry
description:
Sophistry is a two-player deck-building game about winning Discussions. Use your Traits and your Focus to achieve the requirements of the Discussion Topic Card. The best of 3 Discussions wins the game. Build your personality and stick to it... or try to shift it and become someone you are not; everything is accepted in the art of Sophistry.

At the start of each Discussion, a Discussion Topic Card is revealed. The current Discussion Topic Card asks for specific Traits, and players must acquire those Traits to win the Discussion. Alternativly, they can try to change the requirements to fit better with their personalities by cultivating their Traits and using the cultivated Token to replace one of the Trait requirements on the Topic Card.

Players will take turns acquiring new traits from a pool and use their Traits on the discussion to activate special effects that allow them to change the board. Are you going to discuss with passion and be able to use more focus? Or are you going to be logical, which allows you to draw more cards? Each of the six different traits has different strategies, and you can try to focus on building only one or diversify your traits and be prepared for future discussions.

—description from the designer

name: Super Flipop
description: Super Flipop is a dexterity and precision game suitable for the whole family. Similar to shuffleboard but with a twist. Shoot your wooden pucks from an elastic band to get to the number markers on the other side of the game board, by rebounding against the rails. Your opponent must do the same while trying to displace your pieces. The game ends when a team reaches 1000 points.

name: Kreel Manor: The Path of Song
description: This expansion for Kreel Manor: The Dungeon Crawl Card Game adds a new hero to play as (and allows up to 4 players, 5 with The Path of the Dead) and includes over 60 cards.

name: "Give Fyre": Skirmishing and Battle in the Renaissance Period
description: Miniatures wargame rules for Renaissance skirmishes.
categories: Book, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Renaissance, Wargame
publishers: Dropwing Game Systems, On Military Matters

name: Wardelve: Ichor of the Chitin Lords
description: Wardelve is a ready to play out of the box, the game takes only a few minutes to setup and you can start to play pre-laid out maps or a dungeon explore and crawl mode. Setup is easy and fast, typically in minutes as you build as you play. Play can range from minutes to hours depending upon choice of game mode, number of players, etc. You will recruit minions, creatures from a large quantity of low level dust devils to fewer and fewer upper level creatures. While defending your dungeon from the pesky dungeon raiders… humans.. elves… dwarves… halflings… stealing your treasures.

name: Lahnexpress
description:
The Lahnexpress is a dice game for 2 to 4 children from the age of 4 to 5. The game is played on a large wooden board with a central turntable, the railway. Each child gets 5 pieces of one color made of wood. 4 of these are set up on the base plate at your own station. The dice are rolled in turn. The player with the highest score may then turn the game disc so that the first wheel of the locomotive is at his station. Then the starting player rolls again. With the number of points now rolled, the game is played as follows:

First, a token is placed on the rails in the direction of the arrow for the number rolled.
Then the locomotive continues in the same direction for the same number of points.


If the wheels of the wagon of their own color are on the same track space as their token, the player with that token may board the wagon. This also applies equally to all other players. The child who was first to place four game pieces in the wagon of the same color wins.

—user summary

name: Bop It! Maker
description:
Record your own custom BOP IT moves, then keep up with the game to score as many points as you can! It's the Bop It game you know, with a twist. Included BOP IT moves mix with moves you create, for a unique BOP IT game challenge. Record your move and repeat it when it's called out. The game senses if you are doing it correctly!

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Electronic, Party Game

name: Loopz M3
description: Loopz M3 is the music, memory and motion game that can be played anywhere! This handheld unit captures all the fun of the original Loopz, but this time, it's totally portable. Players use four trigger buttons and motion sensors to play a variety of games where the winner is the one with the fastest reaction time and best memory for sequences. Includes 4 different games for up to 2 players.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Electronic, Memory, Music, Party Game

name: Robot Rampage
description:
Shoot your swarm of skillful robots straight through the gap in the solar system to complete their daring space mission! Battle your friends in this rapid-fire riot of hurtling cyborgs. Whose entire team can breach the gap first?

—description from the publisher

Two players sit on opposite sides of the board and take turns using the built-in elastics to shoot their counters through the slot in the center of the box to the other player's side. First player to get all six of their counters through is the winner.

—user summary

name: Up for Debate
description:
Everyone has their own opinion and Up For Debate is a game that allows you to prove your opponent is wrong in a series of wacky debates. Challenge their answer, give your opinion on why your answer is better, and let the other players decide who wins that round. Be the first to get rid of all your cards to win the game.

Up For Debate is a fun and fast-paced game for family and friends. It can also be used as an icebreaker at gatherings or as a way to get everyone talking at your next party. Suitable for players aged 8 years and over, you will need three or more players for gameplay.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Acting, Player Judge, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Outer Space Adventure
description:
A children's game where the players draw cards with either a color or a picture, then move their astronaut piece either forward or backward to the nearest matching square on the board. Some squares have instructions to allow players to take short cuts to move farther along the track, while others will send them backwards. First player to reach the finish star wins.

—description from the publisher

name: Checkers Circular
description:
This is a modern variation of checkers from Africa. It is checkers with an exciting twist; a circular board that will force the players to play checkers as if for the first time. It is no longer the same game you know …

just like in traditional draughts, players capture opponents by jumping over them. the only difference is the board is not connected from both sides.

name: Slime Saga
description:
In the realm of Slime Saga, a lone adventurer, the elemental Slime, sets off on a exciting journey. Armed with courage and wit, they face formidable foes, challenging obstacles and explore peculiar biomes and levels.

To play this PnP board game, you will need two 6-sided dice, one pen, printed and cut-out markers, a printed level sheet and a printed character sheet with one slime selected from six different elements (earth, fire, water, wind, frost and electro).

The goal is simple: You must survive through each level and biome and go from the starting point on the map to the "next level" field to continue in the saga. At the start of every level, you add map hazards by rolling a die.
You roll two dice to move around the map, overcome events and traps, collect items to aid you and fight in combat. Each chapter has their own unique events and setup.

Will you join the saga and become the ultimate Slime Adventurer? Prepare for unforgettable adventures!

name: Topic Trumps
description:
The ultimate card game for knowledge-hungry geeks and enthusiasts! Get ready to delve into the depths of niche interests and expand your geeky horizons in this unique twist on the classic Top Trumps game.

Just like its traditional counterpart, Topic Trumps follows a simple yet addictive gameplay formula. Each player receives a hand of topic-themed cards, with each card containing open-source researched stats.

The objective of the game is to outdo your opponents by comparing specific attributes or statistics of the topic cards. These attributes may vary depending on the theme, but they could include factors such as speed, weight, firepower or even something completely odd and obscure. Players take turns challenging their opponents by selecting a specific attribute from their card and pitting it against the corresponding attribute on their opponent's card. The player with the highest value for that attribute wins the round and collects the opponent's card.

However, what sets Topic Trumps apart from its traditional counterpart is its inherent educational value. All stats and values in the deck have been researched in open-source material - arming you for any pub-quiz or trivia night!

Players get to explore and learn about various geeky topics that they may not have encountered before. Whether it's discovering fascinating facts about rare chemicals, fantasy characters, curries of the world or taking a crash-course in wine or maybe unraveling the intricacies of micro-computers of the 1980s, Topic Trumps is an excellent way to immerse yourself in new, old and exciting subjects.

In addition to its quick gameplay and educational value, Topic Trumps takes learning to the next level with an innovative feature: each card is equipped with a QR code that links to a wealth of information about the specific topic it represents. By scanning the QR code using a smartphone or tablet, players can find out more about their favourite card.

—description from the designer

name: UMS: Modern Age
description:
UMS: Modern Age is the first adaptation written using the “core” of UMS, a set of rules originally developed in Italian and then translated into English whose ambition is to cover the conflicts of the contemporary era (2015+) and other modern historical periods as well.

The scale is 28 or 20mm and the base unit is the Squad/Team or the single vehicle. The structures and equipment of the units mirror the ones from armies of NATO, Russian (former Warsaw Pact), Middle-East, Africa and irregular/insurgent ones. D12s are used to resolve firefights and all others checks such as moral and activation ones. The minimum table size is the standard 120x180Cm, but larger ones can be used too!

Clashes between superpowers armies, local conflicts between Warlords, symmetrical or asymmetrical operations, raids … all this can be played on using the guidelines offered by the rulebook.

UMS: Modern Age gives the players rules for managing a ground battle with vehicles, aircrafts, helicopters and artillery supports. Players will also find generic army lists with a point system and scenarios, or missions, to be used for a quick game among friends. This does not take away the possibility for players to being able to create custom scenarios inspired by historical events of the last decade.

—description from the designer

name: Munchkin Paranoia
description:
The Computer Is Your Friend — this was the first thing you heard when you came out of the clone tank. It'll probably be the last thing you hear when you're lasered down like the Commie mutant traitor that you are.

Munchkin Paranoia crosses the gameplay of Munchkin with the world of Paranoia. Races = mutations. Classes = Secret Societies. Level = color clearance. Monsters = your fellow citizens of Alpha Complex, mostly. Victory = Reach High Programmer status!

Look forward to "Hot Fun, Cold Fun" and "Bouncy Bubble Beverage"...
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Stackosaurs
description: Have stacks of fun with this roarsome dino stacking game! Roll the dice, select your dinosaur and stack the dinos as high as you can. Whatever you do, don’t let your dinos fall into extinction – or you’ll be out!

name: Check-Four
description:
"Now play checkers with 4 players!"

A four-player checkers game from 1972. The board is 8x8 with four 2x8 wings off of each side, clearly separated from the main board by a small gap. The middle 6x6 of the board is distinguished by a yellow line.

Four sets of twelve checkers each in red, black, white, and gold are included.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pattern Movement, Square Grid, Static Capture

name: Munchkin: Polyhedral Dice Set
description: Munchkin Polyhedral Dice is an expansion for the Munchkin card game. Each package contains a set of 7 polyhedral dice and 6 unique cards that use the dice. The dice are available in 4 different colors with each color having cards for that color.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Humor
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Door Panic
description:
Players work together from zombie's awesome buildings,
A panic horror cooperation escape game aims to escape.

What You Get:
Player cards: 4 cards.
Door cards: 54 cards.
Instruction manual (English language not guaranteed) x 1.

name: Paperback Crosswords
description:
Create your own crossword using words from any paperback book.
A solo dry erase game on a single card.
Also available as in print and play format.

GOAL: Use all 26 (A-Z) letters from the alphabet to create and solve your own crossword puzzle using any book of your choice.

SETUP: Open any (paperback) book to a random page. Select eight random 3- to 8-letter words and write them horizontally in the highlighted boxes next to each arrow.

GAME PLAY: Insert your own words with three or more letters, connecting them vertically to the eight horizontal words. Write each letter downwards within the squares and mark off the used letters in the pool at the top. Leave an empty column between your words. Repeat until all 26 letters have been used. You may reuse the letters as needed to complete the challenge.

WINNING:
Use all 26 letters to interconnect all the horizontal words with the vertical words.
Leave no “orphans” (unconnected words).

—description from the designer

name: Nîn
description:
A blitz-krieg strategy game for two players. The players move elementals of earth, wind, fire and water in turnorder on the board. They may also use their tower to block the angry elementals.

Each player have the same kinds of game pieces, which have individual movement patterns. The mountain runs straight on, the river can run dioganally, but only forwards, the fire moves dioganally both forwards and backwards, and the wind may move in any direction.

To win you need to enter the opponent's camp with two of your elementals.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pattern Movement, Static Capture, Sudden Death Ending

description: 18xx set in Arkansas from Reconstruction to the Great Depression. Combines elements of 1817, 1841, and 18Ireland.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Market, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Tile Placement

name: Psychopath: 5th Camper Expansion
description:
A new Camper joins the fight for survival in this 54-card Expansion for the Psychopath Killer Card Game!

The 5th Camper Expansion adds new cards to both the Camper deck and the Psychopath deck, introduces new Situation cards that can be used to modify each game, adds a new Location (the Graveyard!), and enables play for up to 6 players!

Every copy of the 5th Camper Expansion comes with the 2nd Promo Card: the 'Skewer' card featuring alternate photography from that in the expansion. Just add it into the Camper deck!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Hidden Movement, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: Pishtaco
description:
Pishtaco is a social deduction game where you will test your ability to read other players. Whether you're a fat-stealing Pischtaco, or the community trying to defend themselves against their attacks. You will have to win everyone's trust and discover who is lying to make your team win.

This is an adaptation of the traditional Russian game Mafia, later popularized as Werewolf. This edition of Ponte Mosca includes a Peruvian Dog as an additional character.

The "Pishtaco" is a character from the Andes who disappears people to steal their body fat. This character has many versions depending on the region and time in which his stories are collected. He has been a landowner, "misti", african-peruvian, "gringo", US government worker. The fat that he collects is used to be sold in Lima, greasing machinery, oil for cars, beauty products. He is a character that has been studied by José María Arguedas and who does not stop reappearing in modern tales, a character that is used so that children do not play outside the house until late, and today we will use as adults to continue playing.

—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Horror, Murder/Mystery, Party Game
mechanics: Hidden Roles, Player Elimination, Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Ruba Parola
description:
Test your language and logic skills: have fun while developing attention and concentration.
Ruba Parola is the game of words connected in a logical sequence. Each player has three minutes to add a new word to the sequence of words on the board that is logically connected to the word at the top or the word at the bottom, and then to steal one that is in the middle, replacing it with another. For each word placed, the player places one of his own loot tiles next to it. The winner is whoever manages to place all 5 of their loot tiles first!

name: Hybris: Rivalry
description:
An expansion for Hybris: Disordered Cosmos.

The Rivalry expansion includes:

2 new playable God + Board & Miniature (Hera, Dionysus)
18 Conflict cards
12 Enhancement tiles
15 Standees
20 Spark cubes
42 tokens (Location, God, Marker)
2 Aid card
6 Temples
1 Excess Die
Content for Cataclysm expansion

And more!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Tugglery
description:
The 54 card and 12 token minimalistic game which simulates conflict. The game is build around of the idea that the board can also change. The players have to balance heir overall strategy with enough flexibility for tactical decisions in order to secure the win.

Players move their own tokens and push neutral and opponents tokens on the field cards to secure a good position. They can change the scoring cards and field cards to impact overall situation on the board.

You don't like where your opponent stands? Push him!
You don't like the way points are scored? Change it!
You don't like the ground you fight on? Convert it!

The tuggle is always, the tuggle is everywhere.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Sudden Death Ending

name: All For One: Skirmish Scenarios
description:
Here are eleven swashbuckling scenarios to play with the All For One set of rules for Three Musketeers games.


In the courtyard of the Carmelite Conrcnt
The fight in the laundry and dyeworks
Milady and D'Artagnan
The ambush at the river
Duel in the dark
Returning the jewels to the Queen
Milady and Constance
Breakfast in the ruins
The kitchen
No such thing as a free lunch
The inn yard


The sharp eyed and even the not so sharp eyed may spot adaptations of events not only from the books but also from Richard Lester's films of the three musketeers. However because these are games and the baddies have to have some chance of winning, the outcome may not fit with the expectations set up by the films.
