Some games are limited in terms of time thus allowing several games to be played in the course of an evening so that several participants can have a chance to swap characters or try different strategies with the same game without becoming bored.

The first 7 of these scenarios can be played as a mini-campaign. If you so choose to do this then it should be considered that light wounds take a week to heal and serious wounds will become light wounds in the same time. The time between the first and second scenario can be considered as longer than a week. Scenarios 2, 3, 4 and 5 will be fought within a few days of each other. There will be at least a week between scenarios 5 and 6.

—description from the designer
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Renaissance, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Galactic Era: 2-Player Variant with Passive Automa
description:
This is an improved variant for 2 players will full graphics to match the rulebook.

It uses a passive automa instead of the puppet from the rulebook for the third faction. After setup, it is a lot quicker to play with almost no effort for it because it is not active. This variant is also suitable for beginners to the game.

—description from the publisher

name: For The Empire
description:
For the Empire is an expansion for Old School Tactical Vol IV The Italian Theater 1943-45. You must own Old School Tactical Vol IV to play For the Empire.

When Great Britain once again found herself in war, she sent out a call to her Commonwealth allies. They stepped forward and answered the call, as they always had.

New Zealand was in the thick of the action from the beginning. The Kiwis fought bravely in the Balkans and Greece, the battle for Crete and were a key force in the North African campaign.

The New Zealanders came to Italy with the same amount of fight. Among the many battles they faced, they were tasked with a difficult struggle to take the fortress at Monte Cassino.

The Canadian Navy fought vigorously in the battle for the North Atlantic, but the army was static, stationed in the British Isles. But they were itching to get into the scrap.

They got what they wanted when their soldiers and tankers were added to Operation Husky, the invasion of Sicily. They were bloodied and they learned.

They carried on to the Italian boot and fought their way North through difficult terrain against a determined enemy that always had the advantage, Many battle honors were earned, one being the terrible Christmas in Ortona.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Magic Word Squares
description:
A print and play game where you grab predefined letters to make words inside a 3x3 square grid.

Six three-letter words must be made.
Three words will be horizontal.
Three words will be vertical.
Share nine letters across six rows and columns.

SETUP:
Print the grid and letters on the included page.
Avoid viewing the solutions and hints pages.
TIP: Glue the grid and letters onto cardstock,
after printing but before cutting.
Cut out the grid and letters.

TO PLAY:
There are 63 challenges.
Collect the letters for a challenge.
Arrange the letters to form six words.
If stuck, view a middle letter or hint for a random word.

—description from the publisher

name: Musketeer
description:
These rules are suitable for a wide range of actions, from small skirmishes to large battles. By adjusting the ratios you can utilise the figures you have available.

I have deliberately avoided laying down tedious minutae of law. Your interpretation of history is what makes for an enjoyable replication of events as you understand them. If you are lucky, you will find a like mind or at least a tolerant collaborator.

You will notice that the tables have been kept very basic; for example, superior armour. This way you or an umpire can decide by comparing the units engaged, without recourse to pluses or minuses for breastplate, helmet, tassetts etc. If in doubt ignore it.

The ratio of pikemen to musketeers always causes controversy. If you do not have any accurate idea for a particular battle, then it may be helpful to know, that it is generally accepted that Parliament as early as 1642 reached 2 musketeers to I pikeman. The Royalists probably attained this by late 1643. In Scotland the ratio of 3 musketeers to 2 pikemen appears to be more common.

Finally, nothing is written in stone here, but keep to the spirit of the period, avoid gamesmanship, be prepared to lose graciously or be generous in victory.

—description from the designer
categories: Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Renaissance, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Roll to the {Roof} Top
description: Tantrum House inspired, fan-made player board for Roll To The Top: Journeys roll & write from Allplay. This print & play expansion was made available through the Tantrum House Season 10 crowdfunding campaign on Kickstarter.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Travel

name: The Hunt: Lupus
description:
The Hunt: Lupus is a social deduction party game, where two main factions try to prevail on each other by eliminating the other one, by using their powers or by votation, while other independent characters work in the shadows to attain their own purposes and reach victory.

The game is set in a dark horror atmosphere, where an unspeakable entity has doomed the inhabitants of a village, changing them and causing some of them to betray their kind.

Each player has a powerful role, unknown to other players, and must try to guess what other players' roles are by looking at their playstyle and seeing through their lies. Each role has a big impact on the game (no more villagers or dull roles), allowing for strategic decisions and granting always unpredictable and fun games.

The Hunt is on.

—description from the designer

name: Raket: Flug
description:
Raket - Flug is a post war rocket launching game from Sweden. The game sees players roll 5 colored balls at a target board that has 5 openings at the base. The Target board shows a post war military rocket base. From the back of the board 5 rockets are held in place under tension by rubber bands. The base of the rockets are seen through the openings in the target board base.

Players roll all balls one at a time and a direct hit to the rocket base launches the rocket. Each launched rocket has a certain kilometers to which a player receives i.e 30,000 Kilometers earns 30 points. Points are doubled if a player can launch a rocket of the same color as the ball rolled.

The winner is the highest score after a round by all players.

Most interesting about the game is the similar graphics and game play to the rare 1932 "Race to the Moon" game produced by "All Fair". The objective and scoring differ but the graphics have similar rocket launch pad.

—user summary

name: Pippi Sakletarspelet
description:
In this children's game, you will move around on a track trying to collect the six items depicted on your player board. The winner is the first player to collect all their items.

Some spaces have face-down chance tokens. If you land on a chance token, you will perform the associated action (roll again, skip a turn, move five spaces, etc.)
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Candy Land: Giant Edition
description:
Welcome to a life-sized land of rainbow roads and sweet surprises: Candy Land Giant Edition! Unfold the large, 64” x 64” vinyl gameboard and open up your kids’ imaginations with illustrations of a colorful, magical Candy Land. In a game as big as this one, players become the movers! Spin the large Lollipop Spinner and move to that color on the board. If you reach the Peppermint Forest, Lollipop Palace, or one of the other Neighborhoods, collect a Card. Once you’ve collected 4 Cards, make your way up the Rainbow Road. The first player to reach King Kandy’s Castle wins and gets to wear the King’s foam crown! With simple rules and no reading required, Candy Land teaches younger kids color recognition and turn taking while letting them play in an imaginative, magical world.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Matching, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Flex Office
description:
Welcome to Flex Office! At Flex Office we offer our employees hybrid work options: work from home or in the office. Each player is a Team Leader of eight enthusiastic colleagues.
As a Team Leader, your job is to keep your team motivated. For best team morale, you provide the best workplaces in order to score the most points.

Every workplace is worth points, because the available workstations in the office are limited. The Team Leader with the most occupied workplaces (laptop cards) in an office space, gets the points associated with that office space. However, the competition for the best workplaces at Flex Office is so fierce, that your laptop may end up with the Clean Desk Officer if you haven't protected it!

Flex Office is a game that takes place during an 8
hour working day. Every hour is a game round and after 8 game rounds the players run out of cards in their hands. Then the points are counted, after which the Flex Office closes its doors for the day.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Simultaneous Action Selection, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types, Zone of Control

name: My Very First Games: Sound Game Collection
description:
The music game collection is an addition to the range of MES games. We fill with it a gap to the topic music and/or sounds.

The game contains 5 different game ideas to meet the character of a game collection.

name: Monsterhunger
description:
Desperate creatures are creeping around the village ... Can you provide them with food before they break down the gate and devastate everything?

As villagers, the children have to feed hungry monsters that would otherwise devastate the village. To do this, they practice worker placement, using their game pieces to perform different actions. While some plant vegetables in the garden, get milk from the cowshed or eggs from the chickens, others can turn the milk into cheese or, with a little luck, get coveted goods at the market. Always with an eye on the fence or the village gate - because this is where the hungry monsters gather! If they are not fed in time, they want to get their food themselves in the village and demolish the fence! Here teamwork and planning is needed to keep the monsters in the fence!

"Monster Hunger" trains concentration and gets the children to interact to achieve the game goal.

-description from publisher

name: Uncertain Crimes
description:
Dial M for maybe? A crime committed in a stately manor (possibly), and as the world’s greatest detective (probably) it’s yours to solve. Five suspects will help (or hinder) your investigation – can you link a suspect, location, and weapon together, before time runs out?

A single-player micro-game – part solitaire, part interactive fiction.

name: Cosmic Portal 2: Exploring the Multiverse (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description:
Brave followers throw themselves into the mysterious swirling vortex. What will they find on the other side? Winter or desert? Cave men or cowboys? Discover for yourself!
With this fan expansion you can enter the multiverse, interrupting the base game and playing mini-games with several spin-off of the Carcassonne family waiting to close the Portal and to go back to the original game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: Radiocraft
description:
Join the incredible force of university-sponsored space commanders and cadets on a three-day adventure to save a nearby mining planet from a major volcanic event. In this journey for survival, you will rise to the challenge of an unfortunate crash landing, navigate volatile terrain, fend off agitated native scavengers and craft radio parts. As dusk falls on the third day, you either radio home and triumph over adversity as a team, or you die a hot, miserable death under volcanic rubble.

Radiocraft is a medium-weight, cooperative strategy game designed by Cathedral Games. Each in-game day contains multiple rounds. During each round, commanders will each choose a primary and secondary action set to take - giving direction to cadets, negotiating trades, producing key materials needed for survival, planting and harvesting fruit, extinguishing fires, upgrading abilities, and attracting new recruits to the cause. Actions you take are required for survival and also for experience-building in crafting the radio parts required to radio home. Each action set is distinct and requires planning ahead to produce a successful outcome. After each player takes their turn, the round ends and end-of-round events occur - fire from volcanic activity spreads, scavengers move from tile, to tile, which initiates combat, and gardens grow. By sunset of each day, players must ensure that cadets are under their care or protected at supply camps and enough fruit is collected to survive the next day.

—description from the publisher

name: Impromptu
description:
In the game of "Impromptu," players are in for a whirlwind of creativity, quick thinking, deduction, and a dash of luck. Each round presents players with a unique challenge card, with tasks like improvising stories, sharing dreams, uncovering secrets, or stepping into the shoes of talk show guests.

Players aim to race their pawns to the finish line on the game board. To progress, they must complete challenges using word cards. The game proceeds with players taking turns, following a clockwise order, until one player's pawn successfully reaches the end of the track.

A typical turn involves a player selecting a challenge card, executing the challenge as directed, moving pawns based on points earned by the players invlolved in the challenge, and placing the used challenge card face-down.

The game features 5 different challenges, each offering unique twists and creative opportunities: Talk Show, Once Upon a Time, Secret Word, Who Are You?, and Crazy Dream.

name: Rennbahn
description:
2-5 people can take part in the game. The individual lanes are filled by drawing lots. The racing cars line up at the start. Racer l begins to roll a die, the others follow in turn. The cars advance as many spaces as the number of points rolled. If a car comes onto a black space, it has a breakdown and loses a turn. Space W means to roll the die again.
On the + and - spaces, the car must go forward or back the specified number of spaces.
If a car comes to a stop on space A, it is eliminated from the game due to machine damage or an accident.
The winner is the one who passes through the target first.
The players an spectators may bet on the winner of the race.
mechanics: Bids As Wagers, Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Marching Order: Quick and Dirties #5 – Let Me Out!
description:
Madame Toadlicker needs you to clean out her boarding house, but the House of Fading Flowers has always attracted strange visitors. Sometimes, you gotta worry if it’s worth the coin. But the good madame has always been kind to you and your fellow Rogues, so it’s time to repay the favor.

Oh, and if you’ve never played Marching Order before, don’t worry—this is a great opportunity to get into it.

Marching Order Quick and Dirties are no-nonsense adventures meant to be played in a single sitting. Each one comes on a twelve-panel, fold-out brochure that fits real nice in your Marching Order box. They’re a great way to expand your collection without breaking the bank.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Humor

name: ONESTORY
description:
Create rooms, let customers move in, and compete for the rent money.

Draw the pieces in the envelope at random and arrange them on your site to make a room.

Once you have created a room, have guests who meet your requirements move in.

You can make many rooms and invite many guests,

You can make a lot of rooms and invite a lot of customers, or you can make a big room and have rich people move in!

—description from the publisher (translated)

部屋を作ってお客さんに入居させて家賃収入を競うゲームです。
封筒に入ったピースをランダムに引いて 自分の敷地に並べて部屋を作ります。

部屋を作ったら条件の合うお客さんに入居してもらいましょう。

たくさん部屋を作ってたくさんお客さんを呼ぶもよし、

大きい部屋を作ってお金持ちに入居してもらうもよし、 たくさん家賃収入を稼ぎましょう！

—description from the publisher

name: Monopoly: Crazy For Cats
description:
GAME ABOUT CATS: The Monopoly Crazy for Cats board game is for cat lovers and those who know them! In this Monopoly game with a twist, players collect cats, buy cat properties, and win Cat Fights.

PLAY FOR CATS NOT CASH: Forget the cash in this Monopoly game. Instead, cats are currency. Scoop 'em up or give 'em up throughout the game. Purr Power die gives players a special boost to their turn.

CHOOSE A CHARACTER: Move around the board with one of the crazy cat lover tokens. Each character features a unique ability that can be activated when landing on the Cat Treat space.

CAT FIGHT: Pass Go and trigger a Cat Fight! Get a shot at fighting shady breeders to rescue the cats. The game ends when the final Cat Fight is over. The player with the highest score wins.

Includes: gameboard, 4 Character tokens, 4 Character cards, 4 Reminder cards, 8 Cat Fight cards, 16 Title Deed cards, numbered die, Purr Power die, parts sheet containing 95 Cat coins (55 single-Cat coins, 40 five-Cat coins), and game guide.

name: Leverpostej, jantelov og klaphatte
description:
If you can answer yes to one or more of the questions, you have every chance of winning this game. Liverpostej, jantelov og klaphatte is a entertaining game where you gain or lose points in relation to how typically Danish you behave... for better or for worse.

The game contains more than 300 questions, which are about, among other things, liver pate, box wine, potted plants and red sausages.

name: High Roller
description:
The object of the game is to travel around the board, playing each game, trying to win money and collect money. This money is used to buy your dreams.
Games include Poker, Odds & Evens, Two Up, Crown & Anchor, Horse Racing and Blackjack.
Players must buy three prizes from the bank:

One for $800 'luxury motorcars',
One for $1000 'Toys for the idle rich' and
One for $1500 'Wonders of the modern world'


These can be bought from the bank at any time during the course of the game. When a player has bought three of these, then a Pacific Island may be bought. The WINNER is the first player to buy the Pacific Island.
A player may sell prizes back to the bank at face value if the player is running short of money. Players may borrow money from the bank upon the consent of the other players.

Likely timeframe of manufacture, mid 1980's.

—user summary
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Dice, Racing
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Bids As Wagers, Dice Rolling

name: Go-Go
description:
The color of the pieces represents one of the four symbols on the GO-G0 board. Each player places his four pieces in his inner starting zone from which all pieces must go over the entire GO-GO track - in the direction of the arrow — into the outer goal zone. To start into the GO-GO-track a player must
throw either a two, four or six. The piece advances as many spaces as the die shows. A player with a six is allowed an extra throw with which he can either advance his starting piece or start a second piece on the G0-G0 track.
If a piece lands on a occupied space the piece on this space is knocked out and must start from the beginning again. An exception is a piece on a crossed space, these cannot be knocked out. Further barriers can be built on the eight crossed spaces of the track. No pieces are allowed to jump these barriers.
The winner is the player who brings all four pieces into the goal zone, in which the die must equal the exact number of moves required to reach the goal zone.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Static Capture, Track Movement

name: Prise de la Bastille
description:
The Siege of the Bastille is a game for two. Each person has four stones with which he must try to reach the Bastille in the middle of the board before his opponent. Players take it in turns to move their stones, advancing only one square at a time, but in any direction. The first person to occupy three of the positions on the fort is the victor.

—user summary
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Square Grid

name: Mind Reaver: Guardinton Board Game
description:
Fast-paced game that blends strategy, speed, and special attacks.

A card-driven game about the most popular sport in the North Wasteland. Play cards to hit the ball, and don't forget to use spell cards to hinder your opponent! Observe your opponent's moves and play smart to become the best Guardinton player!

Officially licensed from the creators of the How to be a Mind Reaver comic series.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck Construction, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards, Square Grid

name: Host Your Own Game Show
description:
Why watch a gameshow when you can play one live? Bring the fun into your own home and put your skills to the test! Gather your friends and family round the table and get ready to buzz your way to victory through several frantic rounds of mind bogglers and brain teasers!

Let the games continue… This product has been designed to keep - please enjoy, replay and give away for further play.

—description from the publisher
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: LOOP: Life of Ordinary People – The Future Expansion
description:
What will our world be like in 50 years? Will our next generation be able to live happily and sustainably, or still be struggling with our old paths while paying our old debt?

—description from the publisher

The future (expansion) adds futuristic careers, new challenges and several challenging special events.
mechanics: Action Retrieval, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Restless Spirits
description:
In Restless Spirits, you play as a Spirit Guide with the perilous responsibility of attracting strange & whimsical Spirit creatures, and using combinations of enchanted Totem items to safely guide these wayward souls over to the Spirit Realm. Use tactical decisions, powerful abilities and careful timing to be the first player to send 5 Spirits to the other side!


Play as 1 of 6 unique Spirit Guide characters, each with a different Mastery bonus over the 6 Spirit types in the game.



Encounter a wide range of Light & Dark Spirits and carefully decide which you want to attract first.



Use the powerful one-time abilities of Spirits you've attracted- Light Spirits will help speed up your own progress, whilst Dark Spirits will slow down your opponent's!



Search for and collect enchanted Totem cards to match your Spirit's 3 requirements. But remember, every Spirit is different and has it's own specific set of Totem requirements- only the correct combination will allow them to finally be at rest.


—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Take That

name: Forelords
description:
Delve into the mysterious and expansive world of Olroc, a planet on the brink chaos and destruction. Here you will find the likes of post-cataclysmic dramas, tales of exploration, monsters, mechs and all-powerful ancient beings known as Forelords. Explore deeply human themes like existential dread, overpopulation, love, and the threats of technology. Dive into the world by reading the corresponding novels, then come here to play the characters.

Forelords is a 1v1 dueling trading card battle between competing biomes. Play as one of many lands, whether they be high, low, wet or frozen. Move your cards into spaces like chess pieces, and gain favor by collecting one or more of the five terrain tokens. To win, you must destroy your opponent's king or collect the most points in battle by the showing of the final monolith — whichever comes first...

During the game, you will add land and ally cards to your hand, pay the cost to put them into play, then use them to battle your adversary. Land cards will equip you with valuable resources, such as metal, batteries, credit, knowledge...even coveted terrain tokens. Ally cards will maneuver and melee at your command to overcome foes as well as the wilderness.

Will you amass resources and knowledge to wage a strategic battle, or go straight for the king? Only the Forelords know for sure...

Game Mechanics

The game features popular TCG mechanics like hand management, player elimination and deck construction, but sets itself apart with a distinct mix of mechanisms that allow players to:

• Explore a hostile and unpredictable wilderness (exploration)
• Move cards on a grid to tactically position allies for battle (grid movement)
• Unlock unique “fortes" during play (variable player powers)
• Gain surges in power by capturing one or more terrain tokens

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Deck Construction, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Income, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Dark Star Inc
description:
Dark Star Inc: a multi-planetary conglomerate private security corporation for hire.
If you need a job done quickly and discretely, they are the place to go.

Dark Star has the experts for any job, big or small.
From quiet rescue operations, to taking over a planet, Dark Star has what you need… for the right price.

Dark Star Inc is a game of random encounters on far off planets or derelict starships between a small rescue team and a race of vicious xenomorphs.
The ability to use multiple game board layouts, along with randomly generated encounters using cards makes the game unique every time you play.

Turn Sequence:

Team Member Actions - Team Members use up to two actions to move, use equipment, place traps, whatever
Opponent Actions - Xenomorphs or Survivors move up to two Zones in this phase
Team Member Combat - Team Members use a weapon to attack threats using d6 to determine results.
Opponent Combat - Opponents conduct attacks against adjacent team members


The game includes counters for all combatants, but you can use figures of your choice to add to the visuals impact.

Available as a download at Wargames Vault
categories: Adventure, Book, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Square Grid

name: Draconicus: The Fantasy Boardgame
description:
Gain control of the land! Vanquish your foes! Complete your quest!

Draconicus the Fantasy Boardgame is an engrossing fantasy boardgame based on the Draconicus fantasy setting. It is a game of quests, strategy and adventure for 2-5 players. Playing time is between 3-5 hours and it is best suited for players ages 12 and up.

The objective of Draconicus – The Fantasy Boardgame is to build influence with different factions of the medieval island of Draconica: feudal realms, religions and cults, barbarian tribes and different schools of magic. Players must then use that influence to complete a quest. The first player to complete their quest is the winner.

This boardgame can also be played in tandem with the Draconicus Role-Playing Game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Exploration, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Political, Racing
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Auction: Sealed Bid, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Events, Finale Ending, Grid Movement, Resource to Move, Square Grid, Storytelling, Trading, Zone of Control

name: Time Flies
description:
Time Flies is a head to head asymmetric trick-taking cake defence game for 2 players. One player assumes the role as a fly, trying deviously to get some cake on its birthday, the other, as a child trying to stop the fly landing on their cake and ruining their own birthday!

Time Flies has elements of racing, set-collection, area control, and of course trick-taking. All you need to play is a standard deck of playing cards, one game sheet, and a pen.

—description from the designer

name: Revengend Story
description:
Revengened Story is a battle royale board game in which three teams fight to conceal their true identities.

The setting is the world of a fairy tale. It is the story of Red Riding Hood, who was cut into pieces by a werewolf, and 10 years later takes revenge on the werewolf. Each of the 18 characters becomes a hero, and the game unfolds dramatically.

Simultaneous movement, map exploration, card combos, resource management, dice combat, and more. In addition, there is reasoning and gamesmanship with visualized search chips. The appeal of the game is that a total of 18 characters with two abilities create their own strategies and a different sense of play for each character.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling

name: Frontiers on Fire: 18th Century Skirmish Warfare in North America
description:
Frontiers on Fire is a man-to-man skirmish wargame for warfare in 18th Century North America, mostly the French-and-Indian War and the American War for Independence.
Too many skirmish games are simple systems where dice take a greater role in the game than tactics, decisions, or careful use of fire and movement.
Frontiers on Fire allows each player to control a half dozen or so men, but takes some of control away from the player through model/character reactions to the players’ plans and to the situation the characters face.
Skirmish games often have difficulty making a playable and interesting game while depicting realistic ranges, movement distances, and time.
Frontiers on Fire uses a short turn (the time to load a musket) and ranges experienced by those fighting in the Eighteenth Century, not parade ground and firing range optimums. Percentage dice for shooting means many subtle factors can be taken into account, with a separate d10 for the effects of an effective shot. Hand-to-hand is by opposing d6, but even melee allows for tactical choices in the fight.
Each turn, each model is secretly given an order chit such as fire, load, walk (and shoot if loaded or if pistol- or bow-armed), run, etc, although the particulars are defined only when the model activates in a randomized order with other models or groups of models.
Leadership and group rules allow some co-ordination of actions and timing.
Special events account for unusual occurrences and can both benefit a player, or interfere a good plan.
The game system, as written, works for 54mm or 25/28mm figures, and 15mm models can be used if the ranges are adjusted. Frontiers on Fire’s author is a professional historian, specializing in the 18th Century, who also has decades of wargaming experience.
The rules have been extensively play-tested by both veteran and novice ‘gamers.
Frontiers on Fire provides realistic, challenging, playable, enjoyable, and even dramatic games.

Sequence of play:

1) At the beginning of a turn, secretly choose an action chit for each character. Place the action chit face down on the character card or under their base.
2) Roll 1d10 per force for activation sequence. Record results. Re-roll ties but stay within relative sequence to other forces with different rolls.
3) Using the sequence just rolled, each force takes turn activating one character ‘on point’ (must be done before any group moves) OR any one group with a leader OR any stragglers (stragglers can only be activated after ALL group moves)


—description from the publisher
categories: American Revolutionary War, Book, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Bolt Action: Campaign – Case Blue
description:
This supplement for the award-winning Bolt Action WWII wargame focuses on the Axis offensives through Eastern Ukraine and into the North Caucasus.

After the failure of Barbarossa to utterly defeat the Soviet Union, a new plan was devised, Case Blue. This plan involved pushing through the southern Soviet Union to reach the Caucasus and secure the oil fields that Germany so desperately needed. While initially there was great success and sweeping advances as the autumn began, the Axis advances began to falter in the wake of Soviet resistance and counter attacks, culminating the battles in and around Stalingrad.

This Campaign Book for Bolt Action contains new linked scenarios, rules, troop types, and Theatre Selectors, providing plenty of options for novice and veteran players alike.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Time Wars: Stellar Assault
description:
The Galactic War was long ago fought between Humans and Vampires, fleets of star cruisers doing battle alongside demigods known as X-Knights.

Now you can go back in time and command the Human Cosmada or the Vampiric Starfleet, and be a general in the Time Wars.

Two players move stacks of cruisers or individual X-Knights across a board littered with star systems to conquer and gravity spaces which slingshot you across the board. Gather command cards to outdo your opponent in battles with three phases: Blast, to destroy; Drone, to repel; and Marines, to capture. Does your opponent have the cards to back up their move? Or are they bluffing?

When you control the central system, as well as the two star systems on your secret goal card, you win the game!

Comes with two-sided board for advanced scenarios.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hexagon Grid, Multiple Maps, Ownership

name: The Portable Wargame Compendium
description:
The Portable Wargame evolved over several years, and the first book about it was published in 2017. Several more have followed, and the rules have proven popular with wargamers who want to fight battles on a regular basis but who resources of time and space are limited.

Over time, several variants have been written, some of which have been published. The most recent innovation has been the development of the Fast Play 3 x 3 Portable Wargame (FP3x3PW for short), which uses a three-by-three gridded tabletop and a maximum of six units (plus a general) per side. Since this new version of the rules was launched in early 2022, it has sparked a lot of interest and has generated a rapid growth in new sets of period-specific rules.

The Portable Wargame Compendium has been compiled from contributions from members of Portable Wargaming community. The Compendium has been edited by Bob Cordery and includes contributions from David Barnes, Justin Barrett, Bob Cordery, Mark Cordone, Arthur Harman, Marc Pavone, Martin Rapier, and Mike Taber.

98 pages includes - Snakes and Ladders Campaign System and Wargame Rules for Original 3x3, Fantasy, 18th Century Horse & Musket, Colonial & Late 19th Century, WWII Eastern Front Infantry, WWII Operational, 1st Punic War, English Civil War, Little Wars, and Sci-Fi. Plus sections on armies, maneuvers, and terrain.
categories: Age of Reason, American Civil War, American Revolutionary War, Ancient, Book, Fantasy, Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II

name: Til Death Do Us Part
description:
A tabletop, strategy card game of marrying and burying until you're filthy rich!

2-6 players of low moral character compete to become the richest and most ruthless gold digger at the table by marrying and burying one filthy rich oldster after another to bank $150 million in stolen inheritance.

Players woo rich oldsters in Goldmine Park, secure a marriage certificate, and work to increase their oldster's wealth while also working to undermine his/her health, landing them in the graveyard. After which the oldster's Last Will is read before tallying up that player's ill-gotten gains on the money tracker, and moving on to the next target of their "affection".

Players play cards on themselves and others in an effort to gain wealth, secure health, or harm other players in the same way - not to mention forcing intimate acts between their opponents and their oldsters to improve their health sending them backward on the board. Prenups, annulments, divorces, lawyers, blackmail, miraculous cures, fetishes, oldster-swaps, hitmen and more abound in this humor-filled strategy game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Catch the Leader, Dice Rolling, Score-and-Reset Game, Semi-Cooperative Game, Sudden Death Ending, Take That

name: Shadow Storm: Fantasy Mass Battle Rule Set
description:
Shadow Storm - Mass Fantasy Battle is a fast and fun wargame rule set designed to produce a rich fantasy wargame.

All the ‘high’ fantasy archetypes are covered, and the rules contain sections on heroes, mages, magic, and monsters. Special unit rules create depth that helps define orcs, dwarfs, elves, and humans, amongst others. Spell and magic item lists enhance the fantasy depth of the rules.

Shadow Storm offers a unique movement, shooting and combat system, and the players can use either D10s or D6s to play the game.
The game itself is easy to learn, but the tactical play it encourages means that it will take time and experience to master.

The rules cater for all figure scales, and players can use small or large forces to play the game.
You can play a game of Shadow Storm - Mass Fantasy Battle in many ways, be that from a narrative perspective or a matched combat tournament game.

Turn Sequence:

Check Command Ranges
Movement - Move Unit
Rallying - Rally Units
Magic - Cast Magic
Shooting - Shoot Units
Combat - Fight Combat


Once a player has completed all the steps with one command, they hand the initiative over to the other player. That player then selects a command and repeats the process.

—description from the publisher

name: Cutthroat Cannons
description:
Intro:
You command a fleet of pirate ships roaming the Caribbean, looking for treasure and trouble. Rival buccaneers, however, challenge your dominance of the high seas. Use your navigation skills and firepower to send your enemy to the briny depths. Or find a hidden trove of treasure before they do. And try to avoid piratey perils like scurvy, Voodoo curses, a mutinous crew, and a very releasable kraken.

Gameplay Overview:
You and your enemy each control a fleet of 5 pirate ships on sea grids hidden from each other’s view.

The primary goal of the game is to track down and destroy your enemy by sinking their ships. A secondary goal (a greedy pirate side quest, if you will) allows you to win by hunting for treasure.

The deck of cards contains tools and tragedies for you and your enemy, but what you'll draw is a mystery.

Start each turn by drawing 1 card. Then, chose 1 of 7 available actions, ranging from offensive to defensive.

Islands provide shelter and a chance to use certain advantageous cards.

Doubloons allow you to extend your turn and amplify your power.

If you’re smart, you’ll keep track of your enemy’s movements on your Sea Chart.

How To Win:
There are two ways to win the game:
- By sinking 3 enemy ships. If at any point either you or your enemy has 3 sunken ships, the game ends. This includes ships that sink by means other than a direct attack. The person with more ships afloat wins. If both you and your opponent simultaneously have 3 sunken ships, it’s a tie.

- By completing a Treasure Hunt. If at any point you or your enemy successfully complete a Treasure Hunt, the game ends and that person wins.
mechanics: Deduction, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Android Farmer, Electric Sheep
description:
Android Farmer, Electric Sheep is a roll-and-write game for two players. It is designed to be interactive with take-that actions and plenty of hate-drafting.

The future is now and you’re a farmer that is obviously an Android. You’re working to program all the wonderful Electric Sheep that your android brothers and sisters need in order to dream.

You and your android-nemesis will be programming sheep into a data store that has limited space. If you’ve filled a partition in your data store and attempt to program a sheep into it then you’ll experience Buffer Overflow. Too much of that and the game will end, and you’ll have plenty of negative points to show for your efforts. Additionally, the game can come to an end once a data store has been fully filled (which happens through proper planning, of course).

It's not as simple as placing sheep into the data store, plenty of actions like Hacking, Code Injection, and ICE Breaking will get in your way and make things a little more difficult.

Whichever android has made the best decisions and taken the most timely actions will end up with the most points and be deemed the winner.
mechanics: Action Drafting, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution

name: Build War: Invasion of Doretnote
description:
Adding a purple color faction to the game. Available only as a kick starter exclusive to complete pledge backers.

It contains 52 purple cards. These cards are used interchangeably with blue. Expanded versions are put in interchangeable with other colors. The purple expansion is intended to create a small elite force and is filled with cards that gain significant benefits by excluding cards. The purple expansion is a great alternative to blue, which is the core of many decks, and will change the whole flavor of the game.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Multi-Use Cards, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Around the World with Black Emanuelle
description: Revisit the sensual world of Emanuelle. She was the pleasure-seeking photojournalist – forever embodied by the Indonesian actress Laura Gemser, most frequently in collaboration with writer/director Joe D’Amato – who would uncover an increasingly lurid world of sex cults, snuff films, cannibal jungles, women’s prisons, white slavers, depraved convents and beyond to become the premier feminist icon in genre history. Every spot on the board is location or scene from an iconic Emanuelle film. Can you make it home when so many adventures await?
categories: Mature / Adult, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Cartes et quête
description:
The goal of the game is to be the first player to complete one's quest...without dying! To complete a quest, one must accumulate a certain number of road cards. Not an easy task as your adversaries will delect in throwing the most violent obstacles your way in order to slow you down or annihilate you. Good adventuring!

This is a card game published using a book format (135 cards and a book).

name: Cover Me!: WW2 Combat
description:
Cover Me! is a game of individual combat between single infantry squads, their support weapons, and the occasional armored fighting vehicle.
Each player controls a handful of soldiers.
Infantry for all major combatants of WW2 are included, along with many iconic vehicles.


Works with any scale using your existing miniatures
No basing requirements as long as figures are individually based
Prioritizes player agency in matters of move and morale: you get to decide when it's time for one of your soldiers to take cover and restore your combat effectiveness
Ammo is a finite resource but you don't have to count every bullet
Leaders have concrete effects on morale and motivation
Figures can be assigned unique traits or skills
Weapons are realistically modeled and playable, including rifle grenades, mortars, antitank weapons, satchel charges, mines, and flamethrowers, as well as firearms and grenades
Terrain elements are clearly defined and easy to agree upon
No table clutter; each soldier's status and ammo is tracked on a small card
Rules for hidden movement, campaign play, and solo/co-op play are included
Standard OOB or point buy options for choosing your squad members
Includes German, Italian, Japanese, Soviet, UK, and US infantry squads and many vehicles
copious diagrams that explain core concepts in visual format
concierge-level, prompt support from the author and a vibrant online Facebook community
Separate printables PDF included with base labels, counters, figure cards, vehicle cards, and ability cards


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Sano jo se Sana
description:
In Sano jo se Sana, players compete in teams, trying to reach the end of the scoreboard before other teams. On their turn, a team picks up a lettercard, nominating the letter of the turn and then they start asking question cards as fast as they can.

But in order to ask the question, they must fill the sentence with a proper keyword, starting with the given letter. Each question correctly asked and answered, scores a point on the scoretrack.

There's no wrong answer, but the question is bit trickier.

name: The Forbidden Corner Official Board Game
description:
The Forbidden Corner Official Board Game is a magical way of bringing the weird and whimsical charm of the park to your family tabletop. Journey down the twisting pathways of a fantastic land, outwitting your opponents and racing to be the first to gather the elusive and precious gems.

Use a variety of enchanted tricks, tools and trinkets to best the fiendish creatures that will surprise you on your way- is it trouble or treasure that lies around the corner?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Events, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Hangman: Christmas Edition
description:
This ultimate game block is the Christmas HANGMAN edition and offers 160 cheerful and funny terms for lightning-fast guessing fun with the whole family. The aim of the game is to guess the term before the hangman is painted out. Fun guaranteed!

Game flow:
The HANGMAN says a letter and crosses it off the alphabet. The LETTER MASTER now says whether the letter is contained in the solution word and reveals the corresponding position in the solution word. The HANGMAN now enters the letter in the correct position. If the letter does not appear in the word, the HANGMAN must color in a body part. The game is over as soon as the HANGMAN has guessed the solution word correctly or all body parts have been colored in. Should the HANGMAN name a wrong solution word, a body part must be painted out as a penalty.

Dieser ultimative Spielblock ist die weihnachtliche HANGMAN Edition und bietet 160 fröhliche und lustige Begriffe für blitzschnellen Ratespaß mit der ganzen Familie. Ziel des Spiels ist es den Begriff zu erraten, bevor das Galgenmännchen ausgemalt ist. Spaß garantiert!

Spielablauf:
Der HANGMAN sagt einen Buchstaben und streicht diesen vom Alphabet weg. Der BUCHSTABENMEISTER sagt nun ob der Buchstabe in dem Lösungswort enthalten ist und verrät die entsprechende Position im Lösungswort. Der HANGMAN trägt nun den Buchstaben an der richtigen Position ein. Kommt der Buchstabe im Wort nicht vor, muss der HANGMAN ein Körperteil ausmalen. Das Spiel ist vorbei, sobald der HANGMAN das Lösungswort richtig erraten hat oder alle Körperteile ausgemalt sind. Sollte der HANGMAN ein falsches Lösungswort nennen, muss ein Körperteil als Strafe ausgemalt werden.

name: TrapMove
description:
TrapMove is an exciting strategy board game designed for 2 to 4 players, where skill, strategy, and a dash of luck determine the winner. The game includes a 10x10 game board, 100 chips, player game pieces, a die, a drawstring bag, and an instruction sheet. The objective is to outmaneuver your opponents while trapping them and becoming the last player with available moves.

Players start by rolling the die to determine the first player. The game proceeds clockwise, with each player strategically placing their game piece on the board and then selecting one of three chips from the bag to determine their move. The game revolves around five different chip moves, each with its own rules and restrictions. These chip moves dictate how players can move their game pieces on the board, whether it's a simple one-space move, a complex diagonal maneuver, or the ability to jump over obstacles.

The goal is to strategically use your chips to outwit your opponents, block their movements, and avoid getting trapped yourself. Once a player can't make any more moves, they're eliminated from the game. The last player remaining with available moves emerges as the winner of TrapMove. With its combination of strategy, skill, and a touch of unpredictability, TrapMove promises an engaging and fun gaming experience for friends and family alike.

—description from the publisher

name: dark2light
description:
A card game to be played with anyone that wants to know what everyone thinks about things without letting anyone else know what they think.
The base game consists of two types of cards, questions and yes/no cards. The questions are always formatted so that they have to be answered with Yes or No. I think you can see where this is going. One person draws a question and asks the group, the group then answers with the Yes/No cards in their hands without revealing how they voted. The person that drew the question guesses what the group answered, then counts the results. If they get it right they keep the question as a point.
In the advanced version there are Boosts and Drops which are used as rewards and punishments.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Memory, Party Game, Political, Print & Play, Word Game

name: Shoot N' Skedaddle
description:
It is late in the 19th century. Slowly but surely Americans have been expanding westward across the continent. Spurred on by promises of fortune, freedom and territory Americans from all walks of life set out for the untamed lands west of the Mississippi River. This rapid expansion brings with it camps, towns and cities, some popping up overnight and disappearing just as quickly. Vast railway networks are built to connect the ever-expanding country. The vast swathes of land prove difficult to control; attracting criminals, runaways and renegade Indians. The expansion westward is accompanied by law and disorder as state and federal lawmen take up the badge to hunt down criminals.

Crime and murder rates are high. Amidst this lawlessness the states earn their nickname: "The Wild West." Justice is meted out with sixgun, shotgun, and hangin’ rope. In the turmoil some lawmen turn outlaw, and some outlaws turn lawmen. Loyalty to anything or anyone is fleeting and life is cheap. Some outlaws and lawmen become legendary heroes and villains in United States folklore.

In Shoot N' Skedaddle players will take control of outlaws and lawmen, battling for supremacy amongst the cow towns, railheads and mining camps of the Old West. Will you blaze a trail of crime and mayhem? Will you take up the tin star
and uphold the law?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Austria-Hungary: The First Rails
description: This is a web-published variant of the Empire Builder system by Mayfair Games that is set in Austria-Hungary. The geography includes a lot of rivers and a large stretch of Alpine Mountains. There is an event for "Assassination of the Heir Apparent" that can lead to the game ending before the usual 250 million kronen and all but one major city connected.
mechanics: Connections, Crayon Rail System, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver

name: French Railroads
description: This is a web-published variant of the Empire Builder system by Mayfair Games that is set in France. The map is wide open with plenty of room to build and plays up to six.
mechanics: Connections, Crayon Rail System, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Italian Railways
description: This is a web-published variant of the Empire Builder system by Mayfair Games that is set in Italy. The geography is somewhat limited due to the narrowness of the peninsula, similar to Nippon Rails.
mechanics: Connections, Crayon Rail System, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Hands Full
description:
Hands Full is endless, tangled fun for the whole family! The challenge is to keep your hands full while you jump, high five, shake, dance, twist and more! Hang on tight—don't let go, or you lose! Master your moves in Solo Mode, play together to beat a twisted challenge in Team Mode, or get competitive as you play to be the last one standing in Survivor Mode! With 3 games in one, 15 fun moves and over one million crazy combinations this interactive family game always gets out of hand!

3 Games In 1

Solo Mode: Level up as you master the moves. Complete all 6 levels to become a Hands Full master.
1 Player Survivor Mode: Compete to be the last player standing. Don't let go or you’re out.
2-4 Players Team Mode: Complete a sequence of crazy twisted moves. If anyone lets go – it’s game over for everyone.


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Real-Time, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Snylt
description:
In Snylt, the players roll dice to move their pieces around the board. At the start of the games, the players decide how many rounds you need to complete in order to win.

On you turn you roll one die at a time, hoping to get a sum as close to, but not over, 7. If you stop rolling dice while your sum is not over 7, you move the sum multiplied by the number of dice. If your sum gets over 7, you go back to the start space.

If your piece lands on top of another piece, you take control of their next move, and in that move they will bring you along with them (you become a parasite (which is the origin of the name (in Danish, "snylter" means a parasite, and "at snylte" means to parasite))). If they bring you all the way around the board, you will also get the point for it instead of them.

As mentioned, first player to reach the agreed-upon number of points wins.

name: Close Call +/-
description:
A trivia game where the players will answer with both a number and a tolerance interval (e.g. 42 +/-10).
The player(s) with the smallest correct interval wins the round and get(s) one point.
When a player hits spot on with a correct answer and an interval of +/-0, they get a bonus of two points.
The winner is the first to get to five points.
All answers in the game are rounded to the nearest integer.

name: Free Y
description:
Free Y is a two-player game that is played on an initially empty hexagonal grid with an odd total number of boundary cells, preferably outlining a near-regular hexagon with odd sides one cell longer than even sides.

On your turn, place a stone of your color on an empty cell. You win if there is a group (set of connected stones) of your color such that any region (set of connected cells) outside that group includes less than half of the boundary cells.

Bill Taylor posted Free Y in 2008 on the rec.games.abstract newsgroup.
mechanics: Chaining, Connections, Enclosure, Hexagon Grid, Ownership, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: VOXPOP
description:
An immoral, grotesque and mannerless party game.
A game for adults that takes advantage of the multiple meanings of common expressions to generate hilarious situations. Whoever quickly guesses the real meaning of these expressions wins the game. The biggest difficulty? Stop laughing. How can the Portuguese language be so treacherous...

name: Anonymous
description:
Anonymous is a deduction game, where players are hackers ready to launch their cyber attacks. The objective is to discover the identity, target and location of your opponent's cyber attack without getting caught! Each round lasts approximately 20 minutes.
Don't get caught. Stay anonymous!

name: Pizza Pronto
description: Roll the die and gather ingredients to make pizzas. The player who first makes pizzas worth 21 Neapolitan lire wins the game! A push your luck game for the whole family that takes about 15 minutes to play. And, of course, it comes in a pizza box!

name: Oudenaarde (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description:
A mini-expansion for Carcassonne inspired by the city of Oudenaarde, Belgium. Contains 9 tiles with drawings of famous breweries from the city of Oudenaarde.

There are 5 breweries in the city of Oudenaarde. When you place a tile with a Brewery, you can place your minion in two ways:

On the same tile as in the normal game: as Thief, Knight or Peasant.
Your follower becomes a Brewer and delivers beer to a nearby Town. Place your follower in a connected City. The condition is that that City is accessible via a Road that connects to the tile you just placed. The Road can connect to the Brewery tile itself or the Road can be on a connecting terrain tile, this is allowed even if there are already other meeples in the city.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval, Print & Play

name: Far Far Out
description:
Far Far Out is a Space Exploring Sandbox Game where 2 to 4 players start in our home Solar System with a small ship and a sole crew member on a Cosmic Odyssey to go where no lifeform has ever gone before. Five different life forms to choose from you start your space adventure and gather resources, items and crew members to try to gain points on three different tracks: Exploration, Wealth and Reputation. Encounter strange lifeforms on planets, dig for items on asteroids or find quests that help you achieve your goal in this competitive galactic journey where you sometimes help other players, sometimes frustrate them.

While you move your 3d-ships through space you gather more and more dice so your chances of winning encounters on far away planets will improve as your chances of stealing stuff from your opponents.

You explore up to 9 different star systems in a unique way with more than 30 planets, asteroids and anomalies. Oh and beware of spawning Space Wurms and other weird stuff.

—description from the designer
categories: Dice, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Events, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Trading

name: War in Tokyo: The Hunting Pack
description:
In 1945 Japan did not surrender. The Allies push hard to bring an end to World War II. What ends is nuclear fallout in Tokyo. With civil unrest across the globe, the Allies send special teams into radiated Tokyo to find the Japanese Army and its government to secure surrender and bring an end to World War II.

The story to War in Tokyo uses the reality that during a time of war, technology advances at a faster pace than in a time of peace.

The Hunting Pack is an RPG Tabletop wargame, so what a troop finds, hacks, kills or knocks out affects them after the skirmish and any later skirmishes; that trooper may even level up and find new specialties to branch out into, the decision is yours...

Controlling four units to begin with, players will embark on a journey to find the hiding Japanese government (Allied Forces), stop the Allied invasion (Japanese Forces), or assist the army that pays the most (Mercs), to bring an end to the war.

Which side are you on?

—description from the designer
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Role Playing, Simulation

name: War in Tokyo: Diary of a Volunteer
description:
In 1945 Japan did not surrender. The Allies push hard to bring an end to World War II. What ends is nuclear fallout in Tokyo. With civil unrest across the globe, the Allies send special teams into radiated Tokyo to find the Japanese Army and its government to secure surrender and bring an end to World War II.

The diary of Private Chris Hunt shows what it was like before entering Tokyo, and the realisation of the enormous and dangerous task ahead. This is only the beginning of his story....

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Role Playing, Simulation

name: Obsidian Empires: Warfare in Pre-Columbian Mesoamerica
description:
Obsidian Empires is a tabletop miniature wargame set in the colorful and dynamic Pre-Columbian world of Mesoamerica. Focusing on the Post-Classic period, the rules and armies in this book give you all you need to play games set during the rise and domination of the Triple Alliance all the way to the arrival of the Spanish. With gameplay that is intuitive and easy to learn, any player can jump right in and start their journey through this lush time period and setting, and the rules allow for great creativity in scenarios and campaigns.

Simple enough for new players to grasp but also complex enough to entice veteran gamers, Obsidian Empires use a novel mechanic to represent battles in the time period: Focusing on the Core Forces mechanic, Mesoamerican armies all have a common pool of Units that they can utilize, but each specific Faction brings unique bonuses, strategies, and sometimes, unique Units that make each Faction distinct. Gameplay is also kinetic, there is no sitting around here, and all players are active in each and every Step of the game. Each roll is meaningful, and with a focus on a single die for most rolls, there is no time wasted counting dice or figuring out needlessly complex formulas.

The book includes army lists and special rules for:

Aztec (Triple Alliance)
the largest empire in central Mexico, this Faction emphasizes melee and close-quarter battles, but due to their military expertise, they can bring forces in from flanking maneuvers, and due to their size, they even have a free Unit to capture their dense population.

Purepecha
the second largest empire to the west of the Aztecs, the Purepecha were famed for their keen-eyed marksmen, utilizing range combat to stymie their foes, but each Purepecha bow was so well-constructed, it could even act as a weapon in melee.

Tlaxcala
An isolated City State to the East of the Triple Alliance, after years of warfare, the Tlaxcala were bitter enemies of the Aztecs. Renowned for their fervor in combat, they relied on a balanced force that could maximize advantages both from afar and close.

Huastec
a City State of Mayan descent to the Northeast of the Triple Alliance near to what is today known as the Gulf of Mexico. The Huastec have been slowly losing their southern territories to the Aztecs, but their tenacity and expertise with spears is legendary. They were steadfast fighters that would rather die on their feet than flee than the enemy.

Spanish
the first Europeans to begin the task of conquering, colonizing, and converting the native population, the Spanish were often outnumbered hundreds to one, but thanks to their Tlaxcala allies, they were able to utilize the advantages of gunpowder, steel, and horses. Unlike other forces, the Spanish did not fight to claim captives but rather to seek gold and glory.

—description from the publisher

name: Koira + donitsi = ?
description:
DOG + DONUT = ?

Players guess spesific measurement, often ridiculous leghts/dimensions. As the title suggest, how long is a dog and a donut combined? Player who guesses closest to the correct answer, scores a point.

name: Ludi Circenses
description:
As in ancient times, join a faction and take on the role of one or more charioteers in a wild race through the Circus.

The first to cross the finish line wins your faction’s title, and to do so, you’ll have to pull out all the stops!

How do you play the game?

Each round, the player must:

Choose their pace, so as to adjust their speed according to their strategy.
Move around the track according to their speed, to beat their opponents or help their faction.
Brake!
But be careful not to capsize!

And why not go on a collision course? Crash into a competitor’s chariot, at the risk of seeing your own chariot break up...

and !
To go even further!

Advanced rules allow you to :

Select a chariot type: light, classic, or heavy! Piloting and strategy won’t be the same.
Added realism for negotiating turns. Watch out for skids!
More detailed boarding.
Add event cards.

—description from the publisher

Comme dans l’Antiquité, faites partie d’une faction et incarnez un ou des auriges et participez à une course endiablée dans le Cirque.

Le premier à passer la ligne d’arrivée fait gagner sa faction, et pour y parvenir tous les moyens sont bons !

Comment jouer ?

Le joueur doit à chaque tour :

Choisir son allure, de manière à ajuster sa vitesse en fonction de sa stratégie.
Se déplacer sur la piste en fonction de son allure, afin de battre ses adversaires ou aider sa faction.
Freiner !
Mais attention à ne pas chavirer !

Et pourquoi ne pas passer à l’abordage ? En percutant le char d’un concurrent, cependant au risque de voir son propre char se disloquer...

et !
Pour aller plus loin !

Des règles avancées permettent :

De sélectionner un type de char : léger, classique ou lourd ! Le pilotage et la stratégie ne seront pas les mêmes.
D’ajouter plus de réalisme dans la négociation des virages. Attention aux glissades !
De détailler les abordages.
D’ajouter des cartes Événements.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Dungeons & Dragons: Onslaught – Death Knight Promo Card Pack
description:
You and your rivals have managed to put aside your differences for the greater good. You’ve trapped two newly created Death Knights in separate magical containment zones that sap most of their considerable power and link their fates together. You’ll never have a better chance to defeat them! With any luck, the other adventuring party won’t decide to stab you in the back during the fight.

Previously only available at conventions.

name: Flattops & Floating Fortresses
description:
A familiar but totally new game for those who seek the thrill and challenge of naval conflict in all theaters of World War II.
For those who have played Axis & Allies War & Sea, these rules may feel familiar, but there are many improvements and distinctions from the classic game including:


D10 based resolution
Over the horizon rules for hidden movement & reconnaissance
Fun cards to play on vessels for situational bonuses
Use models from any manufacturer … or print your own!
Critical hit cards can knock out weapon systems, engines, armor, etc.
Rules for weather, terrain placement, refueling and more.


How To Resolve Hits
Roll a number of d10’s as shown for the specified range on the Armament Array. Total all results of a 3 or less and
compare that to the defender’s Armor. If the total number of hits exceeds Armor, the defender suffers a Damage. If the total number hits exceeds Integrity then the defender is sunk.

Each Damage reduces the defender’s Integrity and also increases the chance for a critical hit. Critical hit cards add excitement and thrills.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Floresta
description:
Welcome to Floresta, a competitive board game set in central Portugal. Immerse yourself in the captivating realm of forest management, where players strive to achieve the best use of the Mediterranean forest while battling recurring wildfires. Plant trees, score points in different locations, promote tourism, nurture local trees, harvest wood, and bring the lynx back to its habitat. Construct watchtowers to control fires, strategically planting trees near them. With every decision shaping the fate of the forest, will you rise above the competition and emerge as the ultimate guardian of this precious ecosystem?

Floresta is played on several game boards, each depicting mountains, forests, or paths through nature. Each turn, players choose a card from their hand and apply its effect by placing a tree on one of the boards. They must strategically plant trees to create a sustainable ecosystem, while also taking steps to prevent and fight forest fires.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Events, Modular Board, Multi-Use Cards, Multiple Maps, Zone of Control

name: Blood of Ancients: Expanded Edition
description:
Blood of Ancients: Expanded Edition enhances the already solid foundation of its predecessor, marrying strategic tabletop gameplay with the rich tapestry of ancient history. This edition provides greater clarity, intricately designed scenarios, and vivid illustrations, transporting players back to the grand battles that determined the fate of empires.

As the clash of steel resonates and war cries reverberate, pivotal confrontations that carved the course of history come alive on your tabletop. This isn't a mere game—it's an odyssey into the art of warfare and the strategies that shaped civilizations.

The flexibility of the ruleset allows players to employ any collection of figures across various scales, offering the freedom to recreate some of history's most iconic encounters. With the Blood of Ancients' nuanced charge and counter-charge mechanics, each decision, each tactic, holds the potential to change the course of battle.

For those who love strategy, crave a challenge, or simply appreciate the grandeur of ancient warfare, Blood of Ancients: Expanded Edition is an invitation to command and conquer. Secure your rulebook, and let the battles of old ignite your modern gaming nights.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Alexander And His Adversaries
description:
Rules and scenarios for gaming tabletop battles in antiquity. Alexander & His Adversaries includes


Summary of Blood of Ancients rules
Army lists for Alexander & Philip’s armies
Army lists for Balkan rivals, Persians, Indians, Bactrians and more
Interesting leadership abilities (Inspirations)
Era specific rules for elephantry and more
Interesting information to learn more about the arms and armor of armies in antiquity


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Antarctica Game
description: Who will be the first to find 3 baby seals and return them home to their mother. With 5 wooden pieces crafted in quality wood for durability, 15 baby seals and fish, game board pieces and a wooden dice

name: Rugby League: Match of the Day
description: A game based on the sport of Rugby League. Score 3 tries and 3 goals by rolling dice and moving men across the game board

name: Micro Journey
description:
Micro Journey is a simple print-and-play (PnP) game designed for 2-3 players for 10-15 minutes.

The goal of the game is to be the first to reach the treasure on your journey. To do this, you need to overcome three main checkpoints, where you will encounter three events. Each event corresponds to a certain number on the game dice. All possible events are placed at the top of the game sheet.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Dice, Party Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Strategy and Strike TCG
description:
Strategy and Strike TCG is a military trading card game that you can collect and battle with friends.

The five categories of cards, allows the player to build a deck to fight against other people. Each category of card does different things but the unit and support cards are the most important as they populate the battlefield.

Unit cards for example are split into six types, that represent all military and government units around the world. They are what you use in the game to attack your opponent to win.
Support cards are similar to unit cards in the fact that they can also be used to deal damage to other cards. There are many types of vehicles in the military so there is many types of ground, air, and naval support cards.
Logistic cards allow you to equip your unit and support cards with all that they need to attack your opponent. They also boost a card's abilities and stats.
Order cards are useful cards that provide the player with more abilities to use against their opponents. They may create either an instant or permanent effect on the game.
Environment.


Gameplay
The game is a turn based game and each player takes turns. There are five phases you must go through each turn in the game.

Drawing Phase: The first phase you draw a card from your deck and place this card in your hand.
Deployment Phase: The second phase you can deploy your cards to the battlefield ensuring you have enough command points.
Attacking Phase: The third phase you can initiate attacks on your opponent's cards with your unit and support cards.
Counter Response Phase: The fourth phase your opponent can respond to any attacks or actions you deal against them.
Opponent's Turn: Lastly you pass the turn over to your opponent or the next player. Once the turn comes back around to you, you restart from the Drawing Phase.


How to Win
Your objective is to eliminate all enemy unit and support cards that your opposition has.

—description from the publisher

name: Østré' IØ
description:
Østré’ IØ! is a simple, short and dynamic dice game, which will delight young and old alike.

Be the first player to sell 8 tons (8 tokens) of oysters to win !

Oyster version of a game of unknown origin called The Bear's Paw or The Pig Game, Østré' IØ! mixes luck, risk-taking and lots of fun with family or friends.

It is ideal to accompany a good tasting of oysters!

name: To the Ends of the Earth
description:
To the Ends of the Earth's motive is from the bible story at the Acts of Apostles. In short, this game stands on the history which is the apostles' effort to spread the Christianity to the world after Jesus' ascension. Even though the new game is based on the bible story, we tried to design the new game feeling like the movie "Ben Hur" which is a masterpiece for ordinary people.

In this game, each player becomes one of the apostles and travels to an extensive area from Jerusalem to Rome. And then they record a gospel based on Jesus' teaching and try to start an evangelism to Jewish/Gentile community in the world. They establish their Church in the world and spread the Gospel with other players to the ends of the Earth but identify who is the best apostle.

This game's rules are simple and easy to learn, even if someone is a child, but during playing the game there are some select options. So, for the victory, each player should make a good strategy. However, the game has some lucky elements. Therefore, players will be able to enjoy the game well because the game's feeling isn't just super heavy and serious!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Bias, Catch the Leader, Events, Kill Steal, Ordering, Push Your Luck, Simulation, Tags

name: Das lehrreiche Bienenspiel
description:
Up to six people can take part, each with three figures. The players take turns to roll and move. After a six is rolled, the player can start the game with the result rolled after that. The next figure is used when the player, after passing point 130, rolls a six or is favored by the rules of the game.
All figures must reach the large space Z, even if they could skip the space with a higher roll.
Once they reach space Z, they roll the die until they get the number they need to get to the winter hive with the numbered spaces in different colors. No Figure may be passed at this stage of the game. The first person to have his three figures in the winter hive is the winner.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: 18Turkey
description:
18Turkey is an 18xx game about the railway development of the Anatolian Peninsula. It depicts 19th century British, French, and German involvement as well as the Turkish nationalization of foreign-owned railways in the wake of the Great War.

—description from the designer

name: Shackled
description:
Broken heroes captured by a cruel enemy must battle for the chance of freedom. Once allies, they must now fight to the death. Will you overcome the odds and claim your victory?

In Shackled, 2 or 4 players take the role of these heroes, which are split into teams of two. Each round, players will secretly play one of several unique action cards tied to that hero, which will then be revealed simultaneously and played from fastest to slowest. Each action is tied to specific directions relative to how the character faces, meaning positioning and rotation are both very important. When a hero reaches zero health, the opposing team gets 10 points, and the hero is out until the end of the next round. There are also relics in the center of the map that offer points towards victory, as well as powerful abilities for the hero that captures them. The first team to reach 20 points is victorious!

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Square Grid, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Dragon Bowl
description:
Dragon Bowl is a fantasy-themed board game made for bowling. Players take the game to the bowling center, set it up on the back table, and bowl to drive the game mechanics. Players, heroes, travel across a perilous landscape battling creatures and overcoming challenges on their way to defeat the marauding dragon and save the Kingdom.

Dragon Bowl takes the focus off of the bowling score and emphasizes shot-making. With six different bowling skill levels, beginner to pro, any level can play at the same time and anyone can win. A beginning bowler can defeat a pro bowler in Dragon Bowl.

Players select a hero and the skill level (based on bowling average or typical score bowled) at which they will compete. Heroes travel across a kingdom overrun with fierce creatures. When a player encounters a creature, she notes the creature's strength (denoted on an encounter card ranging from 6,8,10, or 12). Based on that strength, she roles the x-sided die to determine how to defeat the creature.

Ex: A beginning bowler encounters a creature with strength 8. The beginning bowler roles an 8-sided die. The result is 5. To defeat the creature, the beginning bowler must knock over at least 5 pins with two balls in the bowling frame. An intermediate bowler would also roll the 8-sided die and have to knock over the resulting number of pins on their first ball to defeat the creature. Each subsequent skill level takes the difficulty to another level.

There are six creature encounters, three defined bowling challenges, and the final battle against the dragon, which consists of overcoming a unique Victory Combo.

In addition to the bowling component, each hero has a unique special skill they can use once or twice during the game. One hero can skip an encounter once during the game, while others can retake a shot or add +1 to their pin count or even steal another hero's die roll.

The game is designed to be played in the bowling center, but we do have people playing at home using some other bowling game like wii bowling or even a phone app.

—description from the designer

name: نبرد قلعه ها (Stronghold Crusader)
description:
Players play as rulers, each having a piece on a looping trail. At the beginning of the game they each receive 70 coins, and roll in order to play.
