Set in the Caribbean Islands during the year 1718, as a privateer warship captain hired by the governor of Port Royal, you will be tasked with hunting down dastardly pirates that are disrupting the shipping industry in the Caribbean, with your ultimate goal being to attack and shut down the notorious pirate town of Nassau.
But it's not all work and no play.
In your free time, you might decide to also gamble in a tavern, or even attempt to recover buried treasure from acquired maps.
Whatever path you choose, no two games will ever play the same.


Two D10 dice are required to play. However, ten D10 dice are recommended to reduce the number of rolls during ship combat.
10 minute game setup and breakdown times.
A large size table is required for full game setup. * Using the optional Warship sheet eliminates some of the game mats and reduces overall table footprint size.
Total play time to the end is approximately 5-10 hours (depending on game length chosen).
Adjustable starting difficulty based on player's skill level.


With most of the rules integrated into the tables, there is practically no learning curve or rules memorization.
And with 5 types of sailing ships, ship damage modeling, weather conditions, special items, warship captain skills, specialist crewmen, random events, a multitude of table modifiers, and an almost unlimited number of player choices, Pirate Hunter: 1718 offers high replay value.

Can you hunt down the most notorious pirates in the Caribbean and eventually close down Nassau?

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Nautical, Pirates, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Rat Trap: Je größer die Gang, desto größer das Durcheinander!
description: These are two promo dice that allow to expand the Ludolux version of the game and add even more excitement to the game.

name: Doublevolt
description:
There's been an accident in the Gear-Gum factory and all of the bots have been caught inside bubbles!

In Doublevolt, 2 players will take turns drawing and playing supercharged robot cards to connect circuits on a shared tableau and create their own secret patterns. Each card in hand can either be played OR score you points, so use your robots wisely!

First to empty their hand of supercharged robots wins!

—description from the publisher

name: Roll & Groove
description:
A chaotic and colourful spoof of old-school roll n' move games, Roll & Groove has a constantly moving finish line, always-changing dice, and a crazily generated path system, with a horde of goofy characters that keep changing the rules!

Players place their Groove Tokens on the randomly drawn start card and start with one die, rolling along their path.

Whenever a new card is added to the map, the finish line moves!

Certain rolls of the dice will force players to steal or give dice to other players!
Landing on the whacky Dunderhead characters, or on other player's token triggers a wide variety if effects!
Players can claim ownership of unique powers or change the community powers at any moment!
Oh, and building Groove Towers on the roundabouts can results in more points!!!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Agenterna
description:
No time to lose!
Gather the team and take on the latest crime case in Krimsta City. But hurry, because the crime scene trail is getting cold and the suspects must be released unless you produce enough evidence.
In Agenterna ("Agents"), you play a select team of agents from the KSSA - Krimsta Secret Service Agency - who are deployed to solve the most difficult crimes in Krimsta City. Go out and investigate the crime scene to collect clues, analyze what you get and interrogate suspects to build your evidence.
With varying crime scenes, crimes and suspects and random elements, there is plenty of variety for many rounds of play. The game is a cooperative game where you work together to win, and you can choose to compete against yourself by keeping track of your score from previous games.
Are you up to the task?

—description from the designer
categories: Children's Game, Deduction, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Action/Event, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Variable Set-up

name: Bookshelf
description:
Bookshelf is a cozy and quick literary set collection card game for 1-5 players (in competitive mode or 2-3 players in co-op mode).

In Bookshelf, you are an avid book collector trying to curate sets of books for your personal collection. Acquire books from the library or bookstore, scour the local flea market for bargains and gain access to the rare books section to build your collection of books!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Gemstones
description:
Gemstones is an a-symmetrical area-control shape puzzle game where you exploit the strengths of your gemstone to grow it faster and larger than your opponents.

Each turn players take turn placing a gemstone from their available pieces on the board. Once no players choose to place a gemstone (or cannot) the game ends.

Points are counted by counting the point value of each gemstone shard (piece) a player played onto the board, minus 5 points for each separate non-connected section of gemstone. (So you loose no points if all your gemstones are touching.)

Other than that, there are also 3 placing rules when placing a gemstone shard (piece).

Each shard has some edges that must be covered when placed.
The shard must be touching at least 2 different sides on the board (parallel sides are fine).
At least one side must be touching either the edge of the board or one of your other gemstone shards.


This causes players to place shards as if their gemstone is "growing" out of the edge of the geode and their other pieces.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Matching, Multiple Maps, Tile Placement

name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Sewers & Ladders – Radical Edition
description:
Created by a team of fanatical film and video game fans who grew up in the 80's and 90's watching and reading about the adventures of Leonardo, Raphael, Donatello and Michelangelo.
Wanting to relive their memories they created 'Sewers & Ladders’ in
the hope that you enjoy playing this game as much as they did creating it!

With a board measuring 400x400mm, four Turtle counters and two dice this is a FaNaTtik homage to the classic 80's TMNT cartoon.

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Grounded for Life: Expansion Pack #1
description: The Grounded for Life expansion pack features 125 fresh cards and countless opportunities for hilarity.

name: The Dungeon Within
description:
The Dungeon Within is a Print&Play Roll&Write Dungeon Crawler game for 1-3 players. Your brotherhood must fight the three Horsemen of the Night and escape The Deep Dungeon to win.

To play you choose 3 Character Cards (one as party leader), set up the 12 room tiles in a 3x4 grid and prepare the Guide, the Beastiary and The Shop documents, which generate enemies and treasures. You also need min. 5xD6 and a 54 card poker deck.

You start on Tile 1 and start to explore the rooms on the tile. Check the Guide to see the tile objective and the maximum number of turns you have to complete it. F.E. Tile 1 requires you to explore at least 1 Dark Room in 2 turns. If you succeed, you can decide to explore more rooms or go to the next tile. If you fail, you loose.

Each character draws 5 cards from the Poker deck. The cards you draw each turn are used for buffs you can use to overcome the encounters, f.E. a Heart suit card can give you +1 health. You win the game if all 3 characters manage to successfully complete the objective of the last tile. If you fail to complete the objective within the given turns, you loose the game. If all 3 characters die, you also loose the game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: フィラデルフィア：拡張 (Philadelphia: Expansion)
description:
フィラデルフィア：拡張 (Philadelphia: Expansion) is an expansion set to the game Philadelphia. It adds a set of advertising cards, including six that act as multi-industry cards. These cards enable players to arrange hands as composites, but also make the player choose between making money or doing good. Playing these composites cost an extra 3 gold, but make it easier to play more cards.
user summary
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Set Collection
publishers: Mogmog Project (モグモグプロジェクト)

name: 可惜夜 (Atarayo)
description:
可惜夜 (あたらよ) (Atarayo) is a card game from Japan, with a similar feel to UNO, in that you play cards following the same number or colour as played before. But in Atarayo, you can also progress by playing a card that is the same number as the cards in your hand.

In addition, the cards have simple effects such as skip, reverse, draw 2, wild cards and so on. The cards feature Wagara (classic Japanese design patterns) such as Yagasuri, Shippo and others. Players win by shedding their hand first.
user summary
mechanics: Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Matching, Take That
publishers: Mogmog Project (モグモグプロジェクト)

name: Ratpack!
description:
MILLRAT Studios presents Ratpack! Six original cards games in one small pack!

Each game uses a handful of cards, a couple of dice and a few tokens, but the experiences are big!

Featuring:
Superposition, a dexterity battle royale game in space
Someone's "Y," a deduction word game where everyone's a vowel, but someone's "Y"
Tiramisu, a set collection game where players bake expensive cakes
Sequelitis, a movie-themed party game where players work together to develop fan-pleasing sequels
Footfalls, a strategic movement game featuring an ever-changing board
Bad Eggs, a 1v1 asymmetric RPG in a possessed grocery store!

A unique game for every situation & any player at any time.

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Deduction, Dice, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Deduction, Dice Rolling, Map Addition, Movement Points, Multi-Use Cards, Player Elimination, Role Playing, Set Collection, Slide/Push, Voting

name: Wave Chase Race (ウェーブチェイスレース)
description:
Wave Chase Race (ウェーブチェイスレース) is a race prediction game from Japan. The players are trying to get their predicted sailing team to win the regatta but not the races. The gameplay has various twists. The team that actually wins the race does not score. Instead, the team in 2nd place determines the points distribution.

As teams move along the course, they can get a boost by passing through boats ahead of them. With several boats, this can create large moves. But if a leading group catches up with a lagging group, instead of being lapped, the lagging group simply joins the leaders. So falling behind is not necessarily bad if you can get the leader to catch you up.

The game is played over two races, and the final winner is determined from several factors: the rankings from each race, your predictions during the races, the cards remaining in your hand, points from your colours. The final total gives the eventual winner.

ENG rules are available online.
user summary

1チーム4隻のヨットで行うレースゲームです
カードプレイによるレースゲームですが、「次の空きマスまでヨットは進む」「先頭集団の先頭のヨットが先頭になる（周回遅れのヨット群に追いつくとそこが先頭に吸収される）」
「全員がカードを使い切るまでレースは続く」といった特徴があります。
また、「各チーム2番目のヨットで順位が決まる」「各チーム1番目のヨットはレースから抜ける」ことでレースは少し混沌となります。
前後半2回のラウンドを通じてより多くの点数を獲得すると思うチームに投票し、最終的に投票に使用したチケットの点数が最も多い人が勝者となります。
publisher summary

name: Autocracy
description:
Extend your influence in all areas of power and beat the competition. But don't let your opponents get in your way… Become the Supreme Leader.

Autocracy is a a management and strategy game played with 2 12-faced dices and tokens.
The first player to have at least 1 Economy Token, 1 Media Token, 1 Justice Token, 1 Army Token and 1 Politics Token during their turn wins the game.

The player who starts is the last to sit at the table. Each player draws 1 Mentor Token and 1 “Dirty Trick” Token. The Mentor Token indicates the influence tokens with which the players will start the game (in addition to there Low Blow). They are immediately collected. Each player in turn rolls the dice to win and accumulate as much influence as possible.

Winning Influence

Each turn, to calculate your winnings, you add your dice roll to your tokens corresponding to the draw. Divide the total obtained for each area of influence and/or “Dirty Trick” by 2 to obtain your winnings.

Influence Peddling

At the start of each round (before rolling the dices) you can trade with the reserve or with another player. The exchange values are fixed, even between players.

There are 5 types of influence areas: Economy, Media, Justice, Army, Politics. The trading values are the following:

1 Media token = 6 Economy tokens

1 Justice token = 2 Media tokens

1 Army token = 3 Justice tokens

1 Politics token = 2 Army tokens

1 “Dirty Trick” token = 2 Justice tokens

(“Dirty Tricks” tokens can’t be converted back into influence tokens)

“Dirty Trick”s

At the start of each round (before rolling the dices) you can use 1 “Dirty Trick” token against an opponent. The attacking player cannot make exchanges, but can roll the dices once the result of his attack is known. Attacks cannot be made on the first turn.

There are 5 types of “Dirty Tricks”

Nationalisation
Make a player lose: all his Economy Tokens and you hijack half of them OR all his Media Tokens and you hijack half of them.

Revolt
Make a player lose half their Justice Tokens AND Army Tokens. You hijack 1 type of lost token of your choice (Justice OR Army).

Blackmail
Take the Influence Token of your choice from an opponent. Blackmail can be countered by blackmail.

Spying
Take a “Dirty Trick” token from an opponent, without showing it to the other players. Spying can be countered by spying (Spying cancelled).

Corruption
Redirect the effects of a Nationalisation or Revolt to another competitor. The diversion cannot be used against the player attacking you. Corruption can be countered by a Corruption (redirection cancelled). Does not protect against Blackmail.

Defending Yourself
You can counter a “Dirty Trick”. Show your “Dirty Trick” Token which protects you when you are attacked. Only if you want to.

Losing Influence
If you cannot defend yourself against an attack, or if you decide not to, you lose the influence tokens corresponding to the attack suffered.

—description from the designer

name: Gemstones
description:
Gemstones is an a-symmetrical area-control shape puzzle game where you exploit the strengths of your gemstone to grow it faster and larger than your opponents.

Each turn players take turn placing a gemstone from their available pieces on the board. Once no players choose to place a gemstone (or cannot) the game ends.

Points are counted by counting the point value of each gemstone shard (piece) a player played onto the board, minus 5 points for each separate non-connected section of gemstone. (So you loose no points if all your gemstones are touching.)

Other than that, there are also 3 placing rules when placing a gemstone shard (piece).

Each shard has some edges that must be covered when placed.
The shard must be touching at least 2 different sides on the board (parallel sides are fine).
At least one side must be touching either the edge of the board or one of your other gemstone shards.


This causes players to place shards as if their gemstone is "growing" out of the edge of the geode and their other pieces.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Matching, Multiple Maps, Tile Placement

name: The Dungeon Within: The Empire of Snow
description:
The Dungeon Within: The Empire of Snow is the first expansion for the game The Dungeon Within. Dive deeper in the universe of The Dungeon Within with this expansion. More levels, new characters and brand new game mechanics.

This expansion includes (needs base game to play):

12 new tiles with Snow rooms
3 new characters
new guide documents with new items
new "partner mechanic" rules update
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Field Day Baseball
description:
Introducing Greg Sovan’s newest creation, Field Day Baseball. Field Day Baseball takes the tabletop game to the next level of ease of play, tiny learning curve, and fast play results with minimal chart lookups, while still having all the depth of major league baseball. See if you can manage your favorite stars to the pennant.

Baseball simulation game with full season MLB teams. Dice are rolled and pitcher/batter cards are consulted which provide results.

name: 主の帰りを待ちながら (Waiting For The Master's Return)
description:
主の帰りを待ちながら (Waiting For The Master's Return) is a co-op mystery game from Japan. The game is strictly for 4 players only, who are the four android characters in the game. Through role-play and discussion, they solve the mystery together.

The publisher says...
"Somewhere in Japan, deep in the mountains that doesn't even appear on maps, there is a small research institute. There, Dr. Sakurada and the four androids he developed were conducting research every day. But now, there is no one who appears to be a doctor at the research institute, and four people appear to have lost their memories...

Players will be asked to step into the shoes of a specific character, experience the story, and uncover the truth of this story through discussion.
The first in a series of 'mystery experience games' that combine the story experience elements of a murder mystery game and the truth-finding elements of a mystery-solving game!"

日本のどこか、地図にも載っていないようなとある山奥に、小さな研究所がある。
そこでは、桜田博士と彼が開発した4体のアンドロイドが、日々研究を行っていた。
しかし今、研究所に博士らしき者の姿がなく、
記憶を失った様子の4人が……。

プレイヤーの皆様には、特定のキャラクターの立場になって、物語を体験しながら、議論を通してこの物語の真実を解き明かしていただきます。
マーダーミステリ―ゲームの物語体験要素、謎解きゲームの真相究明要素を組み合わせた、「ミステリー体験型ゲーム」の第一弾！
publishers: Mogmog Project (モグモグプロジェクト)

name: Golden Goal: VM i Fodbold 2010
description:
A soccer trivia game where the team advances toward the opposing goal by answering correctly, with the questions getting harder the closer to the goal you get. If your answer is wrong, the opposing team takes the ball and begins answering questions.
The game ends after an agreed-upon amount of time.

—user summary

name: Cyclian
description:
サイクリアン (Cyclian) is a quick network building game from Japan. Players use just 12 of the 24 tiles in the game, meaning a 3P game each player plays 4 turns, a 4P game they only have 3 turns.

Whilst the graphic design is very abstract, the game is explicitly about operating a rail network. Players start from their own colour stations as connectors, and build and manipulate routes. The tiles show lines and curves, with 2 lines on each side, in one or two colours on each tile. There are stations which show two rail companies crossing.

The goal is to build the longest section on the board that connects two of your stations. But the track does not have to be all your own colour. In the manner of the private rail companies in Japan, trains run on other people's tracks. So the objective is to get the longest run of your colour from into the whole board and out of the board somewhere else, by which two of your stations connect, thus controlling that line. A section scores 1 point for each tile, and also 1 point for each opponent's station on the section.

However, on their turn, a player can turn a placed tile 90 degrees before placing their own tile from their hand. This is not rotating the tile in place. Instead, it spins 90 degrees on one corner, so moving the tile (and possibly connecting tiles) to an adjacent space. In this way, a player's high scoring section can be broken up.

When all the tiles are played, the player controlling the highest scoring section is the winner.

The designer says this is the first game in a 'Minimalian' series, the next being Serealian.
user summary
mechanics: Map Addition, Map Deformation, Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: Labyrintix
description:
Object: To be the first to win 7 cards.

Preparing to play:

Shuffle the cards and place them in a pile (with their backs showing) on the table.
Just next to the pile, arrange the four totems in 4 differents colours around a space big enough to hold a card.

The youngest player turns over the top card from the deck and lays it maze side up in the middle of the four totems. The players all play at the same time.
As quickly as possible, all of the players visually follow the path indicated by the arrows, starting with the one outlined in red, and as far as the arrow indicating the exit. The first player to spot the exit grabs the corresponding totem.

Which totem should be grabbed depends on the symbol showing on the back of the top card on the deck.
If you are the first player to grab the right totem you win the maze card that you place in front of you as a point won.

—description from the publisher

name: アマロン (Amaron)
description:
アマロン (Amaron) is a simplified Shogi style game from Japan, using a 4 x 6 grid. The two players move their hieroglyph pieces as indicated, trying to capture their opponent's Eye Of Horus piece to win.

To assist them, there are black cubes called Amaron (meaning Energy) they can collect and spend to get extra turns. But if a player gets three Amaron, they explode and are sent to Hell. So another player option is to curse the opponent to give them a cube, to make them explode and lose.

The game is untended to be played rapidly and can finish in just a minute. The game has a cloth board, branded wood pieces, and five black Amaron cubes.
user summary
mechanics: Grid Movement, Static Capture, Sudden Death Ending

name: Waste Knights: Second Edition – Krewni Pyrkonu 2 Promo Cards
description:
This supplement contains 2 cards: KRWIOBUS and ZAPACH KRWI, which are part of the 'Talia Krewni Pyrkonu 2' received for donating blood at the Pyrkon '23 convention. Available only in Polish language.

The wilderness card titled KRWIOBUS should be shuffled during game preparation into the highway/desert wilderness deck found in the base game Waste Knights: Second Edition and used as described in the instructions.

Place the ZAPACH KRWI card into the Sea deck of the Beyond the Horizon expansion pack during game preparation and use as described in the expansion pack instructions.

name: Overtake: Race Manager
description:
Overtake: Race Manager is an exhilarating racing management board game. Players represent managers of racing corporations vying for supremacy in the high-stakes world of motorsport racing. You're tasked to build your fleet of cutting-edge race cars, strategically allocate staff and resources, and outmaneuver rival corporations on the racetracks to secure the prestigious title of Motorsport Racing Champion.

The scoring rounds resolve through intense race days, where your skilled drivers and finely-tuned machines will face the challenges of the racetrack. Success translates to prestige, points, and funding - assuming you've managed to entice sponsors.

Game mechanisms are crafted tightly to reflect the tension of racing management. These include:

Distinct management and racing phases.
An original cast featuring men and women from 31 countries.
Action prioritization of financial resources to recruit staff, build cars, acquire sponsors, and seed rumors.
Variable powers and bonus unlocking through expanding your executive board room.
Streamlined 10 or 20 car race simulations, including variable skill level automa corporations.
Racing that factors car development and driver skill pertaining to the track and weather conditions.
High-stakes probability luck-pressing to push your cars to their limits.

Compete over a year, a series comprised of 6 races, to etch your name into the annals of racing history.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Drafting, Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Different Dice Movement, Income, Push Your Luck, Race, Simulation, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Porsche 911 Cup
description:
A truly special collectors item for both Porsche and board game enthusiasts alike. Designed under the direction of Porsche Design, very few of these games were actually made and distributed through official Porsche channels.

“Porsche Design is a German product design studio and brand founded in 1972 by F. A. Porsche, the designer of the original Porsche 911. The current legal instantiation of the company, Porsche Lizenz- und Handelsgesellschaft mbH & Co. KG, based in Ludwigsburg, Germany, was formed in November 2003 as a majority-owned subsidiary of Porsche AG to combine Porsche AG's and Porsche Design Group's accessories and licensing business into one single company.”
-from Porsche Design Wikipedia

Welcome to one of the world most renowned test tracks.

You are one of the 3 to 6 “911 Cup driver” who are vying for the title of “best Porsche driver” on the Porsche testing grounds in Weissach in their racing cars.

The goal is simple: beat the others to it and be the first to cross the finish line in your Porsche Cup vehicle! You must try to stick to the ideal line and take the lead in as many track sections as possible.

A race take place over one lap.

You will have to fight for you position on every section of the track.

The various acceleration and braking sections give you the opportunity to display your talents.

Of course, you don’t have an unlimited supply of fuel and the brakes can also only handle so much. That’s why you can only the points on each card once. And added to that are those unpredictable events that make racing so exciting!

So it’s just like in real life: the winner will need his wits, some good fortune and, of course, the right vehicle!

name: Satire of the Trades
description:
A worker placement game set in Ancient Egypt.

Perform good deeds for the people of the village and complete your secret mission to earn your place in the afterlife!

Become a fisherman, hunter, trader, explorer and more!

Try different strategies for reaching your goal: Call in favors from the Gods or try to become the richest person in the market! There are tons of possibilities!

—description from the designer

name: Focus!: Last Roll for the Hangul
description:
In this turn-based push-your-luck strategy game for 1-5 players you take the role of a Wildlife Photographer, visiting the Kashmir Valley in an attempt to photograph and publish photos of the critically endangered Hangul. Set in 1970, you are using colour film to take photos, and the game begins when you are down to your last 20 exposures. So, what will you do? Track down the elusive Hangul, or settle for other wildlife? What publishing deals will you manage to obtain—and what photos do they require? Push yourself too hard, and you may end up scaring the wildlife or worse — wasting precious film!

Focus! Last Roll for the Hangul deploys multiple mechanism to recreate the thrilling challenge of wildlife photography: the unpredictability of the animals is reflected by dice, while the challenge of getting published is represented by cards that specify which animals to photograph for the publication. A modular board is used to speed up the process of updating the position of all the fast moving animals on the table.

On on your turn you spend Action Tokens to execute actions like moving to a new area, adding more Animal Tokens to the board, negotiating Contracts before they are gone, and taking photos. When an animal is successfully photographed, the targeted Animal Token is collected from the board. To take the photo however, you must be in the same area as the animal, which means there is a constant pressure to move around the board. You will additionally have to balance the need for a sharp photo with the need to conserve film. And all of this, is wrapped in a push-your-luck mechanic that allows you to repeat any successful action by increasing the chance of failure.

A new round will not start if two of multiple game ending conditions arise, allowing you to tactically end the game when it secures your victory. You win the game by having the most victory points, which are earned by the photos you take — and doubled by getting them published.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Contracts, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Piggily
description:
The Guinea Pigs live happily and contentedly in their beautiful Pig Palace. They will never leave their cosy place unless you entice them with their favourite treats. Maybe they'll join you in a game - try it!

Competitive game with a tactical variant for 2 - 4 players, from 3 years old, (4 and 5 with variants) for a 10 minute game.

—description from the rulebook

name: 1854: The Alma
description:
1854: The Alma is a small footprint grand tactics scale solitaire minigame on the iconic battle between Russia, France, England and Turkey at the outset of the Crimean War. Allied units are mostly brigades while Russian units are regiments, each hex is around 500m, and each turn is one hour.

1854 is mechanically a streamlined combination of our Imperial Bayonets series as well as Koniggratz and the rules only clock in at around 6 pages. The game features no CRT and can be played opposed making it an excellent intro into wargaming for new gamers while providing a satisfying challenge to more experienced gamers.

—description from the publisher

name: Deadly Dinner Party
description:
This season the elites of Bayonette have decided to forgo their usual passive-aggressive court politics and just start poisoning each other. Represent your family by hosting a grand event with amazing drinks, only some of which will send certain parts of the aristocracy to the infirmary. At the same time, you'll have to to find your own patrons a unsullied glass of wine amongst the impostors.

—description from the designer

name: Rock ‘Em Sock ‘Em Robots Fight Cards
description:
Enter the ring for a fast-smackin' slug-fest with Rock 'Em Sock 'Em Robots Fight Cards, a wild, team-based party game. One player on each team wears a robot-themed boxing glove, and whenever matching cards are played, the gloved players race to smack the cards with their gloves. Fastest smackdown wins the cards! Perfect for the whole family, just pass each glove to a teammate so everyone gets a chance to battle for the most cards! Colors and decorations may vary.

Each team wears a padded robot boxing glove – either red or blue. Players take turns flipping over cards until there's a match, then SMACK 'EM! Gloved players race to punch the cards and win the pile!
Teammates swap their glove each round so everyone gets a chance to bring the smackdown! For added craziness, special cards force players to toss their gloves to a teammate before making the smackdown!

—description from publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game

name: The Last Penguins on Earth
description:
Earth is crumbling! Piece by piece, chunks of the earth have floated off to space with only an ice flow from the Antarctic circle left. The earth’s remaining inhabitants, two colonies of penguins, fight for self-preservation. As chunks of ice fall off, penguins will maneuver to the best location of the ice to save themselves as the expense of others. Which penguin colony will have the Last Penguins on Earth.

The Last Penguins on Earth is a two player, dice drafting game where players try to maneuver their penguins away from the disappearing ice chunks onto safer parts of the ice pack. But be careful, for the very icebreak you draw could be used against you! And you could be bumped into oblivion if you get stuck between the edge and your opponent. If a player’s opponent loses all of their penguins, that player wins the game.

Each turn, players will alternate drafting dice for up to three turns and place them on their player boards. Player will decide if their dice will be used for movement or breaking ice. Players will then alternate turns activating their dice. Once all of the dice on the player boards are used. The rounds end and the dice will be rolled to start a new round. Time (and ice) is running out. The player who has one or more of their penguins left on the board, wins.

—description from the designer

name: Birds of Prey: Airbattle RAG 6
description:
Airbattle RAG is the journal of adventure and learning,
expanding your world of jet dogfighting with new aircraft, missiles, and scenarios! Airbattle RAG 6 features all the new content released at two recent Birds of Prey Conventions.

“Strike from the Sea” was the theme of the 2021 Birds of Prey Convention and featured fights where at least one side launched from the deck of an aircraft carrier. Scenarios range from the icy waters of the Baltic, to the ever-tense Taiwan Straight; between the the two warring Koreas, and over the sweltering sands of Egypt.

“The Aircraft We’ve Longed to Fly” of the 2022 Convention featured aircraft that the designers and previous convention attendees selected as those they most wanted to see that had not yet been featured in a product. This adds some very exciting new aircraft, including uncovered gems from the early cold war though ultramodern aircraft that have barely entered service!

All this, plus several aircraft and missiles not featured at the conventions, make Airbattle RAG 6 a substantial addition to your air combat collection!

Good luck and good hunting!

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Temple of X
description:
The Temple of X? Nobody except the group's members knew exactly what it was or where it was located. There were rumors, of course. Most people thought it was a doomsday cult dedicated to aliens and the end of the world. But, the group was notoriously tight-lipped about their beliefs and what went on inside their compound. Yet, more and more people joined the Temple of X thanks to their mysterious and charismatic leader. People left their families without much explanation and cut off communication with the outside world, choosing instead to live at the commune with their newfound "brothers and sisters." It's been weeks since anyone from the Temple of X has been heard from or seen. A group of concerned family members has hired you and your colleagues at the Will Street Detective Agency to investigate and find out if their relatives are still alive. What will you find inside the Temple of X?

Difficulty Rating – 6.5/10

Originally released as the monthly subscription mystery for February 2023.

name: The South Ridge Stalker
description:
For a few months now, people have gone missing while hiking alone in Easthaven Forest. Some people believe it is the work of the South Ridge Stalker. The Stalker is half urban legend, half campfire story. He is said to appear to lone hikers in the woods, and those who encounter him are never seen again. When four hikers stumble across what they believe to be The Stalker’s lair, you, a Will Street Detective, are sent out to investigate the site. Will this lead be a dead end, or will you find evidence to corroborate The Stalker's existence and solve the mystery of so many disappearances?

Difficulty Rating – 7/10


This mystery was never a part of our monthly subscription service. It was released as a one-time purchase.

name: The Darkroom Devil
description:
Your career as an investigative journalist has provided you a thorough education on the darkness that lives in the hearts of some men. Over the years, you have developed quite a network of informants and tipsters, and today, one of those has dropped a story into your lap about another black-hearted soul who has been mentioned in the news lately. According to the tipster, someone anonymously dropped off a roll of film. While it was being developed, the photo tech noticed that some of the images on the roll showed the grisly scene of what appeared to be a murder. This is the third in a string of recent killings. In each instance, the details of the murder have been revealed by a roll of film that has been dropped off at a different photo center. Police are at a loss on how to track down the killer the media has dubbed “The Darkroom Devil.” Thankfully, another of your informants works inside the police department and has given you access to everything they have on this killer. Can you step in and find the hidden clues and bring this devil to justice?

Difficulty Rating – 6/10

Originally released as the monthly subscription mystery for March 2023.

name: Pot of Gold
description:
As the owner of an authentic Irish pub, St. Patrick's Day is one of the biggest days of the year for you. This year seems to be no different. The night's festivities go off without a hitch until a fire breaks out. After evacuating patrons, you assess the damage and find half of your pub burnt to a crisp and your father’s gold coin collection stolen from your safe. With the police tied up with other St. Patty’s Day shenanigans, you take it upon yourself to investigate both the fire and robbery. Can you catch the thief and find your Pot Of Gold?


This mystery was never a part of our monthly subscription service. It was released as a one-time purchase.


Difficulty Rating – 6/10

name: The Case of the Missing Eyes
description:
The Queen’s Eye jewel was to remain on display at the Valley Falls Museum for a month before entering the private collection of its new owner, Charles Henderson. Despite numerous precautions taken by both the museum and the owner, however, the priceless diamond was stolen. Henderson will stop at nothing to get his diamond back and make the thief pay, which is why he hired the world’s most renowned private eye, Jasper Graves. Yet, after just a few days of taking on the case, Graves has gone missing. With few options remaining, Henderson turns to you and your detective agency. Do you have what it takes to untangle this intricate web of deception, locate the missing Queen’s Eye diamond, and find out what happened to one very famous private eye? Accept the case and find out!

Difficulty Rating – 7/10

Originally released as the monthly subscription mystery for April 2023.

name: Ashes to Ashes
description:
The Eternal Slumber Funeral Parlor is exactly the sort of place you would expect to find a dead body. But, normally the bodies are already deceased when they arrive. That isn't true in the case of Bernard Sparks, the owner of Eternal Slumber who is found murdered in the chapel. Can you sift through the remains of Bernard's life and uncover the secrets which led to his demise? Or will the truth be buried with him? Ashes to ashes, lies to lies.

Difficulty Rating – 6.5/10

Originally released as the monthly subscription mystery for May 2023.

name: Murder at the Zoo
description:
Summer is about to be in full swing, and that means the Hampstead Zoo is getting ready for its busiest season. After the zoo closed on Thursday, staff members were busy at work cleaning habitats, caring for the animals, and adding the finishing touches to a new exhibit entitled, “Endangered Species.” Little did they know that the most endangered species that evening was man. Claude, the adult male lion of the Hampstead Zoo, escaped his exhibit and killed head zoo keeper Daniel Strickland in an uncharacteristic display of savagery. Claude was immediately tranquilized and caged pending further inquiry into the incident, but there are many suspicious details about this incident that warrant investigation. The Chief Director of the Hampstead Zoo doesn’t think this was a mere accident and has hired the Will Street Detective Agency to solve this mystery. Explore this wild kingdom and determine if Strickland’s death was the result of human orchestration or the byproduct of trying to tame Mother Nature. But, remember, it’s a jungle out there!

Difficulty Rating – 6/10

Originally released as the monthly subscription mystery for June 2023.

name: Fermentation Station
description:
For the release of Ritual Cuts' 3rd kickstarted, Microbia, a zine about magical fermentation, we are releasing a small free solo one-page roll & write about the many active things that happen in a ferment.

Here, we are mitigating good and bad bacteria through taking actions that affect temperature, sugar consumption and volatility. Meant to introduce aspects of lacto fermentation (the game representing a vegan kim chi), your brew has to survive its early, vulnerable days to slowly de-escalate the various variables that affect the brew.

It is a war game set in brine!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game, Worker Placement

name: Monopoly: Dell Technologies
description:
Win Big in Your Transformation Journey

Stay ahead of your competition and help your organization accelerate its digital transformation by addressing core to edge to cloud with intelligent solutions from Dell Technologies.

Discover your path to transformation by navigating new opportunities and collecting multiple technology solutions. Scale your organization faster by building Coworking Spaces and Reginonal Offices to increase overall business impact.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Cat Trois
description:
Adorable cats are seeking people and like felines to play with!

Cat Trois is a traditional matching game with a twist. On each turn, the player reveals a card. A toy card is immediately added to hand and the turn ends. Cats, on the other hand, present choices. Should you attract this cat to your display using the yarn and stuffed bird it desires? Or should you flip a second card to go for a match, and risk revealing toys - or cats - for your opponents to claim?

Each of the cats is present in the deck three times. Create the largest sets of as many cats as possible to win the game!
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Humor, Memory
mechanics: Matching, Memory, Multi-Use Cards, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Pattern Building, Set Collection

name: Berlin's Gateway: The Battle of Kustrin ‘45
description:
From the creative wargaming pen of Piers Brand, we visit the apocalyptic rehearsal of the downfall of Berlin.
The Battle of Kustrin was every inch as terrible and desperate, and for the miniature wargamer, had just as many opportunities to game out the vicious close quarters fighting that took place as in Berlin.
Moreover, it features one of the last panzer attacks made by the German army.
Over the course of nine scenarios, game out actions representative of the fighting in and around Kustrin.
A variety of troop types and weapons featured in the battle, including King Tigers and everything from Wehrmacht Auxiliaries to Volksturm on the German side, and Lend lease Shermans and White Scout Cars, and assault engineers on the Soviet side.

The scenarios are rules-neutral, so feel free to adapt them for use with your favorite rules system.
This book will have all you need to game this battle out and will be a jumping point to research even more actions set in and around Kustrin.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Froot Loops Frenzy Game
description:
Get ready to dance along with Toucan Sam in Froot Loops Frenzy! Move and groove with Toucan Sam as you choose Froot Loops from his spoon. Will you be able to keep the loop, or will you have to add it to his bowl? The longer he dances the more he moves, until his signature 360 spin will send the Froot Loops flying! Can you be the first to collect all your Froot Loops to win? Get your groove on and play Froot Loops Frenzy!

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Electronic, Music

name: El gran juego de circulación vial
description:
Board game in which children learn to move safely in their closest environment, respecting safety and coexistence rules.
Traffic signs trivia game.

name: Correr el encierro en pamplona
description: The game consists of completing a four-section bullfight while avoiding the horns and hooves of the opponents. The first to arrive does not win, but rather the one with the most points. Bravery is especially valued, such as running close to the bull, being trampled by a bull, or being gored.

name: Le grande course de chevaux
description: The game is basically a horse race with obstacles where you have to roll dice to advance. The winner will be the first to cross the finish line.

name: Nebelmeer
description:
The Sea of ​​Mists is capricious and changeable. In this world, even islands can change their location, and enemy ships can appear at any time. Each player will command their own fleet of powerful airships, and by fighting and expanding your economic supply, you will try to gain more victory points than your opponents or destroy three enemy harbors. There are several paths to victory, but only one commander will become the lord of Nebelmeer!

Nebelmeer is a strategy game of battling airships in a fantasy steampunk world of floating islands. The gameplay is divided into turns, which individual players take until the winner is determined. As the game progresses, players unlock subsequent acts (maximum 4), which give them access to new buildings and better airships. The game ends in one of three cases:


The last act IV victory point token is collected - the player who has collected the most points wins (the tokens have different values, from 2 to 4).
One player destroys 3 enemy harbors - this player automatically wins the game.
One player is eliminated (there are no harbors or airships). In a 2-player game, the opponent immediately wins. In a game with 3 or 4 players, the game ends immediately and the player with the most victory points wins. In a 2 vs 2 game, the team with the highest total victory points wins.


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Map Deformation, Multi-Use Cards, Open Drafting, Ownership

name: Band of Ogres
description:
Band of Ogres is a push-your-luck, set-collection, auction card game with an ogre-musician battle-of-the-bands theme. First players assemble sets of ogre musician cards through Gin Rummy-style set-collection. Then they use a push-your-luck deck in an effort to get as many matches as possible between the push-your-luck cards and their set of ogre musician cards. Then they use the gold they gained through these matches to bid on “Win” cards that provide victory points or special powers.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction: Once Around, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Going Up? An Elevator Card Game
description:
Going Up? An Elevator Card Game is a casual party game combining elements of games like "99" and "Uno" in which players takes turns playing a card from their hand to move the "Elevator" a set number of floors, based on the value of the card. If a player can’t play a card without moving the elevator below the 1st floor or above the 99th, they’re out. The last player standing wins!

To make things more interesting, there are special cards scattered throughout the deck that can shake things up, buying you a breather or putting the pressure on your friends. Will you hoard these cards to protect yourself, or will you risk everything to catch your opponents off-guard? Play your cards right, and victory will be yours!

Players take turns strategically playing cards from their hands in an attempt to keep the "Elevator" between floors 1 and 99. The Elevator starts on floor 1 going up. Each numbered card that's played adds its numbered value to the Elevator. However, players can also flip the Elevator's direction to going down, at which point numbered cards subtract their value from the Elevator.

name: Death Valley: Highs & Lows
description:
Death Valley is a pocket-sized, push-your-luck, tableau-building game for 1-2 players, with each traveler striving to assemble the best mix of cards in their journey and scrapbook in order to win the game.

Each turn, players choose whether to assign a card to their journey, or move cards from their journey to their scrapbook. Cards feature stars (points), special abilities (which affect the value and position of cards), and some interesting facts about Death Valley. Each card also lists a hazard: heat, terrain, flood or animals. Having three of the same hazard visible in their tableau causes the player to bust and lose all the progress in their journey.

At the end of the game, players sum the stars and substract the skulls in their journey, and any additional points from card abilities to determine who wins.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game, Take That

name: SurvivoRoll
description:
It is the year 2215 and the world is a barren wasteland, filled mostly with raiders that will kill you the first chance they get. You and your troupe have been living deep in the mountains away from such raiders, but there is a storm heading your way, and the only way to survive is to head towards the haven you have heard tale of.

Packing up your things you head over the mountains in search of refuge. Be careful and move quickly, because whether at the hand of the storm or the hand of raiders you do not want to get stranded without supplies.


SurvioRoll is a solitaire roll and write in which you are rolling to survive. Using a timer, roll dice as often as you want trying to hit the requirements before time runs out. Along the way you will gain water that you will need to give troupe members, bullets you will need to fight off bandits, and extra troupe members that will help you complete objectives.

So grab 10 dice, a timer, a writing utensil, and print off one of the game sheets and see how you fair! Will you make it to the end, or will your name be lost to the desert?

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Dice, Fighting, Modern Warfare, Print & Play, Puzzle, Real-time
mechanics: Action Timer, Connections, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Hand Management, Paper-and-Pencil, Re-rolling and Locking, Resource to Move, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Track Movement

name: Monopoly: University of Nebraska
description: Object. Buy Sell! "Pass GO and Collect $200!" Or"Go directly to Jail!" All the fun and excitement of Parker Brothers classic real estate trading game is here in this University of Nebraska Edition. Increase the value of your properties by adding houses and hotels. Amass the greatest fortune in money and property and you're the winner!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Adivina Adivinador 2
description:
After the success of Adivina Adivinador... We released a new, pocket-sized version!

Adding dynamics for adults and children. Players must act, imitate sounds and be very creative with their explanations to earn points.

GREAT GAME FOR GROUPS AND MEETINGS!

How to explain that the phone is busy? How to imitate the sound of a spring? How to mime the full moon?

With this game you will be able to explore your expressive capacity 100%.

Players must draw cards where a picture is shown and get their partners to guess it. To do this, he must make sounds, mimic or explain what he sees, as indicated on the card taken out. Also, bring 10 action cards to give it more difficulty. The team that manages to guess the most cards is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Line Drawing, Storytelling, Team-Based Game

name: Kids Cookie Shop
description:
Kids Cookie Shop is a fun family card game themed with your favorite cookies and friends from the Kids Cookie Break Show. Players compete against each other by collecting cookies to fill customer orders. The first player to fill enough orders wins. It seems simple enough... but add some tricky action cards and the craziness begins! Kids Cookie Shop is designed to be customized, players can pick through customers of various difficulties to make game play easier for younger players or a bit harder for players that need a challenge. And with lots of options, the game can be different every time you play!

—description from the publisher

name: Tổ tôm
description:
Tổ tôm or Tụ tam bài (聚三牌) is a draw-and-discard card game played in Vietnam, usually by men. The game is often played at festivals. It is derived from the Chinese game of Khanhoo.

The game uses a type of Chinese money-suited pack consisting of 120 cards. The head and foot of the card give the rank and suit in chữ Hán. During French colonial rule, the Marseilles firm Camoin redesigned the deck to depict people wearing traditional Japanese costumes from the Edo period.[3] There are three suits: Cash (文, Văn), Strings of Cash (索, Sách), and Myriads of Strings (萬, Vạn). Each suit is divided into ten ranks with the highest cards being the Half Cash, Zero String, and Old Man respectively. There are four copies of each card unlike its four-suited kin, Bài bất.

name: Cờ vòng quanh thế giới
description:
Cờ vòng quanh thế giới is a multi-player economics-themed board game in Vietnam. In the late 80s, chess sets were widely sold in bookstores and toy stores nationwide. The original purpose is to teach children how to count numbers and learn more about national flags and famous landmarks. Later, even adults became interested in this form, becoming a pastime for the family to gather together.
Cờ vòng quanh thế giới has quite simple gameplay, each player takes their turn in turn.

During your turn, you roll the dice. From the number of points on the dice, you check which number corresponds to the indication in the box where you stand. Then you move your piece to a new square as directed. In case you roll a number of points that is not listed in the instructions, you must stand still.
The winner of the Round the World game is the one who moves first to the center square or Vietnam square, which means they have completed one Round the World. The others can continue playing until there is only one player left who has not returned to the Center box or started a new game.

name: Clash of Fleets: Naval Warfare of World War II
description:
Clash of Fleets is a miniature tabletop wargame focussing on World War II naval combat.

While we had World War II in mind, it is possible to adapt these rules to World War I scenarios easily, omitting any aircraft except spotters and only using generic torpedo rulers.

You can play any size of game ranging from skirmishes with just a few smaller ships to larger fleet actions following some simple tweaks.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: War with the Allies to Berlin
description:
"War with the Allies to Berlin" is a wartime game and the race is on to see which of the Allies could get to Berlin first. Players choose one of the allied forces to advance on Berlin starting from different points in Europe, Players pass through various towns and cities by roll of a dice. Special spots on the way are colored black or yellow to advance or retreat. First to Berlin in the winner.

—user summary

name: Frayed Ally
description:
Frayed Ally is a party card game filled with deduction, strategy, and explosive misfortune for 3-6+ players.

In the untamed streets of Sewer City, a battle for survival unfolds. Don the cloak of a random crafty character, each with their own unique special ability that can be used at pivotal moments to outlast your adversaries. The villain with a thirst for power and destruction, commands an army of loyal minions, determined to take down all rival animals. Rivals on the other paw are fighting for glory, battling to deal the final blow that defeats the villain and become champion of the city. However if no villain is in play, it becomes a classic battle royale, last character standing.

Strategically wield an array of action cards to outmanoeuvre your opponents, use them to your advantage to boost your defences or enhance your attack but beware of traps hidden within the deck. Traps create an added element of danger, they will deal instant damage to disrupt your carefully crafted plans and are especially dangerous end game.

With every successful attack, characters collect skull tokens to track damage taken until they inevitably fall. When critical with only one health point remaining, a player must reveal their character by flipping it face up on the field and that's how you discover who is in play. Revealed characters are now at your most vulnerable but also at their strongest. Special ability can be used once at any time per reveal to help claw back to the top.

The path to victory lies within the paws of the craftiest Frayed Ally.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hidden Roles, Lose a Turn, Player Elimination

name: Galaxy Fighters
description:
Get ready for an interstellar showdown with Galaxy Fighters, the arcade-inspired co-operative strategy game!

Brace yourself as you step into the role of a valiant defender tasked with safeguarding one of the four districts of Galaxy City from an imminent alien space invasion. The fate of the city hangs in the balance as waves of relentless Exovon extraterrestrials descend from the cosmos.

Armed with a custom ship, embark on a heart-pounding mission to thwart the invaders and ensure the survival of humanity's last stronghold. Shield your ships from damage, strategize your every move, and blast through swarms of Exovon aliens with your state-of-the-art weaponry.

Only your team’s cunning tactics and unwavering determination will stem the tide of invasion and secure the future of Galaxy City. Will you and your friends rise to the challenge and become the ultimate Galaxy Fighters?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Lethal Check Mate
description:
リーサルチェックメイト (Lethal Check Mate) is a Chess-style game from Japan that uses cards to move and attack. The game board is only 3x4 and each player has only a single pawn on the board. It is the specialised cards that let a player either move or attack with their pawn.

Played cards build up, so a player might play a Centaur card to attack the column ahead, and then play a Rook card to move a pawn sideways, which now combines with the attack to do damage to the opponent. Each attack does one damage to the opponent, and players start with 3 Hit Points (HP). Each loss also increases the player's hand size, from 3 cards to 4 to 5 cards. The first to zero is the loser.

However, a player can opt to lose a hit point in order to deal as much damage as their hand allows. Hence the game being lethal. A player can even be on 1 HP and still do a lethal attack to win.

The board also rotates. When a player advances a piece to the opponent's back row, the board turns 180 degrees. The cards remain in play, so by the board changing position, the opponent's attack might suddenly be useless, or the player's pawn might now have a valid attack.

The game comes with the 3x4 chequer board, 4 pawns (one to play and one to score for each player), and a deck of 11 cards each, one for scoring your HP, one player aid listing the card powers, and nine cards to play.
user summary
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Map Deformation, Sudden Death Ending, Variable Player Powers, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Prismatic
description:
Immerse yourself in a vibrant and mesmerizing adventure as you Build, Create, and Win!

In Prismatic, you strategize, plan, and compete to construct captivating creations using motes of color and prisms to earn the most stars. Bring your imagination to life while gathering resources and testing your strategy. Will you emerge as the ultimate master of light and color, illuminating your game nights? Play with friends and family, and let Prismatic shine brilliantly on your path to colorful glory and a palette of possibilities!

Prismatic is a competitive strategy card game for 2-4 players, where you draw motes of vibrant colors from your bag and use them to craft stunning creations. Fill your creation cards with motes, earn stars, and prove your mastery of light and color. The player that builds the most valuable creation cards wins.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Delayed Purchase

name: Monopoly: Predators of the Deep Edition
description:
Get up and close and personal with your favorite sharks in Monopoly: Predators of the Deep Edition!

Take your knowledge of these fascinating fish to new depths as you buy, sell, and trade discoveries about your favorite species, including the Great White Shark, Megamouth, Tiger Shark, and more! Explore the board with deep sea-inspired tokens and build your collection Camera Tags and Satellite Tags. Outswim the competition and be the last one with Shark Teeth currency to win!
categories: Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Nautical, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Monopoly: Branson Edition
description: Whether you check out the Strip with friends or take a road trip through the Ozarks with your family, you are sure to fine some fun! Enjoy some live shows and attractions or take on some lakeside adventures, either way, your days will be filled with fun and excitement. Experince everything Branson's IMAX Entertainment Complex offers before taking a lesurely stroll in Historic Downtown Branson to shop for a souvenir. With the Runaway Mountain Coaster, Silver Dollar City, and taking in the sites from atop the Branson Ferris Wheel, Branson is an action-packed city that is ideal for thrill seekers. No matter how you spend the day, don't forget to end it by watching the sunset on Table Rock Lake from Branson's Nantucket Resort. You'll be able to explore all of this and more with the Branson Edition of Monopoly!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Shape Cycle
description:
Shape Cycle is a quick but thinky card-drafting game where players compete to create the most efficient chains of interconnected shapes.

Each player's cards are not only connected to themselves, but also to the cards of every other player, creating a thought provoking puzzle that requires constant adaptation to opponents' strategies.

Combining quick, engaging gameplay with deep decision making, Shape Cycle will challenge your mind and leave you eager for more!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Connections, Matching, Open Drafting, Pattern Building

name: DELVE: Biomes
description:
The world opens up beneath us Overseer. A wealth of new Biomes to explore, Rooms to Build, and Units to Hire as we continue our search for the fabled Void Crystal. But be warned, with new opportunity comes new danger and there are rumours among the loremasters and miners about terrible things lurking in the shadows.

This expansion to the solo map drawing game DELVE is all about Biomes which are unique areas with their own Natural Formation (♣) and Remnant (♠) tables, Artefacts, Enemies, Achievements and even Biome specific gameplay mechanics.

There are 14 Biomes in this Expansion, each of which can randomly be found by Drawing an Ace while Exploring. From the simple Ant Colony to the fabled Hall of the Gods, any Overseer willing to brave these Biomes will find great reward and terrible risk.

name: No Going Back
description:
STORY
"In the heart of our once-peaceful land, a formidable menace has pitched its sinister camp, unleashing hordes of malevolent minions upon innocent towns and villages. As with all good quests, this one begins in a dimly lit tavern, where you, the intrepid leader, rally a fearless band of companions. Together, you embark on a relentless quest, charging headlong into the chaos, leaving nothing but destruction in your wake.

The unknown malevolent evil, once an ancient guardian of the land, was corrupted by a primeval and sinister artifact hidden deep within the realm. This artifact, long sealed away to prevent its dark powers from being unleashed, has now resurfaced, and the unknown evil entity has fallen under its sinister influence. Driven by the artifact's insidious whispers and promises of untold power, the corrupt guardian seeks to plunge the land into chaos and darkness, believing that only through such chaos can they fully harness the artifact's terrible might. As the land's last hope, your band of heroes must confront the corrupted evil, break the artifact's hold, and restore peace to the realm before it's too late.

There's no retreat, and there's no going back! The fate of the land rests in your hands."

OBJECTIVE
Step into the shoes of one of up to five courageous characters who have taken it upon themselves to combat the malevolent force that has gripped the land, unleashing hordes of nefarious bad guys upon the unsuspecting population. In this epic tale, you are the heroes, the champions of good, and the central figures driving the narrative. Brace yourselves as you plunge headlong into uncharted peril!

No Going Back is a cooperative adventure, where it's either victory for all or defeat for all. Your mission: survive the treacherous journey, gather potent weapons and formidable armour, and ultimately confront and vanquish the evil forces to secure victory. But it's no walk in the park; peril lurks at every turn, and arriving unprepared to face the Final Boss could prove fatal — you might encounter anything from dragons to rock monsters! The Urgency tracker will dictate the intensity of attacks from goblins, orcs, evil mages, and even the undead, while random Events may either aid your team or further complicate your quest.

For those truly seeking a challenge, lead your team on a daring campaign to conquer every Boss character in the game, retaining your hard-earned items and upgrades for the next leg of your journey.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Map Addition, Modular Board, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Cloudsdale Grand Prix
description:
The amber light flashes, and forty-five pairs of wings snap open at the starting gate. Steely eyes of all colours stare down their neighbours just as intensely as they stare down the vortex-laden, magical-warp-portal-strewn drag strip of floating rings that separates them from the rainbow finish line.

Welcome to Cloudsdale! The Grand Prix has begun, the sponsors have arrived, and crowds look to the skies to catch a glimpse of their favourite superstar daredevils streaking overhead.

YOU will play one of these superstar daredevils! In this unique racing game, the number of racers that are packed together with you determines your speed for each turn. You must manage your pack, draft appropriate bonus abilities over five races, and end up with the most Grand Prix Points overall.

(This game is a work of MLP:FIM fan fiction. I have no affiliation with Hasbro, Lauren Faust, the Hub, or F1 Racing.)

—description from the designer
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play, Racing
mechanics: Matching, Modular Board, Movement Points, Open Drafting, Race

name: Peeps Fight PNP
description:
The game is a martial arts duel between 2 combatants.

Each player control a peep(fighter) and their objective is to reduce your opponents life to 0.

The Life is defined by dice. Which are rolled once when placed on the board and then they keep the values.

The game is devided into Rounds which are devided into Turns.

At the beginning of each Round you gain an amount of Energy(dice), that maybe used as Power, Speed or Reserved for the next Round.

You can move your Peep and perform techniques to damage your oponent or defend against your opponent. And always take into consideration your and your oponent's energy.

The techniques are represented by cards, with each peep having its own unique deck.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fighting, Print & Play

name: Rabe, Frosch und Fips
description:
The cards are dealt among the players and each player pay 10 coins for each of his cards. Then the players take turns to roll the five symbol dice and one number die.

If symbols are rolled, the owners of the corresponding cards get coins from the toll, accordingly to the rolled number.

If a player rolls his own symbol, he has to pay coins into the toll.

If no symbol is rolled, the owner of the frog gets the coins from the player who rolled die dice.

Whomever owns the most coins after the toll is cleared an agreed on number of times wins the game.

—user summary

name: Hummeln
description:
Each player receives 5 bumblebees (figures) of the same color, which he places on the four-leaf clover in the circles of his color. The task of the game is to bring all the bumblebees onto the inner disk with the picture of the bumblebees. The game is over as soon as this happens the player succeeds and that player wins the game.

The players take turns to roll and move. As long as the player does not have a bumblebee in circulation on the rings, he rolls the die and tries to throw the number 1 or 6 to bring a bumblebee into the game. As often as the bumblebee comes to stand on a sun after the move has been made, the player rolls the die again and moves on with the same bumblebee in such a way that when the bumblebee comes to stand on the sun on a black surface, he moves on in the same ring. When the bumblebee comes to stand on the sun on a white surface, in the following move it passes over to the sun one ring further inwards and continues on this new ring.

If comes to a ring occupied by a foreign bumblebee, the player lets this foreign bumblebee return to its cloverleaf. He then makes another move with this bumblebee of his, as if He had stopped on the sun. If, after completing the move, the bumblebee comes to a ring that is occupied by its own bumblebee, both return to their cloverleaf.

If the bumblebee stops on a flower, the player transfers it to the inner white disk with the image of the bumblebees. After such a transfer, however, the player places a new bumblebee from the cloverleaf into the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Static Capture, Track Movement

name: Zwerg Pfiffikus auf der Wanderschaft
description:
First, each player has to pay 4 coins into the game cash register, after which the dice roll begins. Whoever rolls a 6 first gets the dwarf Pfiffikus figure and begins the game.

The players take turns to roll and move. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first player to reach space 160 wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Schreibmaschine-Spiel "Rund um Europa"
description:
The Players take turns to roll and move. Placement is on Space 2 to 6 (space 1 is not in play). The outer, unboxed keys: shift key, lock key, backspace key, etc. are not taken into account in the game, but the intermediate spaces filled with fingers or pictures count. All throws are made when moving from the left to the right half of the game and vice versa using the space key.
At the goal, both space 2 and 1 are considered to have reached the goal. Throws beyond the target do not count. The first payer to reach his goal space wins the game. There are 7 game variants which differ in the use of the special dice.

The game was made as a promotional for "Olympia" typewriters ("Modell 8" was produced from 1930 to 1939).

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Auto-Game: Ich sehe was, was...
description:
A game played whilst in a car journey.
A card is drawn.
Players try to be the first to see the item shown on the card or give clues and let their fellow players guess the item on the card. The player who solves the observation first takes the card. Game ends when the deck is used up and the winner is the player who has the most cards.

name: Logos
description:
1st game:
2 people play against each other on 2 number areas each with 12 figures of one color. The numbers from 1-16 in the area are arranged in such a way that 4 specific spaces result in the number 34. One can form the number 34 in over 70 different ways. The players take turns placing a figure in a number space with the aim of reaching 34 with 4 figures as quickly as possible and preventing each other from doing so by cleverly placing them in between. Once a player has reached 34, he calls out “is” and robs his opponent of a piece of his own choice, just not from a closed “is”. The winner is whoever robs the opponent of all but 3 figures. 2 or 4 people can play this way, on 2 areas each. If there are 6 or 8 participants, two players each play against each other, but only on one area with 6 pieces of one color each. Here, for an “Is” no figure is stolen, but 1 point is added; The number of points to be achieved is determined in advance.

2nd game:
In each area, 2 people can play with 5 figures of one color each. Whoever rolls one puts his figure on space one, rolls the dice again and advances the figure by the number he rolls. The path crisscrosses the 16 spaces. If a player rolls onto an occupied field, the throw is invalid, but if he already has several figures in play, he can carry out this forward movement with another one, as long as the space reached is free. The path goes over the 16 spaces to the 8 white spaces , always starting with the smallest space. From there it goes through the 5 spaces in the pyramid into the SOS-space, where only the O is occupied. But the O must be touched with every figure. From here go straight to the middle via the 31st, 32nd, 33rd and 34th to the 35th red space. Whoever has reached this space places his figure in one of the 5 yellow spaces. The first player to get his 5 figures on the 5 yellow spaces wins the game. One may also play around the whole game board.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Coverage, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Der Siegeszug unserer jungen Wehrmacht
description:
The players take turns to roll and move to travel europe as war correspondents. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first to reach space 147 (Leningrad) wins the game.

German propaganda game from WWII.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Prepare!
description:
Prepare! is a family friendly, pandemic inspired card game. We love playing games. We wanted a card game that could make a little fun of the current pandemic. We took elements of the card games we love, added in the pandemic, and you have Prepare! (From the publisher)

Prepare! is played similar to "Go Fish," with a pandemic/lock down humor twist. Players each start with 7 cards, and play passes to the left. On each turn, a player draws a card and can match 3 of a kind (ex: face masks, water bottles, toilet paper, etc), and place it visible to other players once three of a kind are acquired. Once the three of a kind are placed down, they are your safe supply, and cannot be stolen or asked for anymore through the game. A player may receive and can optionally play an Action Card (steal a card, ask for a card, draw cards). Play continues to the left throughout the rest of the game, until all deck supply runs out. At the end of the game, the player with the most points from their three of a kind sets wins. (Optional for younger kids: you can count how many matching sets, and the person with the most sets win, as opposed to points).

name: Kingscraft: Benno / Benno der Gerissene Promo Card
description:
Double-sided promo card, included with Pirate Tales.

Front: "Benno"
Power: D6×D12
Speed: 4
Special Ability: "Pirate Flag" - After losing a battle against "Benno", the losing player must return one of their items of their choice (other than a potion) to the forge.

Back: "Benno der Gerissene"
Power: D6×D12, 1×re-roll
Speed: 4
Special Ability: "Pirate Flag" - After losing a battle against "Benno", the losing player must return one of their items of their choice (other than a potion) to the forge.

name: Favela Venceu
description:
We all want a safer and more comfortable community to live in. But we know that this responsibility lies in our own hands.
Come and help create a better favela for everyone in this strategy game.

In Favela Venceu you have a mancala mechanism to select the cards that will gradually increase the community size and shape.
Each card is a domino-like, with a house and a community building (school, sports court, cultural center or police), bringing a new inhabitant and a special action to the favela.
When all the cards have been placed, the players reveal their final score cards, which will bring points based on the inhabitants, community buildings and combination between both.

name: Host a Heist Dinner Party
description:
The Host a Heist Dinner Party follows in the tradition of Dinner Party games. This is a game meant provide a unique evening experience. The host explains the back story to everyone. Loki, a thief, has stolen the sword of Avalon. The players work together to perform a heist to return the sword to the city over the course of a dinner. Players discuss how they will get into Loki’s estate, get past the guard, the security dog, and bypass his security system. The players can role play the various characters such as the team leader, safe cracker, security system specialist, guard, and animal trainer. This is a cooperative game that takes place over the course of a dinner that involves interesting dinner conversation and culminating in cracking a safe. This is creative party game requires only the Tech Deck (a deck of cards) to play.

OBJECTIVE – The objective of Host a Heist Dinner Party is to get to the safe and crack it open.
GAME PLAY – The dinner guests work through six stages of the game: the introduction story, Challenge #1: Break into Loki’s estate, Challenge #2 Foil Helblindi the guard, Challenge #3: Get past Fenrir the guard dog. The players then work to bypass the security system. Then, they work together to decode the combination to crack Loki’s safe to retrieve the Sword of Avalon.
GAME END AND WINNING – Player collectively win by cracking the safe.
THEME – Host a Dinner Party Game

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Memory, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Cooperative Game, Deduction, Finale Ending, Matching, Memory, Pattern Building, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Storytelling

name: Flattops & Floating Fortresses: Mediterranean Thunder
description:
Step into the thrilling naval epic of World War II's Mediterranean theater with this scenario reference for Flattops & Floating Fortresses, World War II naval tabletop wargame.
Fight legendary naval clashes inspired by real-life naval battles, including audacious maneuvers of the Regia Marina versus the unwavering determination of the British Royal Navy. Take command of historic warships like the Barham, Formidable or Vittorio Veneto and Andrea Doria. Can you lead your fleet through intense engagements to victory at sea?

Experience captivating scenarios like the infamous Battle of Cape Matapan, where the Royal Navy orchestrated a deadly trap to assert their supremacy over the seas.
