Feel the ferocity of the Battle of Calabria, a tense showdown between British and Italian forces with the fate of nations hanging in the balance. Engage in the heart-pounding moments of the Battle of Cape Spartivento, as both sides unleash the full force of their naval might. But Mediterranean Thunder holds more than just epic clashes. This reference explores shore bombardments and thrilling patrol encounters as well.

Assemble your fleet and navigate through the ever-changing tides of war at sea. With powerful vessels and stealthy submarines at your disposal, seize the opportunity to unleash devastating gunnery and deadly torpedoes. Mediterranean Thunder challenges you to make crucial decisions in the heat of battle, testing your strategic acumen and resolve.

Discover the fascinating stats and attributes from both Italian and British navies. Lavish illustrations bring this naval reference to life, capturing the suspense and drama of naval warfare across the azure expanse of the Mediterranean Sea.

Whether you are an experienced war gamer, naval wargame recruit, or a history enthusiast, Mediterranean Thunder offers a captivating blend of strategy, action, and immersive storytelling that will keep you hooked, returning to the fray time and time again.
Flattops & Floating Fortresses is an easy game to play for even casual gamers.
Take command, rewrite history, and secure crucial victories for your nation as you lead your fleet to triumph in the Mediterranean Thunder.
Join the battle and make waves in the destiny of nations.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: 赤いアリスと黒の騎士 (Red Alice and the Black Knight)
description:
Bored on a rainy day, Alice follows a red light to a strange land where the only colors are red and black. In fact, she's turned into a Red Alice. An angry queen accuses Alice of stealing her tarts, but Alice escapes with a new friend, the Black Knight. Join Alice and the Black Knight on their adventures!

赤いアリスと黒の騎士 ("Red Alice and the Black Knight") includes 32 cards, 14 black and 18 red. The cards are numbered, but OR cards offer a choice of numbers. This anthology includes rules for three games, each one being the designer's take on combining other popular games. Certain cards also have special effects that change from game to game.

Party (Daifugō (Tycoon) x Dabon, 2-6 players) is a climbing and shedding game with goal of getting rid of all your cards. Players must play an equal or higher number unless someone plays multiple matching cards; then players must play equal or lower numbers. If the deck runs out, the player with the most cards chooses one to keep and contributes the rest of their cards to become the new draw deck. There are also optional rules, including the ability to play all of your cards at once if you can add, subtract, multiply, or divide all the cards in your hand to equal the last card played.

In Tart (Cockroach Poker x Love Letter, 2-4 players), players attempt to guess other player's face-down cards while keeping their own secret. Players begin with three face-down cards. Each turn they play a card from their hand face-up. If they play a red card, they may guess one of another player's face-down cards. There are optional rules where different cards have special effects.

Checkmate (Chess x Rock Paper Scissors, 2 players) uses only 14 cards. Players place 5 cards from their hand face-down in front of themselves and will flip one face-up each turn. If the colors match, the higher number wins. If the colors don't match, the lower number wins. Players continue until one has won the best of five games.
mechanics: Deduction, Hand Management, Ladder Climbing, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That

name: Biblion
description:
"Whether you are a child attending Sunday schol or a Bible scholar, you can have fun and improve your knowledge of the Bible by playing BIBLION!"

Biblion is a Bible trivia game where players must roll and move across the board. Avoid Wilderness Cards that cause misfortunes and answer trivia from the Question Cards to earn 10 Staters (or other sum agreed on by all players) to win the game.

name: CoGNaC
description:
CoGNaC is a unique deck of cards with which a variety of games can be played. Each card has three aspects to it: color, gem, and number (whereas standard playing cards have two: suit and rank). The primary game uses these three aspects to take tricks. The name and unusual capitalization of CoGNaC reminds you of the rule to determine the winner of the trick: Color over Gem, gem over Number, number above Color.

The included rules will teach you how to play a beginner trick-taking game and how to add complexity with a dummy and two types of bidding (sharing similarities with the card game Bridge). Also included are suggestions for how to use this deck with 6 traditional card games: Spades, Hearts, Rummy, Gin Rummy, Crazy Eights, and President. (you must already know how to play these games with a standard deck of cards before applying these adaptations.)

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction: Turn Order Until Pass, Bids As Wagers, Constrained Bidding, Hand Management, Matching, Ownership, Predictive Bid, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Set Collection, Trick-taking

name: 卒業promenade (Graduation Promenade)
description:
Five problem students enroll at a prestigious girls' school! On their own, these bad girls are out of control. All of them at the same school will be a disaster. They're all experts in certain subjects, but at this rate they're a perfect storm for failing grades and will have to repeat a year. How did they pass their entrance exams in the first place? A three-year battle between teachers and students begins now!

In 卒業promenade ("Graduation Promenade"), players take on the roles of teachers trying to help five students pass their class. Each round or school year made up of three turns or semesters. At the end of each round, teachers gains victory points for every student who passes the Final Exam. If students fail to pass, the teacher receives a penalty.

The play area includes a Class for each player and a Schedule, made up of rows and columns of School Cards that match the colors of different students. On each turn, players take all the cards from their choice of row or column and place them under students of the same color. Depending on turn order, players may switch out cards from their hand with cards in the Schedule. If all the cards taken by a player share the same color, the player may take a Motivator (a token that counts toward the Final Exam) or a Break Card (plays like a School Card but some have special actions). Players end their turn by selecting their place in the turn order for the next round.

At the end of every third turn, players count up the points under each student to see if the pass the Final Exam, and points and penalties are given out. At the end of the third round, the player with the most victory points wins and gets to choose one used Break Card for each student. Someone reads the corresponding ending for the students, which changes depending on which Break Card is chosen for them.

This game is a remake of 業method ("Graduation Method"), a Manifest Destiny game from 2013.
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Open Drafting, Turn Order: Claim Action

name: Bad Habits Die Hard
description:
In a remote monastery the nuns are the head of a huge criminal underground. The leader of the corrupt monastery has died, leaving the position open. The nuns saw only one viable option: kill off the competition.

Your goal is to survive this unfortunate situation: 2 - 14 nuns all attempting to assassinate each other.
You will be struggling in a game of wits against 1 or 2 players at a time. Use your best judgement, your special abilities, and luck, to become the lone survivor.

GAMEPLAY DESCRIPTION:
Players are in a veritable "shoving match" with the players to their immediate left and right. All actions are played simultaneously then settled. Using attack cards, players will pit one number against the player to their left, and one against the player to their right. Whoever has the higher number will be the attacker for that round, and the other is the defender. Subtract the defenders number from the Attackers and move the pawn that many spaces toward the defender. If the pawn goes over the end of the track, the player on that end dies, and is removed from the game. Players also have a special ability to set them apart. If used wisely, it can turn the tides of the match.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection, Tug of War

name: Deep Six: A Game of Galactic Mayhem
description:
Deep Six is a fast-paced Take-That / Area Control game set on a quirky dystopian space colony.

Players choose Leaders and must defeat their opponents' Leader, vying for control of Territory Tiles, entering combat with their recruited Units, and causing havoc with powerful Glyphs and unexpected Events. Territory control shifts frequently and strategic choices are made while keeping the chaos of the randomized draw deck in mind. Just like in life: You have to deal with what you're dealt!

The core game can be played with 2 players for the standard experience, or in a 4 player 'Allies' mode that teams up players against each other.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Science Fiction, Territory Building
mechanics: Events, Interrupts, Modular Board, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Take That, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Zone of Control

name: Maladicte
description:
Maladicte is a completely insane card game where deceitful sorcerers at the forefront of immorality (you) exchange pleasantries with the help of surprising black magic. It is also a family-friendly card game whose gameplay is simple and easy to learn. The principle is to try to combine spell and curse cards to force your opponents to carry out a whole series of gestures, small tasks and language games which, by accumulating and combining, make situations just as comical as unpredictable.

Maladicte est un jeu de cartes complètement insensé où de fourbes sorciers à la pointe de l’immoralité (vous), s’échangent les amabilités à l’aide d’une surprenante magie noire. C’est aussi un jeu de cartes d’ambiance familiale dont le game play est simple et facile à prendre en main. Le principe est d’essayer de combiner des cartes de sortilèges et malédictions pour forcer vos adversaires à effectuer toute une série de gestes, petites tâches et jeux de langage qui, en s’accumulant et se combinant, rendent des situations tout aussi comiques qu’imprévisibles.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Bluffing, Card Game, Fantasy, Humor, Memory, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Command Cards, Events, Memory, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Lost in "Plane" Sight
description:
Luggage has been lost at various airports around the world.

Lost in "Plane" Sight is a deduction game where everyone knows what everyone has lost except their own.

Two to four players try to be first to recover their lost luggage, verify its contents and win each round.

Each suitcase contains one or more items, is found at a specific airport and needs a code to unlock it. Players need to determine all three secret mysteries to win.

Players draw cards and ask questions to narrow down the information they need to recover their bag.

Lasercut Components:
• 16x16 game board
• 40 airport code tiles
• 40 unlock code tiles
• 154 secret item cards
• 54 attribute cards
• 4 secrets holders
• 20 question tiles
• 40 possibility markers
• 4 dry erase boards
• 4 dry erase markers
• 12 coins valued 1-3 points.

Initial Setup:
Assemble the game board.
Give each player a secrets holder, dry erase board, dry erase marker, 10 question tiles and 10 possibility markers.
Shuffle the attribute cards and place face down in a draw pile.
Place the coins face up, nearby.

Basic Round Preparation:
Shuffle the three sets of secret tiles.
Carefully slide one number tile, one airport code tile and one item tile face down to each player.
Each player places their secrets holder over the three tiles and flips the holder over such that tiles are facing outwards.
Each player will now see the holders of the other players but not the contents of their holder.

Game Play:
Players take turns to either
Flip over an attribute card or
Ask a question or
Attempt a guess.

Flipping an Attribute Card:
When the card is revealed, all players report what is shown on other players secrets holders. Here are some examples:
If the attribute is “METALLIC” and a player’s holder has the “TRUMPET”, then tell that player they have lost a metallic item.
If the attribute is “Airport on ISLAND”, and a player’s secret holder has “Trinidad”, tell that player their location is on an island.
If the attribute is “CITY A-F”, and a player’s secret holder has “ORD - Chicago”, tell that player their city starts with a letter between A and F.
Asking a Question:
A player may ask a general question about one of their secrets.

Asking a Question:
A player may ask a general question about one of their secrets. This includes narrowing down the locker number and non-specific questions like “Can I hold my item?” or “Would my item cost less than $20?”. If you think you know what your item or location is, attempt a guess instead.

Marking Possibilities:
Place your possibility markers on items, locations and numbers you think match the answers to questions. For example, if someone tells you’re your item is green, place the markers on the green items. When you find out your item is round, remove the markers from items that are not round. Use a process of elimination to narrow down your secrets.

Attempting a Guess:
A player may attempt to guess one of their secrets by using one of their question tiles. The tile is placed on either the airport code, locker number or item. If the guess is correct, they, highlight it on your dry erase board. Otherwise, discard the question tile as it cannot be reused in this round.

A player who guesses all three secrets will get the next highest value coin. Up to three players can receive coins per round. For example, the first player to guess correctly will receive the coin with the value "3".

Winning the Game:
The player who has the most coin values at the end of three rounds is the winner. In case of a tie, the youngest player wins.

Attribute Cards:
When an attribute card is revealed, all players must inform each other when they see someone’s secret tiles matching that attribute.
Specific Attribute Missing item can be described with this attribute See cheat sheet.
Airport in … Airport is in this country or continent See cheat sheet
Airport Code Two Vowels Airport codes with two vowels Examples: OOM, ACE, ODE, EAR
Airport on Island Three airports: POS, ORK, ARE
Airport Code Contains A,E,O Examples: SEA, OLD, ART, ALL, ILE
Airport Code Letters 1st < Last The first letter of the airport code is alphabetically less than the last letter. Examples: EAS,
COO, POS, ANK.
Not: UNK, ODE.
City a-z The first letter of the city for the airport is in the specified range. Examples for
CITY G-L:
Gold Coast (OOL)
Kileem (ILE)
Will Adding x Make a 4-letter word? When the specified letter is adding to the beginning or end of the airport code, will a four-letter word be formed? Examples for adding the letter “S”:
S+EAT = SEAT
BEE+S = BEES

name: Boss Monster: The Puzzle Reward Cards
description:
The 1000-piece Boss Monster-themed jigsaw contains an envelope with instructions to only open upon completing the puzzle.

The envelope contains a boss card (King Croak, Puzzle Master) and a spell card (Secret Piece) for use in the Boss Monster card game series.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Video Game Theme

name: Blinde Kuh
description:
1. WITHOUT DICE
The playing surface is placed in the middle of the table. Now everyone tries to place the 3 game pieces (large number discs) one after the other in the spaces with the red numbers, but with their eyes closed and their faces turned away. The spaces are targeted at least from the edge of the table. The numerical values achieved are added together. The unwanted black numbers are deducted from the plus points. Whoever achieves the best result after one or more rounds wins.

2. WITH DIE
The chips are distributed evenly and placed face up in front of each player. The highest throw of the die starts the game. Each player rolls the die once and covers the number he rolled on the game board with his chip of the same number. Plus and minus signs in front of the numbers do not count.For the numbers 7, 8, 10, 15 and 25 you roll the die continuously until this number is reached. Exceeding the number does not count and the next player continues rolling the die.
The winner is the first person to cover the game board with their number chips.

name: Supremacy 2021: BRIC & Minors
description:
A Supremacy 2021 Expansion --

Minor areas are no longer undefended! A set of armies and navies to supply Minor countries with their own armed forces.

The BRIC Scenario is a variant of the base game you can play with 2-6 players, who will win?

name: Supremacy 2021: War on Terror
description:
Fight the war on terror in the modern age of nuclear conflict!

Pirates can blockade and interrupt sea lanes. Terrorists can pop up anywhere on the planet. They can launch suicide attacks, seize control of undefended areas and even steal nuclear warheads! If you attack them, they can simply run away.

Their insidious spread can cause real damage without a concerted effort to keep them in check. Ignored they can grow into a new Islamic superpower!

—description from the publisher

A new player controls the Terrorists. The Terrorist player has no home country areas or capitals. They can never be conquered or destroyed, but will rise up from other conflicts.

—user summary

name: Numbalaya
description:
This is a print-and-play game that requires 3 6-sided dice and a pencil.

Numbalaya is a roll-and-write game inspired by 3 different concepts from mathematics: Prime numbers, functions and graphs, and the Fibonacci sequence. Feel the excitement!

But don’t worry – knowledge of these subjects is not a prerequisite to enjoying Numbalaya. To succeed in Numbalaya, you will need to adeptly choose which dice and which action to use. But beware! The die you don’t choose can be just as important.

Each round, any player rolls all 3 dice which will be used by all players. Each player will allocate 2 of the 3 dice to an Action which they will perform, then the remaining die will be allocated to the Single Die Track. Play another round unless your game has ended which happens when you allocate the 6th die of the same number to the Single Die Track.

Highest score wins! Solo players should evaluate themselves against the bell curve.

-description from designer

name: The Shivers: The Ominous Observatory
description:
A new room has appeared in Fogmoor Manor, an ancient observatory! Through its large windows, and using its archaic scientific instruments, you are able to spot strange things in the skies over Fogmoor Cove. Can you solve the mystery of what is moving amongst the starry heavens?

-description from designer
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Murder/Mystery

name: SPELL'T!
description:
This new and exciting game is called SPELL’T! SPELL’T! is a spelling bee-based game where both spelling and listening skills are tested.

Teams will take turns facing off spelling words as a group. They will spell the words letter by letter, person by person, in a clockwise direction. Words are chosen from a deck of cards called SPELL'T! cards. Spell the word right as a team and you are awarded points. Spell the word wrong however, and a challenger round occurs.

In a challenger round you’ll be asked to define words and wager points before spelling attempts. The incorrect team will start by reading a word to the opposing team, where they will need to define the word and elect to spell or not.

There are 4 wild cards in the game called “Bee” Cards, which allow you to skip turns, skip words, double down points, or take a second chance at spelling.

The games are played to 150 points. It’s fun and appropriate for ages 10 and up, and only requires a minimum of 4 players. How well can you spell?

-description from designer

name: Rome & Her Rivals: A Blood of Ancients Sourcebook
description:
Experience the intensity and excitement of ancient warfare in an exciting and fun tabletop miniature wargame.
Immerse yourself in the epic battles of the ancient world with Rome & Her Rivals' army lists and thrilling scenarios for some of the most famous and pivotal battles of the Roman era.

Rome & Her Rivals also offer comprehensive guides on how to play Blood of Ancients with or without a hex grid, and how to effortlessly convert your game to any scale of miniatures.
Use any collection of figures at any scale to recreate the most iconic battles of the ancient world.
Blood of Ancients' elegant charge and counter-charge rules, allow you to experience an interactive thrill of ancient warfare like never before.
Blood of Ancients core rules are recommended but not required to use these rules.

—Description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame

name: Kit Escape Game Famille: L'île du T-rex
description:
Your team of explorers have been transported to Jurassic, and is facing dinosaurs. You have 60 minutes to find a way to come back to our present time.
This is a complete kit to organize escape games within the family or group of kids.

—user summary

Un kit complet pour organiser des parties d’escape game réussies en famille ou lors d’anniversaires et de fêtes. Votre groupe d’explorateurs se retrouve nez à nez avec des dinosaures, transportés en plein jurassique. Vous avez 60 minutes pour revenir à votre époque.

Le matériel comprend :
- 48 cartes/énigmes
- 1 grimoire de 16 pages
- 1 lettre aux aventuriers
- 1 grand plan de l’île avec des gages
- 10 tuiles à découper
- 2 jetons « T-rex » et « aventurier »

—description from the publisher

name: Romeo and Juliet
description:
Can you help two star-crossed lovers escape the clutches of their prejudiced families? Romeo and Juliet is a card game for the whole family based on Shakespeare’s famous play.

2 to 5 players must outmanoeuvre the other players to guide Romeo and Juliet to safety and true love in Verona. Gameplay is easy to learn but challenging to master.

10 cards are placed face-down on the table representing the city of Verona. Hidden among the cards are Romeo and Juliet. players take turns secretly looking at and switching places of cards.

The player who manages to move Romeo and Juliet to their meeting place, and then reveal them wins the round and gets a point. At intervals, a player is forced to turn a card face-up for the rest of the game. Should both Romeo and Julia end up revealed this way, the revealing player has lost the round and everyone else gets a point.

The first player to score 3 points wins the game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deduction, Matching, Memory, Passed Action Token, Push Your Luck, Score-and-Reset Game

name: Mine 77
description:
Factory 42 is a bustling hub of Dwarven innovation, where diligent Odrixian laborers work hard for the betterment of society. The Overseer frequently shouts, "More materials are needed for today's orders,” shouts the Overseer, with monotonous regularity “We need to improve! The Motherland needs our best!" This prompts a worker, Isabella, to rush to the office under the watchful eye of the Commissar to fill out an acquisition order.

As she starts to write, she happens to glance at the top of the page and sees the workers who will have to fulfill this order. It’s the workers at Mine 77. Isabella chuckles at the thought of them struggling with this demand, remembering her former experiences working in the mine. She recalls the vast complex of underground fields, caves, and caverns drilled through the city's bowels and the long weary days spent toiling there. In Mine 77, workers work four days in two shifts, with only a brief on-site rest to break the tedium.
Fortunately, she is now too old to be sent back to the mine.
Age has its perks.

Mine 77 is a prequel game to Factory 42 that simulates the inner workings of Odrixia's largest mine. It is here that the valuable resources are gathered for the Factory. As you play the game, you will experience the hard work, cunning, and outright shenanigans required to become a successful Overseer at Mine 77.

Up to five players compete to become the most productive Overseer, manipulating their workers and tasks to achieve a profitable balance of hard work, difficult administration, and copious quantities of beer. The game comes with two solo AI variants. The AI may also be used as an additional worker in 2p game.

Mine 77 uses a dual-rondel mechanic and simultaneous action selection, spiced with some deck-building elements. And there are two different NPCs to offer an opponent to battle against when no human opponents are available.

name: Natal Seas
description:
Natal Seas is an ocean themed, dynamic-territorial game played on the cells ('waters') of a hexagonal grid in the shape of the Pacific Ocean. Each piece abstractly represents a pod of Orcas or Humpback whales.'
The goal is to add and move your pods until the other player's pods are permanently excluded from over half the waters of the board.

To start, one player places

2 Orcas pods anywhere on the board, and
1 grey Humpback pod next to one of them.


Then the other player chooses which kind of pods to play.

Humpbacks begin the regular alternating turns.

Each turn has:

A. two required 'birthing' actions (placements), and
B. a maximum of one 'migration' action (optional movement)


The migration may be taken at anytime during the turn.

The 'Birthing' Action:
consists of placing a new pod on 'water safe for birthing', that is an unoccupied water cell next to more friendly than unfriendly pods.

The 'Migration' Action:

One pod begins migrating around another pod (of either type) by moving to a cell of open water that is next to them both.
The first pod may continue to skirt pods in this manner for as far as it likes.


-- HOWEVER, The migrating pod may never:
-- * move to or through water that is safe for unfriendly birthing; that is, it may not move to water that has more unfriendly than friendly pods around it. Be sure to count the migrating pod when comparing.
-- * move away from all the neighboring pods, even if it would reach other pods by doing so.

Natal Seas:
Areas that the unfriendly pods can no longer ever enter are called 'natal seas' because they are effectively reserved for the birthing of friendly whale pods.

Ending the game:
When your pods, together with all your natal seas cover over half the board, you win. If you are the player that set up the first three pieces, you win when you cover exactly half the board, as well.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Environmental, Nautical, Print & Play, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Chaining, Enclosure, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Zone of Control

name: Lucrum
description:
The king is dead and there is no clear heir. You are the leader of a noble family seizing on the opportunity to capture the throne for yourself.

Lucrum is a two player strategy board game where you and your opponent attempt to claim the throne by raising the most gold. Careful deployment and strategic application of force in battle, along with securing key terrain features are all needed as you vie to accumulate the most wealth.

Players use advantage tokens to move units across the board, accumulate wealth and influence battles during the six turns of the game before finally tallying up their gold to see who has successfully claimed the throne.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Advantage Token, Grid Movement, Moving Multiple Units, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Coral Sea Carrier Clash: Scenario for Flattops & Floating Fortresses
description:
In this thrilling high-seas scenario for Flattops & Floating Fortresses, we take a deep dive into one of history's most monumental naval battles.
Experience firsthand the rush and the tension as over the horizon carriers go head-to-head.
Immerse yourself in a fast-play naval battle with exciting and unexpected rules on weather, deployment, and the pursuit of unseen adversaries.
With detailed profiles and stats on the Allied and Imperial Japanese fleets, the guide offers an up-close look at renowned vessels like the Lexington, Yorktown, Shoho, Zuikaku, and Shokaku, along with a vast array of naval aircraft.
'Coral Sea Carrier Clash is more than just a scenario-it's your passport to reliving an iconic chapter of naval history!

So gear up for a gripping adventure into the depths of naval warfare, where strategy, anticipation, and the thrill of the chase will have your heart racing.

Note: This is a scenario reference book only. To best enjoy the game you'll also need access to

Flattops & Floating Fortresses advanced rules or Anchors Aweigh beginner rules
Naval models
Damage cards, threat cards and Decorations cards.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: The Shivers: The Fogmoor Museum
description:
The Shivers crew gets out of the Manor and into the surrounding town! They find themselves drawn into the Fogmoor Museum, its enormous hall filed with exotic dioramas, ancient relics, puzzling exhibits, and even an enormous skeletal dinosaur! How will they get in, how will they get out, and what will the Shivers discover when trapped inside?

This series contains four new episodes, new standees, and the enormous pop-up museum.

-description from designer
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Murder/Mystery

name: The Shivers: The Deadly Dungeon
description:
A new room is found in the depths of Fogmoor Manor, an ancient medieval dungeon! First, the Shivers crew has to find their way across a bottomless pit, or perhaps into it? Upon discovering the dungeon, they'll see a hideous iron maiden, with groaning from within. Next to it, the guillotine stands poised, ready to fulfill its lethal purpose. Will the Shivers make it out alive?

This series features 4 new episodes, new standees, and the Deadly Dungeon pop-up room.

-description from designer
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Murder/Mystery

name: C.O.R.E: Mech Warfare
description:
C.O.R.E is a fast-paced skirmish game where Mech pilots and their machines clash to further the goals of their Faction.

The mechanics behind C.O.R.E are designed to be easy to pick up, but with a depth that is very rewarding to master.

C.O.R.E will reward its players lots of great narrative moments. Will you take control of a plucky team of green pilots, eager to pick apart a veteran in a heavy Mech and make a name for themselves? Or will you build a Mech that relishes close combat, smashing buildings aside as you charge towards your foe?

Contained Within:

Complete Rules for 1/144 (10mm) scale Mech battles in a near-future Sci-Fi Cold War setting
Play two different game modes - hop right in to the action with C.O.R.E Operations or engage in total warfare with Colony War
Rules to create your own Mech units. Field endless possibilities - replicate machines from popular fiction, or create your own!
Add further flavour to your games with rules for 5 Factions
Wage war in six varied missions
Includes Mech stat cards and Colony War unit reference cards!


This product contains assets that were procedurally generated with the aid of creative software powered by machine learning.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Primordial Steel: Sword and Sorcery Skirmish Battles in a Lost Age
description:
The Earth is older than we know, our best guesses millions of years wrong.
Just as the Earth orbits the sun, so too does life on our world move in cycles.
Creatures rise, evolve and then go extinct, only to re-emerge once more.

Primordial Steel is a fast-paced miniatures skirmish game for two players, where ancient forgotten civilisations clash for power.
Designed to be miniatures agnostic and to work with players’ existing historical fantasy collections, Primordial Steel features an exciting world created by bestselling author Tracy Gregory

Featuring a unique game system that puts the focus on moment-to-moment tactics and with nine distinct factions to choose from, Primordial Steel is a game that brings the excitement of battle to the tabletop like no other.

Contained Within:

Complete Rules for 28mm scale fantastical battles in a forgotten time with an innovative turn structure.
Nine distinct and unique factions each with its own culture and rules. Each has been designed so that fantasy and historical wargamers can use their existing collections.
Six different missions.
Lore by bestselling fantasy author Tracy Gregory. Explore a dark fantasy world that was once our own.


This product contains assets that were procedurally generated with the aid of creative software powered by machine learning.

name: Tank-Duel Arcade
description:
A fast-paced and exciting game of tank-on-tank action, Tank-Duel Arcade lets you play out thrilling battles in thirty minutes or less!

All you need are 2+ Tank Models, some Dice and a Tape Measure.
Each player controls each of their tank's crew members (Gunner, Driver, and Commander) as they act out your orders in turn.
Do you activate the Gunner first to get a shot off early, or use the Driver to get a better shot into the flank of an opponent?

Tank-Duel Arcade is miniatures and scale agnostic, and can be used for battles from the dawn of WW1 to modern conflicts.

-Description from the publisher
categories: Book, Modern Warfare, Wargame, World War I, World War II

name: Z: The Last Stand
description:
The Zombies are at the gates!
Z: The Last Stand is a fantastic new tabletop game for 1 or more players as they fight their last fight against an ever growing zombie horde!

Play out solo or with some friends as you play as a survivor in a world over run by the zombie menace!
With simple yet effective game mechanics, 3 set missions, an array of familiar weapons and super-zombies, you can be sure of this being one of out best microgames yet.

Scale agnostic, just like many of our offerings, Z: The Last Stand can be played with whatever models you have to hand, at whatever scale is convinient (playing at greater than 1:1 may produce problems the Nth Level does not accept responsibility for...)

-Description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: All Aboard!
description:
"We sink!" shouts the elephant, “That mouse is too heavy!” "Don't worry!" whispers the lion, "If I eat the giraffe, we can lose a little weight."

In All Aboard! you must get your gang of animals to safety in the different boats, but be careful not to exceed their capacity, or else they will sink. Designed by Paco Yánez and illustrated by Monsuros, this fun card game can be played as a couple or in groups of up to 5 players, from 7 years old, in games lasting about 20 minutes.

Before starting, each player receives a set of 12 cards with the 12 different animals in the game (mouse, peacock, fox, octopus, monkey, sloth, elk, zebra, giraffe, lion, bear and elephant). The game is played over 4 rounds and each one consists of two phases: boarding the boats and setting sail. In the boarding phase, players will place one of the animals face up in any of the boats, taking into account that there can be no more than 3 animals in each one. In the second turn, they will place a new animal in any of the available boats, but this time face down; Finally, in the third turn a third animal will board the available boats, again face up.

At the beginning of the setting sail phase, all animal cards that have been played face down are revealed and then a check is made to see if there are two or more animals of the same species. If there are 2, they both fall in love (and the players will receive points for it). If there are 3, they fight and the boat sinks. Next, the animals activate their effects and finally the sum of the weight of the animals on board the boat is checked. If the weight of the animals is equal to or less than the weight that the boat can withstand, the animals manage to set sail and will score at the end of the game. Each player takes their animals and places them in a pile of saved animals in their playing area. If, on the other hand, the boat sinks, the animals are discarded.

Knowing when to play each animal is one of the keys to the game. However, depending on how your rivals play the cards, unforeseen situations can arise on the ships. Each animal has its own power, which can unleash chaos or balance the scales. Will you be able to save as many animals as possible?

-description from the publisher

name: Strange Occurences at Sea
description:
Strange Occurrences At Sea (SOS) is a turn based, asymmetric action game for 2 players.
One player takes command of a vessel and her crew as they brave treacherous waters on the open ocean.
The other controls a vicious sea monster, intent on sinking the misguided ship, and killing all its crew.

Each turn the monster and the crew act in turn;
can the monster sink the vessel?
Can the crew defeat the monster whilst keeping their ship afloat?

This game includes the full rules as well as a game board and some handy cut-out game pieces (although a few miniatures of your own couldn't hurt...).

-Description from the publisher

name: Fritos
description:
Set in the Blind Business universe, Fritos is a game for cooking lovers where the playing area is...a fryer! Players take control of various foods and try to survive at all costs, jumping from one side of the fryer basket to the other. When a player cannot move, they fall into the boiling oil, being fried, and (unfortunately) eliminated from the game. You must use all the cards you collect to survive and not become deliciously battered.

Fritos has three game modes: free-for-all, suitable for 2 to 6 players; the mode against the chef, a semi-co-operative version for groups of 3 to 7 players, in which one will be the chef and will try to fry the rest of the players; and team mode, in which two equal groups compete to win. Each game mode has a few different cards to tailor the experience.

After assembling the central board with nine cards, which represent spaces on the fryer grid, players begin their turns, which are divided into two phases: playing cards and moving. The first phase allows you to play as many cards as you want, with the aim of improving the position in the fryer or annoying and attacking your rivals. The second phase allows you to move 1-2 cards away. At that moment, the card you reached is revealed, then either an effect is triggered or you can claim that card to use it later.

—description from the publisher

name: Tangle Town
description:
An active and energetic game where you move the car with your finger to accomplish food delivery goals! Don’t take your finger off the car, do not topple the clock tower or move the car from the board. Gather as many points as possible to win the game!

All players work for Tangle Dash, in a highly competitive work environment where the best courier is declared the employee of the month! To win, collect the most points by completing food orders, without toppling the City Hall clock tower or removing your finger from your car (or your car from the board).

Watch out for other players’ hands and don’t get tangled!

Play the competitive or the cooperative mode in this fun family game full of humour, speed and surprising situations!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Point to Point Movement

name: Arena: The Contest – The Mythical Phoenix
description:
The Mythical Phoenix features villain cards for both incarnations of the Phoenix, in addition to a new card for the innovative Kemet Hunt rule that incorporates the Phoenix's gameplay mechanics. As a recurring antagonist throughout your campaign, the Phoenix becomes integral to your game narrative. The Penumbral Phoenix emerges as an adversary at the first level of the Kemet Hunt, while the formidable Hellfire Phoenix appears at level six.

Incorporating the Phoenix into your campaign will add an intriguing layer of novelty to the Kemet Hunt system. In the first level, the Penumbral Phoenix arrives as your opponent after the first enemy killed on a quest, entering the fray in a blaze of flames, wreaking havoc amongst nearby combatants. Should you progress to the daunting Kemet Hunt level 6, you will face the powerful Hellfire Phoenix bringing even greater challenge to your heroes.

These awe-inspiring mystical creatures, native to the Darkall continent, have been bound by Kemet's necromantic magic. They now roam the skies of Tanares, seeking out the energies of death and arriving in a spectacular fiery display.

The Phoenix undoubtedly enhances the Kemet Hunt system. Along with a refined Kemet Hunt we developed for all backers, those who pledge for the Phoenix will also have the option of using this stunning miniature and distinct villain, offering a unique new mechanic.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Miniatures, Mythology, Puzzle
mechanics: Action Queue, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Movement Points, Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Arena: The Contest – The Silver Dragon
description:
Our latest addition to the dragon family! This giant miniature comes with its own quest and Boss Fight, adding an extra layer to your Tanares Adventures main campaign without consuming your weekly gameplay time.

An extra Boss Fight during your Tanares Adventures campaign, offering a unique special reward. Includes a miniature that might even surpass our Gold Dragon in grandeur!
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Mythology, Puzzle
mechanics: Action Queue, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Movement Points, Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Skalvenia
description:
The constant struggle for power in the old land has already wearied the Jarls of the North. Rumors have it that there are still lands where no human foot has set foot. This challenge is worthy of a true Viking!

Skalvenia is an area control game, based on worker placement and deckbuilding mechanics. Players strive to reach uncharted land to establish their settlement there. However, they must not forget about the old land, wise development, and balanced access to resources. Above all, they must keep in mind their warriors and their ships, as it is through them that they will have a chance to defend against the encroachments of other players and win the race to the new land - Skalvenia!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Zone of Control

name: Malware Mayhem Hacker Duel: Chaos Edition
description:
Malware Mayhem Hacker Duel is a two-player face-off using a tower-defense style game must defend their high, medium and low value data which is placed into one of three systems. Each player also has one secret that can be moved between the systems as long as the data is still intact. The objective of the game is to capture the secret.

Each player builds cyberweapons including a botnet, trojans, and zero-day exploits that can be used to attack the opponent's systems. Each system can be defended by firewalls, anti-virus and intrusion detection systems. An attack consists of three phases: breaching the network perimeter, hacking the system, and then in a later turn attempting to capture the data and secrets.

Each hacker is assisted by an Agent who helps raise funds, restores disabled cyberweapons and defenses, or uses one of their unique special abilities (each agent has two) such as sending spam or initiating ransomware. Each hacker can employ up to two agents by hiring or firing from the pool of available agents.

The currency of the game is cryptocoins. The DarkWeb Marketplace allows weapons and defenses to be bought and stolen data to be sold.

The game includes two decks of cards which are used to collect resources and to perform special actions (or enhanced actions).

Malware Mayhem Hacker Duel, Chaos Edition features a hacker duel between the Genius supported by the Researcher agent and Anarchist hacker who is supported by the Prankster agent. Additional agents included in this set are the Vigilante and the Mafioso.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Turn Order: Role Order

name: Initial Thoughts
description:
Initial Thoughts puts a modern twist on classic trivia. We’re tempted to call it the pop-culture party game of the future, but in truth (and even better), it’s trivia designed to always remain current - even decades from now.

Instead of straight forward questions, players are dealt broad-stroke “thought” cards, each with hundreds of potential answers (e.g. Name a fictional character from a TV sitcom). The catch is their answer can only use a limited set of initials. The more initials their answer uses, the more points scored.

Add to this, a bluffing mechanic. Plus bonus cards that offer unique advantages. It’s an exciting race to the finish as players move around the board. The first to score 40 (or more) points wins. But it’ll take a winning combination smarts and strategy to get there.

-description from designer
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Deduction, Hand Management, Team-Based Game, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Arctic Riders
description:
Spring has arrived in the Arctic Circle! Players take turns trying to feed the narwhals by adding or subtracting the numbers on their cards and placing treats on the correct answers on the board. Different point values are scored when the narwhal lands on your treat or swims by. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins!

Skills Focus: Addition & Subtraction, Decision Making.

-description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math

name: Crash Test Zombies
description:
Welcome to Crash Test Zombies Propulsion labs, founded 2045 CE. Our mission is to create the safest conditions for humans. Since the failed zombie apocalypse of 2042, zombies have found gainful employment with CTZ Propulsion Labs. Each crash teaches us about impact and safety to ensure the greatest level of safety. 

Crash Test Zombies is a revolutionary game, from Roll and Write Revolution, where players are using a pizza saver table to launch their die and hopefully land it on the target. The value of the die is recorded as this is what the zombie crashed into from roller skates to ice cream trucks to UFOs. Your opponents will also launch their own dice. Doing so may result in a change to your die which you will record at the beginning of your turn before launching again. 

As you gain skill with each type of crash you will earn bonus effects such as relaunches. Points are also scores based on how many of the target rings you have landed on. Get your crash gear ready for this brand new game! Bring up to 3 friends to play on the same sheet or take on the crash test missions solo!

-description from designer

name: Crimson Eco
description:
Crimson Eco is a sci-fi, cyber/magi-punk, manga inspired tabletop skirmish game where two players battle for survival, artifacts, and high value targets in an alternate dimension.

Each player will command a squad of miniatures in fast paced combat.

On the tabletop, each squad member's training and equipment help them secure victory, interact with the battle zone...and stay alive.

-Description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Book, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Auto-Game: Kennzeichenspiel
description:
Car game, license plate game.
Which player can be the first to form a sentence or a combination of words using the letters and numbers from the license plate on the card?
The player who has the most cards wins when the deck has run out.

name: Stadt, Land, das inoffizielle Spiel für Game of Thrones-Fans
description:
No matter where you are - with this exciting City, Country, Game of Thrones edition, you'll always bring a big dose of fun to the table! In 52 categories you can test your fan knowledge and prove your creativity. The game block convinces with cool design and exciting topics - perfect for all fans of the houses Stark, Lannister and Targaryen. From simple questions to tricky categories - there's something here for everyone.
Cause of death, character or typical for the House Targaryen - dive into the world of fire and ice and test yourself and your friends - which of you is the biggest Game of Thrones expert and can fill in the categories the fastest? Factual knowledge, creativity and speed are required, only then will you manage to shout "Stop!" first. Are you ready? Then grab your pencils, get set, go!

—description from the publisher

name: Stadt, Land, das inoffizielle Spiel für Herr der Ringe-Fans
description:
No matter where you are - with this exciting City, Country, Lord of the Rings edition, you'll always bring a big dose of fun to the round! In 52 categories you can test your Middle Earth knowledge and prove your creativity. The game block convinces with cool design and exciting topics - perfect for all Tolkien fans. From simple questions to tricky categories - there's something here for everyone.
Live in Middle-earth, setting or term from the Shire - dive into the world of the Hobbits and test yourself and your friends - which of you is the greatest Lord of the Rings expert and can fill in the categories the fastest? Factual knowledge, creativity and speed are required, only then will you manage to shout "Stop!" first. Are you ready? Then grab your pencils, get set, go!

—description from the publisher
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Word Game

name: Der magische Spiel- und Rätselblock für Potterheads
description:
No matter where you are, alone or with friends - with this exciting puzzle block for Potterheads you will always have a lot of fun! Magical quizzes, bewitching crosswords and enchanting bingos - with over 10 different games, you can test your Hogwarts knowledge and put your creativity to the test. With its cool design and exciting themes, the game block will win over every Potter fan, big or small. From simple questions to tricky puzzles - there's something here for everyone.
Dive into the wizarding world and puzzle your way through the word games - or compete against your friends in "Who's going to catch the Death Eaters" or in the quiz questions! Factual knowledge, creativity and logical thinking are required to solve the tricky tasks. Are you ready to dive into the world of Harry Potter and his friends? Then grab your pencils, get set, go!

—description from the publisher
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Word Game

name: Das pferdestarke Quiz: Lia und Lea
description:
The pony-strong knowledge game from the popular social media stars.
The two pony-crazy YouTubers Lia and Lea inspire hundreds of thousands of young and old horse fans every day on their channels and take them through their everyday life on the riding stable. Whether it's a ride, a tournament or the arrival of new ponies - the camera is always with them. You can test your knowledge with their pony quiz.
More than 120 questions in three difficulty levels await you in this horse-powered quiz game. Test your knowledge: How well do you know horses and how well do you know Lia and Lea? An exciting knowledge quiz for all fans of the popular YouTubers: How many teeth does an adult horse have? What colour is Alfi? What kind of hook should you use to lead by the halter? With hidden solutions on each card, cheating is impossible! The perfect gift for all horse fans.

—description from the publisher

name: Master of Orion: Ad Astra
description:
Master of Orion: Ad Astra is a 4X game designed for 2-4 players. Choose from a roster of six unique races and become the leader of a spacefaring civilization. Manage the population, spearhead technological advancements, and oversee critical infrastructure development. Employ espionage to stop your rivals' advances, and should they fall short, ready your forces for conflict. In the end, the galaxy will yield to your indomitable will, one way or another.
At the beginning of every round, you'll engage in a technology card draft, a critical step in shaping your strategic path. You might opt for an exploration-heavy strategy, aiming to uncover and secure numerous habitable planets. Alternatively, you could adopt a more focused approach, channeling your efforts into building robust infrastructure on select, defensible systems. Regardless of your chosen path, it's imperative to familiarize yourself with the ever-changing objectives during the game. Ultimately, victory belongs to the player who amasses the highest number of victory points.

—description from the designer'
categories: Civilization, Exploration, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Income, Moving Multiple Units, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Tile Placement, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Erben oder Sterben: Das offizielle Spiel zum Original Krimidinner
description:
With more than 2 million enthusiastic visitors, the Original Krimidinner has been inviting audiences to an incomparable show for over 20 years that is truly not for the faint-hearted! Now the crime fun can finally continue at home with the pitch-black board game Inherit or Die, in which the players go on the hunt for the legendary inheritance of Lord Ashtonburry.
After Lord Ashtonburry's unexpected death, his surviving relatives are greedy for the stately inheritance. The race for the inheritance already begins, in which not only bizarre events complicate the way for the players, but also the treacherous players who want to eliminate their competitors at all costs so that their own share grows. But who will have the most riches in the end? And will everyone really make it to the finish line, or will someone soon be joining Lord Ashtonburry in the afterlife?
The black board game for the Original Krimidinner Show
Inherit or die - who will collect the most inheritance in the end and who will go away empty-handed or even die?
In this family game, the players take on the roles of the Ashtonburry family, who want to secure the largest possible share of Lord Ashtonburry's fortune at all costs. If only there weren't those pesky relatives who also want a piece of the cake ... There's only one thing to do - get rid of the competitors! But watch out, because the other players are trying the same thing. So who will end up with the most inheritance and who will come away empty-handed or even die?

—description from the publisher

name: Der Original Krimidinner: Adventskalender – O du Tödliche
description:
With more than 2 million enthusiastic visitors, the Original Krimidinner has been inviting guests to an incomparable show that is truly not for the faint-hearted for over 20 years! Now the crime fun can finally continue at home with the pitch-black Escape Advent Calendar, which has over 24 exciting puzzles, hidden clues and encrypted codes in store. Including a competition to win tickets to the Original Krimidinner Show!

We don't want anything to go wrong at this year's Ashtonburry Christmas Dinner! So Milady hosts a rehearsal dinner in advance, but the dessert has a bittersweet aftertaste as one of the guests ends up with his face in the plum pudding - carried off by prussic acid! With a blizzard raging outside and no one able to enter or leave Darkwood Castle, the case seems clear: there is a treacherous poisoner at the table! But who is it and will he strike again?

In this interactive Advent calendar book with detachable pages, gripping puzzles, encrypted codes and hidden clues await you day after day to help you progress through the story. With the red decoder foil, you can uncover hidden clues and follow new tracks. Will you manage to find a way out in time, or are you possibly the next victim of the poisoner?

—description from the publisher

name: True Crime: Die Mafia-Verschwörung
description:
Undercover in Las Vegas: Mafioso Bugsy Siegel has been murdered and you infiltrate the Flamingo Hotel, which Siegel ran until shortly before his death, as undercover FBI investigators on a secret search for the murderer. But a mole has betrayed the operation to the Mafia and a race against time begins! Will you manage to solve the case and escape in time?

A dead mafioso, a hotel full of suspects and a race against time
Thrilling Escape Game to solve over and over again: the game board and course change every time!

In this ultimate Escape Room game for 1 to 4 people, you will become true investigators! Collect clues, combine clues and puzzle your way from room to room. Will you manage to escape the mafia in time and unmask the murderer? Who will think creatively enough and convict the culprit? A gripping crime game to solve over and over again, because the game board and the course of the game change every time!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game, Team-Based Game

name: Unsolved Crime Cases: Spurlos verschwunden
description:
In this gripping crime escape game, you can expect the exciting case of a desperate mother who is looking for her missing child. The village is in turmoil, but the community is silent and the police are treading water. What is being hidden here? Was the child the victim of a crime or does it all turn out to be a tragic accident? Visit all the places related to the case, collect clues as well as evidence, question the witnesses and interrogate your suspects in a thrilling multimedia finale.

A missing child, a desperate mother and a village shrouded in silence - What happened? A kidnapping? A tragic accident? Or an insidious murder?

Join tech nerd Ian, the son of the lead detective, as he takes on the case and collects real evidence. All your investigative progress can be recorded on the evidence board. Who will think creatively enough and convict the perpetrator? Only in the multimedia finale will you see whether you are right with your conclusions. A case for real investigators!

—description from the publisher

name: Detective Games: Löse die Fälle!
description:
Crime Cases - Become an investigator!

The series for all crime puzzle fans: Interactive puzzle adventures with many exciting and mysterious clues and evidence. Can you solve the tricky cases?


For clever amateur detectives
Interactive puzzle books with exciting clues and evidence
Put your powers of observation and logical thinking to the test!
With detailed solution section


It's crime time: track down mysterious clues, decipher coded messages and crack secret codes - in the interactive mystery puzzle adventures in book form you become an investigator and have to solve exciting criminal cases. Test your powers of observation and put your logical thinking to the test. Will you accept the challenge?

With a detailed solution section to check your results.

—description from the publisher

name: Mein Escape-Adventskalender: Die geheimnisvolle Zeitreise
description:
Every year it's the same: from August onwards, the first Christmas articles are already on the shelves and melting away, Last Christmas blares from the radio and the Christmas madness starts all over again. But not this year! Not with you. Your plan is set: you will spend Advent in your great uncle's old house, far away from all the hustle and bustle. But what starts out as a quiet getaway quickly turns into a real adventure when you find a strange-looking device. Where did it suddenly come from? And more importantly: what is it good for? Your discovery takes you on an unexpected adventure into different eras of the past and possibly even the future...

In this interactive Advent calendar book with detachable pages, gripping riddles, encrypted codes and hidden clues await you every day to help you progress through the story. Use the red decoder foil to uncover hidden clues and follow new leads.

Puzzle your way through the high-quality illustrated story in this Escape Advent Calendar! Can you follow all the clues correctly and solve the mystery of the mysterious time travel machine? Only when all 24 puzzles are solved will you find your way back to your own time. Are you ready for the pre-Christmas thrill and will you be back home in time for Christmas? A real Escape Adventure!

—description from the publisher

name: Build My-Town
description:
Play as Malaysian MPs trying to build the best constituency you can - but will you use clean or dirty money?

Each turn you choose to draw 3 cards either from the money pile or the action pile (in any combination). The money pile gives you clean or dirty money to spend, while the action pile has buildings/improvements to purchase, reforms to table in parliament and vote on, and events that change gameplay or add a bit of take that. Buying some improvements with only clean money will give a positive side effect.

The game finishes at the end of the round in which someone buys their 7th improvement. Add up the points on the improvements, take a bonus if you were the first to reach 7, or a smaller bonus if you were able to reach 7 after that. Check your hidden goal to see if you have made it. The highest scorer wins, with the tie break being who used least dirty money.
mechanics: Action Points, End Game Bonuses, Events, Hand Management, Take That, Voting

name: Stadt Land: Das inoffizielle Spiel für Potterheads
description:
No matter where you are - with this exciting City,Country,Potterhead edition you'll always bring a big portion of fun to the table! In 26 categories you can test your Hogwarts knowledge and prove your creativity. With its cool design and exciting themes, the game block will convince every Potter fan, big or small. From simple questions to tricky categories - there's something here for everyone.

Dive into the world of wizards and test yourself and your friends - Which of you is the biggest Potter fan and can fill in the categories the fastest? Factual knowledge, creativity and speed are required, only then will you manage to shout "Stop!" first. Are you ready to dive into the world of Harry Potter and his friends? Then grab your pencils, get set, go!

—description from the publisher

name: Das Quiz für Potter-Fans
description:
The card quiz for all Potterheads!

Test your magical knowledge with more than 120 exciting questions and find out if you are a true Potterhead. Puzzle your way through the different levels of difficulty alone or together with other wizarding apprentices. The solutions are hidden on each card - so cheating is impossible! Are you ready for your exam?

Take on the ultimate quiz and puzzle your way through the different difficulty levels. Answer all the questions correctly and prove that you are a true wizard! The practical card box in a handy take-away format is ideal for on the go, at home or as a fun party game. The perfect gift for all fans of the magical world!

—description from the publisher

name: Dígalo con Memes: Pack de Expansión #2
description:
Expansion Pack #2 with "new" memes and "new" situation cards for Digalo con memes. To complement the original game or simulate dementia and play with this mini version.
This version has memes updated to 2023
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: Memmes
description:
Memmes includes 55 cards and each of them contains eight memes. Don't wonder how, but between two letters, there is always a meme that repeats itself. Yes, you read that right, one, always!
Basically you have to be the first to find the meme that is repeated between your card and the middle one.

name: Battletech: Shrapnel Magazine – Issue 14
description:
Shrapnel: The Official BattleTech Magazine brings you more hard-hitting BattleMech action from the heavy-metal wars of the 31st century and beyond—but don’t let your guard down!

No matter the situation, you can stay out of harm’s way by reviewing a most-wanted list of criminals and assassins, a roster of the Marian Hegemony’s Legion of the Dead, technical readouts, unit and planet digests, playable scenarios, a campaign set in the resource-poor wilds of the Third Succession War, and more—all by battle-hardened BattleTech authors and some new boot-camp graduates.

-description from publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Dígalo con Memes: Pack de Expansión #3
description:
Expansion Pack #3 with "new" memes and "new" situation cards for Digalo con memes. To complement the original game or simulate dementia and play with this mini version.
This version has memes updated to 2023
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: Dígalo con Memes: Pack de Expansión #4
description:
Expansion Pack #4 with "new" memes and "new" situation cards for Digalo con memes. To complement the original game or simulate dementia and play with this mini version.
This version has memes updated to 2023
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: Tabletop Tussle
description:
A tabletop co-opetition card game where you play as tables in a world of inanimate objects where you must fight and steal to be on top!

What is Tabletop Tussle?
Tabletop Tussle is a board game where you and your friends will play through the adventure booklet together playing as the tables you pick. You will each pick a hat for your character and subclass card at random.
If you have the retail game you just pick a character card.

Your goal throughout the game is to gain as much money as possible. Whether that will be stealing from each other or defending your money from others, it is yours to pick.
Gameplay
You will play through an adventure booklet that will take you on quests with your long lost friends who have rejoined to talk about your glory days and you all decide it would be fun to do a few quests while you are all together.

You pick one of the four quests available. Doesn’t matter which order it depends on what your group wants to do. Then you head off and find the old table kings armor or help a village under attack it's completely up to you!

When you are confronted by an enemy everyone will have 1 choice to make. Either Attack, Block or Steal.
Attack will just damage the target you are aiming for and if you have an ability to use you can do so.
Block will stop anyone trying to steal from you.
Steal is where you actively avoid helping your teammates and steal their money. Even though enemies can still attack you.

When you finish killing an enemy rewards will be handed out either in money form or in loot.

Loot will help you gain armor and attack strength or it can give you a hidden item that can be used at certain points of your adventure.
Possibly gain a wolf companion.

Win or lose

If you happen to lose all your health and end up dying, it’s ok it isn’t the end of the world, you just miss out on the juicy rewards of the current mission. Also! Everyone can steal from your dead body and you won’t be able to protect yourself!

When you finish your quests and adventure you will all count up how much money you have and whoever has the most in the end will be crowned victorious and everyone else will be crowned envious!

-description from designer

name: Matchbox Empires
description:
You have been sent to the fringes of the known world to start a new colony for your Emperor. In this game you will Explore new lands, Build a thriving city, Fight your opponents and try to Survive. What will be your history?

Matchbox Empires uses a unique fog of war tile mechanic. Each player starts with a randomly seeded game board where the terrain tiles all begin face down. They have to explore the area for resources using their 3 unique Hero chracters. Once they finad a place to build their Town Hall, they select a Governor to run the city and steadily create a beautiful 3D isometric city. Using resource gathering the player can continue to expand their population, generate income, unlock more advanced units and build up infrastructure to help achieve their objectives.

The player loses if their Town Hall is destroyed, if their Heroes suffer 3 casualties (collectively) or if an objective is not met.

The player wins if they defeat their opponents and/or meet the victory conditions laid out in the chosen game mode.

The game supports multiple game modes from solo build, solo campaign, coop single player, coop vs, and last player standing.
-description from designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Events, Grid Movement, Line of Sight, Player Elimination, Resource Queue, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: High Command: Grand tactical rules for the second World War
description:
Where most miniatures rules for the Second World War are low-level tactical, dealing with individual tanks if not individual riflemen, High Command is decisively grand tactical, allowing entire battles, allowing forces consisting of multiple corps to fight it out on a reasonably-sized table over an evening.

—user summary

name: Schnell Rules for Schnell Boote
description: These rules are intended for very quick, deadly battles fought between WW2 Schnellboote, MTBs, MGBs and other craft of the “Mosquito Fleets”. They have been designed to be played on a wargamer’s standard 8x6 or 6x4 foot table and hence missile ranges have been heavily compressed. The current rules cover coastal forces boats, small surface ships (up to destroyers) and fighter aircraft only.
categories: Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement

name: Zechdachs: Badger Bash
description:
Badgers love a good party! In Zechdachs - Badger Bash, you cooperatively build the den for the badgers' party. Each evening, one of the seven badgers is the host. They each have their own ideas about the perfect party and how much it should cost. So, a new badger den is quickly dug, and guest rooms are set up. Everything is fine and dandy, except for all the uninvited guests who like to drop by spontaneously...

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Map Addition, Variable Set-up

name: Black Stories Junior Probekarten
description:
In Black Stories Junior the players try to reconstruct the crime by asking, guessing and fiddling about. A card game just right for any party.

One player, the Chief, takes one of the cards and reads it secretly. The front of the card has the mystery, the back the solution. Then the player reads the front of the card to the other players and shows them the illustration. The other players are the detectives. Singly and together, they try to solve the mystery by asking the Chief questions. But the Chief can only answer Yes, No, Close, or Not Relevant.

name: Mech maker
description:
Combine the BODY, ARM, and LEG parts to create your own mech

Game Overview
Players combine different parts of their abilities to create a mech and fight the opponent's mech on the field map. Break your opponent's mech or press the center of the field to move the container forward. The player first to reach the container in the opponent wins. Analogue game loaded with personalization elements of robot that boys love from kids to adults. Set Contents: Mech parts (1 each of 18 types), cards (43 pieces), field map (1 piece), container (2 pieces), damage counters (6 pieces), rule book (1 piece), instruction manual
mechanics: Command Cards, Grid Movement, Programmed Movement

name: Mead-Price
description:
Published in issue #347 of Slingshot magazine, Mead-Price is a very simple set of early medieval battle rules for miniatures.

Each army consists of one Warlord, two lesser Leaders, and 6-12 Units, divided into Hearth Guard, Warriors, Mounted Warriors and Skirmishers.

name: Coastal Command
description:
Share in the excitement of Commanding a small vessel as you patrol the Seas in enemy controlled waters. All you need are some small scale miniature ships, two dlOs and you are ready to chart a new course to danger and thrills.

Coastal Command is a challenging set of miniatures rules that can be used to recreate small vessel engagements from
WW II, or you can design your own
scenarios.

—description from the designer
categories: Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Trolls and the Shoemaker
description:
Everybody knows the story... the poor Shoemaker wakes up to find that elves had filled his shop with beautifully crafted footwear and his family is saved from poverty!

However, did you hear about the time the elves went on strike and TROLLS were sent in their place?! It was a disaster and no wonder that the tale was erased from history.

Experience being a team of trolls with a terrible task. Work together in the dead of night to assemble shoes and boots before sunrise. You'll need to plan carefully and communicate in silence to complete the job and avoid being captured by the Shoemaker (who wouldn't want a cobbling troll?!)

Players cooperatively handle cards with limited communication and literal hand management - as soon as a group of cards are placed on the table, it's a shoe! Just hope that it's got all the correct components...

Complete your cobbling contract, earn Troll Bux, improve your cobbling quality - or just try and survive!

—description from the designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Fantasy, Industry / Manufacturing, Real-time
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Team-Based Game

name: Kingscraft: Carol die Verspielte Promo Card
description:
The card depicts SPIEL organizer Carol Rapp with the SPIEL mascot Meeps.
Carol die Verspielte gets stronger, depending on how many board games are in your collection.

First available at the Skellig Games booth at the SPIEL 2023 in Essen.

name: Invasion: The Horde Game
description:
In INVASION, you play as a Chieftain leading a band of Barbarians against rival factions to seize control of the largest number of Cities in the Empire.

Each turn, a player places one of their tiles, called Hordes, on a modular square grid board representing the Empire, to form larger groups called Tribes.

The largest Tribe adjacent to a City can lay siege to it. The player who is besieging the most Cities at the end of the game (when players can't find space for more tiles) wins.

Playing larger tiles seems like a priority, but here's the catch: the main rule of Invasion states that a player cannot play a Horde smaller than any of the Hordes they have already played.

As a result, each game is characterized by a constant decision about when to start using your larger tiles, thus sacrificing the smaller ones.

-description from designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Coverage, Square Grid, Tile Placement, Variable Set-up

name: Millenial Loteria: Gen Z Edition
description:
A brand new take on the best-selling Latinx card game that reflects a new NEW generation

Hilarious and insightful parody of the classic "Mexican Bingo" game called Lotería

Original artwork by creator Mike Alfaro and designer Maistro

Set includes 46 cards, 10 boards, and 108 emoji tokens

For 2-10 players, 20 minute playing time, Ages 13-Boomer

name: New Kingdom: Sowers
description:
Step into the shoes of the sower in this fast-paced card game inspired by the Parable of the Sower from Matthew 13. Out-sow your opponent by making wise decisions about when and where you scatter seeds.

In the Sower, two players draw from shuffled identical decks, 'seed' cards 1 through 10 in yellow and black. Their goal is to play all ten black cards in order from 1 to 10 in the Good Soil area of the board. Playing cards into the other soil areas (The Path, Rocky Soil, Thorny Soil) will help players cycle through and reorder their draw decks and retrieve cards from the board.

You will start with three cards. On your turn, draw a card and play a card into one of the four soils. You will interact with each soil differently. Important to keep in mind is that The Path and Rocky Soil are areas shared by both players, while players keep their piles separate in Thorny Soil and Good Soil areas.

The interactions of each soil are as follows: Play a yellow card lower in number than any previously played into Rocky soil, then draw two cards and play any one from your hand into a different soil. Be careful, however, because once there are four cards in Rocky soil, they get moved to The Path and are out of the game. Play a black card into Thorny Soil to draw three cards from your deck and replace four cards either on the top or bottom of your deck in any order. Play any yellow card into The Path--those cards are gone for good--to draw a card and pick up a card from either the Rocky or Thorny Soil. Finally, play any number of black cards in order from 1 to 10 into the Good Soil to work toward winning the game.

The theming is this game is apparent in each of the four soils. Each soil's interaction is based on the Parable. Seeds that fall onto The Path are taken away by the birds. Seeds that fall on the Rocky Soil wither in the sun and blow away. Seeds that fall on the Thorny Soil are choked by the weeds. And the seeds that fall on the Good Soil flourish. The mechanics of the game are meant to reflect these ideas.

Players can expect to look for action combinations, dig through their deck as efficiently as possible, play tactically to to affect their opponent's choices--particularly in the Rocky Soil--and feel the mounting pressure as the bottom of the draw deck gets closer and closer.

-description from designer

name: PanzerKnacker
description:
PanzerKnacker is a ruleset for gaming German infantry anti-tank combat on the Eastern Front during WWII.

PanzerKnacker has been designed as a set of stand alone rules which can be adapted to fit into any existing rules, but especially Cross of Iron.
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: SIN PIEDAD
description:
SIN PIEDAD is a miniatures skirmish wargame set in the Old West. Characteristics:


Solitaire, face to face or cooperative: from 1 to 15 players.
For miniatures from 28 to 32mm; no stunted ranges...
Bands of any size; usually, 3 to 8 gunmen.
Easy to learn: basic rules and optional advanced rules.
Narrative, with some elements of role-playing games: each gunslinger has his own name, various weapons, localized wounds, traits...
Uncertainty and tension... How many enemies are approaching through that alley? When will the dynamite explode? What if the town drunk decides to shoot me?
Campaigns and sagas: does my gunman recover, convalesce or die? Will he acquire traits: Drinker, Distrustful, Vermin, Traitor, etc.?


—description from the designer

name: Route Words
description:
