Travel North American city routes picking up wordy packages. A manifest indicates what needs to be picked up. Packages are identified by the letters in the manifested words and are taken from the adjacent cities on your route.

"Route Words" is a word game where you travel from city to city collecting letters to make words.

One to six or more players simultaneously compete to get the highest scoring words.

Lasercut Components:
• 16x16 game board
• 96 city route tiles
• 6 trucks
• 20 doubled sided manifest cards with 120 root words
• 6 dry erase tracking boards & dry erase markers

Initial Setup:
1. Assemble the game board.
2. Randomly scatter the city route tiles within the board.
3. Fix any “orphaned” cities.
4. Give each player a truck.
5. Shuffle and place the manifest cards in a draw pile.
6. Agree upon a winning target score, for example 200 points.
 
Game Play:
One player reveals the next manifest card (either side is fine).
Players simultaneously attempt to call out a word, adjust their score and move their truck to the last city on their new route.

Making a Word:
A word is formed by collecting all of the letters that match one of the manifest’s words from names of one or more adjacent cities along a route. Additional letters may be added to increase the score.

With six words available per manifest, it should be possible to almost always make a word.

 
Examples
Using the manifest word “AND”, the truck picks up letters from the route to VANDALIA via LOS ANGELES to collect GLANDS
for 8 points. The bus will end up in Vandalia, ready to use the next manifest. Note that all letters from the manifested word must be used to form the word you collect.
Solo Mode:
In solo mode, use the least number of moves to get to a score of 100 points.

Scoring:
Add up the point values of the letters in your word and adjust the score on your dry erase board.

Winning:
The first person to match or exceed the target score is the winner.

Strategies:
• Quickly examine the cities adjacent to your truck to find the optimal route for making the best word possible.
• Try not to get your bus stuck in a city that has fewer routes leading outward.

FAQ
Can I use more than one word from the manifest? NO

-description from designer

name: Haunted Lands: Akron Mini Expansion
description:
Originally a bonus for pre-ordering the game from the publisher.

An alternative character to play (and its game material) and 10 extra Assignment Cards, to have a more asymmetrical gameplay!

name: Crazy Dino Theories
description:
You are a paleontologist attempting to prove your unconventional theories about alternative paths of evolution that could have enabled dinosaurs to survive extinction. Your brand-new simulator is the sole tool at your disposal for testing these theories!

The game is a tableau builder featuring just 18 cards. On your turn, draw the top card from the deck and position it in a valid location on your personal tableau. Afterward, execute the action shown in the top right corner of the newly placed card. Each card offers four distinct placement choices. You need to score at least 30 VPs to win the game.

-description from designer
categories: Card Game, Prehistoric, Print & Play, Puzzle
mechanics: Multi-Use Cards, Pattern Building, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: 超超長城 (Super Hyper Great Wall)
description:
超超長城 (Super Hyper Great Wall) is a 2 player deck-building game with some novel ideas. Players are competing to build a Great Wall, such as a famous Great Wall in another land. The wall is the victory points, so simply extending the wall as much as possible is one path to success.

However, the game uses a wide variety of cards, and as well as extending the wall, it is also used to store cards for later use.

The cards have no purchase cost. Instead, the player uses the powers of one card to gain more cards, dependant on conditions. So a player might play an action card get another card, if their hand is not too large. So there is a usage cost, but not a purchase cost.

Also, the starting hand is already strong. Players begin with powerful cards and good choices, and do not have to spend several rounds building up the action. The game is quite serious right from the start (the designer rates it for age 12+), but also beginners do not have to be familiar with the game to play well. The designer says the dilemma is whether to increase your hand or the wall, not puzzling over spending money.

There are 30 different types of card in the game, including a lot of folklore characters and historic weapons. The artist (黒子洋瓦 Kuroko-tile) was overworked completing the game.

When the game ends, the player with the most points is the winner, drawn from the length of wall and the cards used to build the wall.
user summary
mechanics: Action/Event, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Modular Board

name: El huerto de los abuelos
description:
El huerto de los abuelos es un juego infantil cooperativo de memoria.

Objetivo del juego
La familia tiene que recolectar todos los frutos del huerto pero, ¡cuidado!, solo hay un día para hacerlo.
Preparación
- Forma el huerto con las 15 losetas de huerto sin mirar los frutos.
- Coloca las 27 cartas de cosecha boca abajo.
- Por último, sitúa la ficha de Sol a la derecha del huerto (Este).

Desarrollo de la partida
El jugador en turno levanta una carta de cosecha. La carta de recolección contiene 3 frutos, uno de cada franja: Fruto de árbol, fruto de planta y fruto subterráneo. A continuación, los jugadores
levantan 3 losetas del huerto, una de cada franja.
- Por cada fruto que no se muestre correctamente, el sol avanza una casilla.
A mitad de recorrido, el sol se esconderá por el oeste. A partir de ese momento, se gira la ficha de Sol para mostrar la Luna pero el movimiento de la ficha no cambia.

A continuación, se coge la carta jugada y se lleva a la caja del juego.

Los jugadores ganan si consiguen poner todas las cartas de cosecha dentro de la caja antes de que se acabe el día.

También existe un modo competitivo.

Grandparents' garden is a cooperative children's memory game.

Objective of the game
The family has to collect all the fruits from the garden but, be careful! There is only one day to
do it.
Preparation
- Build the garden with the 15 garden tiles without looking at the fruits.
- Place the 27 harvest cards
upside down.
- Finally, place the Sun token to the right of the garden (East).

Development of the game
The player in turn raises a harvest card. The collection card contains 3 fruits, one of
each strip: Tree fruit, plant fruit and underground fruit. Then the players
They raise 3 tiles from the garden, one from each strip.
- For each fruit that is not displayed correctly, the sun advances one square.
Halfway through the route, the sun will set in the west. From that moment on, the token is turned
sun to show the moon but the movement of the token does not change.

Next, the played card is taken and taken to the game box.

Players win if they manage to put all the harvest cards into the box before the day is over.

There is also a competitive mode.

-description from designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Educational, Memory

name: Ba Knocka Dock A Vision in Collision
description:
Race the other teams around the course to your finish line while knocking other pawns this way and that. Set up your pawns for Ricochet action shoot the gap and knock your opponents backwards, or go for the double, triple, or even quadruple knock about! It takes real skill and strategy to set yourself up for the mad dash to the finish!

-description from the back of the box

name: Legend of the Galactic Heroes:  Fleet Battles
description:
This is fan-produced set of rules for recreating the fleet battles as shown in the anime series Legend of the Galactic Heroes. This is a modification for the rules Brigade: Fire and Fury. A copy of these rules is needed to play this game.

Why has a set of Civil War rules been adapted for space battles? Simply put, the battles in LotGH are EPIC. Fleets consist of thousands of vessels, from battleships to destroyers, and millions of soldiers. Because of technology it is no longer possible to use guided weaponry, so commanders are made to adapt formations and fight the battles using Napoleonic tactics. Ships line up and fire volleys, hoping to score a hit, they charge, outflank, and form various breakthrough and fire formations. The battles are fought over long distances, with weapons firing out as far as 40 light seconds. The commander of the fleet, like Napoleon, watches the battle and makes decisions, hoping that his strategy takes the day.

It was apparent that the battles of LotGH would need to be land based. Fire and Fury presented a groundwork that was easily adapted for fleets that have adopted horse and musket tactics. As such, there was no great need for modification of the rules; the only big difference being that the infantry, cavalry and artillery stands were now replaced with ships. The way the game plays has some minor changes, but all-in-all the game plays like a typical Fire and Fury battle.

The game is meant to be played with the 1/12000 scale model ships from Hobby Base and Alba Creates. The scale is 1" = 1 light year and 1 ship is around 500 vessels. The 34-page booklet includes modified rules for playing the game under Brigade Fire and Fury, ship and leader data, organization tables, game charts, and counters of the ships that can be cut out and used as proxies.

You can get a copy of Fire and Fury at: https://www.fireandfury.com/
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Simulation

name: Head Hauntcho
description:
Using different types of spirits (peaceful, mournful, vengeful, etc.) to form chains, players attempt to match the unique patterns of various Location Cards, thus capturing them. Players are assisted by their Graveyard, a collection of otherworldly powers that can be revived after use.

When a Location Card is captured, players must decide if they wants to gain the card's full point value OR partial points and a Spatial Ability. Each player is also on the lookout for their Favorite Haunts, two locations that net them bonus points at the games end.

When only three locations remain, all points, be they full, partial or bonus, are added up. The player with the highest total point value is the winner and gains the title of Head Hauntcho.

-description from designer

name: Mekkablood
description:
A mecha (mekka) card game inspired by real-time strategy games, trading card games, and miniature games. The cards are sold in non-randomized packs or printed at home, but there are custom and exclusive art options to collect and trade.

Mekkablood is a turn-based card game about giant armored suits locked in combat. Use resources to build buildings. Buildings plus additional resources allow you to build mekks, upgrades, walls, and to play special actions. Use your mekks to attack the enemy base and defend your own. The core game is a 1v1 battle, but you can also play 2v2 for a 4-player experience.
categories: Collectible Components, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: Luminis: 9/9/9 Promo Card
description: An additional card for the 4th level of the cathedral with resource costs of 9x red, 9x green, and 9x blue.

name: Space Race
description:
Space Race is a Cold War game from the USA where players race to a predetermined planet, whether it be from earth to Jupiter or Saturn to Neptune. It is up to the players to decide before the start of the game.

Players roll a dice and move their rocket playing piece the number shown in a circular path representing the planets orbit around the sun. A segment of the all the planets orbit is colored red and is called the "Anti Gravity Corridor". A player entering this red area can move their rocket to an adjacent orbit, so as to reach other planets.

If a player lands on an orbiting planet that is not the final destination then he rolls the dice again and receives either has a penalty or assistance on their travels.

The players whose spaceship reaches the destination planet first is the winner.

The game is promoted to be educational by teaching facts about the Solar System

name: Wild Life: The Card Game – Stories
description:
Wild Life - Stories introduces 7 new expansions to the game to make sure no game feels the same as the last one: create new strategies, meet new animals, face new menaces, and find new ways to have fun with the animals of Wild Life: The Card Game.

-description on the back of the box

[The box actually mentions 8 expansions. But the expansion for 6 & 7 players was added to the base game instead.]
categories: Animals, Card Game, Educational, Environmental, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Lemi Gulliver's Abenteuer
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first to reach over space 102 wins the game.

The game is based on the animated Hanna-Barbera TV show.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Pampero: Clear Skies
description:
The Clear Skies expansion is a collection of stretch goals from the Pampero Kickstarter. Included are additional components that can be used with the existing base game rules, as well as three new game concepts:


Private Industries
Investor Tendencies
Companies
publishers: APE Games, Cosmodrome Games, Intrafin Games

name: Darkfleet: Command – Core Rules
description:
Darkfleet: Command is a 2+ player versus tabletop strategy game where you command a crew aboard your ship during a space fantasy conflict of intergalactic consequence.
Each player controls one ship and four crew, strategically stationing them in your wide array of ship systems to take down your opponents.

Darkfleet: Command requires only access to the rules, printed ship terminals, six-sided dice, and a friend or three.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Fantasy, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Badaboum
description:
Set aside the Badaboum penalty cards, In preparation for the game, the dealer should construct a new deck of cards by pulling sets of 4 of-a-kind; the number of sets being determined by the number of players.

The remaining cards will NOT be used. Shuffle and deal 4 cards to each player. One Badaboum-card is placed at the centre of the table. Each player looks at his (her) hand, keeping it secret. Since the object of the game is to get 4 animals of the same kind, the 1st player chooses 1 card to discard and hands it to his (her) neighbour on the left. Each player will have to do the same. When a player obtains 4 matching cards, he shouts "Badaboum" banging his hand on the centre card. All the other players must hurry to do the same. The player whose hand is on top of the pile, will be given a penalty card. In the end, the player with the lowest penalty score, is the winner.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game

name: Stranger Things: Lucas' Slingshot Shooting Game
description:
Help your friends defeat the creatures of the Upside Down with Lucas’s signature slingshot. Each pack includes a 30-sheet pad of “rock” paper, 2 rubber bands, 8 malevolent entities, and 1 trusty slingshot with all of Lucas’s signature detailing. It’s your mission to save the day! Made of durable MDF and packed in a colorful window box, each comes flat-packed with simple instructions for quick and easy assembly.

Rules: Lucas's Slingshot Game is fun by yourself or with friends. Crumple the paper into "rocks" and use the slingshot to hit each monster from the Upside Down!

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Fantasy, Horror, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Flicking, Physical Removal, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Let's Goals!
description:
Let's Goals! is a family weighted card game for 1-6 players, ages 10+, with each round lasting between 5-10 minutes. The game consists of 2 main components, Goal cards and Icon cards. Each round of the game consists of 4 turns and on each turn, players discard a Goal card. It is as simple as that.

Players attempt to score the most points using their Goal cards in the most effective way. Each player begins with 6 Goal cards in hand and throughout the game, must discard down to 2.

The Goal cards have discard abilities that may be used to affect the Icon cards in front of players. When a Goal card is discarded, the player may choose to activate the accompanying ability, but only twice in a round.

Icon cards are laid out in front of each player (7 for a 1-4 player game, and 5 for 5-6 players.) These cards are not allowed to be rearranged unless discard abilities are used. The final layout/composition of the Icon cards determines whether players are or aren't successful with the final 2 goals left in their hand.

At the end of each round, players add their cumulative scores across their 4 discarded Goal cards and their final 2 Goal cards to see who won the round. There are varied ways a game can be scored to determine an ultimate winner.
mechanics: Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards, Score-and-Reset Game

name: quizzone HVEM VED?
description:
quizzone HVEM VED? ("Who knows?") is a battle of trivia and how well the players know each other.

All players are involved in each question. In each round one player answers four questions in four specific categories, while the other players must guess wither the answering player knows the correct answers or not. This creates a fun and entertaining game for all, where it's possible to win just by knowing your opponents strong and weak sides best.

Just like the other games from quizzone, HVEM VED? is easy to play, and all players are involved all the time.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Monopoly: Van Gogh Museum Amsterdam
description:
Vincent van Gogh travelled far and wide throughout his lifetime. The places where he lived inspired him to create his artworks. With the Van Gogh Museum edition of Monopoly, join the artist’s journey from the Netherlands via Belgium to France. During the trip, find out all about the paintings he created in these three countries.

The collaboration between the Van Gogh Museum and Monopoly resulted in a unique edition of the board game. The board consists of paintings by Vincent van Gogh, and his famous work The Yellow House (The Street) forms the basis for the board game. Two exclusive tokens – only available with this edition – were also designed: a paint tube and the bed from Van Gogh’s painting The Bedroom. A booklet with facts and information about Van Gogh completes the game.

The Van Gogh Museum is always seeking new ways of telling the story of Vincent van Gogh. The collaboration with Monopoly means that through playing, families all around the world get to know the life and work of the Netherlands’ most famous 19th-century artist. The Van Gogh Museum also supports the focus of Monopoly’s parent company Hasbro on corporate social responsibility and their mission to make the world a better place for children and their families.

—description from the publisher

name: Lakserytterens Tegn & Spjæt
description: Tegn & Spjæt (" Doodle Lake ") is a game filled with mad and colorful salmons, which you have to draw or act (mime), and finally guess. But it's not an ordinary fishing trip, if you land on a "Challenge" space you will be challenged to draw is silly ways, either with your non-dominant hand, with a rubber pencil, or with closed eyes. Are you ready to draw, act and laugh? It time for another round of Doodle Lake. Family Game of the year 2023 - Danish Play Association ( Legebranchen )and Family Game of the year 2023 Bog og Ide.
mechanics: Acting, Drawing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: All Screwed Up: The Adults-Only Game of Tangles and Turns
description:
Here's a twist you didn't see coming: meet All Screwed Up, the adult party game that gets up close and personal! All Screwed Up brings a hilarious edge to party games for adults. Stack the decks around the mat, then pull a card and read it out loud. Every player it applies to has to move in the way it says. For example, "If you've ever totaled your car, put your right foot on blue." Last one standing wins! Perfect for fans of group games for adults to play at a party, as an ice breaker with your coworkers, or on a date with your crush. Get ready to get twisted.

—description from the publisher

name: Death Over Horizon
description:
ANALYZE THE EVIDENCE AND FIND THE KILLER - Take a role of a lead detective and examine witness reports, suspect profiles, CCTV footage, and decipher numerous clues to catch the murderer. Are you ready for the most thrilling of mystery board games and unsolved cases?

WHO IS THE MURDERER ON THE AIRPLANE? - During a flight from Colombia to the US, a dead body was found in the aircraft restroom. Who among the 5 suspects is the culprit? Follow the trail of clues to uncover the details of the story and solve a murder game

REALISTIC EVIDENCE AND CHALLENGING PUZZLES - With over 35 pieces of realistic evidence and captivating puzzles this board game for adults will surely test your investigative skills to the max

DIFFICULTY, AGE & PLAYTIME - Unsolved case has a moderate level of difficulty and is suitable for players aged 14 years and above. With an average playtime of 2 hours, this murder case files to solve promises a captivating experience for everyone

—description from the publisher

name: Toe Cheese Chase
description:
Toe Town: This silly board game is perfect for a hilarious and competitive family game night.

How to Play: Child-friendly cards make moving around the game board easy. Just pick a Toe figure and pull a card, then move according to the card's instructions. Just don't let Toe Cheese tag you out!

In this action-packed family game night board game, the whole family races around the board to outrun Toe Cheese – if you can! If he gets ya, it's off to Sweaty Sock Swamp... at least until the next round. Simply draw a card and move to the color it gives you. Just be warned. Every time you move, Toe Cheese does too!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Lose a Turn, Player Elimination, Race, Take That

name: Alien Race
description:
Experience the fun of a board game, a puzzle, and a search-and-find all in one with Puzzle Play Games! Race to be the first player to finish their spaceship puzzle and make it back home to be declared the winner, then earn awards in the search-and-find! This puzzle-ing game is easy to learn and so much fun you’ll want to play over and over again!

THREE IN ONE: A board game, a puzzle, and a search-and-find!

BUILD THE BOARD: Work together to build the outer boarder of the board.

COMPLETE THE PUZZLE: Move around the board and be the first to finish your puzzle and make it home to win!

SEARCH AND FIND: Once the game is over, play the bonus search and find game using the spinner!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Modular Board, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Doggy Dash
description:
Experience the fun of a board game, a puzzle, and a search-and-find all in one with Puzzle Play Games! Race to be the first player to finish their doghouse puzzle and make it back home to be declared the winner, then earn awards in the search-and-find! This puzzle-ing game is easy to learn and so much fun you’ll want to play over and over again!

THREE IN ONE: A board game, a puzzle, and a search-and-find!

BUILD THE BOARD: Work together to build the outer boarder of the board.

COMPLETE THE PUZZLE: Move around the board and be the first to finish your puzzle and make it home to win!

SEARCH AND FIND: Once the game is over, play the bonus search and find game using the spinner!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Modular Board, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Wild Life: The Card Game – Echoes of the Past
description:
How many legends exist in the worlds about magnificent creatures that fill us with emotion? Echoes of the Past brings a group of towering creatures to the table that will alter the course of the game!

—description from the rules

The rules for this eight-card mini-expansion are printed on a card included with the base game.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Educational, Environmental, Expansion for Base-game

name: Costu'Monsters
description:
In Costu'Monsters, each player has their own monster on a large round piece of acrylic, and a bunch of monster clothing and accessories is piled on the table.

On a turn, reveal the top card from the deck. Each card shows monsters dressed in particular articles of clothing, and players must now race to dress their monster in the depicted clothing. Whoever dresses their monster correctly first wins the card, and whoever first wins a certain number of cards wins the game.

name: Get It! Promo Card Sleep
description:
Starting from level 3, add a sleep card to your deck. When you see a sleep card, close your eyes until the card is played.
If a player notices that everyone closed their eyes, they know they have a sleep card they should play.
You can add up to three to a game.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Broad Lines: Additional Cards Set
description:
A small pack of six extra cards for Broad Lines.
Like in the base game, each card contains 6 words describing what to draw.

name: Picky Packrats
description:
Picky Packrats is a tactical, small-deck card game for 2 or 3 players. Players take turns peeking at hidden treasures, rearranging their nests, raiding the house and each other’s nests, and cementing their treasures in place to make the neatest nest. The most organized player tableau wins the game. Play 1-3 games at 10-15 minutes per game. Or play against Roborat in solo mode. Turns and games are quick, so play a best-of-three tournament for more fun. The game can be expanded to 4 to 6 players with two decks.

In Picky Packrats, you are a packrat neatly arranging the treasures you have collected in your midden (nest). Add treasures by raiding the house or other packrat middens. You are very particular and want everything 'just so.' Unfortunately, like all packrats, you are very forgetful, so you need to remind yourself what treasures you have already packed away, while you try to arrange them in your midden to near perfection. When you really like where your treasures are hidden, you cement them in place. Once you or another packrat cements everything down, you compare middens. The pickiest packrat—the one with the neatest nest—wins!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Highest-Lowest Scoring, Multi-Use Cards, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Take That

name: Drachenhüter: Die Prophezeiungen der Urdrachen
description:
The Prophecies of the Primordial Dragons

Mini expansion with 6 tiles (3 gold and 3 silver).

Instructions

1. There are 6 prophecies: 3 gold and 3 silver. At the start of the game, shuffle them face down and put 1 gold and 1 silver back in the box.

2. Reveal the other 4 prophecies. They show in which position you have to place which color of dragon in order to fulfill the respective prophecy. If you are the first to fulfill a prophecy, you may place it in front of you. The others can no longer fulfill this prophecy. At the end of the game you get the corresponding points (6 for a silver one, 14 for a gold one). Note: Among the 4 prophecies there are always at least 2 that are not mutually exclusive and therefore you can fulfill both of them.

name: Planet Repossession Force
description:
Genre: Sci-fi Action Rogue-lite

Class: Lightweight | Fast-paced dice-chucker with tactical grid map movement and tableau building using cards and chips (resembling your personal arsenal and character stats) | Includes a competitive and a co-op mode

Objective: defeat the final Raid in the center of the map. In competitive mode, it's a race to the objective. In co-op mode, enemies on the map become harder while powerful enemies will spawn and roam around the map hunting players down

Mechanics: dice rolling, dice manipulation (re-roll/locking), limited movement (orthogonal only on a square grid), territory control(checkpoints for players to respawn closer to Objective upon death or retreat), RPG (stats building, item collecting), rogue-lite (start weak and get stronger to survive; dying puts you back at "Start" but with all the loot you previously gathered, and you have three chances)

Summary: Each player is a super soldier in the year 4325. Their mission is to repossess humanity's long abandoned origin world, Earth, which has evolved into a planet teeming with hostile wildlife. After crash landing in the same region of the planet, players will have to...

+ Explore the grid one tile at a time which triggers an event, even when revisiting a tile. Simultaneous player movement each turn, resolving events one by one (events include Combat, reward rolls, and unlocking respawn checkpoints)

+ Collect supplies cards such as weapons and armor to add to their character pad's tableau (resembling their arsenal)

+ Find settlement cards to grant them passive abilities that provide rules exceptions (which can only be activated on respawn checkpoints players unlock by simply visiting them)

+ Take on creatures and large-scale raids to become stronger and find better loot. The game ends when the final raid is defeated or everyone loses all three of their lives
categories: Adventure, Dice, Exploration, Horror, Science Fiction, Territory Building, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action/Event, Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Race, Re-rolling and Locking, Role Playing, Simultaneous Action Selection, Square Grid, Team-Based Game

name: Boss Fight
description:
Boss Fight is a high fantasy deck building, dice throwing game where you build up armies to take on high damage Bosses! No more grinding through hundreds of minions or pawns. Boss fight takes you straight to the action.

Every round, a new trio of Bosses emerge from the portal and you must fight! If you win, you can add the Boss to your army. If you lose, the Boss runs, flies or slinks away, only to return in the devastating final act.

Boss Fight supports multiple styles of play. Team up with your favorite adventure buddy to play cooperative mode, get down and dirty with an archrival in competitive mode, or set off on your own quest with solo mode.

Will you save the day or be decimated by the bosses? Strategy can only take you so far. In the end, it is up to the gods and the dice to determine your fate.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses

name: Harry Potter Unofficial Magic Duel Card Game
description:
Backs are turned, paces are taken, wands are raised. The word is given and the magic duel has begun!

Players take the role of a magic student and fling spells at each other with the ultimate goal of removing the opponent's wand. Each deck is identical except for one unique spell that the individual student has prepared just for the occasion.

Rounds are quick. Will you be lucky enough to pick off their wand early? Or will you whittle away their stamina until they are left utterly defenseless?

—description from the designer

name: Harry Potter Charms Card Game
description:
Suitable for two or more players, the set of 48 game cards will have you trying to get rid of all your cards the quickest
Fast-paced card game
Contains 48 cards and instructions
Suitable for two or more players
Officially licensed Harry Potter product
The set includes easy-to-learn instructions and comes with a metal storage tin
The Harry Potter Charms Card Game will bring some Wizarding World fun to your game collection

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Frække Tankestreger
description: Frække Tankestreger (Naughty Thoughts) is in all ways an inappropriate drawing game for adults. Here you have to draw and guess embarrassing, rude and tabu words and concepts. A lot of them are under the belt, while other are just fun or weird. Frække Tankestreger is an engaging game, where everybody plays all the time - either as the drawer or as guesser. Points are up for grabs, and the quicker a word is guessed, the further the player may advance on the track. The result is a fun and different drawing game, where laughs and red cheeks are guaranteed.

name: One More Day
description:
In this solitaire sci-fi adventure board game, You are an astronaut who crashed on an alien planet. Every day starts with rolling dice, which determines the daily options you have, some of these open up even more possibilities, with a deck of multifunctional cards that brings random events, buildable tools, and unexpected weather anomalies into the gameplay. You will fight the elements and try to escape.

The game consists of rounds, each round you decide what to do based on the dice and the available resources. You should administer the changes on the game board, use cards from the exploration deck, activate other combinations, then subtract your resources consumed that day and start the next round. The game continues until the victory conditions are met; you successfully send an S.O.S. radio signal and receive an answer and also build the escape pod. The other option is that your resources or health points are depleted.

-description from designer
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Drawing, Multi-Use Cards, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Kitchen Quest
description:
Welcome to the culinary realm of Kitchen Quest, a tabletop card game set in a magical fantasy world! In this delightful game, players take on the roles of hero chefs, embarking on an epic culinary journey to become the chef chosen by the kings.

1. GAME FUNDAMENTS:
"Kitchen Quest" is a turn-based board game designed for 2 to 5 players. The core gameplay revolves around strategically utilizing drawn ingredients to craft meal cards, which can be used to either nourish your enemies or temporarily activate power-ups that enhance your abilities.

2. GAME SCOPE:
The game's scope is to fulfill the requests outlined on the King cards drawn at the start of the game, with each player receiving their unique card. Each King card presents 3 buffet meals, each of which can be acquired by vanquishing a specific enemy during the course of the adventure. The game concludes when a player successfully collects all three buffets as stipulated by their respective King card and wins.

3. PLAYERS TURN
To determine the initial player to take their turn, each participant will roll a die at the game's outset, with subsequent players proceeding clockwise.

During his turn the player will have 3 turn actions that allow him to do different actions, each move allows specific actions that the player must follow, can’t advance to the next move until he doesn’t complete the current one.
Player actions are:

- Action 1:
Draw an Ingredient
Use a Meal on the Hero
Use the Hero’s Power

- Action 2:
Discard an Ingredient
Ruin Another Player’s Meal
Craft a Meal

- Action 3:
Draw an Ingredient
Feed an Enemy
Make an Ingredient Exchange

The number of turns the players will play during a specific adventure card depends on the type of adventure card there is down, Neutral or Dungeon location.

- Neutral Locations:
Each player will play only 1 turn, when the turn comes back to the 1st player will be revealed a new Adventure card.

- Dungeon Locations:
There isn’t a defined number of turns that the players will play, the turns will continue until all the enemies are fed, after the feeding of all enemies, when the turn comes back to the 1st player will be revealed a new Adventure card.

4. START THE GAME & PLAYERS' INVENTORY
Before the beginning of the game each player will roll a dice to decide the first and last player for the rounds.
Players have a max amount of ingredients and meals that they can bring during the adventure.
Each player will draw:
1 Hero Card
1 King Card
3 Ingredient Cards

5. COOK PERFECT MEALS
To create a meal the player must have 1 or more required ingredients, the player can create the meal also if he doesn’t have all the 3 required ingredients but it will be harder to create a meal with 1 or 2 ingredients.

- With all the ingredients:
If the player has all the 3 correct ingredients he will be able to collect instantly the selected meal and discard the used ingredients.

- Without all the ingredients:
If the player doesn't have all the correct ingredients he can also try to create the meal if he has at least 1 correct ingredient by dice roll.

6. EXPLORE THE REALM
Adventure cards are the storyline of the game, when an adventure card’s quest is fulfilled the players will advance and reveal the next adventure card, each adventure card has a different location and a different achievement to fulfill:

- Neutral Locations:
Neutral locations are cards that don’t reveal an enemy card, have a request that will be completed in only 1 turn.

- Dungeon Locations:
Dungeon locations will reveal an enemy card, the request to complete the card is to defeat the current enemy.

7. COLLECT INGREDIENTS
Ingredients are used to create the meals that will allow the players to use them during the game to progress, there are 3 levels of rarity of the ingredient cards, and the rarity level changes the possibility of being found. Ingredients can be drawn during the player’s turn or drawn by adventure cards.

8. ENCOUNTER ENEMIES TO FEED
Enemy cards can be revealed only by adventures. To be defeated, a player must fulfill his meal's request during his turn. When an enemy is defeated, it will be given to the player that beats its personal king’s meal.

9. BECOME THE HERO
Each player will draw a hero card before the beginning of the game, heroes are strong cards that can change the outcome of the game, each one has 2 special abilities and 1 favorite meal, these power-ups can be passive or active and can be activated during the player’s turn, abilities are divided in:

- Class Ability:
Passive ability that is the same for each hero of the same class, and can be activated at each moment based on the ability.

- Hero Ability:
Active ability is different for every hero and can be played only in specific moments during the player’s turn.

- Favorite Meal Ability:
When heroes eat their favorite meal, it will activate the favorite meal ability instead of the base ability.
categories: Adventure, Animals, Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Travel
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Drawing, Hand Management, Role Playing, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Le Neckbeard: Quest for Love
description:
Players take the role of a neckbeard and use the skills and talents of their neckbeard player decks to impress (have more cards worth higher points placed around) the Waifu cards that are in play.

Each player draws 4 cards from their deck.
On their turn, they place a card next to any available Waifu slot and use any effect their neckbeard card may have.

Then draw back up to 4 cards at the end of their turn.

When a Waifu card is full, the highest sum of points takes the Waifu. Second place takes a small Waifu.

The first player to get 3 big Waifu cards or any 7 selfie cards, wins.

name: Mobile Suit Z Gundam
description:
This game is set in the Mobile Suit Zeta Gundam Universe. The game's objective is to protect the colony from being taken by the other side and defeat the AEUG or TITAN forces.

It features a fold-up board that curves on the edges to fit into a box, a rotating colony at the center of the board, and plastic models of the Mobile Suits, which you can paint.

The game was produced by Bandai.

—user summary

name: Computer Wargame no.8: Mobile Suit Z Gundam
description:
This is a boardgame that uses an electronic device to calculate combat. The theme is based upon the anime series Mobile Suit Zeta Gundam.

The game includes plastic models of the Mobile Suits that can be painted.

When mobile suits fight, a button is pressed on the device. This activated the calculator which determined the results of the combat and provides a red "dot" in the spot under the result. The player than makes the necessary adjustments to the game based on the calculation.

The idea of the game is to defeat the side. If you are a TITAN, then that means defeating the AEUG.

name: Red Sun Black Cross Caribbean Campaign June 1949-Sep 1950
description:
This is a Japanese Doujin produced by the designer that goes by the "creator name" Ulysses. It was made for sale at Japanese game shows. The game was made on-demand and you had to order in advance and then pick it up at the show. The game was made with professional materials, and the counters came precut. It comes in a ziplock bag.

This is a variant game that is set in the Red Sun Black Cross world. It deals with a victorious Germany fighting an alliance consisting of the USA, Japan, and Exiled Great Britain.

This particular scenario deals with the German invasion of Cuba.

The game does not use the RSBC system, it is a new design entirely.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Ratio / Combat Results Table

name: A City too Far
description:
This is a Japanese Doujin produced by the designer that goes by the "creator name" Ulysses. It was made for sale at Japanese game shows. The game was made on-demand and you had to order in advance and then pick it up at the show. The game was made with professional materials, and the counters came precut.

This is a game that is set in the Red Sun Black Cross world. It deals with a victorious Germany fighting an alliance consisting of the USA, Japan, and an Exiled Great Britain.

This particular scenario deals with the German invasion of Louisiana in 1949. Japanese forces help out with the defense.

The game does not use the RSBC system, it is a new design entirely.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table

name: Fall Gold
description:
This is a Japanese Doujin produced for sale at Japanese game shows. The game was made on-demand, and you had to order in advance and then pick it up at the show.

This is a game dealing with the German invasion of America, "Ost Unt West," as it is called by the Germans. It is variant game that uses the Ad Techno's Red Sub Black Cross System.

RSBC deals with a victorious Germany fighting an alliance consisting of the USA, Japan, and Exiled Great Britain.

The game needs to be assembled. It comes with a map, and counters that need to be cut out and mounted. There is a scenario guide, and the rules are a photocopy of the RSBC rules. It comes in a ziplock bag.

—user summary

name: Deloyer war of Independence
description:
Deloyer war of Independence is a strategic game produced by Solger. The game is a doujin (fan produced) game that is produced for upcoming game shows in Japan. You must place an order for it and then pick it up at the show. They are made on-demand and are not available for the general public.

This game is set in the world of Fang of the Sun Dougram, as Japanese anime show from the early 80's, deals with the planet Deloyer and its struggle against Earth.

One side plays the Deloyer rebels, trying to gain their independence through their strategy, while the other plays the Earth and Loyalist forces trying to crush the rebellion.

The game requires some assembly of the cards and counters.

—user summary
mechanics: Action/Event, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Card Play Conflict Resolution

name: Heliborne Tactics
description: This game simulates helicopter-to-ground combat in the 80's. It is a low complexity game, and the third one in the Sports and Adventure series from Ad Technos.

name: Alpine Tricks
description:
Alpine Tricks is a fast-paced, trick-taking card game based on Austria's national card game Schnapsen. While it keeps the tried and tested game rules and mechanics the same, the layout has been redone to ensure smoother gameplay and make the game easier to learn.

Both players try to be the first to reach 66 points to win a hand. Points can be earned by winning tricks or by presenting certain card combinations. Players may also block the draw pile or make strategic use of their cards to impede their opponents' ability to score points.

At the beginning of the game, each player is dealt 5 cards, an additional card is revealed and placed face up under the pile of remaining cards. This suit now has the advantage, cards of this color will now win tricks against any other color. In all other cases, the card with the higher number wins the trick if it matches the suit of the card that started the trick.

Whoever did not deal the cards, starts. They may play a card to start a trick, present a card to use its special function, or block the drawing pile. The latter carries a penalty if the player does not reach 66 points.

If there are cards available to draw, a card is drawn after each trick. If it is not possible to draw new cards, players are obliged to match the trick's first card's color. Only if they can not, they are allowed to win by advantage.

The game's mechanics are easy to learn, but mastering it takes time, because there are many tactical ways to back your opponent into a corner.

—description from the designer

name: Letter Together
description:
Letter Together is a cooperative word game. It has 100 letter tiles, a strip with spaces for 30 tiles, and a downloadable timer app.

Players assemble the strip (from 6 joinable pieces), draw 15 tiles, and start the timer, with more time given for fewer players. They form a word at the start of the strip, and then draw more tiles, usually 2 less than the word formed. They then make another word that starts with one or more letters at the end of the letters already on the strip, and draw more tiles as before. This continues until either time runs out, or they fill the strip with 30 letters, in which case they win, and read the long compound word together.

There is also a competitive mode where 2 or 3 teams or individuals split the strip pieces evenly, take 12 tiles each, and play normally, with the first team to fill their strip winning.

—user summary

name: Spin Machine
description:
A serious-or-satirical political party card game for 3+ players.

Each round, one player reads a problem, and the others compete for a point within the time limit by giving their best speech using a solution. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Questions and Answers, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Word for Word
description:
Word for Word has 99 letter tiles, a bag to hold them, and a timer. Players start by drawing 9 letters. The first player forms a word from their tiles and places in the middle of the table.

In each turn thereafter, a player does one of the following to make a new word:

Rearrange the letters of the word.
Swap a letter from their tiles with a letter in the word, possibly rearranging the letters.
Add one letter from the hand to the word, possibly rearranging the letters.
Add one letter and swap one letter, possibly rearranging the letters.


Then they draw a tile from the bag to go back to 9 tiles, if necessary.

If a player cannot do anything to make a new word, they pass and are out for the rest of the round. Once everyone passes, the last player who modified the word gets 10 points for each letter in the final word. The first player to reach a total score of 500 points (or another chosen goal) wins the game.

—user summary

name: Rituals
description:
Mario Party meets The Cabin in the Woods in Rituals, a cooperative multiversal horror game from Iconiq Studios.

You and your friends take on the roles of strangers who have become trapped by a malevolent force. You must work together to complete rituals, battle monsters, and escape before it’s too late!

Start by customising your board, combining pieces to not only shape the layout of the map but also influence the story of your game.

On each turn, players must navigate the 2D board to uncover keys, unlock doors, and solve puzzling rituals. Once every player has taken their turn, draw summon cards that contain statements such as 'IN A ROOM WITH A RED DOOR'. Add a token to the active monster card for each player who meets the condition, and when it reaches a critical point, it's time to do battle!
Each monster encounter is a quick and exciting mini-game. Test your skills with dice, coins, cards, timers, and more. Can you name 7 things that scare people? Balance 4 dice in a pillar on your hand? Close your eyes and stop the timer before it runs out? Every encounter guarantees laughter as your group tackles an array of fun and diverse challenges.

Once all rituals on the board are deciphered, it's time to make your escape! Some of you will make it out alive, others may not be so lucky. Regardless of the outcome, you'll all have a story to share.

—description from the designer

name: Quangle
description:
Quangle consists of two decks of 55 cards:

A blue-backed deck of word beginnings of 1 or 2 letters
A red-backed deck of word endings of 2-5 letters.


Rules are included for 9 different games that can be played, all of which involve pairing one blue and one red card to make a valid English word.

—user summary

name: Lyrical Liniment: Word Merge
description:
Lyrical Liniment has 80 medicine-bottle-shaped cards, each with one or two letters, plus two wild cards.

To play a round, the dealer turns up the cards one at a time onto the table. Once any player can make a word using at least 3 cards, they call out the word, and if it's judged a valid word, they gather and keep the cards that make it up. If not valid, the get nothing and each other player gets a free card from the deck. At the end of the round, the player with the most cards gets one point.

Each player has a turn being the dealer. After all the rounds, the player with the most points wins the game.

—user summary

name: Derhome: The Party Game
description:
Derhome is a tabletop version of the word game Wordle, that allows use of words up to seven letters. It includes:


4 laminated worksheets for the guessers, with 6 rows of spaces for the guesses, and a keyboard on the bottom to mark showing which letters are or are not included.
4 privacy screens for the guessers to hide their worksheets.
A laminated master sheet to record the current secret word, and the scores of all players.
4 black dry-erase markers, for the guessers.
1 yellow and 1 green marker for the referee.


It does not include instructions, but it's easy to figure out the rules:

In each round, a player is the referee and writes a secret word of up to 7 letters, and announces the length of the word.
The other players are guessers, and take simultaneous turns writing guesses of the secret word.
For each guess, the referee marks the guesses as in Wordle: letters that are in the right spot are circled green, letters in the word but the wrong spot are circled yellow, other letters are unmarked.
When a player guesses the word, the number of guesses is recorded on the master sheet. If they failed to guess it in 6 tries, a higher number like 7 is recorded.
After each player has had a turn as referee, the player with the lowest total guesses wins the game.

name: Power City Arena
description:
In Power City Arena you control a team of unique super heroes that fight for the control of Power City. All character have a unique ability that is always active and 2 super power that need energy to be used. Your goal will be to defeat other players' teams and be the last one standing on the board.

You start the game with a 15 actions cards deck that allow you to boost your characters, mainly charge their energy for their powers, you can also attack your ennemies or protect yourself. During the game you will be able to move around the board to seek for bonus that let you draw extra action cards, more powerful, or draw equipments that would increase your range, add extra damage to your attacks or give you extra health. If you seek for bonuses, you will make your deck stronger, give you advantage to your oponents by enlarge the possibility of actions.

Bonuses and turn order are set randomly at the begining of the game, each turn is by character order and not by players. The active character make all the action for himself but share the cards in hand with all the team the player control, so choose wisely wich character will use wich cards.

You start the game with a hand of 5 cards, each character's turn, you start by drawing 2 cards from your deck (if you start your turn on a bonus, you may draw card from the designated deck), you have 1 free movement to do whenever you want in your turn, you may use any number of cards from your hand, the only limit is for the attacks that are limited by 1 per turn (some bonuses can break this limit), then when you end your turn, you can't have more than 7 cards in your hand so discard the surplus.

When a character's health reach 0 he is eliminated and there is no way for him to come back, when all the characters from a team are eliminated, the team is eliminated and lose. When all other team are eliminated, you win the game.

-description from designer

name: Unrest: Uprising Expansion
description:
The first expansion for Unrest, Uprising, plays over 3-5 games and introduces new gameplay twists for the Rebellion and the Empire. Each player takes on the role of the Rebellion or the Empire for the entire campaign, and the first player to win three games claims victory! The total playtime is 1-2 hours and can be played in a single setting or over multiple sessions.

Gameplay is the same as the base game with a few exceptions. Each player will have Enhancement cards to aid them during the game. Additionally, after the first game, each subsequent one in the campaign will include a unique Scenario that changes elements of the game.

—description from the publisher

name: GridHack
description:
In GridHack you’ll play the role of a hacker, invading a machine through the weak spots in code, and building your own hacking network to steal data. But you better hurry – you’ll be playing against the counter-hack program, which can introduce firewalls, freeze or corrupt your network and more.

GridHack is a game that takes place on a grid, similar to graph paper. Over a series of turns, you'll roll dice to add nodes, bugs, and grow your hacking network. Copy enough data before the counter-hack program completes, and you win the game!

On your turn you'll roll two dice. The result of the dice determine the actions you can choose to take on your turn - expand your network, or add a node or bug to your network. Doubles allow you to take both actions OR an action of your choice. You can also choose to ignore the dice rolls and take any action of your choice - but if you do, the counter-hack program gets to advance two steps.

After your turn, the counter-hack program goes. This is a pre-programmed series of turns designed to stop you from hacking the network and stealing data. The counter-hack program has one action it takes per turn. After the counter-hack program is complete, it is your turn again.

Play continues turn after turn between you and the counter-hack program, until you copy enough data and win, or the counter-hack program complete and you lose.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Programmed Movement

name: Dylematy 3
description:
2 parts of Moral dilemma behind you, and you are still friends? What's more, you're sure you know everything about yourself? Nothing could be further from the truth! The new version of your favorite party game and its over 150 new challenges will quickly dispel this myth! "Dylematy 3" is a party game for adults, full of difficult choices.
Sit in a circle in a group of 4 to 15 people and give each player 2 voting cards ("A" and "B"). Choose a deck to play and who will start playing. Each turn, the Dilemma card lands on the table – a moral issue with two possible solutions. Your task is to predict which option most people will choose at the table. The group can – and even should, we strongly encouraged to! – discuss possible solutions, after which each player makes a decision. You score if you have correctly predicted the majority vote.
The ultimate goal of the game is to collect 5 points, but the secret to having fun is to talk. The cards are to be an excuse to discuss more or less crazy topics.

—description from the publisher (translated)

2 części Dylematów za Wami, a mimo to wciąż się przyjaźnicie? Co więcej, jesteście pewni, że wiecie o sobie wszystko? Nic bardziej mylnego! Nowa odsłona Waszej ulubionej gry imprezowej i zawarte w niej ponad 150 nowych wyzwań szybko obalą ten mit!
Dylematy 3 to imprezowa zabawa skierowana do osób dorosłych, pełna trudnych wyborów. Usiądźcie w kręgu w grupie od 4 do 15 osób i rozdajcie każdemu z graczy po 2 karty do głosowania. Wybierzcie talię, którą będziecie grali oraz tego, kto rozpocznie zabawę. A potem dajcie się porwać dyskusji o moralności i konsekwencjach swoich decyzji!
W każdej turze na stole ląduje karta Dylematu: zagadnienia moralnego z dwoma możliwymi rozwiązaniami. Twoim zadaniem jest przewidzieć, którą opcję wybierze większość osób przy stole. Grupa może – a nawet powinna, gorąco do tego zachęcamy! – dyskutować nad możliwymi rozwiązaniami, po czym każdy z graczy podejmuje decyzję. Punktujesz, jeśli udało Ci się poprawnie przewidzieć głos większości.
Ostatecznym celem gry jest zebranie 5 punktów, ale sekret dobrej zabawy polega na rozmowie. Karty mają stanowić pretekst do dyskusji na mniej lub bardziej odjechane tematy.

—description from the publisher

name: Traveller Ascension: Kickstarter Exclusives
description:
This pack contains a few components given away exclusively to Kickstarter backers.

3 Ship Cards:

Sct 33 "Pincer"
Sct 34 "Quel'Far"
MD 23 "Teir'Dal"


4 Ship Standees

7 Action Cards:

Plasma Overload
Corps of Engineers
We Nailed 'em, Sir!
Give Them Everything!
Let Us End This
Better Part of Valor
Shields Holding
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Wargame

name: Lupin: Escape Game
description:
Three exciting adventures await you in this official Escape Game for the successful Netflix series Lupin! Puzzle your way through the interactive game alone or together with your friends. You can choose between three different cover identities of Assane Diop, each with a different gameplay. Can you get into the house of the Pellegrini family without being seen, collect evidence against the entrepreneur and disappear again within 90 minutes? The clock is ticking!

—description from the publisher

name: Escape the Game: Babylon Berlin
description: On a secret mission: Together with Samuel Katelbach and Elisabeth Behnke you are on your way to Moka Efti to find clues to the Armenian's crooked dealings. But your pursuers are hot on your heels and a race against time begins! Will you manage to escape in time?

name: Lupin: Escape Game – Das offizielle Buch zur Netflix-Erfolgsserie!
description: In this official Escape Game in book form for the successful Netflix series Lupin, exciting puzzles, encrypted codes and hidden clues await you. Will you manage to commit the perfect crime?

name: Stadt, Land, Gartenliebe
description: No matter where you are - with this exciting Stadt, Land, Gartenliebe edition, you'll always bring a big dose of fun with you! In 26 categories you can test your gardening knowledge and prove your creativity. The game block convinces with a pretty design and interesting topics - perfect for everyone with a green thumb. From simple questions to tricky categories - there's something here for everyone.

name: Phaistos
description:
The Phaistos Disc is still a mystery but a valuable item too because it may contains the knowledge of Minos king's Island and is protected by the gods such as Zeus !

In this abstract race, you will play a Hero and try to bring back the disc to your city, but you will also play a God to help your hero and interfere into the others race...

The game mechanism is easy and let you play your hero AND your God with only ONE chosen card provided by the Delphi's Oracle. Of course, you have to plan your way to victory, by managing your hand, erect temple and obtain ancient gods grateful help !

There is four (4) game modes including small resource management, some race blocking tricks and secret/victory condition revelation for the more experienced players.

—description from the publisher

name: Peaky Blinders: Das Spiel – Bis zum letzten Atemzug
description:
Birmingham in the 20th century - The city is dominated by criminal gangs who have only one goal: To expand their power. And they will stop at nothing to do so. Robberies, blackmail, illegal betting and smuggling - under their leader Thomas Shelby, the Peaky Blinders try to get closer to their goal by any means necessary. But in the process they face a number of enemies. Among them is the opposing gang of the dangerous Billy Kimber.

In this official game of the hit series, you slip into the familiar roles of the enemy gangs and try to seize the power of the city. In the roles of the Peaky Blinders and as Billy Kimber's henchmen, you face each other in Birmingham. Either you help Thomas Shelby with his plans or you try to sabotage the notorious gang. But your true identities remain secret, so you can't trust anyone in this game!

—description from the publisher

name: Cartzzle: La Nuit Étoilée
description:
Cartzzle is a new concept of board game containing a game, a work of art and puzzles. Compose this master piece of Vincent Van Gogh, then redo it by taking up challenges.

The box holds a single Cartzzle, an endless one you can make with both sides of the 50 cards. Cartzzles are pictures you must first piece together by laying cards on top of each other (with or without the template, depending on your dedication). Then, start again, using challenges this time! Removing cards, flipping them, and laying them elsewhere will change the picture and also allow you to meet some challenges (as example: turn of the church light in the picture).

name: Cartzzle: Foules
description:
Cartzzle is a new concept of board game containing a game, a work of art and puzzles. Compose this graphic interpretation of Pauline Détraz, then redo it by taking up challenges.

The box holds a single Cartzzle, an endless one you can make with both sides of the 50 cards. Cartzzles are pictures you must first piece together by laying cards on top of each other (with or without the template, depending on your dedication). Then, start again, using challenges this time! Removing cards, flipping them, and laying them elsewhere will change the picture and also allow you to meet some challenges (as example: Compose a scene that show only people going to left).

name: BattleMonsters: Rules Booklet
description:
Welcome to the world of BattleMonsters. A barren dystopian world where humans are using monsters with wicked elemental powers as their slaves. In this world, wars are not only fought with weapons, but also with trained monsters unleashing the wrath of the elements upon their enemies. A great world war has razed the globe, severely crippling society. Nuclear warfare has led to great uninhabitable fallout zones, separating regions by vast radioactive wastelands.

People must fight for survival in this anarchistic society with little to no government. Colonies and republics ruled by the warlords and tyrants with the strongest BattleMonsters are constantly rising and falling in an ongoing post apocalyptic BattleMonster civil war. Do you have what it takes to become a beastmaster and lead your own party of BattleMonsters to victory?

This Rules Booklet contains the basic rules for your games of BattleMonsters!

Challenge your rival to a duel of an agreed upon Battlepoint value or embark on an epic campaign with villains and chatacable monsters!

This tabletop miniatures game for two or more players is all about little monsters duking it out against each other in epic pit fights. This booklet contains all the basic rules you will need to play games with your BattleMonsters miniatures, as well as tips for how to assemble and paint them.

This rules booklet is divided into sections, explaining the rules and procedures for playing single battles as well as how to incorporate a series of battles into larger narrative campaigns, where players can catch BattleMonsters and battle against all sorts of villains and bosses in a fight against your rivals to become the ultimate beastmaster!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Variable Player Powers

name: Never Mind the Boathooks
description:
Boathooks is a set of late medieval naval wargames rules related to (but not requiring) their landlubbing forefather: Never Mind the Billhooks.

Boathooks is a light-hearted card and dice-driven game of skirmish combat on the seas, where a tactician’s approach counts for little in the face of the tides of fortune.

The rules were given away free with Wi426 - the June 2023 issue of Wargames Illustrated. You can order a copy of the magazine and the rules from the Wi webstore!


A handful of medieval model boats and figures are required for each side.



Create and customise your fleet with a variety of warships, galleys, support vessels (skiffs), and more advanced vessels (carracks, merchantmen, and great ships).



Rally your seafarers with Captains and Admirals. Each player requires one Captain figure onboard each of their warships and an Admiral on their flagship.



Lead your forces to victory and win the sea skirmish by capturing/sinking your enemy’s flagship or by depleting their morale.


-description from publisher's website

name: ZSA Cards
description: A multi-deck of cards for playing any game you can play with a traditional deck, as well as a Pairs deck, and many other types of games.

name: Hobo
description:
Players are "hobos" living on the road in the Depression-era. Object of the game is to accumulate 1,000 miles traveled, find 3 days food supply, getting a job offer and $25 for new clothes.
—user summary

"Congratulations! You are the only hobos left in America. Enjoy the challenge, excitement and life of a hobo...riding the rails, hiding from the sheriff, searching for food, money & a job, so that you can say "I Quit the Life of a Hobo" and win!!
—description from the back of the box

name: Scouts Out! Expanded
description:
Expansion for WWI skirmish rule set Scouts Out! features new Raider lists for Americans, Russians, and Italians along with some updated rules and new units to the original British, German, Austrian, and French lists.

Includes rules for gas and grenades, new Army lists, new Scenarios, how to paint section, and printable tokens and gaming aids.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Turn Order: Role Order

name: Volley Fire
description: This is a set of 7 Years War miniatures rules. They are done on the scale of 1" = 50 yards, 1 fig = 50 men, and 1 turn = 15 minute. It uses percentile dice for resolutions.

name: REFINERY: 2-player mini expansion
description: An mini expansion for the 3-player game REFINERY that adds rules for 2 players, a new action tile (the city), and 3 action tokens.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing
mechanics: Modular Board, Turn Order: Claim Action, Variable Set-up

name: Treachery and Schemes
description:
A captivating rat-themed strategy card game filled with cunning maneuvers and deceptive actions, perfect for fans of poker and playing cards alike! Assemble 2-4 players, immerse yourselves in 20 minutes of strategic warfare, and engage in a battle of wits suitable for ages 10 and up.

In this game, you'll use 104 playing cards (or 2 standard playing card decks) to dive into the underground world of the Ratten, where four clans are embroiled in a civil war. With Diamondhood at stake, players must raise their rat legions and employ shrewd tactics to outmaneuver, outwit, and overpower their rivals.

Will your clan be the last one standing, claiming ultimate victory in this exhilarating playing card strategy game? With every move crucial to your success, the perfect blend of treachery and schemes will determine the fate of the Council of Ratten.

Gather your friends (to backstab), strategize your moves, and embrace the thrilling world of Treachery and Schemes, where ambition and cunning are your only true allies!

-description from designer

name: Le Temple de Feu
description:
Players are projected into an INCA universe.
They become archaeologists and must face trials.
The goal is to collect as much gold as possible before the temple burns down!

Progress of a game
The player who has visited the most countries starts the game.
In case of a tie, the youngest goes first.
The first player rolls the movement dice and advances the number of squares.
To find gold several solutions,
- reach the squares which have a drawn piece, on which a gold piece is placed at the start of the game.
- the player advances to a “Search” space, there he draws a card, and among 8 possibilities, he can win 1 or 2 gold coins for example.
- reach the "Entry" boxes, another possibility is to participate in the 3 events, by betting a coin on the big spider web, if you succeed you win a golden statuette (1 statuette = 3 gold coins )
- finally by throwing the "Action Die" we can obtain "spider web" and there we take all the pieces that are on the spider web.

To summarize, the player rolls dice, moves his "Archaeologist" pawn, draws cards, realizes the effects of the squares, participates in tests...
The game ends when the temple erupts, then each player counts their gold coins and statuettes, the one with the most wins.

Les joueurs sont projetés dans un univers INCA.
Ils deviennent des archéologues et doivent faire face à des épreuves.
Le but est de récupérer le plus d'or possible avant que le temple ne s'enflamme !

Déroulement d'une partie
Le joueur qui a visité le plus de pays commence la partie.
En cas d’égalité, le plus jeune commence.
Le premier joueur lance les dés déplacement et avance du nombre de case.
Pour trouver de l'or plusieurs solutions,
- atteindre les cases qui ont une pièces dessinée, sur laquelle on placé en début de partie une pièce d'or.
- le joueur avance sur une case "Fouille", là il tire une carte, et parmi 8 possibilités, il peut gagner 1 ou 2 pièces d'or par exemple.
- atteindre les case "Entrée", autre possibilité c'est de participer aux 3 épreuves, en pariant une pièce sur la grande toile d'araignée, si on réussi on gagne une statuette d'or (1 statuette = 3 pièce d'or)
- enfin en jetant le "Dé Action" on peut obtenir "toile d'araignée" et là on prends toutes les pièces qui il y a sur la toile d'araignée.

Pour résumé, le joueur lance des dés, déplace son pion "Archéologue", tire des cartes, réalise les effets des cases, participe à des épreuves...
La partie s'arrête quand le temple rentre en éruption, là chaque joueur compte ses pièces d'or et ses statuettes, celui qui en a le plus, à gagné.

name: Game Rover
description:
Game Rover is the first game designed to play with your best friend (the one who was looking at you longingly on family game night). In this fast-paced game, players draw a card, set a timer, and have 60 seconds to keep drawing cards and trying to get their dog to do as many trick as they can before time runs out. Rules are written in both people and dog's native language (woof woof..woof). Game Rover not only provides endless fun for you and your dog, but also offers a sneaky opportunity to train practice tricks with them. Find out who your dog loves the most once and for all, or compete with other players and their dogs, to see who wins the coveted "Top Dog" status.

INCLUDE YOUR DOG IN GAME NIGHT: Your dog has been patiently waiting this whole time... it's about time for him to join the fun! Best for (humans) ages 8 and up.

CHOOSE YOUR PLAYERS: Play with multiple humans or dogs, you choose! Get your family together and find out who can get the dog(s) to do more tricks, or invite friends and their dog to play agaisnt them!

WHO IS YOUR DOG'S FAVORITE PERSON? It's fun for the whole family and we encourage all positive reinforcement methods to get your dog to complete the tricks – treats, toys, and even you doing it with him – it all counts for the fun!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Acting, Race, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Team-Based Game
publishers: Solid Roots, LLC, Spin Master Ltd.

name: One Minute Rant
description:
Do you have strong opinions about stuff? Then RANT is perfect for you! Players must talk...er, rant, for 60 seconds about a topic that may be controversial. Maybe it's "pineapple is the best pizza topping" or "Bigfoot exists." Players must defend the position as if it's their own. The catch is, if the one ranting stumbles, pauses too long, or repeats themselves, the other players buzz in and a rotating judge passes judgment. The player speaking at the end of 1 minute gets the card and the point!

DING THE OTHER PLAYERS: The goal is to be the one talking when the timer runs out. So if someone else is talking, ring the bell if they hesitate, stumble, or repeat and take over with that much time left. Just don't do it yourself!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Acting, Player Judge, Questions and Answers
publishers: Solid Roots, LLC, Spin Master Ltd.

name: Crazy Races: Wheels, Wings & Water
description:
Travel the globe placing your bets on 16 of the worlds craziest races from land, air and sea! Stuart Hall hosts this crazy collection, including classics such as Siamese car racing, Lawnmower racing, Street Luge, and caravan racing to name but a few.

Each player is given a gambling float of £6000 of crazy race money as you attempt to make as much money as possible.

The formbook has well and truly gone out of the window and you will have to use all your intuition and gut instincts if you are to beat the bookie!

Presented by the iconic NONCE Stuart Hall, get under starters orders for a great night's entertainment.

—description from the back of the box

name: Seelenkonfetti
description:
Seelenkonfetti is a reaction game for 2-6 players. It has the theme to make a destigmatization of mental disorders.
The organisation Regenbogen Duisburg gGmbH helps people with problems in this field.

The game itself is a easy reaction game with lots of fun to play it. You can use it to talk about the mental disorders which are shown in the game.

There are many cards with 8 coloured items. They are all lying open on the table. Then a player draws a first task-card. Here is one item in one colour. Now all players have to find one card on the table, where this item has this colour. There are many cards who fits. Then a second task-card is drawn. Now players have to find a card where the the two colours fit. The cards who fits, are less.
Then a third task-card is drawn. Now all players are searching for only one card on which the drawn combination is right.

—description from the publisher

name: Candy Land: Game of Cupcake Creations
description:
Move your custom cupcake along the rainbow path!

Welcome to the Candy Land Bon Bon Bakery, where everyone is invited to create their own unique cupcakes in a celebration of individuality and inclusivity. Players travel along the classic rainbow path through a whimsical bakery, and using the molding compound, create a cupcake like no other and put it on display. There are over 50 toppings to mix and match. How sweet! In this board game for kids, players get to frost their cupcake and mold toppings, but things can change in an instant! Land on a certain space on the board and a player can take someone else's topping or they might even get toppings from other players. The first player to reach the end of the rainbow path and put their creation on display wins the game.

FAMILY GAMES FOR KIDS: It's a make-it, decorate-it, display-it board game for kids with a 3-D interactive gameboard

INCLUDES MOLDING COMPOUND: Wow! There are 50+ moldable toppings to mix and match. The game includes seven 2-ounce cans of Play-Doh compound for sweet creations and sweet victories

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Der kleine Robinson
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first to reach space 70 wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement
publishers: Verlag von Auerbachs Deutschem Kinder Kalender

name: 愛羅武粋逸 (Ai rabu suiitsu)
description:
愛羅武粋逸 (あいらぶすいいつ) (A ira busu i itsu) is a game from Japan, where one player is trying to fool the other players (working together as a chorus (大喜利 Ogiri)).

Each player is a JKヤンキー (JK Yankee), a High School delinquent, from the same school or the local area (boys or girls alike). The players take turns to try and buy sweets from a shopkeeper (the player on their left), without the other Yankees finding out, because wanting sweets will damage their reputation. In Japan, Yankee is a broad term from 1904 meaning thug or tough, later being styled on the 50s rockers/bikers style, and then with punks.

The turn player looks at a theme card showing a list of different confectionery they want to buy, and then writes on a whiteboard. But they try to write in a way that only the shopkeeper will comprehend. If the gang of their yob friends can work out the sweets the player is trying to buy, they win the theme card, worth 1pt. But if the player can disguise their intent, and the player who's the shopkeeper this turn can also read it, they win the card instead.

So the player is trying to write the characters in a way that the shopkeeper will understand, but the others will not. For example, to order a Macaron the player might write Makron. The game is timed with a stopwatch, with the same time being applied to the Yankee and to the gang. So the faster the Yankee can complete their writing, the less time the gang has to work it out.

At the end of the game, the player with the most points is the winner, being the best at disguising and deducing.
user summary
mechanics: Deduction, Drawing, Role Playing, Roles with Asymmetric Information

name: Das Struwwelpeter-Spiel
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first to reach space 75 wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement
publishers: Verlag von Auerbachs Deutschem Kinder Kalender

name: ロングロングマホウ (Long Long Maho)
description:
ロングロングマホウ (Long Long Maho) is a party game from Japan. The players are part of a magic school that disguises its spells by using tongue-twisters. Players take turns reading ever more complex phrases until somebody fumbles their turn and is out. The last one standing takes the points.

The game has a set of cards with short phrases, like ボポボホ」(Bopo Boho) or ンルンンルヌ (Nrununrunu). The round starts out with a couple of cards being dealt up and the starting player reads them out loud, within a time limit. The game has a digital stopwatch.
