The next player draws another card, and adds it into the set where ever they like and reads it out. Any player that chews their words, or goes over the time limit, is out. Play goes on like this, with more cards being added until only player can read it out loud correctly. That player score a point.

After five rounds, the winner is the player with the most points.

The designer makes it clear that they are not actually a wizard and these are not real spells and the game is perfectly safe to play. Perfectly.
user summary
categories: Fantasy, Party Game, Real-time, Word Game

name: O.P. Variable
description:
In the dangerous world of Mortterra, a world abandoned and cursed by gods, only the most powerful beings can survive. Harness your Champion's unique abilities to challenge others in disputes over the powerful resources found in this deadly world. Gain mythical assets and claim victory by proving you hold the greatest power in the realm!

O.P. Variable is a 3-6 player auction deck-building game, where players use their unique champion decks to gain power and sabotage each other. Acquire cards with various abilities to expand your options. The player with the most victory points at the end of the game wins.

Players take turns in Disputes playing cards to gain POW, to WOUND and a number of other effects in a bid to have the most power. The player with the most power at the end of each Dispute gets first choice of valuable Spell, Artifacts, Monsters and other cards to add to their arsenal. Spent cards aren't regained for awhile, so be careful not to run out of cards too quickly or you won't be able to hold your own in Disputes.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction: Turn Order Until Pass, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: マジカルカナグル (Magical Ka Naguru)
description:
マジカルカナグル (Magical Ka Naguru) is a two player card game from Japan. The players are fighting a magical battle, but use bluff and deception as well and magic and weapons.

Each player starts by constructing a deck for the battle. Then the players take turns by playing a card face-down and declaring what the card is. But the player can lie, and trick their opponent into wasting a good defence, whilst striking them with a staff.

But failing to bluff well can result in a harsh counterattack. If the other player responds with a weapon, the staff is useless and the player takes a hit.

The players continue taking turns until one is defeated.

The artwork is by Polygonotes in their distinctive stained glass style.
user summary
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Take That

name: On Track
description:
It's a race! On Track commemorates historic terminals, engines, and the landscapes they crossed. To win this card game, be the first to build your railroad from engine to terminal. Draw from the Supply Yard to find cards to keep you on track ... or derail your progress fast! Use strategy to decide which cards to lay and which to hide. Unique tracks build differently every time you play our On Track railroad-themed card game. Hidden details on the cards and game-changing surprises are exciting for everyone to discover.

—description from the publisher

name: Monopoly: Barbie
description:
Grab your Be Anything card and follow your dreams around the board with your Barbie pink token! Buy famous Barbie streets, build DreamHouses, and draw Dream Closet and Dream Career Cards for extra twists. Flex your unique skills, dream big, own it all-and be anything!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Great Robot War
description:
This is a game from the long defunct Takatoku line. The game is about two factions of robots that are in conflict with one another. Their goal is to capture and destroy the other side's base.

The game includes many plastic robot figures, complete with stands, a spinner, and other identification pieces. The game uses the spinner for results and there are no dice. There are also terrain pieces that are representative of hills and swamps.

Robots are rated according to their movement ability, with some doing better at sea or land, their endurance, and weapons. Weapons are rated for their range and destructive power.

In this game, it is possible for any robot to destroy another if its destructive power is larger. All of this, and movement is defined by the spinner's results. The spinner has two values. The top value is the attack, and the bottom is the movement, so when you spin there is two results. There is a chance to replenish your robots at your base.

A careful combination of strategy and tactics are needed to win the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Who's The Boss
description:
In Who’s The Boss, you compete with 1-4 other players (assisted by a non-playing banker) to roll and move around three concentric tracks, with the aim of having the most money at the end of the game.

You have to try to get promoted to the inner tracks in turn, either by landing on the correct square, drawing the correct chance card, or collecting a set of five things. When one player is promoted to the centre of the board, the game ends and you count your cash.
mechanics: Income, Ownership, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: 皇継の書状 (Koukei No Shojyou)
description:
皇継の書状 (Koukei No Shojyou) is a card game from Japan that combines deck construction and a worker placement by using people cards upon letter cards. The game marks the 10th production of Polygonotes and features Hugame's innovative game system.

In the game, player's are aides of different princesses following the death of the emperor, trying to build up the nation. The previous emperor was a tyrant, shunned by the people, so many talented people were scattered all over the place. The aide's are using letters from the princess to bolster support from Masters in the regions and build their strength in the land.

The game works with a deck construction system and uses card placement to trigger the letters of influence (the title translates as Letter of Imperial Succession). The game is designed to be quick but intense, serious but easy to play though. As players develop their field, the goal is to send people to their own flag, building up Imperial Succession points.

Key to the game are the Letter cards. By placing other cards on a Letter, the player triggers action such as drawing cards, exchange cards for stronger cards, generate coins and so on. But the Letter cards are one-off and must be bought again and prepared before their effect can be used.

By drawing on the skills of a Master, the player can amplify their actions and attack their opponents by forcing them to reduce their hands of cards. By this way, the Masters let players use powerful cards quickly and not feel a mistake of buying the wrong card.

This combination of one-off Letters and powerful Masters means the player must try to build a strong set of experts to make the most of the preparation. By sending these cards to the player's own flag, the player who gets enough support wins by achieving imperial succession.

The Master cards also can improve by rotating in the tableau, so a merchant goes from generating 2 coins to 3 coins. This way, cards obtained early in the game remain useful as the players progress.
user summary
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards, Take That, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: World Cup!: Qatar 2022 Expansion
description:
Move your World Cup! game to the Middle East as the world's greatest men's sides travel to Qatar for the 2022 tournament!

Take advantage of the exclusive Hydration card, which can give you an extra boost at just the right time!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Sports

name: ビルドリーダーズ (Build Leaders)
description:
ビルドリーダーズ (Build Leaders) is a deck building game from Japan. In the game, players take on the role of mentor to a juniour character (akin to merlin coaching King Arthur). The focus of the game is developing a leader, and players are building up their victory points by crafting a story around the character from their first meeting.
user summary
publishers: Pantarei Games (パンタレイゲームズ)

name: Atomic Edge
description:
Atomic Edge is a resource-management and area-control strategy game that pits you against your friends in a high-stakes race for control in an increasingly dangerous nuclear Cold War. Play as a nuclear superpower vying for control over the neutral territories of the world. A cold war has started between you and the other superpowers of the world and it is vital to your people that you expand and maintain your influence around the world. Use a combination of military, diplomatic, and subversive tactics to increase your Influence on the world stage.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Area Majority / Influence, End Game Bonuses, Hexagon Grid, Map Deformation, Moving Multiple Units, Variable Phase Order, Zone of Control

name: ドランク (Drunk)
description:
ドランク (Drunk) is a card game from Japan, reflecting the after-work drinking culture where employees are obliged to join their boss drinking all evening.

The game has three kinds of cards, Drinks which range from tea to whisky, Locations including sushi restaurant and the boss's house, and Drunkenness cards to measure intoxication. This includes a special card that let's a player sober up.

Players take turns being the Boss, and go from one location to another playing Drink cards. These are affected by the location, so at a sushi place you cannot get whisky, but at a bar whisky has zero effects on you.

As the game proceeds, players get more or less drunk than the Boss. This makes the Boss or the staff draw more cards. If the Boss reaches 10pts of Drunkenness they are out (cold), and the next player becomes the Boss. The Boss has various things to call out, such as "Well, for now." and everyone in unison shouts "Kampai!". Later the Boss calls "I'm going to reorganize." and so on, so it feels like a drinking party.

After the players have gone round enough places, and everyone has been Boss, the player who has the least Drunkenness is the winner.
user summary

The publisher says:
Players are divided into bosses and subordinates and compete based on the strength of their drink cards, and the losing player receives the drunkenness card. In the end, the player with the fewest points on his drunkenness card will receive the title of "Big Drinker" and win.

Can you keep drinking until the end without getting drunk at a drinking party with different conditions depending on the bar?
publishers: Fuji Game Factory (フジゲームファクトリー)

name: Singularity Hex
description:
Singularity Hex is a sci-fi horror survival game where 4 players work together to escape an ever-changing ship.

The goal of the game is to collect 9 artefacts by defeating monsters avoiding obstacles and using your character's special abilities all while working together because you are connected and if one of you dies everybody dies.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Enclosure, Finale Ending, Pieces as Map, Team-Based Game

name: Excalibur
description:
Created by Brazilian writer Egídio Trambaiolli Neto, based on the Legend of King Arthur, Scottish and English knights try to win the sword in this abstract game, while Celtic Sorceresses need to protect it. Excalibur is the name of the sword that belonged to King Arthur. According to legend, Excalibur was forged in Avalon, the magical island of the priestess Morgana, the Lady of the Lake, located in the south of England. There are two versions about how the sword came to belong to Arthur, in those related to Lancelot and the Holy Grail, Excalibur was embedded in a stone and, in the other version, Exalibur was given to Arthur by Morgana, the Lady of the Lake. Excalibur could only belong to someone with a good heart, with extraordinary character and integrity, whoever got it would be the future king of Britannia, the old name of England when the tale appeared. In this game, knights from two different kingdoms must compete and at the same time face Celtic sorceresses, among the swamps, to have the right to conquer Excalibur, which is once again trapped in stone, right in the middle of Avalon. Only a true heir of Arthur will be able to accomplish such a feat.
The game happens in a board with and octagonal grid. Knights move from octagon to octagon, while sorceresses move from square to square. Captures happens when two peons of the attacker (knight or sorcerer)are placed adjacent to the captured item, but diagonally opposite each other.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Relative Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Aquario
description:
Create your own Aquario! The rules are very simple: no two same sea creatures or colours can be side by side.

But watch your opponent – he could break your Aquario!

The game consists of a total of 60 cards, which are all shuffled together.

Most of the cards are animal cards (fish, crabs, starfish and turtles in different colors and point value). The remaining cards are action cards that allow cards that have already been placed to be moved.

The aim is to place nine of these cards in front of you in the 3x3 grid with as many points as possible.

The game ends when a player has created a completely correct aquarium (no touching of the same species/colors) or the draw pile is used up. When the game ends the player who scores the most points for their aquarium wins.

name: Legend of the Galactic Heroes: Hand-to-Hand Combat Game
description:
This game is a retheme of GDW's Asteroid game, and deals with man-to-man combat in the Legend of the Galactic Heroes genre. It was designed by Nishiki Taitei of TUBG.

The game is a doujin (fan made) game that was produced only for the Japanese game shows. Each game was made on demand. In order to get it you had to place an order in advance and then pick it up at the show.

The game plays much like Asteroid, with some changes to suit the Legend of the Galactic Heroes theme. Pieces are provided for Imperial and Alliance troops, Imperial Grenadiers and Rosenritters. There are energy weapons, and others, such as axes and crossbows, which can be used when Seffle Particles are utilized (since energy weapons cause explosions within Seffle proximity).

The game consists of rules, several maps, and two sets of counters that need tom be attached to cardstock and cut out.

—user summary
categories: Adventure, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Movement Points, Square Grid, Variable Set-up

name: Kill Kira
description:
Kill Kira deals with the events of the 47 Ronin.

One player controls the Kira mansion and the other play the Ronin. The idea of the game is for the players to explore the Kira home, find Kira Yoshinaka, and kill him. There are many dangers and bodyguard that protect Kira. As a team, the group must overcome these to accomplish their objective. This will avenge their late lord and bring honor to the Ronin.

This is a Doujin (fan made) game produced on-demand for Japanese game shows. In order to get it you had to place an order in advance and then pick it up at the show. The game requires some assembly.

name: Treats or Trash
description:
You've been chosen to work at the World's Best Candy Company. Get ready to battle it out and climb the ranks to become the Confectioner in Chief. Do you have what it takes? Use your candy-sorting skills (and a lot of luck) to outsmart the other players and win the game.

Object of the game: Win each round by turning 10 candy cards (in numerical order) FACE UP before all other players. After each round, a player receives a promotion (Peppermint President, Gumdrop Director, Sweet Supervisor, and Confectioner in Chief). Beware! The crazy cards will dash your dreams and stop you from winning.

TRASH CARDS: Your turn is over. Sad day!
SHIFT CHANGE: Switch places with any player of your choice. Best card ever!
CAUGHT TASTE TESTING: You've been caught tasting the treats while on the job. Replace one FACE UP card with a new FACE DOWN card. Yikes!
VACATION CARDS: Your boss is giving you a much needed vacation. Lose a turn! Bummer.
GLITTER GUMDROP: This is the most beautiful card ever. Replace any card in your sequence. Yum!


For 2-4 players Ages 4+
81 adorable, superior smooth cards
Fantastic idea for birthdays, holidays, and vacation/travel
Easy to learn and fun for everyone of all ages
Number recognition/sequencing for younger players


—description from the publisher

name: ¡Adiós Calavera!: Sancho & Panza – the load bearers
description:
Sancho & Panza - The load bearers

Choose an adjacent figure to be "piggybacked". Piggyback means you place the chosen figure on top of the load bearer The load bearer takes the piggyback figure with him.

At the end of the bearer's movement, the piggyback figure is placed adjacent again. Then flip the load bearer over to the empty side. This now counts as a normal figure with a -1 effect. The player has -1 movement points for the next turn and in this phase the load bearer moves like a figure with no special effect, except for the -1 effect.

You flip the load bearer every time the figure moves, even if it was moved by the effects of other figures, and even if the load bearer is turned to the -1 side.

Examples:

1. Load bearer takes a figure piggyback, turn the figure over to -1 afterwards.

2. As a -1 marker, the figure moved, then turn the figure over to the load bearer side 3, Loader has been moved or shifted by the effect of another figure,

then flip the figure
categories: Abstract Strategy, Bluffing, Expansion for Base-game

name: Rapid Fire!: Normandy Battlegames – Across the Elle
description:
A Rapid Fire! Normandy Battlegames scenario.

The US 29th Infantry Division’s attempt to break through the German 352nd Infantry Division’s lines along the Elle River on the 13th and 14th June 1944.
Playable on a 7’ x 5’ table this printable scenario is an also an ideal companion to our Rapid Fire! Normandy Battlegames book, providing a convenient playing aid for both sides.

Reloaded vehicle and gun data is included and a picture of what a tabletop may look like.

-Description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Meanwhile, Capitalism
description:
A unique twist on trick taking games where players play tricks with cash and try to win assets. Tricks can be cancelled at any time with Bust cards, and if too many bust cards are played, the round immediately ends. The first player to win 5 Deal wins.

However, to put a spin on things, the player with the most Fraud icons on their assets is automatically eliminated from scoring that round. Not every trick is worth winning.

name: Pet Paw Pal
description:
This is a joyful reaction game that owners must observe and outpace others to complete the pet's wish list. By fulfilling the wish list of a particular pet, players race to be the first to give the pet a "high-five" and earn points！

The player closest to the "Best Pal" becomes the starting player. Each player takes turns flipping over the top card from the draw pile and quickly placing it in the Park Area. When flipping the card, do not peek at it before revealing.
During the turn of flipping cards, if "Wish List Card" and "Gift Card" both appear in the Park Area, and the "Gift Quantity" on those Gift Cards meet (or exceeds) the number of gifts required on a pet's Wish List Card, players must quickly slap the corresponding Pet High-Five Card. This action is called "high-five" (using palm to slap the Pet High-Five Card).

-If the high-fived pet has the required quantity of gifts as stated on its Wish List Card, the player who high-fived successfully and can earn the Wish List Card, placing it face up in front of them for 3 points per card.

-If a player high-fives a pet but fails to meet the Wish List Card's gift requirements, or if they high-five the wrong Pet High-Five Card, they must draw one card from the top of the draw pile and place it face down in front of them as a penalty. Each covered card deducts 1 point.
The game then continues.

The game continues until the draw pile is depleted, and then the game ends. Players calculate their total points. Each Wish List Card in possession is worth 3 points. Each emoji on the Gift Cards is worth 1 point. Each covered card deducts 1 point. The player with the highest points wins. In case of a tie, the player closest to the Best Pal wins.

-description from publisher

name: Tremplin / Menos
description:
Jumping is important when playing Tremplin, preferably as far as possible. Cross and cross it goes over the playing field and perhaps directly into the target row. However, you should keep an overview and block the other player's way in the other direction.
The winner is the first player to completely fill his destination row.

Simple jumps, as known from many games, are allowed. Chain jumps are also possible. The highlight, however, are long jumps, in which the same number of empty fields must always be in front of and behind another piece. Combining these different jumps leads to the goal in the fastest way.

In Menos, the familiar principle of "jump over + take away" is combined with a new idea. As soon as an outer row is emptied, the playing field becomes smaller by this row. At the end, the color of the remaining pieces is important, they bring minus points.
Menos is a solo game.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Race, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: シロいぬ vs クロねこ (Shiroinu vs Kuroneko)
description:
シロいぬ vs クロねこ (Shiroinu vs Kuroneko) is a Japanese variant on the classic game Reversi but here as dogs vs cats because of the trademark restrictions. The player pieces are dogs and cats, competing for control.

The game includes a variable board set-up using four grids, so you can play on a board with a hole in the middle. You can also rotate the sections during the game to create large scale changes to the plan.

There are 12 tokens you can play on the board that are traps. When played upon, they have various effects. So a dog bone can only be covered by a dog piece, a cat toy can only have a cat piece. Plus, they cannot be flipped, or might reverse a row of flipped pieces.

Otherwise the game plays as normal.
user summary
mechanics: Enclosure, Grid Coverage, Map Deformation, Modular Board, Square Grid, Tile Placement
publishers: Fuji Game Factory (フジゲームファクトリー)

name: カードゲーム　ミスターエフの張出横綱 (Card game Mr. F's Haridashi Yokozuna)
description:
カードゲーム　ミスターエフの張出横綱 (Card game Mr. F's Haridashi Yokozuna) is a print'n'play card game from Japan, in which Mr. F engages in a sumo wrestling tournament.

Mr F. is a strange character wearing a white body stocking, and has an enormous head, created by the m:Design team and features on products and Line stickers.

In this 2 player game, distributed free online, players compete in a sumo bout by playing cards and resolving dice rolls. The cards feature the signature moves in a sumo bout (tachiai, early stage, middle stage, and dohyo edge). These have lines in colours (blue, pink, yellow) which branch off and join at the edge of the card.

The idea is that players choose cards to play which connect and form the flow of the bout. If players choose the same card, then the dice decide who wins and the loser turns their card down. If the players choose different cards, they follow the card instructions and use the dice to determine the outcome.

The opening move in sumo is a Tachai, when the players lunge forward, so gaining the advantage lets the player play more complex cards to grapple. The goal is to move the opponent to the edge and win by playing a move to get them out of the ring. By having cards with branches, the player can keep their options open and maintain an attack when blocked.

The gameplay is quite technical, and needs a good command of Japanese and an understanding of sumo. The game is designed to play quickly, closely resembling a real sumo bout.
user summary
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Take That
publishers: Fuji Game Factory (フジゲームファクトリー)

name: Fields of Honor: World War II – BattleSet 1
description:
Included in this set are the US and German forces of the Western Front. Recreate the battles in the push on Berlin in the campaign included with the Fields of Honor rules.

—description from the publisher

name: Batab: Guardians of Chichen Itza
description:
Step into the ancient world of the Maya civilization and assume the role of a Batab, a noble guardian and leader of the grand city of Chichen Itza. In this immersive board game, you'll navigate the intricate web of political power, resource management, and cultural influence, all while vying for control over this magnificent realm. The game ends when after the end of 3 scoring rounds, called K'atun Celebrations. At the end of the game, the player with the most Might wins, and is crowned the supreme guardian of Chichen Itza.

"Batab: Guardians of Chichen Itza" builds upon the renowned system of "Ahau: Rulers of Yucatán" but streamlines it into a seamless worker placement experience. In this game, you'll immerse yourself in the vibrant streets and sacred precincts of Chichen Itza. Your mission is to ascend to greatness by earning the favor of the gods and the respect of your peers.
To achieve this, you'll:

Construct Monuments: Erect magnificent temples, including the iconic Kukulkan Pyramid, to assert your influence over the city.

Manage Resources: Strategically allocate resources such as maize, jade, and obsidian to sustain your city and retain the loyalty of your followers.

Participate in Rituals: Perform sacred ceremonies to harness divine powers, gaining unique advantages and blessings.

Navigate Politics: Form alliances, vie for political sway, and tactically position your followers to secure control over the city's districts.

Defend Against Challenges: Protect Chichen Itza from intruders and fend off natural disasters to ensure the city's security and prosperity.

Features:

Rich Cultural Theme: Immerse yourself in the historical and cultural depth of the Maya civilization, complemented by authentic artwork and thematic elements.

Streamlined Mechanics: "Batab" streamlines the beloved system of "Ahau" into a worker placement format, providing an accessible and engaging gameplay experience.

Diverse Strategies: Multiple paths to victory cater to a range of strategic preferences, whether you excel in diplomacy or military prowess.

New Challenges: Battle intruders and overcome natural disasters that threaten the city, introducing fresh layers of strategy and decision-making.

Unique Role Cards: Acquire role cards that grant special abilities, enhancing your strategic options and adding depth to your decisions.

Batab: Guardians of Chichen Itza presents a captivating blend of strategy, history, and culture. Each decision propels you closer to becoming the ultimate guardian of this ancient and magnificent realm. Will you rise to the challenge and etch your name into Chichen Itza's illustrious history?

-description from publisher
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game, Worker Placement

name: Fields of Honor: World War II – Battleset 2
description:
Battleset 2 features the British forces and lets you bring an array of new weapons to the battle for Europe.

Along with stunning new battleflats for Units such as Cromwells, Churchills, and Universal Carriers, are a selection of new battle cards, some additional rules, and a 20 page campaign tracking the Tommies' progress westward from the beaches of Normandy.

Add a touch of the Dunkirk spirit to your Fields of Honor games!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: イカイルカ？ (IkaIruka?)
description:
イカイルカ？ (IkaIruka?) is a bluffing card game from Japan that raises the simple question we have all pondered at some time. Squid or Dolphin?

Players are trying to push each other to elimination by getting too many squid or dolphin cards in front of them. The start player picks another player and offers them one or two cards face down, saying Squid or Dolphin?. The target replies that the cards offered are Squid, or Dolphin, and the offer is shown.

If the target was wrong, the cards go on the table in front of them. If they get to 7 Squid, or 7 Dolphin, or 3 special ±ル (le) cards, they are eliminated from the game.

If the target was correct, the offer goes face up in front of the questioner.

The ±ル cards are used to swap a Squid to a Dolphin or the other way round. So playing a Squid plus a ±ル card means you have played one Dolphin. There are 12 normal ±ル cards, and 6 special ±ル cards, which have an extra effect, forcing the loser to pick up the cards in front of the other player.

A player is also eliminated if they cannot play a card because their hand is empty or they have only ±ル cards in hand.

There is a stricter rule which prohibits the same type being called in succession, and this can be waived by playing a card to your own field.

The last player standing is the winner.
user summary
publishers: Fuji Game Factory (フジゲームファクトリー)

name: Mind the GIUK!: Cold War Combat in the GIUK Gap
description:
This is a postcard game that is given away for free when you place an order with Against the Odds (LPS). This is from its webpage:

Imagine that in the spring of 1988 the Cold War gets hotter. With considerable domestic political unrest, the desperate Soviet government gambles, sending a pack of "Boomer" nuclear missile-armed subs through the "GIUK Gap" (the sea passages between Greenland, Iceland, and the UK). After stationing them off America's east coast, they begin negotiating favorable political and economic concessions. Can NATO stop the transit?

The game consists of a postcard. You have to cut out the counters for it, or you can get mounted counters with your order.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Events, Point to Point Movement

name: Alienados: Carga 99
description:
Alienados: Carga 99 ("Alienated - Load 99") is the ultimate sci-fi game for those who love intergalactic chaos! Imagine this: you and your crew are space delivery experts, but this time, a certain client made a job offer that seemed too good to be true. An astronomical cash payment, practically irresistible, in exchange for the transport of a "mysterious cargo." What could go wrong, right? The so-called "mysterious cargo" is, in fact, a biological weapon that woke up angry due to all the turbulence and decided to turn your spaceship into a space party buffet. As if all of this weren't enough, you and your crew will also have to deal with mechanical crises happening on your ship - and, of course, with existential crises that arise when you realize that the only hope is to survive all this chaos.

Your mission? Survive this galactic catastrophe while trying to maintain the sanity and integrity of your crew. Manage your resources and explore the innards of your ship on a modular board. Cooperation is crucial here - after all, it's hard to discuss the philosophy of existence when you're busy trying to prevent your ship from being torn to pieces by crazy invaders. Isolate all rooms infested with eggs from these creatures and prevent your ship from becoming a horror show in space!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Alienados - Carga 99 é o jogo sci-fi definitivo para quem adora um caos intergaláctico! Imagine o seguinte: você e sua tripulação são especialistas em entregas espaciais, mas desta vez, um certo cliente fez uma proposta de trabalho que parecia boa demais para ser verdade. Um pagamento astronômico em dinheiro, praticamente irrecusável, em troca do transporte de uma "mercadoria misteriosa". O que poderia dar errado, não é mesmo? A tal “mercadoria misteriosa” é, na verdade, uma arma biológica que acordou irritada com tanta turbulência, e decidiu transformar sua espaçonave num buffet de festa espacial. Como se tudo isso não fosse suficiente, você e sua tripulação também precisarão lidar com crises mecânicas que acontecem na sua nave - e, claro, com as crises existenciais que surgem quando vocês percebem que a única esperança é sobreviver a toda essa confusão.

Sua missão? Sobreviver a esta catástrofe galáctica enquanto tenta manter a sanidade e a integridade da sua tripulação. Gerencie seus recursos e explore as entranhas da sua nave em um tabuleiro modular. A cooperação é crucial aqui - afinal, é difícil discutir a filosofia da existência quando você está ocupado tentando evitar que sua nave seja reduzida a pedaços por invasores malucos. Isole todas as salas infestadas por ovos dessas criaturas e evite que sua nave se torne um show de horrores no espaço!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Exploration, Humor, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Action/Event, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Events, Memory, Modular Board, Multi-Use Cards

name: Et bim!
description:
Et Bim! is an individual and collective hidden-identity game in which you have to stay with the surviving team to win.

Like every year, the youngsters of a small, remote village go head-to-head in a frenzied battle. On the paintball field set up by the elders, they'll have to eliminate the opposing team(s). Armed with their fully-charged launchers, they'll have to spot their allies, then eliminate their opponents and become part of the winning team.

The atmosphere of Splatoon in a card game for kids, teens and even adults, very dynamic, with lots of twists, tricks, bluffing and betrayals!

name: Control Freak & Loser Heroes
description:
In Control Freak & Loser Heroes, players take turns being the Control Freak Demon. When it's your turn to be the Demon, you choose three out of six weapon tokens to be your weapon shields. This means that if the heroes use these three weapons to attack you, they will make an attack error and lose points.

The hero's attacks are made using weapon dice, so your goal is to use your hand of cards to try to make the heroes attack with those specific weapons. If you don't like the hero's weapon, you can use your skill cards to make the hero roll the dice again.

The fun part of this game is that when you play a skill card, it is played face down, so you can choose to bluff. For example, you play 'Skill 1,' but then claim, 'I played 'Skill 2.' When you plays a skill card, other players can decide whether to catch you.


If you are caught bluffing, that card is removed and has no effect.
If not caught, the card is successfully used to trigger the skill you claimed.


Each player takes turns as the Control Freak Demon, and each Demon has three rounds. After each player has been the Demon once, the game ends, and scoring begins.

Go for it! The hero has only 3 rounds! Get your weapon ready to attack the demon!
Can you become a renowned hero? Or will you be a 'Loser Hero' who repeatedly experiences attack failures? It all depends on your luck and observation!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Role Playing

name: Tempus Imperium Aeternum
description:
Tempus Imperium Aeternum is a solo game that works similarly to a roll and write. The difference is that you don’t need any dice. Instead, you will use the date and time to set up the map and determine your actions for the game. So all you need to play is a single page map, something to write with, and the date and time.

In Tempus Imperium Aeternum you will start with a map full of resources and obstacles, you will need to build roads to connect to resources and build buildings. You must carefully weigh the cost of every action to defeat enemies and grow your empire while managing your economy.

The date and time you use to set up the game will determine your assigned action for each turn, but you can always pay to use a different action. So a strong economy is important.

Over 9 rounds you will build your empire, balancing the cost of every action against its potential gain. At the end of the game you’ll score points for the natural beauty of your empire, the majesty of your castles and how well you managed your economy and enemies.

-description from designer
mechanics: Connections, Income, Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Set-up

name: ドキドキ☆堕転ゲーム The Heart-throbbing Fall Into Depravity Game (Doki Doki Daten Geemu)
description:
Magi - Volume 22 Special Edition Card Board Game

This game can be played by 2-4 players and the goal of the game is to NOT fall into depravity as the game continues, to win:
1. gather 3 Character same colour Card Allies or
2. be the last man standing!

[How to decide the starting position]
Starting from player who won Rock paper scissors, choose pieces of the same colour at the four corner of the game board.
The game start with clockwise. No need to follow the instruction of the stationary squares at start.

2) Basic procedure
Spin the wheel, advance the pieces clockwise by the number that comes out

name: Infomania
description:
Card set of adult oriented questions in six categories that can be used with any other six category trivia game, or by itself (with the addition of a die, and many suggested game modes).

Categories are:

(Yellow) Pleasure Chest: Food and drink. Not the usual though...
(Orange) Wild Side: Health and beliefs about health.
(Green) Street Talk: Terms and vocabulary of adult nature.
(Blue) Bare Facts: Questions revolving about statistics.
(Pink) Spotlite: Celebrities and their habits.
(Brown) Mixed Bag: A menagerie of questions, mostly attribute this quote to someone questions.


Comes in a thick cardboard box with very plain text. Contains 500 cards (3,000 Questions), and the instructions sheet.

name: Roll RACER
description:
Roll RACER est un Roll & Write, dont le but est d'être le premier à remporter la course. Pour cela il va falloir faire des croix dans les différentes zones pour faire avancer votre voiture et gagner la course.

Roll RACER is a Roll & Write, the goal is to be the first to win the race. To do this you will have to make crosses in the different areas to move your car forward and win the race.
categories: Dice, Party Game, Print & Play, Racing
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Different Dice Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Race, Re-rolling and Locking

name: Resolvendo Conflitos
description:
Your brother wants to watch one television series and you another. What would you do? This game contains assertive answers to this and other questions. Designed and developed for therapeutic purposes, the possible answers indicated in the game encourage participants to use social skills (dialogue, patience and empathy and humility).

The game is played by choosing one of the five cards in the table and rolling the dice to match the skills (Dialogue, Patience, Empathy and Humility) that are necessary to solve the situation presented in the card. Cards for easier situations have only one attitude and its value is 1 point. Cards with average complexity situations have two possible attitudes and their value is 2 points. Cards with complex situations have three possible attitudes and their value is 3 points. The winner is who gets 12 points first.

—user summary
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Stratego Ancient Battles: Thermopylae
description:
The battle begins! Choose one of the historical armies.
Greek alliance of the Spartans against the Persian Empire.
You have an entire army at your disposal. You need to think about the strategy you will follow.
Line up your troops, attack and form a phalanx to strengthen your defense.
The aim is to capture the opponents flag while protecting your own flag.

Come and take them!
mechanics: Grid Movement, Memory, Secret Unit Deployment, Square Grid

name: Quiznödig på resan
description: Quiznödig på resan ("Quiznödig - travel edition") is a fun mix of tricky questions, humor and unnecessary knowledge. Quiz your friends and family during a road trip or a train ride. A perfect game to bring with you where ever you are going.

name: Malaco Musikquiz
description: Swedish music quiz with questions about 80s and 90s music.

name: Ahlgrens bilar Musikquiz
description: Swedish music quiz with questions about music from 2000 and 2010.

name: Pettson och Findus: Hyveltjuven
description:
Combine parts from different figures of the Pettson & Findus universe and try to make them complete. Each figure has a head, torso and legs that you will try to steal from your opponents by rolling the dice.

—user summary

name: Beavis & Butthead: The Great Cornholio Game
description: Hang out with your friends on the couch, put on your favorite music videos, and call each other names. The Great Cornholio Game turns the stupid humor of dumb words into fast-paced fun! The rules are simple enough that even Beavis and Butt-Head could play. All you have to do is pick up your cards, match the first letter of the words in your hand to the corner-letters of the card in the center, and shout out stupid insults. Be the first one to get rid of all of your cards to win. Score!
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game
publishers: Games Adults Play, Pressman Toy Corp.

name: おんしゃ (ONSHA!)
description:
おんしゃ (ONSHA!) is a game from Japan themed on job hunting for students starting their careers. Onsha is a polite way of saying 'your company', used during a job interview.

The players build up their profile by getting Growth cards, then secure an interview. But to win, they must secure the job offer at interview by playing the best Value cards. These show how they will maximise their advantages for the company to succeed. These values include World Peace, or Getting A Day Off. The player presenting the best set of values at interview will win the game.

There are 30 different professions in the game, which is designed to help students understand job hunting in Japan and prepare for the trials ahead.
user summary

name: どんちき百鬼 (Donchiki Hyakki)
description:
どんちき百鬼 (Donchiki Hyakki) is a social game from Japan where players have to convey meanings through the medium of dance! You are given a theme to express, and a manner to dance in, and a limit of just using your head, or right/left arm or both arms.

The goal of the game is to help people overcome their inhibitions of performing in front of other people. The theme is about a secret party where demons and foxes and humans and strange creatures gathered and boasted who was best at the performing arts. So they held a contest, but because the party was so noisy, it had to be settled by dancing.

Similar to charades, players are given a topic to express, and must follow a style such as Fluffy, Sneaky, Noisy and so on. If they can get the other players to guess the topic, they score points. Most points wins, but the real winner is getting people to show off.

The publisher says:
鬼、狐、天狗、人間が種族を超えて寄り集まり、夜な夜な密かに開かれる怪しげな大宴会の話である。その席にて顔を突きあわせた各々の親分たちは、自らの種族こそ最も芸に長じていると酒の肴にとくとくと論議しはじめるが、めいめい一歩も譲らず埒が明かない。結果、百聞は一見に如かずとばかりに駆り出されたるはその子分たち、出されたお題にかなう踊りで芸を競い、逆に見物側はその踊りのお題を看破せよとの命を下される。だが、魑魅魍魎馳せ参じた宴の演台は喧騒凄まじく、とても一息にお題を伝えることなどできず、人づてに耳打ちする他はないが、さりとて面子を賭けた勝負ともあってずるをしないとも限らない。踊る阿呆に見る阿呆、夜は短し踊らな損々、恥はかきすて踊れよ乙女、前後不覚でどうなることやら、これより開宴どんちき百鬼！

user summary
categories: Animals, Card Game, Deduction, Fantasy, Party Game

name: Das Autorennen mit Hindernissen
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first to reach space 49 wins the game.

The game was published as a promotional giveaway for "Hipp's Kindermehl"
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Das neue Degea-Spiel
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first to reach space 75 wins the game.

The game was published about 1930 as a promotional giveaway for "Auer Gasglühstrümpfe".

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Technocracy
description:
Technocracy is a game of economic manipulation and military strategy for 2 to 4 players. Technology is the prize resource, and can be traded for gold, other resources, or Achievement Cards.

Gain territories that produce resources. Use those resources to build military assets such as armies, navies, air forces and missiles. Colonize or capture more territories with your armies. Defend your territories with strategic placement of your assets.

Achievement Cards can augment your military assets' abilities. Trade in technology for a card and gain those abilities for the rest of the game. The abilities include reducing oil costs for armies, making missiles travel farther, doubling an air force's range, and more.

Complete a continent and earn a bonus that includes resources, gold and technology. Completing a set number of continents wins the game.

—description from the designer
categories: Civilization, Economic, Modern Warfare, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Resource to Move, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Zone of Control

name: Die neuen X-Y-Z-Strahlen
description:
The players take turns to roll two dice and move. On some spaces events and radioactive rays hinder or benefit the players. The first to reach space 105 wins the game.

The game was published as a supplement to the 11th annual of the boy magazine "Der gute Kamerad".

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Macross: Minmay Attack
description:
Minmay Attack is a doujin (fan-produced) game that was only sold at Japanese game shows. It was not made for the general public. To order, you had to place an order in advance. The game would then be made, and you would pick it up at the show. The game requires assembly.

This game reproduces the fleet battles that were fought in the world of “The Super Dimensional Fortress Macross”. It mainly deals with the First Macross War.

The game uses a combination of the show "Macross" and the movie "Do you Remember Love" for the settings in the game. The players have units that are made from both shows and setting.

The game is a hex-and-counter wargame, typical of many wargame types, with ZOC's and CRT's. It comes with a map, counters that need mounting, player aids, and unit data sheets.

The sequence of play is:

Phase 1: Special Weapon/Special Action Declaration
Phase 2: Initiative Decision
Phase 3: Movement Phase
Phase 4: Stealth/Dimensional Movement
Phase 5: Air Operations
Phase 6: Bombardment/Missile Attack
Phase 7: Special Weapon Judgment/Special Action Execution

There are units for Zentraedi, Maltrandi, UN Spacy.

A second edition was made that added ships from the show Mospeda.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Zone of Control
publishers: (Self-Published), Hitachi Mito Game Club (a.k.a. Mr. Nambu and Prince Mito)

name: えくすくるーど！：ドッペルゲンガー (Ex-Clued: Doppelganger)
description:
The character cards in your hand are a combination of three races, three occupations, and the characteristics of glasses.
Each player is dealt an NG card that represents one of those traits.
You play a card from your hand that does not match either of the two NG cards.
You can win by playing out all the cards in your hand or by guessing the contents of three NG cards other than your own.

-description from publisher

name: 大喜利的生存競争ゲーム「合体アニマロイヤル！」(Hybrid Animals Royal)
description:
Create 3 "Hybrid animals" by combining the upper and lower body cards!
You can use up to 3 words for your appeal! Let's convey our strength simply!
Choose the one you think is the strongest and vote, the top gets 2 points and the majority gets 1 point!
Compete in 3 rounds and aim for the strongest champion!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Secret Unit Deployment, Storytelling, Voting

name: シャーク・ロワイヤル (Shark Royal)
description:
シャーク・ロワイヤル (Shark Royal) is a card game from Japan. Players are B-movie sharks eating humans, with a shark deck and a faction deck. By multiplying their cards, players try to eat enough humans to get to 7pts and win.

Tornado, Mega Size, Octopus, Zombie! Become a famous shark from B-movies!
Take out two cards, a shark card and a faction card, and multiply them to determine the shark power!
Attack humans in order of shark power and compete for points! Get a high score if you eat a bikini!

-description from publisher
categories: Animals, Bluffing, Horror, Party Game, Zombies

name: パトロンホールデム (Patron Hold'em)
description:
Invest in how many requests the adventurers who come each round can complete.
Those who have given up on investing will drop out, and if only one person remains, he will collect all the invested money!
If two or more people remain, the adventurer who has invested and completed the most requests will take it all!

—description from the designer

name: 変体かるた (Hentai Karuta)
description:
Find the correct combination from the 9 Hiragana cards and Hentaigana (an archaic Japanese alphabet) cards!
Arrange the Hentaigana cards that were dealt to you and play Karuta!
You can even have a nervous breakdown with all the cards facing backwards!

—description from the designer

name: Beaujorating
description:
You guys are lovers of Beaujolais Nouveau.
You must decide whether or not to buy that year's wine based only on each year's catchphrase.
The true quality of your purchased wine will be announced at the end of the game.
A good connoisseur should know both great and not-so-great wines alike.
The difference in ranking between the high-quality and low-quality wines you bought will be your score, and the person with the largest difference will be the best connoisseur (winner).

-description from publisher

name: Lookalikians
description:
There are 36 Lookalikians, aliens with three types of horns and eyes, and two types of mouths and legs. The number of similarities between two Lookalikians is called "similarity".

Using this deck of cards, more than 5 types of games can be played by both children and adults. For example, a game where you quickly guess how similar two Lookalikians are, or a game where you choose two Lookalikians with a specified degree of resemblance. So if the aliens both have one horn and two feet, but different eyes and mouths, then their degree of resemblance is two. So you can play a game where you can create Lookalikians with a lookalike level of 2 or higher, and so on.

-description from publisher

name: Space Battleship Yamato Role Playing Game
description:
This is a special edition of the Yamato and Anime Fanclub magazine Blue Chateau.

The game is based on TSR's Dungeon. The goal of the game is to rescue Yuki.

Each turn the player rolls a die and travels down a path towards an objective. Once an objective has been reached the player draws a card and it reveals an obstacle (usually a Gamilon ship or device) that must be overcome. Based on the player's ability the obstacle can be overcome by a die roll that is greater than the number shown on the card. By doing so you will get a treasure card. The treasure cards can help by giving you bonuses throughout the game.

One thing about this game is that the maps can be arranged into different patterns, making it so that there is never a game that is the same.

The game is printed in black and white on cardstock and requires assembly. Rules are in Japanese.

—user summary
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Exploration, Science Fiction
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Multiple Maps

name: Troubadours on Tour
description:
A competitive music game where each player manages the funds and careers of four different musicians.

Over the course of a career spanning nine turns of gameplay, each player strives to earn the most cred in the music industry through three phases of gameplay each turn.

In the movement phase, players send their four artists traveling throughout the city to position themselves for the action phase where they may buy instruments, practice, perform at local venues or cut an album. Next comes the collaboration phase where players can choose to collaborate with opposing players whose artists share the same location as their own.

A great manager can deal with all of their artists travel, funds, time and equipment as they earn enough cred to make it to the top!

—description from designer

name: ヨンゴー(YON5O)
description:
Just select one card at a time and pass it to the left.
You win when all the cards in your hand are the same color.
A high-speed casual draft game.

—description from the designer

name: Lachen ist gesund
description:
First, a personal number must be rolled for each player, then the game can begin with three dice.
If the first player has rolled the dice and got his number on one of the dice, he uses a meeple to occupy the circle of his triangle marked with the +. He then continues to roll the dice and occupies the circles of the same color but without any special markings, one on the left and one on the right, as often as his number appears. If this does not happen, the game goes to the next player. Each player who has occupied the + circle with his own roll can now continue to set a meeple every time his number appears, regardless of whether he or another player rolls the same dice.
If a number appears twice in a roll, the owner of this number must occupy the two circles marked with the O at once. If the O circles are occupied and the number appears twice again in a roll, the player can each time occupy two additional circles in his triangle that do not have any special markings.
Only when the triangle is completely finished can you begin removing the meeples in the same way. The first player to remove all his meeples wins the game.
If a player's number appears after his + circle has been occupied by himself or another player when he rolls all three dice, the game is over for that person and he has won.

name: イヌネコ探偵社 (Inu Neko Tanteisha)
description:
Become a pet detective and search for the 4 dogs and 4 cats requested.
You can win by flipping over a card with a dog and a cat on both sides and guessing whether it's a pair or the last one.
On one side, there are 4 images of 4 types of dogs, and on the other side, 4 images of 4 types of cats. There are no two matching dog and cat combinations, so you can turn the pages while predicting the back side based on the visible side.

-description from publisher

name: Tamamlandi
description:
Be the first to complete the puzzle by combining 4 cards into a square!
Even though everyone uses the same cards, the answer patterns vary from person to person. Inspiration is the key to victory!
A speedy puzzle game that can be played by 1 to 6 players.
description by publisher

Note: there is an errata in the first edition rules set, which has been corrected online.

name: Großtierjagd in Afrika
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first to reach space 80 wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement
publishers: A. Anton & Co., Leipzig, Verlag von Auerbachs Deutschem Kinder Kalender

name: Dark Nebula Yamato 2199
description:
This game is a doujin that is produced for sale only at Japanese game shows. It is printed on-demand, and in order to get it you have to order in advance and pick it up at the show. It is not for sale to the general public.

The game is set in the universe of Yamato 2199, with the player commanding the forces of the Gamilas Empire against the barbarians of the White Comet Empire. The game is closely based on Dark Nebula published by GDW.

You are in command of the Gamilas Empire [Great Garmillas Empire in official translation] facing the invading barbarian White Comet Empire in the vicinity of the Small Magellanic Cloud. Also, reports have come in that the defenses of the faraway Teron Quadorando sector have been destroyed by a lone indigenous space cruiser called Yamato.

With your limited budget you must construct ships to fulfill your mission. Both the savages and the natives oppose you, seeking to defeat you as you aim to do to them.

The game plays similarly to GDW's Dark Nebula and includes a six-piece map. The counters need to be assembled.

Game sequence is as follows:

Barbarian (Teron) Player Turn
A. Barbarian Maintenance and Production Phase
B. Barbarian First Movement Phase
C. Barbarian First Combat Phase
1. Space Combat Subphase
2. Anti-Planetary Combat Subphase
3. Ground Combat Subphase
D. Gamilas Special Movement Phase
E. Gamilas Counterattack Phase
1. Space Combat Subphase
2. Anti-Planetary Combat Subphase
3. Ground Combat Subphase
F. Barbarian Second Movement Phase
G. Barbarian Second Combat Phase
1. Space Combat Subphase
2. Anti-Planetary Combat Subphase
3. Ground Combat Subphase

Gamilas Player Turn
A. Gamilas Maintenance and Production Phase
B. Gamilas First Movement Phase
C. Gamilas First Combat Phase
1. Space Combat Subphase
2. Anti-Planetary Combat Subphase
3. Ground Combat Subphase
D. Barbarian Special Movement Phase
E. Barbarian Counterattack Phase
1. Space Combat Subphase
2. Anti-Planetary Combat Subphase
3. Ground Combat Subphase
F. Gamilas Second Movement Phase
G. Gamilas Second Combat Phase
1. Space Combat Subphase
2. Anti-Planetary Combat Subphase
3. Ground Combat Subphase

The game includes three scenarios with specific victory conditions for each.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Point to Point Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: World War III: The Battle of the Indian Ocean
description:
World war III - The Battle of the Indian Ocean, is a doujin that was produced for Japanese game shows. In order to get one, you had to order in advance and then pick it up at the show. They were not available to the general public.

This is a kit that uses the map from Modern War #1 (Red Dragon/Green Crescent). It is a retheme that recreates the battle between Japan, Britain, and Germany and Italy for control of the seas in the Indian Ocean. It is based on the world of Daisuke Sato's novel version of Red Sun Black Cross.

The kit includes a mini map, random event chart, OP table, 8-page rules, and 1 sheet of 250 counters that need mounting and cutting.

name: Ancient Blood: The Order of Vampire Hunters – The Unholy Cloister Expansion
description:
In the Unholy Cloister expansion, the hunters will have two brand new stories that will guide them to uncover the horrific secrets of an ancient cloister and the mysterious monastic order hiding behind its walls.

This expansion contains:

4 new vampire hunters (a team of Slavic hunters) with their unique ID cards, special abilities, and weapons
One Adventure book
6 brand new double-sided tiles
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Ancient Blood: The Order of Vampire Hunters – Spikes and Fangs Box
description:
This box contains all the stretch goals unlocked during the crowdfunding campaign:


2 Inn cards
24 Path cards and Terror Book entries
7 Spoils of War cards
4 Combined Attack cards
Vulk Story Book


Hunters:

Magenta miniature and ID sheet
Sir Eldridge miniature and ID sheet
Azadeh miniature and ID sheet
Armand miniature and ID sheet
Francisco miniature and ID sheet
Sebastian miniature and ID sheet
Boris miniature and ID sheet


Enemies:

Kruss miniature and ID card
Ariak miniature and ID card
Wampyr miniature and ID card
2 Zulek miniautures and ID card
Vulk miniature, ID card, and 16 Ability cards
Sorok miniature and ID card
6 Ahool miniatures and ID card
Striges miniature and ID card
Krakus miniature and ID card
Slodaniek miniature and ID card
Vulkruk miniature and ID card
Taku miniature and ID card
Dr. Steinlauf miniature and ID card
Nuk miniature and ID card
Tussek miniature and ID card
Sigfrien miniature and ID card
Koreba miniature and ID card
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Alone in the Woods
description:
A folk horror social deduction game for 5 - 8 players. It is the tale of a Witch's revenge on a village, the will to survive, and your choice between your faith in the village, or your desire to become a witch.

There are two teams, the Villagers and the Witches. Every player is given a secret Mark card that determines their team. The Witches win by either rotting the village's meat, water, and lumber to gain their full power on the Pentagram, or by converting every player into a Witch. The Villager team wins by surviving long enough to hold a Trial at the end of the game and execute the suspected Witches.

The "Woods" are separate he game is play in multiple rooms around the house. In every round of the game.

—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Exploration, Horror, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Deduction, Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Traitor Game, Voting

name: Pictureka! Rivais
description:
The Pictureka! Rivais boardgame is an exciting game for 2 players. The cards feature funny images of characters and objects. Fun for everyone! Just adjust the number of cards to play short or long games. It can be played with children who don't yet know how to read. Great activity for friends and family.

—description from the publisher (translated)
mechanics: Command Cards, Dice Rolling, Speed Matching

name: Pit Lord
description:
PIT LORD! Gladiatorial combat on a brutal alien planet set against a Cosmic space fantasy backdrop where anything is possible. The second solo game in the Malev Microverse! In Pit Lord, you are the COMBATANT! A peerless warrior hailing from an alien culture that has been conquered and absorbed by the MEGALITHIC MEGOPOLIS, a massive arcane living city that crawls the surface of BATÜL PLANET, scouring and consuming everything in it's path. You have been thrust into the fighting Pits to be entertainment for the masses, thought to be nothing but fodder but you are filled with nothing but red hot vengeance and determination to crush their foes, see them driven before you, and to slay the Pit Lord and tear down the MEGOPOLIS from within.

To face the Pit Lord you must complete three challenges and be judged by the crowd. Pass trials, slay your enemies with your bare fists or a deadly assortment of weapons, smash them into traps or off the arena floor to their doom and win the hearts of the creatures and people watching. Only then may you challenge the Pit Lord herself.

Pit Lord builds off the mechanics introduced in Demon Ship and turns them on their head, and up to 11. Roll your Balance Dice, they program your enemies unpredictably, while giving you choice with your movements. Use clever positioning to gain damage bonuses with weapons represented by a deck of over 45 attack pattern cards to slash your way through 12 Pit Arenas all designed to end your journey. Do you think you have what it takes? There is no choice, only combat. Fight!

In this starter box you will receive:

The Pit Lord rule booklet (booklet size is around 6x6")
Rule Book PDF included
Pit Lord Arena booklet (this spiral bound booklet will contain all the maps to play on)
52 Card deck (41 attack cards, 6 balance cards, 4 enemy reference cards)
1 Token Sheet
1 Resin cast combatant miniature
2 Resin cast Blade Born
1 Resin cast Spear Snake
1 Resin case Shield Servant
1 Resin cast Pit Lord
1 6x6x2" Game Box


—description from the publisher

name: Card Clash: Dungeon Duel
description:
Welcome to the dungeon! Take control of a powerful champion, and utilize your unique strengths to your advantage in a fast-paced duel to be the last one standing.

This is a family weight, 1v1 dueling game that's easy to learn and can be played by gamers at all skill levels.

Choose one of twelve dungeon-themed characters, select two artifacts, and get ready to CLASH as you use your deck of unique items, weapons, and abilities to drop your opponent to zero HP.

name: Mixtery: The Pirate's Treasure
description: Mixtery: The Pirate's Treasure challenges you to complete a 300-piece jigsaw puzzle, after which you need to solve the eleven enigma cards that tell you the story of the discovery of a pirate treasure.

name: Mixtery: Catch The Thief
description: Mixtery: Catch the Thief challenges you to complete a 300-piece jigsaw puzzle, after which you need to solve the eleven enigma cards that tell you the story of catching a sneaky thief.

name: Mixtery: Hacking Attack In London
description: Mixtery: Hacking Attack in London challenges you to complete a 300-piece jigsaw puzzle, after which you need to solve the eleven enigma cards that tell you the story of an hacker attack you need to neutralize.

name: Drug War Z
description:
Wargaming rules for skirmish warfare among the drug cartels, policia, DEA and zombies.

The setting for DrugWarZ is time-period agnostic and could be any time from the 1980s through today.
The weapons are generic enough that you don’t have to worry about what type of sub-machine gun a mercenary is carrying, you just have to know it is an SMG. Same holds true for vehicles. A 1980s Toyota pick-up technical or a modern Ford Ranger with mounted machine guns will play exactly the same. And since we are not attempting to realistically
portray everything (there are zombies, for crissake!), keeping things a little generic allows you to use the models you want.

The heyday of the drug cartel wars feels, to me, like it was the 1980s. Miami cops in flashy clothes and fast cars getting into shootouts with drug runners and their bosses. You knew who the good guys were (with the exception of the occasional corrupt cop storyline) and you knew who the bad guys were. Of course, the war on drugs continues each decade, a little different from the previous. Now we see government-sanctioned contractors going into countries and taking out targets, typically fueled by dark money and shady characters with their own agendas. Throw an out-of-control drug, some nefarious scientists looking to find short cuts, and bodies that won’t go down because they need the drug and you have a formula for mayhem and chaos. Just the way I like a good zombie game.

The zombies in DrugWarZ are designed to be “AI-driven” so that each player can control their own force and the zombies can cause havoc with both. But a player is more than welcome to control the zombies instead. It will make them a bit more intelligent, in that the player can cut off escape routes or attack easier targets but they are still just zombies and will still go down with some well placed shots/blows to the head. Don’t debate the logic of zombie actions if a player is running them. Just treat them as any other faction in the game. Finally, the model build section does not have a breakdown by faction. You can make a Rambo-style policia captain as well as a marksman Cartel boss or martial arts-master DEA agent. You will see some suggestions in the Faction section on how you could build your teams, but you can choose to completely ignore it and go your own way. Also, be sure to add some drawbacks. They make the game more interesting and give you more points to make that hero the way you want.

Welcome again to DrugWarZ be sure to keep your head on a swivel since you never know where the next RUSH zombie might appear from.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Mafia, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame, Zombies
mechanics: Area Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation
publishers: Brigade Models, Rattrap Productions LLC, Sinister Laboratories LLC

name: Legend of the Galactic Heroes: Twilight of the Gods
description:
This is a doujin (fan-made) game that was made for the Japanese game shows, such as Tokyo Game Market. To get it, you needed to order it in advance and then pick it up at the show. It was not made for the general public.

The game is set in the Legend of the Galactic Heroes world; more specifically, First Ragnarök. Ragnarök was the Empire's invasion of the Free Planet Alliance's territory and the conquest of it.

The game uses Decision Game's "Red Dragon Rising system," which has been adapted and rethemed for Legend of the Galactic Heroes. The game includes a map, rules, event charts, and counters that you need to mount and cut out.

name: Legend of the Galactic Heroes: Lippstadt War
description:
This is a doujin (fan-made) game that was made on demand for the Japanese game shows. To get it, you needed to order it in advance and then pick it up at the show. It was not made for the general public.

The game is set in the Legend of the Galactic Heroes world; more specifically, the Lippstadt War. The War was a civil one, fought between the Goldenbaum Nobility and Reinhard's followers. In the end, Reinhard's side would win the civil war, and the Empire's nobility would be ended, leading to a Constitutional Monarchy.

The game uses Decision Game's Red Dragon Rising system, which has been adapted and rethemes for the Legend of the Galactic Heroes. The game includes a map, rules, charts, and 65 counters that you need to mount and cut out.

—user summary

name: Inspector McClue: The Monte-Carlo Murders
description:
Everyone's a suspect when murder is on the menu. And with a Classic Detective Murder Mystery you have everything you need to serve up a perfect murder dinner party.First the invites, you choose which of your friends play which devious character. Then the shopping list, menu suggestions and recipes. Plus of course .....a really tasty murder to solve. We guarentee that it will be drop dead fun, and by the end of the evening one (or more) of the suspects, your 'friends' will be caught out as the murderer.

It's 1951 and as Europe recovers from the horrors of the Second World War, perhaps one more death shouldn't amount to a hill of beans. But when the body of a beautiful young woman is found on a private beach in Monte Carlo, it turns into an international sensation.

The beach can only be reached through the palace of Prince Reynard. So when the police conclude that there has been foul play, suspicion falls on the Prince and his glamorous house-guests.

Who is the mysterious woman? Why would anyone want to kill her? And what is her connection with the shadowy Sisterhood of Sibyl?

The anticipation, mystery and excitement begins before guests have even arrived as each of the guests, or suspects, will receive their invite and suggestions for suitable dress which begins setting the scene for the forthcoming crime – and by the end of the evening, one of the guests will be exposed as a killer! The suspects include Prince Reynard, the most eligible bachelor in Europe, Princess Peacock, the distant cousin of Prince Reynard and the last survivor of an obscure family of Bavarian royalty and Colonel Jock Strapp, a Scottish soldier who won a Victoria Cross on D-Day and never returned home.

Suspects are:
Prince Reynard the most eligible bachelor in Europe nicknamed the playboy of the western med.

Princess peacock a distant cousin of prince Reynard and the last survivor of an obscure branch of Bavarian royalty

Alfred Higginbottom and English film director who is currently the most powerful man in Hollywood

Cassandra a newly famous film star who is accompanying Alfred as they seek out locations for a new movie

Amy Jackson the most celebrated female pilot in the world, she flew missions for the RAF during the war

Colonel Jock Strapp a distinguished Scottish soldier who won a VC on D-Day and never returned home.

Lord Lummy one of the best known dance band leaders in America

Bobby driver the unofficial women's world champion golfer who is trying to break into movies

name: GOLD RUSH
description:
GOLD RUSH is a game from Japan, themed on the American West in 1848. The publisher says it is based on a gambling game of the period. The game has a large number of wooden coins, held in a jute bag. Each player has a matchbox of matches, which they use in bidding for the coins. The coins have different values on either face, include poison and explosions.

In turn, a player draw a coin from the bag and auctions it off for matches. The player draws the coin from the bag, and looks at both sides secretly. Then they slap it down on the table and reveal only the face-up side to the other players. Now each player makes a bid for the coin using their limited supply of matches. The winning bid takes the coin but may not look at the hidden side. So players are trying to judge the hidden value from the lead player's bid.

At the end of the game, the players turn their coins over to find their real value, and then work out who is the winner.

The first edition was hand made, so few copies were produced and sold out immediately at the Tokyo Game Market in 2017. In 2020, the publisher finally revised the game and produced a mass produced version, crowdfunded through the Japanese platform Campfire. This had smaller and cheaper components, and all new artwork by a new illustrator, and JPN and ENG rules in the game.
user summary
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Löwenzahl
description: 48 square tiles showing different photos of the region of Göppingen (Germany) are stacked in 12 piles. Put onto each pile except one a slightly larger tile numbered from 2 to 12. On your turn, throw the 2 regular dice and guess the motive below the according number tile defined by the sum of the pips. Collect the tile, if you are correct. Displace the large tile onto the pile without large tile. The player with the most tiles collected wins.

name: Bricka
description:
The game was designed by Marino Carpignano in 2023 and published in the same author's volume "Il Manual dei Giochi di Tavoliere" (October 2023). It develops on a particular board made up of thirty pentagonal squares, whose vertices form a total of sixty-nine intersections, on which the pieces are gradually positioned. When a player conquers the majority of the intersections of a square, the piece just played becomes neutral. The first player to connect two opposite edges of the board with an uninterrupted sequence of his own and/or neutral pieces wins.
White begins. The player whose turn it is must place a pawn of his own color in any free (and not blocked) intersection on the board.
The squares that share the vertex (or intersection) in which a pawn was placed in the immediately previous turn are called "blocked". On the other hand, the boxes that have in common the vertex where a pawn was placed in the current turn are called "active squares". Locked squares are inaccessible to the player whose turn it is.
When, after playing a pawn, the player whose turn has occupied the majority of the intersections not occupied by neutral pawns in at least one of the active spaces, then that pawn will become neutral (grey).
The first player who manages to connect two opposite edges of the board with an uninterrupted sequence of his own and/or neutral pieces wins. The dark edges (from h13 to l8 and from b6 to f1), the light edges (from b8 to f13 and from h1 to l6) and the gray edges (a7 and m7) are opposite.

—description from the designer

name: Cookies Battle
description:
In a box of cookies you have everything from those that are very good to others that taste not very good. Take the cookie from the box and try to have as many points as possible or throw them at your opponents so they lose the game. Will you be the player who eats the most cookie points at the end of the game?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hidden Victory Points, Score-and-Reset Game, Set Collection, Take That

name: Three Card Wonder
description: Rules for 3 consecutive played games of One Card Wonder. The winner and all players having completed their wonder get points. Highest total wins the series of 3 plays.

name: DESIGNER
description:
DESIGNER is a set collection game from Japan. Players are furniture and product designers and build up their collection of designs by trading with other players. But they are not obliged to be truthful when trading, and might hand over a bomb instead of that stylish lampshade.

The publisher says:
他のプレイヤーと交渉し、カードを交換しながら、誰が1番最初に指定された4枚のカードを集めるかを競います。

交渉時に相手を騙すのか、それとも正直に交渉するのか…
あなたの人間性が試される…そんなゲームになっております♪

Compete to see who can collect the four designated cards first while negotiating and exchanging cards with other players.

Do you deceive the other party when negotiating, or do you negotiate honestly?
This is a game that will test your humanity.

user summary

name: MATCH STICK COUNT BATTLE
description:
MATCH STICK COUNT BATTLE is a matchbox game from Japan. Designed during the lockdowns for Coronovirus, the designer was considering how to play games when people cannot meet.

Match Stick Count Battle is based on an old game where two players take turns removing matchsticks from a line, until the player who takes the final stick loses. The designer knew this game is solved (meaning a player can always force a win), and so thought how to redesign the game by using card play as well to create an uncertain outcome.

The game is intended for solitaire play, but also for up to three players, and can easily be played on a video link.

This was the 7th Payaso game and was successful crowdfunded in Japan.
user summary
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Party Game
mechanics: Single Loser Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Ancient Blood: The Order of Vampire Hunters – The Barkugus Expansion
description: This expansion allows you to play the Barkugus, a small gang of bandits who recently developed an addiction to vampire blood. The Barkugus are three brothers: Niku and the twin brothers Gunari and Boldo.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: WHERE IS MY PARTS?
description:
WHERE IS MY PARTS? is a matchbox games from Japan. As part of a crowdfunding campaign to support a Tokyo game cafe, the designer Sharkyuu produced some new matchbox games. One of them is Where Is My Parts? co-produced with SoLunerG.

In this game, the two players are monsters constructed from various body parts. They want to go out for Trick or Treat, but they are lacking some of their bits and must be repaired before leaving.

Each player has some tokens, in black or white, showing three neck bolts (value=1), two brains (2), or one heart (3). These tokens and a bonus lollipop token will go into the matchbox. When it is carefully shaken up, one token is able to slide out under the divider in the matchbox tray. If the token belongs to that player, they keep it and score the points. The first to get to six points in total is the winner.

Each turn, both players secretly choose tokens from their supply to the total value of 1 to 3, and these go into the tray along with the lollipop. After each turn, the tokens are returned from the tray to each player's secret supply.

If the lollipop token comes out, and the player is behind in the scoring, they keep it for a bonus 1 point. otherwise it goes back into the tray for the next turn.
user summary

name: CLUMSY SANTA
description:
CLUMSY SANTA is a matchbox game from Japan, with players stacking little cubes to win.

Produced as part of a crowdfunded campaign in Japan to support a Tokyo boardgame cafe, Clumsy Santa was co-produced with T.A. Works. It is based on their game マギアルマ (Magiarma), in which players stack cubes to match patterns to energise weapons.
