In this matchbox edition, the designer simply uses the coloured stacking part to make a quick fun game for people to enjoy during lockdown. The game has a set of tiny coloured cubes, three each in red, yellow, blue and green, and a set of small cards showing Christmas gifts stacked up in various formations. One card is dealt up and players compete to build the stack required on the card first.
user summary

name: Ancient Blood: The Order of Vampire Hunters – Khirnanian Clan Expansion
description:
New vampires are coming out of their Dens to plague the world with their corruption. An Ancient Vampire Clan awakens from its slumber: the Khirnanian. The origin of this Clan dates back to the beginning of time. Before the human race started to populate these lands, more primitive creatures were a common sight. Heavier and bulkier but less intelligent, they used to be a common sight in the plains and hills of this region. Some scholars and men of letters believe that primitive humans killed them all as they claimed possession of these lands, but the reality is far more gruesome.

An Ancient Being and its lust for blood were responsible for the genocide of these ancestral cousins, the only evidence of their existence recognizable in the corrupted forms of the Clan Adepts. After the slaughter, the lands deserted of living preys, the whole Clan fell into a slumber for centuries...until now!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Ancient Blood: The Order of Vampire Hunters – Wallachian Clan Expansion
description:
The Wallachian use to be one of the most powerful Vampire Clans, its founding Elder aspiring to the role of Vampire Lord, the ruling figure for all Clans with the authority to settle disputes and collect a tithe from all Clans. However, the ambitions of the rich and powerful clan were crushed under the booth of a cruel and merciless Elder. A few centuries ago, on the day in which the blood covenant would crown Wallachian as Vampire Lord, a mysterious uninvited figure joined the gathering and challenged him. The fight was short and the mysterious Vampire tore in half Wallachian and elected himself Vampire Lord. That night, no clan raised objections.
Even Wallachian's first offspring was forced to bend the knee and its will to the new Lord. However, to honor his progenitor, he renamed himself Wallachian and the Vampire Lord accepted to let the clan preserve its name, but not its power.

The Wallachians were stripped of all lands and dens, their vampire minions enslaved in the ranks of the Vampire Lord. The remnants of the once-proud clan were relegated to a small mountainous region, in a ruined underground palace. However, there is still power in the blood of this once powerful Clan.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Ancient Blood: The Order of Vampire Hunters – Lord Vlad Expansion
description:
Experience the climax of the Hunters' story as they take on the ultimate enemy, Lord Vlad. Search across three new locations (the Castle, the Cathedral, and the Order Library) for fragments of holy relics and forge them into powerful weapons which you will need to defeat deadly vampire lord.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: The Order of Vampire Hunters: Upgrade Pack
description: This upgrade pack contains ~130 cards that will allow you to play with all the miniatures from The Order of Vampire Hunters in Ancient Blood and vice versa, including those in all expansions, add-ons, and stretch goals for both games!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Flintlock and Tomahawk: A King Philip's War Board Game
description:
New England, 1675. It is a generation after the Pilgrims first landed at Plymouth Rock. Native Americans and Puritan colonists live side by side, but any goodwill that once existed between them has now totally dissolved. War is inevitable, and each side considers the other to be an existential threat. It is a fight to the death - it is King Philip's War, a tragic conflict that will be known to posterity as the bloodiest war per capita in American history.

Flintlock and Tomahawk is a turn-based strategy game in the tradition of Axis and Allies, A Game of Thrones: The Board Game, and the Total War video game series. In the game, you take command of an English or Native faction during King Philip's War, each with their own unique special abilities, advantages, and weaknesses.

Win by conquering your enemies and becoming the dominant power in New England. Victory will not come easily. Your most carefully laid schemes could be foiled by desertion, disease, political intrigue, and more – you may even be accused of witchcraft!

The combat system is ruthless and gameplay is cutthroat. Alliances will be broken. Friendships will be tested. And the suspense won't let up until the very last turn.

—description from the publisher
categories: American Indian Wars, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: LiveWire
description:
LiveWire is a brand new, fast paced strategy game where you will balance building your own circuit with breaking your friends to come out on top with the first complete circuit!

The aim of the game is complete a fully functional circuit - connecting a CPU and a GPU to your Power Supply with Wires. You will start with a hand of 3 cards and draw 2 cards each turn. Cards consist of both Resource and Action Cards. Resource cards will enable you to build Wires, CPU's & GPU's and pay for repairs and reconfigurations of your circuits. Action cards will allow you to disrupt other players or help push yourself ahead. Only 1 action card can be played a turn though so the choice is yours!

Each player starts with one of ten unique character cards which provide a special ability to help you get ahead in the game! The changing mix of characters makes every game have a different twist. There is also the special 'LiveWire!' Card which must be played immediately and repairs your entire circuit!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Drawing, Negotiation, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: The Source CCG
description:
The Source CCG is a deck building game with both Collectible Cards and an app for users to create their own cards to be submitted add official. It also functions as the battle mechanism for the Tabletop component.

The goal of both games is to eliminate your opponents Source Orb, capture all opposing Character Cards, or perform a win-condition set of actions from your deck. In addition, the Tabletop Game has scenarios chosen by both competing players or the Lore Master that allow a user to win. (Ex. Capture the Ark of Aena to Win)

The Tabletop game functions as the most comprehensive way to play in that it allows for various game styles similar to MOBAs, RTS, and DnD.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Command Cards, Hand Management, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Tile Placement

name: The Loony Barn Band
description:
All the farm animals are very excited! They are all gathered at the barn for the first concert of the looney barn band!
They have practiced for this the whole month and now need your help!
Every animal must make the correct sound! They must not make any mistake!
However, the knotty parrot, the seal, and the blowfish came to distract the band!
Can you help the farm animals sing accurately?
In this hilarious memory-based game players try to memorize a chain of sounds without making any mistake!

▶GAME PLAY
The youngest player starts by flipping a card and puts it next to the pile, starting the chain of sounds. Everybody can now see the animal he flipped.
He then makes the animal sound, and then flips the card back. The card remains in its new position. The second player flips another card from the deck and places it next to the first card, continuing the chain of sounds.
Now he has to make two sounds: the first flipped card, and the second, which was just flipped. Then he flips the card back. The card remains in its new position, continuing the chain of sounds. Play continues as each player flips over a new card from the deck and performs the chain of animal sounds or actions from memory. Simultaneously, players pay a careful attention, trying to catch the calling player with a wrong sound.
The first player that thinks that someone had just made a mistake, (meaning that he made a wrong animal sound), must immediately put his hand on the card where he/ she thinks the mistake happened. If he/she was correct, he wins the card. If not, the calling player wins a card. All cards in the chain are then discarded and the play begins with a new chain of sounds all over again. When there are no more cards to draw the discard pile is sub eld to serve a new cards deck.

The first player to collect 4 animal cards wins the game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Card Game, Humor, Memory, Party Game

name: Go Shark
description:
A fast-paced reimagining of a classic game. With sharks. For 2 to 7 players.

Objective: clear your hand of cards by playing combinations and capturing cards from other players.

Components: Can be played with 2 standard poker card decks. Remove the face cards and jokers and shuffle the rest together (total 80 cards). Shuffle and deal 7 to each player.

While Go Shark is inspired by Go Fish, key changes make it more competitive and faster paced.

Basic Play: Seek to collect playable combinations, by drawing cards and creatively asking the player to your left for a card meeting your custom criteria, such as "4 or lower" or "an 8 or 9 of spades." But watch out, since each player can keep 2 protected cards (facedown), which can block your request. If the request is not met, it moves around the table clockwise until either fulfilled or blocked.

Shark attack! Any played card can be captured with an exact matching cards, removing it from the opponents set or run and playing as an exact pair.

Winning: The game ends when a player clears their hand of all cards or when they choose to "go out" with 1 or more cards, yielding that many additional turns to the remaining players. Win by having more point value in the played tricks using a nonlinear point system: 1 point value for any trick with 2 or 3 cards. Tricks with 4 or more cards are scored that number of points. Cards left in hand do not matter, and tricks reduced to only 1 card (after shark attacks) are valued 0.

Go Shark starts with the "Do you have an X" mechanic from Go Fish, but deepens the strategy and risk. Keep your wits about you as you aim to clear your hand and outscore your opponents.

—description from the designer

name: Safari Photo: Ants Promo Cards
description:
A set of three promo cards:

1 Rule card (in French)
2 Ant Cards (no text)


Effect of Ant card: Block the line where the card is played.

name: Agents of Sherlock Holmes
description:
Help the famous detective in his battle against proffesor Moriarty solving cases in the London of 1890!

Agents of Sherlock Holmes is a solitaire roll and write game with variable goals and a play time of 20 minutes. Player will take the role the lead of Sherlock Holmes agents organization, who act as his eyes, ears and information gathering service through London. At the same time, Moriarty criminal organization will place crooks and hitmen across the streets to make you fail.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Solo / Solitaire Game, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Monster Hunt
description:
Monster Hunt is a set of miniatures war games rules for running games based on Monster Movies. Films like; Godzilla, The Blob, Them, etc.

The scale used in developing the rules was 20mm, but any scales miniatures can be used.

There are two types elements involved; The Monsters and the Army.
The number of Monster involved can vary from a few Dinosaurs to swarms of Ants and spiders. The Army have Infantry, Vehicle, Tanks, Artillery, Mortars and Machine Guns.

The game turn is very simple as follows;
1) Monsters Move and Attacks.
2) Squads Check Morale.
3) Squads Move and Attacks.
4) Start New Turn.

The rules are designed to be quick play and simple.

First published in the Ragnarok Fanzine in 2004.
The second edition of the rules; Ant Attack is available from the files section.

-description from designer

name: Beautiful Garden
description:
As a gardener, you must wisely relocate beautiful flowers to exchange them for coins, which will allow you to build houses, tractors, and tools, or trade your flowers for points, which will determine the winner of the game. Play over the course of approximately 40 minutes simultaneously with your companions by rolling three dice, which will affect everyone and determine the column where you can choose between plants, terrain, mowing the lawn, placing bees to follow the flower path, or preparing the cactus to attack your opponents. After making your selection, you can exchange the flowers for the two limited options in your inventory. Finally, make your purchases. In the course of 5 rounds, the player with the most garden points will be the winner.

-description from designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection

name: ArchPiratus
description:
You’re not going to become a legendary 1. Ordered listspace pirate overnight! You’ll1. Ordered list have to equip your ship…hire a talented crew…take whatever jobs you can get…and maybe even commit a little PIRACY. The ArchPiratus Core Set includes everything you need for two players to start their journeys towards INFAMY!

Jobs: Jobs are how you win. Take easy jobs, like salvaging a wreck, or hard jobs, like a high-speed heist. Do enough jobs, and you’ll get a chance to rule the entire sector.

Tech: Your starting ship isn’t much to look at. But buy and equip the right engine, rooms, armor, computer, and weapons, and you will be a force to be reckoned with.

Crew and Titles: You won’t get far without a talented crew. Pilots, navigators, commanding officers, security officers, and mechanics will help you get the jobs.

Piracy: Every pirate has to have an ace (or three) up their sleeves. Piracy cards will give you an edge, allowing you to perform abilities that either help you or hurt your opponents.

What are the other features of the game?

Our signature two-deck store: When refilling the store, choose the Crew Deck or the Tech Deck.
Multi-use cards: Many cards can be used for multiple purposes, and the strategy is up to you!
High-quality materials: UV coating and linen texture on the cards, with high-resolution printing on cards and packaging.

Welcome to the dangerous world of ArchPiratus!

—description from designer

name: ArchPiratus: Admiralty Add-on
description:
Add a whole new level of ArchPiratus gameplay with the Admiralty expansion! Admirals are legendary leaders, granting your ship and crew global bonuses!

Core Set or Complete Set of the ArchPiratus game required to play
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Pirates, Science Fiction

name: ArchPiratus: Cosmic Events Add-on
description:
Add a whole new level of ArchPiratus gameplay with the Cosmic Events expansion! Events can pop up at any time, creating unpredictable challenges and strategic opportunities!

Core Set or Complete Set of the ArchPiratus game required to play
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Pirates, Science Fiction

name: ArchPiratus:  First Contact Add-on
description:
Add a whole new level of ArchPiratus gameplay with the First Contact expansion! Add all new alien crew members and technology to your ship...and visit the alien space station to contract exciting (and strange) new missions!

Core Set or Complete Set of the ArchPiratus game required to play
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Pirates, Science Fiction

name: ArchPiratus: Four Player Add-on
description:
Add up to two more players to your ArchPiratus gameplay with the Four Player expansion! Everything you need to expand up to four players: More cards, playmats, and dice!

Core Set or Complete Set of the ArchPiratus game required to play
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Pirates, Science Fiction

name: Ancient Blood: The Order of Vampire Hunters – Follower Weapons Pack
description:
Contains 8 new weapon cards.

Free pledge add-on for followers of the Ancient Blood Gamefound campaign.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: ArchPiratus: Complete Set
description:
ArchPiratus: Complete Set includes the base game plus the four player add-on, the admiralty add-on, the four-player add-on, the cosmic events add-on, and the first contact add-on all in one box!

You’re not going to become a legendary space pirate overnight! You’ll have to equip your ship…hire a talented crew…take whatever jobs you can get…and maybe even commit a little PIRACY. The ArchPiratus Complete Set includes everything you need for two to four players to start their journeys towards INFAMY! Includes ALL FOUR ADD-ONS: Admiralty, Four Player, Cosmic Events, and First Contact!

Jobs: Jobs are how you win. Take easy jobs, like salvaging a wreck, or hard jobs, like a high-speed heist. Do enough jobs, and you’ll get a chance to rule the entire sector.

Tech: Your starting ship isn’t much to look at. But buy and equip the right engine, rooms, armor, computer, and weapons, and you will be a force to be reckoned with.

Crew and Titles: You won’t get far without a talented crew. Pilots, navigators, commanding officers, security officers, and mechanics will help you get the jobs.

Piracy: Every pirate has to have an ace (or three) up their sleeves. Piracy cards will give you an edge, allowing you to perform abilities that either help you or hurt your opponents.

What are the other features of the game?

Our signature two-deck store: When refilling the store, choose the Crew Deck or the Tech Deck.
Multi-use cards: Many cards can be used for multiple purposes, and the strategy is up to you!
High-quality materials: UV coating and linen texture on the cards, with high-resolution printing on cards and packaging.

Welcome to the dangerous world of ArchPiratus!

name: Decayed
description:
A hospital has experienced a parasitic zombie outbreak. Play as one of three survivors and attempt to defeat a zombie boss and escape the hospital.

The player takes their turn by choosing between one of two exploration card and resolving the card. The card may be a zombie, scenario, or room. Once the card is resolved, the players turn ends. The player will roll 2d6 to take the bosses turn, the boss may miss, attack, or use their special ability. When a boss attacks you they have a chance to give you decay. When decay and health levels meet the player dies.

The game ends when either the player defeats both stages of the boss or when the player dies.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Move Through Deck, Multi-Use Cards, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Gold Rush Mini
description:
Gold Rush Mini is a matchbox game from Japan. The designer has revised their earlier game GOLD RUSH into a little game for two players.

The players take turns drawing a coin secretly from the matchbox. The coins have different values on either side, including a crossbones and dynamite.

The player looks at both sides and places the coin with one side face-up. Both players then bid on the coin using their gold bars. The winner keeps the coin but may not examine the hidden side.

At the end of the game, the coins are all flipped and their real value is totalled. The player with the most value in total is the winner.

This mini edition was produced following the 2nd edition of the main game also being sold out. The designer created a 1 day crowdfund, and the mini edition sold out instantly. Demand was so high, the designer started a second 5 day crowdfund for the 2nd edition of the mini game. These mini editions re-used the original matchbox artwork, so the 1 day edition has a cattle skull on the matchbox, and the 5 day edition has a native American skull.
user summary
categories: American Indian Wars, American West, Bluffing

name: Lupercalia
description:
Lupercalia is a matchbox game from Japan, for two co-operative players. The designer is hoping that it will bring the players closer to a better friendship.

Lupercalia is a Roman festival for cleansing and purging, held from February 13th to 15th. In this game, it stands in for Valentine's day, and the them is bringing male and female couples together.

The game has a small deck of cards in male/female pairs, 1 blue pair, 2 red and 3 yellow pairs. The players draw cards and work together to try and decide whether they will be matching or not. The probability in the game means that by the end, players should have a better chance of creating pairs successfully.

The designer says that should the game not bring you closer to your friedn, you should say 'one more time!' and play again.
user summary

name: Pizza On Fire
description:
Pizza On Fire is a bid and bluffing matchbox game from Japan. The two players are competing pizza chefs trying to bake the best pizzas first.

Each player has a hand of ingredient cards numbered 1 to 6 and a Burn card. Three pizza chips are stacked up, valued 11, 13 and 15.

The players take turn placing ingredient cards face-down, trying to reach the exact target value of the top pizza. However, if they get the total exact, they must wait until their next turn to play their Burn card and claim the pizza.

Instead of placing a card, a player can instead challenge the opponent to reveal their total. If it matches the top pizza exactly, the challenger wins the chip. If not, the other player wins the chip.

So players are trying to bluff each other into challenging wrongly, or to not challenge and let them bake the pizza.

The first player to win two of the three pizzas is the winner of the game.
user summary
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Push Your Luck

name: Bridge of Spies
description:
Prepare yourselves, fellow Spymasters, for a thrilling journey into the fun and exciting world of espionage with 'Bridge of Spies,' a new upcoming code cracking bluffing game for 2 to 6 players, designed by Johann Chipol.

Drawing inspiration from the classic spy films of the 1960s, the game envelops you in its world with captivating Saul Bass-style artwork, casting you as a covert agent on a thrilling mission. The game is designed and tested to be easy to learn but also be delightfully complex with strategic thinking and social deduction.

Your aim is to correctly decipher a concealed 6-symbol combination placed on the world map, earning valuable intel points as you progress. Using currency cards and special agent cards, you can take actions and prepare to guess the code! Fellow players can engage in negotiations with you, to either offering help or bluff their way to the top! Are you a trustworthy person or a deceptive rogue?

—description from Designer, Johann Chipol
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Memory, Negotiation, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Alliances, Betting and Bluffing, Bribery, Deduction, Memory, Multi-Use Cards, Negotiation, Push Your Luck, Targeted Clues

name: 10 BILLION POINT
description:
10 BILLION POINT is a push-your-luck matchbox game for two players, produced to support the opening of the game cafe in Tokyo named [10 Billion Point https://10billionpoint.com/].

The game has a deck of 13 small cards, six showing 0, three 00, and one showing 000, and one 1, and three blanks.

The two players take turns placing cards face-up and face-down, until a player thinks that the number 10,000,000,000 is formed. They shout out 10 BILLION! and must turn up one card to create the number. If they are correct they win. If not, the other player wins.

The game was produced through a crowdfund, but can be bought at the game cafe as a souvenir of a happy visit.
user summary

name: Wolf and seven goats
description:
Wolf and seven goats is a reverse werewolf matchbox game from Japan. The game is based upon the classic folk tale of The Wolf and the Seven Young Goats, in which a wolf impersonates the Mother goat and gains entry to the goats' home to consume the youngsters.

In this game, the Mother goat is trying to identify which are her children, to allow them back indoors, but to keep out any wolves. However, if a wolf is identified, the wolves win the game and the goats lose. Only by letting only all the goats in do the goats win.

The game is one of the matchbox series of games, and has a set of cards for seven goats (three of which are special), and two wolves. The players have voting tokens. As the game was produced through a crowdfund campaign in Japan, additional cards may have been added at production, such as a goat card based upon the designer's prior game Amabie.
user summary
categories: Animals, Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Fantasy
mechanics: Deduction, Hidden Roles, Negotiation, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Traitor Game, Voting

name: 114 BCE – 1450: Silk Road
description:
114 BCE – 1450: Silk Road, is a 18xx-inspired economic game. You will play as traders of 1 of 5 different goods : silk, spices, tea, ivory, cotton, opening your own firms and trade on the silk road.

After 15 rounds (each round representing 100 years) or when somebody goes bankrupt, the game ends. The winner is the one with the highest capital (liquidate all stock before the end game) (excluding the one that went bankrupt).

In a round player take 2 actions of the following action:

Build/upgrade route
Selling goods
Deciding goods
Investing
Opening a firm
Signing contract

Additionally, player could do as many free action they could:

Taking loans (max3)
Closing a firm
Nationalized a firm
Merge firms
Buying shipment

-description from designer
categories: Ancient, Industry / Manufacturing, Negotiation, Print & Play
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Contracts, Hexagon Grid, Loans, Network and Route Building, Ownership

name: Zombie Survival Infection: Undead Reckoning
description: This expansion allows you to face different zombie apocalypses and gives unique powers to those turned into the undead.

name: Desert Bloom
description:
En Desierto Florido, 2 o 3 jugadores intentarán formar el grupo de flores más grande de su color para dominar el desierto y ser los ganadores de la partida.
Para esto, expandirán el desierto florido jugando las cartas de su mano, cubriendo una o dos flores presentes en la mesa. Las fichas de insecto servirán para alterar el curso de la partida.
Cuando las cartas se acaben, el grupo más grande de flores conectadas ortogonalmente determinará al ganador.

In Desert Bloom, 2 or 3 players will try to make the biggest group of flowers of their designated color, to dominate the desert and be the winners of the game.
To achieve this, they will play cards from their hands, layering them with the ones already in play, covering one or two flowers in the board, and playing insect tokens to alter the flow of the game. When there are no more cards to play, the biggest group of orthogonally connected flowers will determine the winner.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Layering

name: patisserie 3CARD
description:
patisserie 3CARD is a two player card game from Japan using only 7 cards. The designer had published Cabaret 4 Card, in which players have only 4 cards each, but then thought if it could be minimised further.

The game was designed for a French patisserie in Kobe, where the chef wanted customers to play card games in the cafe.

In patisserie 3CARD, the two players have only three cards each. There is one start card which goes in the middle between the players. The 6 cards are shuffled and three dealt to each player.

The cards have simple logic instructions (Place, Do Not Place, Place Last One) and the players take turns placing one card to the left or right side of the middle card, or taking a card back. When placing, cards can be placed on top of another card, staggered to show the card below.

By placing the cards, the three cards form a sentence in Japanese. This sentence controls how the other player may proceed.

The first player to shed their three cards wins.
user summary

The designer says:
When you place a card, it becomes a sentence. It is a sentence like this: "Place a card called "Place"", "Do not place a card called "Place"", or "Place the last card called "Last card"".
The cards in your hand are played according to the sentence. If the sentence is not followed, the card in the field is added to your hand. The sentence structure is different between Japanese and English, so it is difficult to translate the sentence into English.
publishers summary

name: FARMER vs FARMER
description:
FARMER vs FARMER is a two player logical game from Japan. It takes the old puzzle of the farmer trying to cross a river with a sheep, a cabbage, and a wolf, and turns it into a two player game. Both players are moving their pieces back and forth across the river.
user summary

name: Fallen Spacecraft
description:
Roll and write game where you take on the role of an engineer. Your spaceship has crashed due to malfunctions; make the necessary repairs within an estimated time of 10 minutes. It's a simultaneous game where all players use the same result of the dice, rolling 4 dice, with 3 to place in any of the 6 game areas while following specific placement rules for each area, such as ascending even numbers, repeating the number 5, among other conditions. After this, use the 4th differently colored die, which indicates an explosion occurs, damaging an area in one of the game zones, thus disrupting your repair strategy. At the end of the specified time, each player adds up their score in each area, and the one with the most repair points to escape the planet will be the winner.

-description from designer

name: Freedom_Palestine
description:
Freedom Palestine is a game played with a single, two sided card.

On one side are paths to the Al-Aqsa Mosque (Dome of the Rock) which players race along to become the first player to the mosque. On the back are a set of letters. Players choose their path by randomly selecting a letter from the card back with their eyes closed. If you land on nothing, you lose a heart. Lose 3 hearts and you're out of the game.

First player to reach the mosque (or the last player with hearts) wins the game.
categories: Card Game, Civil War, Modern Warfare, Print & Play
mechanics: Drawing, Line Drawing, Multi-Use Cards, Player Elimination, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Otherworld: Orcs vs Humans
description:
Epic fantasy strategy, reimagined for the kitchen table. Choose your faction and prepare for war.

Otherworld is a 2-4 player grand strategy game about two factions vying for control over a new land. Inspired by classic Real Time Strategy games such as Warcraft III and big map games like Crusader Rex, Otherworld aims to be a "4X-Lite." Simply put: it's the epic scope without the epic time commitment.

The factions of Otherworld are led by powerful heroes, each with their own strengths, weaknesses, and goals. Heroes are able to gather magic items and level up as they explore the game map. They are the key to victory; the stronger your hero is, the stronger you are!

True to its RTS inspiration, both factions of Otherworld play differently. The human Free Guild Merchants want nothing more than to build a thriving series of settlements and reap the rewards, while the Orc Clans seek out the thrill of battle wherever they go.

The orcs and humans each have their own unique army units, structures, special abilities, and economies, so a game of Otherworld changes as you switch sides!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Movement Points

name: Shashibo Battle Shapes
description: Each player gets a Shashibo Cube. A card that shows a Shashibo shape is drawn from a deck of a chosen level of difficulty. Players manipulate their cubes to try to be the first to complete the shape that is shown on the card. Play through ten cards.

name: Rovo-Würfelspiel Nimm: Gib
description:
The tokens are distributed evenly among the players. At the start of the game each player places a token. Each player has one throw. Depending on, what the dice roll shows, he has to pay tokens to the bank or receives them from the bank.
Play passes from hand to hand until one player throws “Bank”. This player receives the entire contents of the bank. The game round is now over and a new round can begin. Generally, a game is over when as many rounds have been played as there are players participating. The tokens are settled by having the losers pay the difference to the winners.

—user summary

name: Forgotten Victory: The East African Campaign 1940-41
description:
Forgotten Victory lets you wargame the fighting in Eretria and Ethiopia, an often-overlooked campaign in which the British conquered the Italian colonial empire.

It covers the Italian invasion of Eritrea in August 1940 to the final British conquest of Ethiopia in November 1941.
The campaign is covered in 10 action packed scenarios featuring the fighting throughout the area.

These scenarios are for use with the Fireball Forward rules system. However, they can be adapted to any company level system in which the basic maneuver unit is a squad. There are a maximum of two companies per side with supporting armor.

All scenarios have been thoroughly researched and extensively play tested.
Two especially interesting scenarios are Crocodiles and Tanks and Tribesmen.
The first highlights a Belgian Police Battalion that invaded south western Ethiopia and was confronted by Italian irregular tribesmen.
In the second, the British employed Ethiopian tribesmen supported by South African armor in one of the final battles of the campaign.
Also included is a 12-page historical monograph.

This is not a stand-alone game system.
You need the Fireball Forward! rules.

-Description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Archaic Realm Missionaries
description:
Fantasy Gods compete for supremecy in a new land

Bring Faith to a Secluded Island that has never seen religion!
Based on the mythology of the Archaic Realm Fantasy Roll-Playing Game.

The land is pure, the people untouched, Nearly naked, the poor heathens muddle through their daily lives hunting, fishing and well, making more heathens. These poor fools believe the sun merely comes up on its own and rain just happens! You must put this to an end! Beware, though. You have competitors that arrived the same day you did - undoubtedly to spread their false faiths.

This cannot stand! You must prevail and bring these benighted savages to the light!

Archaic Realm Missionaries is a strategy game where you are the missionary leader of a fantasy deity from the Archaic Realm role-playing game. Your mission is to promote your faith on a secluded island whose inhabitants have never seen religion. Ever. Other missionaries have learned about this island and have arrived at the same time as you and will try to thwart you at every turn. Fortunately, even their believers can be converted or eliminated as need be. Used compassion or force to convert these poor souls to the true path!

Winning

There are three ways to end the game. 1) Player eliminated (no player pieces of any type left on the board). 2) Natives eliminated or converted (No natives left on the board). 3) A player has all believers played (all 30 of a player's cubes are on the board).

Game Play

1) After choosing a color, a deity, trait cards & event cards all players begin on their start space with a missionary and five believers.
2)Players (in turn), draw an event card.
3) Select 1 of the two trait cards to play face up.
4) Collect coins from the bank as listed on the deity card.
5) Move your missionaries one space each.
6) Perform deity, trait and event card actions (all are optional) in any order desired.
7) Discard extra event cards (max of three per hand).

name: 潜入軍師対潜入軍師 (Infiltration Tactician vs Infiltration Tactician)
description:
潜入軍師対潜入軍師 (Infiltration Tactician vs Infiltration Tactician) is a card game from Japan for two players. Two nations are at war, and both send their top spy over the border to disrupt the enemy. But each spy succeeds in taking control of the military, and now both agents are trying to make their host armies lose.

In this game, the players use a limited number of cards to direct attacks on each other. But the one player chooses the card to be used the other each turn. The cards with high values have the weakest actions, and the cards with the strongest actions have the lowest values.

When the game ends, the player with the most points on their cards is the winner. So a player wants to gain a high value card, but that will make them vulnerable to attack. But giving their opponent a low value card will cause more damage to themselves.

The designer was inspired by watching a TV show in which rival teams were involved in match-fixing, and both were instructed to lose.

The game has a deck of only nine cards, and in the basic game, a set of seven are used. In the advanced game, all nine are shuffled and seven dealt out, giving a variation each time. There are also two tokens, Defence and Sleep, which stay with the player affected until the next round.

The card actions include Defence, Sleep, Robbery, Assassination, Exchange and Standby. For example, Robbery lets a player take the lowest value card from the opponent, and Assassination lets them turns the lowest card over.
user summary
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Action/Event, I Cut, You Choose, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: 3climbers
description:
3climbers is a single player puzzle game from Japan. By using a set of cards, the player must advance three mountain climbers to the top of the board to win.

The players has two decks of cards they shuffle face-down. One deck has the numbers 1-3 three times plus a star as a Joker. The other deck has three Up cards and two Down cards.

The climbers, marked 1,2 and 3, start in the middle of the board and can go two steps to the top or one step down.

The player shuffles each deck separately and draws three numbers, and two directions, face up. Then they choose one number to apply to the climber, and one number to the step, and a direction. So picking a 1 for the climber and a 3 for the step and an Up for direction moves the #1 climber up two steps to the top (the climber does not go off the plan).

The used cards are put aside face up, so the player can work out what remains, and two more numbers and a new direction are dealt up to choose from.

In tis way, the player is trying to get all three climbers to the top. Anything less and they lose.

name: Kult: Inferno
description:
Kult is an out-of-print collectible card game by Target Games and Heartbreaker Hobbies. The game is based on a role-playing game of the same name.

It was released in November 1995. The game had one expansion released in July 1997, called Inferno. It added 127 cards to the base set's 262. According to The Duelist magazine, the expansion was announced as having 121 cards and 2 chase cards.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult
publishers: Heartbreaker, Hobby & Works, Target Games, Wydawnictwo MAG

name: ラインハルト上洛 Legend of the Galactic Heroes:  Frontier Conquest
description:
This is a doujin game produced for sale at Japanese game shows. In order to get one, you needed to order the game in advance and then it could be picked up at the show. These were not available to the general public.

Ginga Gunyu Densetsu Ni: Henkyou Seiatsu or "Frontier Conquest" reproduces the Legend of the Galactic Heroes conflict using the "Sengoku Gunyuden" system. It is a campaign game with a map that stretches the galaxy. The game comes with an 8-piece 34"x 45" map, rules, two sheets of counters, and four tables/charts. You need to assemble the map and mount the counters.

While this is an expansion for "Reinhard Joraku," it may be played as a stand-alone game.

Scenarios include “Imperial Invasion” and “Lippstadt,” as well as an introductory scenario "Amritsar."

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table

name: Lock & Spell: Stranger Fates
description:
Deep within the ancient mysteries lies the keys to your destiny. Do you dare to seek your fate within the abyss?

Lock & Spell: Stranger Fates contains sixty new, heart-pounding fortunes to discover. From dark omens and horrible doom, to great riches and true love’s embrace, these alternative destinies are sure to thrill those brave enough to open the chests of fate.

Available as a 13 page paperback booklet or downloadable pdf.

—description from the publisher

name: Iron Combat: Tactical Class Dougram
description:
This is doujin game (fan produced) that was available only at Japanese game shows. To get one you had to place an order in advance; the game would then be made, and you would pick it up at the show. It was not made for the general public.

This game deals with combat in the world of Fang of The Sun Dougram, an anime show from the early 80's.

—user summary

A tactical-class game with the theme of armored combat with combat armor as the main focus in "Fang of the Sun Dougram".

The basic engine is the "chit pulling system", which selects and executes actions each time a unit chit is pulled. In addition, by judging the initiative based on command ability, it is possible to secure action chit in advance, and by introducing it at any time, it expresses the excellent command of Major Zartsev and others. Combat resolution is a single roll of dice + damage chit with an emphasis on playability.

The game comes with a four-part map, a mounted set of counters, rules and player aid. You need to cut out the counters and assemble the map.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table

name: Mouse in the House
description:
Mouse in the House is a scoop them up before they scatter mouse game. The game board is battery operated and it has a wobbly platform that shakes the game board so the little white and black mice move around frantically. It is a two player game with each player having a vibrating cheese paddle flat scooper to scoop up your color mouse and put it in the basket in front of you. The mice have little metal marbles underneath that attract to the black wheels underneath which are magnetic. That is what moves the mice around the game board.

Game Contents:
1 Game Base
2 Battery Operated Scoopers
2 Holding Baskets
4 Legs
8 Black Mice
8 White Mice
Instructions

Requires 4 "AA" Batteries (not included)

name: High-Command
description:
High-Command, a game in which there is no element of chance, is played by two, three, or four players on a game board. This board has a red central section called "Siege Zone", containing 36 squares. At the four sides of the Siege Zone are yellow sections called "Base Areas", each containing 12 squares. The Siege Zone and the four Base Areas together constitute what is called "Combat Territory".

—description from the rulebook

High-Command is a chess-like game for up to four players, either individually or as partners. Each player controls an army consisting of 5 soldiers, 3 fighter planes, 2 tanks, 1 captain, and 1 bomber.

The bomber has special rules for capturing opponent's pieces: if the piece is "watched" by a friendly piece, the bomber may not capture it. A separate rule sheet gives detailed examples.

—user summary
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pattern Movement, Square Grid, Static Capture

name: Bug Zapper: Creepy Crawlers
description:
Creepy Crawlers Bug Zapper Game from ToyMax form the year 2000. There are 3 game modes to play. The Game starts with the roll of the dice and then you collect as many bugs as you can. The game is designed like a real bug zapper with a cage that is electrified like the game Operation. If you touch the outer cover, you get zapped! The game includes a real looking bug zapper, 20 bug zapper bugs and 1 bug zapper die.

Included in the box

Purple game top
Internal bug column
Game base
3 Frame Sections
20 Bug Zapper Bugs
1 Bug Zapper Die

Requires 4 C Batteries

name: Traveller Ascension: Free Trader Pack
description: Money can buy you happiness, at least in the Imperium. Gain an economic boost to Trade and Power in this add-on pack. Make the stringent trade agreements treaties run smoother to ease your way to victory. Includes 16 Action Cards and 1 Faction Panel.

name: picopul
description:
Print and play solitaire tile-laying game played on a 7x7 board with 36 tiles in total.

Starting with only 6 tiles, the player must optimize their play, draw tiles to empty the core while creating the 3 biggest enclosed groups possible.

It is a remake of micropul:

Solitaire-only
36 tiles instead of 48
No dot-plus catalyst
No big puls
No tokens needed


With some twists:

New art
Bigger tiles
7 x 7 grid
Different challenges


Note: picopul is an official reimplementation of micropul.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: みにまむ会議 (Minimamu Kaigi)
description:
みにまむ会議 (Minimamu Kaigi) is a party game from Japan. Players are business people, preparing the agenda for a meeting. They need to convey their agenda to the company president, which is not easy because everyone is competing for attention. Plus there are spies working for competitors who are trying to spoil the meeting by planting false items on the agenda.

Players are given their roles in the business, and receive email cards telling what their topic is to get on the agenda today. Players can only hint to the president what the item is, and can only give one word at a time. The spies are part of this, trying to plant false information too.

At the end of the round, the president must try to confirm what the items are for the agenda. Players score points for succeeding in getting their topics on the agenda, and the winner is the player with the most points at the end.

—user summary
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Industry / Manufacturing, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Acting, Deduction, Hidden Roles, Role Playing, Roles with Asymmetric Information

name: Word Turners Juniors
description:
Word Turners Juniors is an adaption of the Word Turners game, aimed at ages 5+. Word Turners Juniors is a Word playing card game with the simple aim, 'who can make the longest word?' Word Turners Juniors is made up of lower case letters so that younger children can join in on. the fun too! Pack contains 60 cards which comprises 1 instruction card, 52 alphabet cards, 7 choice card which can be any letter you choose! Enjoyable and educational game for family and friends.The game play is for 2 - 6 players who are dealt 7 cards each they then look at their own cards and decide how many cards they would like to swap,they only have 1 chance to swap so they then give the amount of cards they are swapping to the dealer who puts the cards to the bottom of the pack and deals the player back the same number of new cards, once everyone has swapped they then have to look at their cards and try and find the longest word they can! Then when everyone is ready they turn their cards to reveal their words.In case of a draw there are shapes on the cards that equate to points so the person with the most points wins! The game can go on and on so the timescale can be as long as you want as the game is very competitive and you'll have players saying best out of 3, 5, 10 games!!

-description from publisher

name: トリノス (Bird's Nest)
description:
トリノス (Bird's Nest) (Trinos) is a card game from Japan. Players are little birds, trying to complete a nest with twigs of one colour.

The game has a deck of 36 cards, numbered 1-36, with each card showing that number of twigs. The twigs are in six colours, so a card shows one or two colours (also written on the card).

The players are dealt a hand of six cards, with a goal of getting all six to include one colour the same. Each player chooses a card and holds it face-down, and then all the chosen cards are revealed.

If all six colours are present, the player who selected the lowest number goes first, otherwise the highest goes first. Going clockwise, each player chooses a card other than the one they played, and places it face-down in front of themselves.

This is repeated, and the previous face-down card is now taken in hand.

The first player to get all six cards, including their face-down card, to have one colour the same, declares and is the winner.
—user summary
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Fest Season
description:
Fest Season is approaching… This is your chance to organize and host the most memorable festival of all times! Hire the hottest bands to build up the fan’s excitement, sell tickets to ensure a strong attendance, build your venue with stages, amenities, consumables, attractions, and sponsors, and complete projects to accelerate your progress.

Fest Season is a thematic Euro-style game where players can conduct lucrative turns, using the three core actions, earning money by selling tickets, and securing sponsors. Increase your success points by constantly boosting your attendance and installing new amenities. Explore the various strategic paths and options hidden among a relatively simple, easy-to-learn ruleset, generously wrapped in a festival theme.

The game ends once any one player has completed 3 of the 6 objectives. The variety of objectives allow the players to modify the game length from the start. At the end of the game, players count their success points and the player with the most points is declared the winner of the festival season! Victory is up to you!

-description from designer
mechanics: Action Drafting, Action/Event, Commodity Speculation, Contracts, End Game Bonuses, Events, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Income, Market, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Tile Placement, Track Movement

name: Dig Down Dwarf: Mineshaft Mayhem
description:
Mineshaft Mayhem is a solo variant expansion for Dig Down Dwarf. A copy of Dig Down Dwarf is required to play this game.

In Mineshaft Mayhem you play as a dwarf trying to sort gems into bins as they are quickly coming down the conveyor. It uses most of the components from the base game, but uses them in a completely new way. Mineshaft Mayhem has a built in timer that creates a ton of tension and you must use your wits to get the most value out of the gems you are sorting.

Will you successful sort all the gems, or will too many gems get past you and jam up the gears? There is only one way to find out!

—description from the publisher

name: Mediterranean Fleet Story
description:
This is a doujin (fan-made) game that was only for sell at Japanese game shows. It was made on demand, and you had to order in advance to get it, then pick it up at the show. They were not made for the general public.

This game deals with the Mediterranean theater during WW2 and pits the UK versus the Italians and Germans.

The game contains three scenarios with different victory conditions. It is a typical I-go-you-go game, and fleets are moved by areas on the map. Fleets can pick up and drop off as they move. When a fleet moves into a box with enemy forces, combat is resolved.

Combat is fought on a tactical map with rows A-G. Ships move by rows and can attack at certain ranges. Guns can shoot 5 rows and torpedo strikes can shoot 3 rows. Ships can create smoke screens and can withdraw from combat. There are air strikes in the game too.

The game comes with one sheet of rules, one sheet of scenarios, 1 sheet of counters, and two maps. Assembly is required.

—user summary

name: Kačeři na lovu
description:
The world is a treasure trove of hidden caches waiting to be discovered, and an enthusiastic group of adventurers is on a quest to find and gather these hidden treasures. Armed with nothing but GPS coordinates and their wits, these explorers set out to uncover these secret stashes. While some of these caches may be relatively easy to locate, others pose a challenge that demands a combination of skills, unwavering determination, and puzzle-solving.

In the game known as 'Kačeři na lovu,' players compete to become the first to gather 25 of these elusive caches. Each cache requires a certain way of collecting it with a specific items which can be obtained on special location on game board.

The search for caches is further influenced by a collection of action cards, which present an array of events - negative, neutral and positive. These cards add an element of surprise and strategy to the gameplay.

The ultimate objective in 'Kačeři na lovu' is to be the first to accumulate at least one cache of every unique type and achieve a total of 25 successful cache retrievals.
mechanics: Action/Event, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Move Through Deck, Resource to Move

name: Ruhr-Spiel
description: The players take turns to roll and move. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. If two players meet on the same space, the person who occupied the space first has to skip a turn. The first to reach space 99 wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: GLOBULE
description:
GLOBULE is a placement game from Japan that mixes dice, card actions, and Go-Moku style placement of numbered pieces to play three different games. The board and the pieces are in acrylic, and include a North Star piece, the board being the starry skies above you.

There is a set of 72 discs' numbered 1-6 three times in four colours. The game also has a d6, and set of cards numbered 1-6, and a set of 20 Effect Cards that trigger special actions in the game.

1. スターライン (Star Line) - This is a version of Gomoku with dice and cards. If you don't use dice cards, you can play it as Gomoku.
五目並べのサイコロ・カードあり版です。サイコロ・カードを使用しなければ五目並べとして遊ぶことができます。

2. フォーティーン (Fourteen) - If you can roll the dice and line up 4 pieces with a total of 14, you win.
サイコロを回して出た目の駒を合計の数字が14ピッタリに4つ並べることができたら勝利のルールです。

3. サーティワン (Thirty One) - This is a 2 on 2 team game rule. If you align 4 or more star pieces, the total number of the aligned pieces will be your score. The team that scores over 31 points wins.
2対2のチーム戦ルールです。4つ以上の星駒をそろえるとそろえた駒の合計の数字が点数になります。チームの各得点数が31を超えたチームの勝利です。

user summary
mechanics: Action/Event, Chaining, Dice Rolling, Grid Coverage, Pattern Building, Team-Based Game, Tile Placement

name: サンカンスシスライド (Sankan Sushi Slide)
description:
サンカンスシスライド (Sankansushisuraido) is a two player game from Japan, where players are trying to combine pieces to complete three sushis, or write words on the board to connect 4 words.

Sushi dishes are actually the combination of シャリ (sushi) which is the prepared vinegar rice, and ネタ (neta) the different fillings or toppings.

In this game, one players has the sushi parts, the other has the neta parts, and they try to capture the other piece to complete a sushi dish. The first player to get three dishes completed is the winner.

The pieces are slid across the table surface in a square grid pattern, and the player needs to get the sushi next to the neta or the other way round, to combine them.

The pieces and board are made of acrylic, and instead of moving a piece, and player may write a word on the squares of the table, which affects how the pieces move:
ヤジルシ (Yajirushi) - this lets the pieces change direction.
シカク (Shikaku) - this stops the pieces at the square written upon.

As well as controlling the movement of the pieces, this allows a sudden win. Instead of making three dishes, a player can win by connecting a line of four words in their colour in any direction.
user summary
mechanics: Grid Movement, Line Drawing, Square Grid, Static Capture, Sudden Death Ending

name: Rift Zone: Contact
description:
Boosted Reality presents a future where humanity must venture to a promising world to find a new beginning.
But we are not the only species looking for a new start.

War is never simple, and this isn't just a bug-hunt.

The Scry'Ox are not villains.
They are a sophisticated society with a long history and culture, are just as tough and determined as humanity, and have just as much right to this new world.
And, although both may think the REAL war is with each other, something else was here, long ago, is far tougher, and has much more right to claim what once was theirs…

Rift Zone: Contact is a revolutionary table-top tactical battle game system that uses Mixed-Reality (Boosted Reality!) to eliminate the complexity of miniature war games by using innovative technology that you already own.
Yup, your cell phone holds half the battle!
Using AR, NFC, and some patent-pending special sauce, we've brought table-top gaming into a NEW dimension!

Rift Zone: Contact comes with real augmented minis and maps for you to stage your battles.
Using RFID to identify them, each of your units have a name, individual abilities, and an amassed history.
They are scarred veterans of your generalship.
Don't let them down!

Rift Zone: Contact - Quick Start to Game Play
Welcome to the Rift Zone! We don’t think you should be forced to read a tome of rules before you can begin to have fun. The Rift Zone: Contact app knows all of the rules and will help you along the way. The first thing you should do is download the app from your favorite app store or by scanning the QR code on the website with your smart phone.
Once you’ve installed the app go ahead and open it. Great! You’re ready to play!
The Basic Game
Every game has a host and players. The host chooses the rules of engagement and the players choose to join the game and select which team they want to support. In the app the host taps the “Host Game” button and selects the rules which are made up of the winning conditions, number of teams, and the allowed army power per team.
Players select “Join” and select the host’s game to join. Then they move their player to the team they wish. Everyone selects the units they will add to the team. Once all units have been added everyone presses the Ready button and the Host starts the game.
A single game, or battle, is made up of multiple rounds. A round consists of multiple turns. Each unit takes a turn exactly once per round. Once a unit has ended its turn it cannot do anything other than evade or counter attack until the next round begins.
You may execute your units’ turns in any order you want. You know it is time for you to make a move when the music for your faction begins to play on your smartphone.

During a turn a unit can move and spend action points. Movement limits differ between units and are measured in centimeters. A unit can split its move into as many smaller increments as needed and can take actions in between moves. Terrain will have varying impacts on a unit’s movement depending on its movement type. Once a unit’s movement is zero it cannot move again until the next round.

Action points (AP) can be spent on attacks and abilities. Each unit has a maximum number of AP and an amount they recharge between rounds. AP you do not spend during a turn roll over to the next round up to the maximum for that unit.

Attacks - Every attack is different. All attacks have a maximum range and formula for calculating accuracy at a distance less than the maximum. Likewise, most attacks have a maximum damage and a formula for calculating damage at a particular range. Attacks that do damage will do damage of a single type. Finally, some attacks may have special effects that impact the targeted unit if it is hit. An effect may do damage of a different type than the attack’s primary damage. The more you play the more you will learn about the interactions of range, accuracy, damage, damage type, and armor.
Abilities - Some units have special abilities that they can use to give them an extra boost. Some abilities can use AP to get extra movement. Others can repair damage or add defensive capabilities.

When you select “End Turn” for a unit, that unit cannot be used again until the next round. Any leftover AP will be available for evasion or counter attacks in the event the unit is attacked.

When the victory conditions set at the beginning of the game are met the game is over. That’s it!

name: Line 'Em Up
description:
Two-player abstract where you are trying to line up all five of your pegs in a row.

Turns consist of moving any of your own pegs one space in any direction, including diagonally. Jumping is not allowed.

name: Legend of the Galactic Heroes: Double-Headed Snake – The Battle of Rantemario
description:
This is a doujin (fan-made) game that was produced only for sell at Japanese games shows. To get it you had to place an order for it, the game would be made, and then you would pick it up at the show. It was not made for the general public.

This is another Legend of the Galactic Heroes game from designer Nishiki Taitei, and uses SPI's Napoleon's Last Battles to recreate the Battle of Rantemario from the show.

The sequence of play is roughly:

A. Cadence determination
B. Imperial Army Movement Phase
C. Imperial Army Combat Phase
D. Allied Army Movement Phase
E. Allied Army Combat Phase
F. Turn Update Phase

Combat is fought using a Combat results table. Odds are calculated and a die is rolled for results. Victory is dependent upon the scenario played.

While this game uses the NLB system, it adds some new innovations. Commanders have a Command rating A-D, and a tactical color-coding red, white, blue, green. These are used to give certain abilities and bonuses to the fleets. This brings the game closer to the feel of the animated series.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Zone of Control

name: Civil War Battlefields
description:
Civil War Battlefields focuses on engagements during the American Civil War. It blends strategy and tactical thinking into an immersive experience where you can lead a Union or Confederate army in battles that will determine the fate of the nation.

A turn-based game where each player, or you can play on your own, is responsible for deploying their forces on a randomly generated battlefield. Using support elements such as artillery, calvary, irregulars, etc. the players will seek to complete a mission as set out at the beginning of the engagement.

The game also takes into account tactics that were used in the war and the generals who fought. This is my first game using the CHAOS system where even the best laid plans can be disrupted by the surprises of the battlefield. The unknown is a quantity of its own when it comes to Civil War Engagements.

Players will use support elements and tactical maneuvers to assault or defend various points of the battlefield. Formations will suffer losses and those losses will translate into lower effectiveness as the battle wears on. Reinforcements and reserves are limited so the player must make wise choices as to where they want to focus their strength and how they plan to wear down the enemy.

Engagements last from one to three days and at the end the winner is decided based on the number of forces that remain and the situational objectives. With territory cards that represent many of the most common grounds of the Civil War, players can develop battles that mirror those of history, from Gettysburg to the Fall of Richmond.
categories: American Civil War, Card Game, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: 戦国武将ゲーム (Sengoku Warlord Game)
description:
This is a children's game produced by Takatoku. It is set during Japan's Warring States period (Sengoku-jidai) and plays 2-5 players.

To win the game a player must become powerful enough to either destroy all other opponents or become rich enough to enter Kyoto and declare themselves the winner.

On your turn you do one of the following actions: Departure, Tax Revenue, Navigation, Weapon Procurement, or Construction of Castles.

Money (koku) is raised by controlling territories. You draw a revenue card for this and follow the results.

With your money you can build armies of infantry, archers, cavalry, firearms and artillery in a territory by procuring them. This is done by paying 10,000 koku and spinning the wheel, which determines what is available. Navies can similarly be raised in territories with ports.

A player moves by the roulette's results; either 1, 2, or 3 territories can be moved. A player can take control of a territory by moving armies into it and building a castle. The territory states how much to pay to do this. However, if there are enemy troops in the territory you must fight them.

Combat is resolved by drawing a card which dives the details of how victory is achieved (such as having the most guns).

—user summary
mechanics: Area Movement, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Income, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move

name: BattleMonsters: Model Profiles
description:
Contains the specific rules for each individual BattleMonster miniature!

Print this booklet to create your own BattleMonsters stat cards and campaign sheets!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Variable Player Powers

name: Darkwoods
description:
Without darkness there is no light, but darkness is all that is engulfing us and it has been spreading for years from the forest.

During the late evening we hear mournful screams and during night we see the silhouettes walking toward the town…

The sanctified items in the church are hot, we can’t even take them in our hands to fight the evil. What is happening, what is advancing toward no one knows! We need God’s merciful to save us from what is lurking from the Darkwoods!

Step into the role of valiant defenders guarding the last bastion of a fading empire, standing firm against the encroaching darkness of the foreboding Darkwoods. Alternatively, embrace the sinister allure of the demons and choose to align with the forces of darkness in this cooperative and competitive gaming experience.

In a world where each night brings forth hordes of bloodthirsty demonic creatures, the town's morale and faith must be upheld to survive. You can opt to maintain the flickering flame of hope within the town's people. Or, you can cast your lot with the corrupted Cults, collaborating with the demons in their relentless quest to obliterate humanity.

This deck-building and strategy game immerses you in a dark fantasy realm deeply inspired by the folklore, legends, and myths of Eastern European mediaeval history. Choose your path wisely, for the fate of the last remnants of humanity rests in your hands.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Striking Effectively First
description:
“As a consequence, carrier battles were risky, unstable affairs that hinged on striking effectively first. To do so, a carrier force had to locate its adversary before it was detected itself, or not long after.”

– Robert C. Rubel, Deconstructing Nimitz’s Principle of Calculated Risk

This is an expansion to my ruleset There's The Effing Scheer, which allows you to wargame early- to mid-war WW2 naval combat. This game adds an operational map for moving task forces, rules for fog of war, reconnaissance and detection, and aircraft carriers launching air strikes.

Aircraft carriers were a huge shift in twentieth century naval warfare. The ability to detect and strike enemies beyond line of sight upended naval strategy. The warship that had taken hundreds of thousands, if not millions, to build could be sent to the bottom by a handful of aviators shrieking in, dropping some ordnance then disappearing over the horizon.

When I first published Scheer over a year ago, I aimed to add a quick little expansion within a couple of months to bolt-on a mini-campaign system and get aircraft carriers into the fray. It has taken me a little longer, but it is a more substantial expansion that me and my playtesters are happy with.

As with the base game of Scheer, I wanted something that incorporated the fog of war and confusion of early carrier combat. Operating on half-information and making crucial decisions without all of the pieces in front of you are big parts of this game (in one Coral Sea game, I was defeated as the Americans by rushing my first strike on what turned out to be some cruisers, while the Japanese, now knowing where my carriers were, stuck effectively first and crippled both my carriers). I want to put you in the seat of Nagumo as he wonders whether or not to wait for better information or to launch now and hope you hit the right targets.

This game comes with rules for incorporating aircraft into the Scheer base game, generic operational rules for fighting multi-day engagements and four operational scenarios (Matapan, Java Sea, Coral Sea and Midway).

If you want to complete an operation in a day using a game which isn't going to take up all of your time, give realistic results and allow you to roll some dice with friends as you refight the early naval operations of World War 2, look no further.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Little Soldiers
description:
In Little Soldiers, two armies of plastic soldiers fight it out on the table, using the plates, glasses, and anything else that happens to be there for cover or as vantage points for action. Move your characters, attack your enemies, hide behind the butter dish, and use your cards for special actions.

Little Soldiers includes scenarios for play with up to four people as well as a team mode.

name: はぐれちゃやーよ (Hagurecha yaーyo)
description:
はぐれちゃやーよ (Hagurecha yaーyo) is a card game from Japan, in which the players are trying to identify which one of fifteen different couples are splitting.

The game has a deck of 30 cards of 15 couples, and each card has a special ability that is triggered when it is played or when it is held. The deck is shuffled and one card is placed face down in secret. The players are dealt the remaining cards (they don't have to be evenly shared).

Players then take turns drawing a card from their left neighbour. If the player can determine which is the secret card, they can declare it and check if it is correct. If so, points are scored by all players. Otherwise, they lay their hand out and are out of the round.

Alternately, the player might have a matching couple in their hand, and can choose to play these down into the open, or keep them in hand. A player that exhausts their hand is out and will lose one point in the round.

If only one player remains, they have a chance to declare the secret card and then the round ends.

Points are scored by adding the number of cards in hand plus 1 pt, scoring positively for a correct declaration and negatively for anybody else.

After three rounds, the player with the most points wins.

The game also has two marriage declaration cards and these are used in an alternate game, where a player is trying to get both declarations cards and only one person card in their hand. At this point, they declare which player they are marrying and lay their hand out for the win.
user summary
mechanics: Action/Event, Closed Drafting, Deduction, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Tuns
description:
Tuns is a card game for 2 to 4 players that is inspired by classics like Spite & Malice and Russian Bank.

It features number cards from 1 to 9 and two special cards marked with a T and a -T.

The goal is to get rid of the cards you've been dealt first. To get rid of them you have to play them from 1 to 9 to certain stacks. You also draw cards from a deck and have special stacks to lay down cards and share them with other players.

—description from the designer

name: Solo Vocali
description: In Solo Vocali, you need to collaborate with other players to find words that feature the exact number of drawn vowels.

name: Shattered Veil Promo Cards
description:
The incomprehensible mission of the ethereal Veilwraith, affected by its magnanimous patron The Lady, has resulted in a tear in the weave of time and space. As reality, possibility, nightmare, and dream coalesce, shades of what once was (or could be) emerge from beyond the faltering Veil.

These 3 exclusive Shattered Veil promo cards can be used in any of the three Kilforth Fantasy Quest Games.

- Description from the Art of Kilforth Kickstarter page

The promo cards (Veiled Diablo, Agent of Locus, Lamented One) are numbered VW1 through VW3.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Role Playing, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Galactic War 2202
description:
Galactic War 2202 is a doujin (fan-made) game that was only produced for sale at Japanese game shows. To get one you had to order in advance and then pick it up at the show. It was not sold to the general public.

This is a strategic simulation war game which is based on the war between the two major interstellar nations – Galman Empire and the Bolar Federation, which was depicted in the TV anime "Space Battleship Yamato III".
As leaders of the Galman Empire or the Bolar Federation, players will build ships, engage in fleet battles, and compete for full control of the star system.

Each turn lasts for about 2 months. The players are given about 20 normal ship units and 1~5 special ship units. 1 fortress unit represents 1 whole fortress.

Galactic War 2202 is a retheme of the Legend of the Galactic Heroes and plays much the same way with some changes to it to suit Space Battleship Yamato.

The game comes with a rulebook, map, 11 sets of counters, and several organizational and turn charts. All of this must be assembled to play.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Income, Point to Point Movement

name: Biathlon Blast
description:
Biathlon Blast catapults players into the heart-pounding world of biathlon, fusing the adrenaline rush of cross-country skiing with the intense precision of rifle shooting in a strategy-driven board game. Whether you're a seasoned biathlon enthusiast or new to the sport, Biathlon Blast offers an exhilarating journey where you'll master the delicate balance between speed and accuracy, putting your skills to the test as you navigate various terrains and tackle the challenging shooting range. It's a thrilling adventure that invites players to embrace the essence of biathlon – where speed meets precision and strategy reigns supreme.

In each round, you and your fellow biathletes select cards representing skiing actions. These cards influence turn order, move length, pulse levels, and the management of dynamic wind conditions, with each biathlete offering their distinctive set of strengths.

At the shooting range, enclosed within a specially designed barrier attached to the game board, your accuracy relies on a roll of the dice, your pulse level, and the individual shooting skills of each biathlete, all while contending with the ever-changing wind conditions.

Biathlon Blast offers multiple thrilling courses, each packed with its own set of challenges. So strap on your skis, chart your path, and aim for glory as you embark on your journey to become the ultimate biathlon champion!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Multi-Use Cards, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Race, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Track Movement, Turn Order: Role Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Grey Smoke and Blue Sky
description:
Grey Smoke and Blue Sky is a Japanese doujin (fan-made) game that was available at the Japanese Game market show. The game is about the American Civil War.

The game comes with a map, 16 cards, 3 double-sided leader cards and 20 3D printed army markers. You must also provide 50 six-sided dice for the game.

From the designer's website:
This is a game of intense dice rolling and supply management where you fight through four rounds and aim for victory for both the Confederate and Northern armies.

The game follows this sequence of play:


Draw phase.
Initiative phase.
Action phase.
Combat resolution phase.
Victory determination phase.


Victory is determined by victory point totals, which change according to the year of the war. Meet your quota and you win the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Area Movement, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling

name: Men-Nefer
description:
Founded around 3050 BCE and located south of the River Nile Delta, Men-Nefer (a.k.a., Memphis) became the capital of ancient Egypt and the most populated city on the planet.

In Men-Nefer, you will relive one of the greatest periods of ancient Egypt, carrying out tasks typical to Egyptian culture: acquiring knowledge in the houses of life, navigating and trading on the Nile River, making offerings to the revered God, embalming the corpses of the nobles to send them off to a better life, erecting beautiful sphinxes, and contributing to the construction of the Great Pyramids. In addition to this, you must be careful of how you make your way through this earthly world to be sure that Osiris will grant you passage to Aaru, the long-awaited heavenly paradise of the afterlife.

Throughout three eras, by means of a novel selection of actions that combine worker placement and tile drafting, players choose on each turn which area of Egyptian life and culture they wish to develop. Players must attempt to obtain the greatest number of prestige points in each era since only the one who manages to achieve the most prestige will take the victory.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Income, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Track Movement, Worker Placement

name: Sancti et Malum
description:
Sancti et Malum is a solo game of cards and dice which can also be played as a team.

The game is based on the epic struggle between the Holy and the Evil; the player (on the side of the faithful Angels) tries to defeat the fallen Host of Satan.

There is a deck of 40 cards, each card face split into a pair of Holy and Evil content. Most of these are Angels, each with their own dice-rolling power and other aspects, OR they are modifier cards to enhance or hinder the performance of the Angels.

Enemy cards are drawn, and players choose from their hand the Holy heroes they wish to assign to the conflict. Dice are rolled and modifiers applied to best meet the powers of the foes on the battlefield. If either Angelic army wins five rounds, they win the battle.

But the eternal conflict goes on forever between the Holy and the Evil - Sancti et Malum.

-description from designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game, Team-Based Game

name: Someone's Y
description:
